M2ImkdSdwV0rIa8KU9qHzQ.text: Arts District Gem! First time had honey vanilla latte & croissant. However looking around neighboring tables the breakfast looked delicious!

MukPa8VkrZexEVi2mt6_Hg.text: One of the best coffee houses in Vegas! The staff is amazing and friendly with a lots of delicious varieties of Latin American dishes. 20/10

jRVJfVHdhXqhkjg_sp47sA.text: Like the place , would go again soon but because I like it I believe I need to be critical . I feel that the portions should be grander for the price . I felt like my coffee was watered down . Over all everything is kinda bland tasting. I want to see the meat , I want to see the ingredients better . The sauce is good and it would be nice if it was the sea around the island of super pile !  If I want comfort food in a social locals setting this can be the place . I didn't know if my waitress was giving me space to eat , or didn't care to check on me . I wanted more out of my experience and left feeling a little disappointed. I hope the owner will read this and step up his game which I know he can . Thanks til next time

Hr_0ma3K81lEFPYmzem06Q.text: I am so jazzed to hear that this place will have a Downtown Summerlin location!  The boyfriend is very particular about his coffee and enjoys a simple blonde roast, black. The coffee made his eyes roll back...so good!!   We were both excited about the food menu. I ordered the empanada sampler! The presentation was simple and satisfying. The outer casing of each empanadas was light and flaky. The first and subsequent bites of each individual empanada suggested that someone knew exactly how to make our taste buds cry.   If you like el desayuno, gotta check this place out for yourself!

SXn7CzD_N6dKi8_ceLdJjQ.text: Place is busy. Expect a wait. They have outdoor seating which was expectedly full.  Got some lattes to start. The hot lavender latte was just ok. Good for trying once. My husband got a salted caramel latte and it was delish. Waited quite a long time for them to be made.... I ordered the La Paisa which came out fairly quick. Good, quality food. Could've used a little heat..but overall good. My husband got a breakfast croissant. Pretty basic, nothing special. Atmosphere was nice and bright. Modern decor. Service was pretty slow. I think there was only one girl helping most of the place, so that didn't help considering how busy they were. She didn't come around much.  A nice stop in the arts district. Walk off your food afterwards and check out all the vintage shops down the block. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted Caramel (left) and Lavender  (right) lattes.

pRClwkY5nUJLcIZrk1E4PA.text: B-b-b-benny and the jets! Holy mother of Benedict! Makers & Finders really churn out some primo breakfast. Their arepa benny is my absolute fave. Those tasty little hunks of heaven were devoured with enthusiasm on my recent trip to the Hop Nuts neighbor. I knew they made amazing drinks but that was my first time brunching there. My companion ordered their smoked salmon benny and was pleased as well. They stole the spotlight from their delicious lavender latte and quite possibly the best damn chai latte I've ever had. Kudos to you Makers & Finders! The patio is pet friendly and makes for a great spot to take in the arts district. Free street parking and usually plenty of it even with the current construction going on. I'll be back.

l2eoWp1bW1XTd3N_2eLCxQ.text: Sooo good! We had the Mexican spiced lattes, empanadas & yucca. Everything was tasty & fresh and the Mexican lattes were phenomenal! Food came out fast, service was friendly.  Only complaint was the bathroom was dirty - but that has nothing to do with the food so I will not deduct a star for it. Just something to improve on if the manager reads this.  I'm all about these small quaint places with good quality food! Leave the Applebees in the 90s where it belongs!

qS4H_YmUaHG3iH3v34CTRg.text: I can say the service was quick and friendly, the coffee was great, the presentation was a little less but all  worth it just to have my dog accompany me. The Patio is dog friendly.

x8caQY7gL3iEQZQtPgqMjg.text: I came here with my friend to play catch up over coffee and lunch. It's right on Main Street downtown. Parking was not metered but did have a 2 hour limit. They do close fairly early, so this is not a night time study spot :(. The patio looked awesome but we opted to sit inside and get out of the summer heat.        We sat down at a little table, in chairs that were a lot more comfortable than they looked. We were greeted about five minutes later and asked if anyone had taken our order. Took a little while, but the server was so nice and knowledgable About the menu that it was difficult to care. We both opted for lavender lattes with almond milk. They didn't ask about sizes, so I'm assuming dine in all run the same ($5.50). We received our lattes promptly but the server disappeared before we could order our food. About five minutes later he reappeared and we were able to order. My friend ordered the veggie bagel and opted for the brussels sprouts prepared vegan with fresh garlic.        The lattes... I Highly recommend this beverage. It's probably one of my new favorite coffee drinks. The lavender isn't over powering or too fragrant, which was my biggest concern. There was a perfect balance with hints of lavender and espresso with a touch of sweetness. It was perfect, just not hot enough for me since I drink slow when I'm talking. The veggie bagel looked great! The veggies looked fresh and colorful. It even came with plantain chips. The brussels sprouts were cooked until tender. Lots of flavor from the citrus lime and the savory garlic. I will definitely be ordering these again.        The check after tax was 27.00. For a sit down coffee house, I didn't think it was too bad. I will definitely be returning in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie bagel

sOPuhgqIuiGo7S5EbF7UKQ.text: Great location! Very unique everything is awsome here! The staff is very nice and kind! I was greeted with a warm smile and my coffe was amazing! 5 stars for ANgelica

ivckQm8NtcFJbaL9W34rDg.text: Cute spot & price is fair! The smoked salmon Benedict had an mediocre hollandaise sauce and the arepas wasn't for us. The whole dish was blend. The chicken chilaquiles on the other hand was over seasoned but the overall dish was still good and we still finished the whole thing. Also enjoyed the house coffee and cold brew.   Even though our experience with the food was meh (3/5 for food), the overall environment was comfortable and we feel like we might have just ordered the wrong brunch items.

mrNoRdHw7P84B3KSdpOR6w.text: Their lavender latte is one of the best I've had hands down. The food is always delicious. I just wish they had easier ways to park and maybe a second location closer to Henderson!

54OzKn0HsNNNIr0dmaA30Q.text: The place is situated in the arts district that is undergoing a major remodel.  They will be in the middle of this neighborhood once all the roadwork is completed.  My coffee was great, a Cortado that contained espresso I could really taste.  Some coffee shops their coffees are weak, this place serves the strong stuff.  Also, I ate a breakfast sandwich/bagel, I would have given this place 3 stars because the bagel had no character.  They customer service here was highly attentive, yet not over bearing.

3fKrFZtlegzq7Hdywjn0Lg.text: This is the place you must eat in Vegas.. omg!! I can't believe I waited till my last day in Vegas to be here. This place makes me want to stay in Vegas and eat here every day. I had the grilled chicken arepa and my husband had the paisa arepa. Mind blowing dishes. I will come here again when I come back. The infused lavender latte has been the best coffee I have ever had! I posted the pics when I had already picked from it. Couldn't help myself!

sK5EiYuFqQUj_qKfcgheSw.text: Favorite place in Vegas! Cute atmosphere, amazing food every time and not too expensive. Super nice and attentive staff in a very cute and artsy area. My best friend and I always make sure to stop here when we're in town :)

5XXMDCLKN8oRy_V5vK90ww.text: Love this place!! Not because it's located downtown and I live here but you can bring a man's best friend with you as well. I love cafes where they take the time to make a great cup of java especially if there using the V60 slow drip process.. That's the only way to go when you want a coffee fix.   I ordered the the arepa Benny which is like eggs and Benedict. The hollandaise sauce was unique and the beef was made to perfection. Instead of an English muffin they use arepa which is a flat bread made with maize (corn). It was all perfectly matched..  Our server Christian was very good at knowing the inns and outs of the menu and answered all my coffee snob questions lol.. Thanks Christian..

8CGIs9L0lZ0lAdGFCw3XmQ.text: Discovered this local downtown LV gem via Yelp search & came here for a late breakfast with my hubby since it was only a mile from our hotel. The main draw was their unique trendy menu with healthy/vegan options & most importantly the Lavender Infused Latte. Wow! Not only did the Lavender Latte surpass my expectations, but everything else we ordered did as well (Veggie Benny, Soyrizo Brussels Sprouts, Mexican Spice Latte). I've had about 4-5 other Lavender Lattes in my U.S. travels & this place makes coffee with absolutely NO hint of bitterness or bad aftertaste. Also, their customer service is top notch. It's totally worth visiting for any- both traveler or local.

h87HnrYmdiH43aiiQJGrsw.text: Great menu,  like how they categorize by healthy and vegan, etc... Had Latin flare.  Amazing coffee and tea.

4HuFKDf8Thnk1qCzJnJ5VQ.text: Came in here on a Saturday morning looking to get our coffee buzz on and have a little brunch. After placing our order for our food we indulged in the Salted Caramel Latte and we ordered the vanilla honey latte. However they brought out the wrong latte for my wife, so instead of the honey latte she got the Mexican latte which was fine after all. We had to wait for about an hour to get the Empanada platter which was tasty however after drinking the coffees and eating the empanadas we canceled the rest of our order which had not yet been prepared. The manager came by and apologized at about the 30 minute mark and then the hour-mark because he said they were breaking in a new cook. This place would be on point if they just get their stuff together in the kitchen and pay a little more attention to detail with the orders. I'll probably give them another try in about a month. But if you're stopping in for a latte, I don't think you'll find a better place and this part of town.

tnm13p3klVTwA9vWuhGhiA.text: Strong coffee and a friendly staff. I'm in!   I came here to kill some time after a lunch meeting. Being both a coffee fiend and snob, I like to see what the black gold brewing masses are creating out there. Makers and Finders are making some serious java, with what seems like five different styles of coffee brewing going here. It's easy to tell they treat it like a True craft. I ordered an iced coffee and it was delicious. No bitter or burst taste and a very smooth finish. This is a good way to wake up after that mid-afternoon crash.   The venue has a very modern and clean look with a mix of both retro and contemporary wall designs. The dining area has plenty of space for eating and sipping coffee or if you just need to get some work done, belly up to the coffee bar or the large work table provided and feast on all that glorious free WiFi.   The staff here is very nice and let me hang for a bit even after they were closing. I will be back for some food samplings and a chill session on their patio!

pbSbnB1wvqhVEtQmWsXDTw.text: Although this place was a little off the beaten path my wife and I took a chance and were very happy with the results!  I ordered a lavender latte and my wife ordered a Mexican spice latte - both were the best lattes we've ever had.  For food we ordered chilaquiles and some other dish I can't recall the name of.  Everything was very delicious. The portion size was probably just perfect but I was left wanting more of that salsa verde.  The place was quite busy with both patrons dining in and ordering takeout.  This place is like a diamond in the rough.

_Sc1_lbkfAGWcyWWbLJi8g.text: Good from start to finish and well worth the drive from our hotel. Love love loved the honey latte, Egg white w tinga. And the Bloody Mary was perfect! YUM!!

gp1Hphllf4_kkm4rh_JRDw.text: Update: They now offer a vegan menu (many options!) although my favorite is the avocado toast. Marco is absolutely amazing! Great coffee and great food :)

kCk7yjP4Yk9wkX_15Taymw.text: While I have been to M&F multiple times and share similar positive reviews that have already been posted, I felt the need to comment after their first CAMA last night. It was a Japanese-inspired pop up dining experience at midnight that transported us to Tokyo. The mood in the space was set perfectly, the staff did their best to attend to the large crowd, and the offerings were so delicious. We tried everything on the small menu and the eel was our favorite....melted in your mouth with excellent flavor. The whiskey option on the drink menu was smooth, fragrant, and classic. Oh! Almost forgot the DJ...mixed music perfectly and kept the mood smooth and sexy. M&F is evolving as a power house when it comes to special events, mainly due to the team's desire to collaborate and bring great people skilled in certain areas together under the same roof. Love this place, and I hope you will as well!

Hkbnou-jxxa3IXdT51visg.text: This place was a recommendation from a good friend, and now I know why. There service was beyond great, we told them we were in hurry and they were about to accommodate us in no time. I can not wait to return to this place when I have more time to relax in this urban but chic environment.

XQRRmGZoRw8neGw7UU6SIg.text: I love M & F however, I was there the first time in a while with a friend who has a gluten allergy. The waiter had to keep telling us that things that were listed on the menu as gluten free were not actually gluten free? So it took us much too long to find us something she could actually eat. My only complaint on this place is they need to update their menu of these errors. If you are celiac or have a very serious gluten allergy, please be careful eating here!

VyDsWknE2PlX-_r9ffkmTg.text: The food is pretty good. The chairs are not comfortable -- so if you're looking for a place to camp and work/write for a few hours, know that your back and butt are going to hurt after a very short time because the chairs are too low and the edge of the chairs is too sharp/corners dig into your legs. Plus there are only two power outlets in the entire place -- which is fine if they want to discourage campers from hanging out and drinking pour overs all day, but for my purposes, I'll pass on this one. The coffee was good though.

tBkHDJMzuUT-rycmTbVnIg.text: It's nice to have a new cafe like this in the downtown area without being in the middle of Downtown Las Vegas, per se.  Located on Main St. near Charleston Blvd., the boyfriend and I stopped in on Saturday afternoon at 3:40, 20 minutes before they close, unbeknownst to us.  Parking was easy since we got lucky and snagged a spot right in front.  The staff didn't shoo us away, even though they would be closing soon and we were ordering more than just coffee.  The menu offerings include breakfast served all day, bagels, sandwiches, salads, soup, arepas, empanadas, desserts, pastries, plus various teas and coffees, including cold brew.  Since time was not on our side during this visit because we had a 4:30 appointment elsewhere, I just had the Turkey Club and a lavender latte.  The club sandwich was nothing special, but I did like the plantain chips that came with it; I wouldn't pay $9 for this again, though.  I did love my lavender latte with almond milk, however.  It smelled wonderful, of course, and was creamy with just the right amount of sweetness.   Service was excellent and I really like the ambiance.  There is a counter as well as an area for the electronic-toting patrons who want to plug in and do some work on their laptops.  I also spied at least one couch in the corner.  I look forward to more visits to try some of the other coffees and the Latin food items, especially when we're not pressed for time.  *Closed Sundays Open Mon-Sat, 7:00-4:00

W0LYV0gc0xOfgpVLndOVFQ.text: This place has great food and I love their coffee. If my rating was based on food alone I would give them four stars. However, as I am a firm believer that service is paramount I had to give three stars. This place is disorganized, expect extended wait times for parties larger than two. Yes, they are busy due to their popularity for great food however this restaurant unfortunately could be  significantly much more efficient and increase the number of customers they can turn around. Their layout and service is disorganized. communication between servers needs improvement, in my case the host mistakenly seated a party ahead of us and offered us seating that later the owner/manager had a problem with. At the end we were given a receipt with one total, when we gave our payment the server decided to added 20% gratuity after the fact presenting us with a revised total they charged before discussing with us. This needs to be stated clearly ahead and should be presented at the time the bill is provided. Otherwise I have no problem with a 20% gratuity automatically applied for parties above the restaurants pre-determined size. I value great service and WILL pay for it. Do not go if you are starving, make sure you expect to wait at least 40 mins for larger parties. Reservations are NOT available. Also, they do have an order to go coffee counter, however they have a policy not to sell you a cup if you plan on sitting for a meal until you are actually seated at a table. A customer focused establishment would want you to be comfortable drinking your pre paid coffee in a to go cup while you wait your 30-40 minutes to be seated.

YXeLmEH3XsF4Imw_nrSSsA.text: Makers and finders is such a cute place. So glad they offer food too. Never knew it had Latin influences. Trendy coffee shop and food spot. Most people had their laptops out so they prolly go good wifi too. We ordered a lavender infused latte which was super good. U can actually taste the lavender. Also ordered the salmon lox which was pretty good. Nothing special though. Wish they put salmon on both bagels. The cream cheese was good. It had chives in it I think. My boyfriend ordered one of the arepas with an egg and shredded pork or beef and avocado with Spanish rice. He said it was delicious. Prices are decent. like $8-10 range a plate. Noise level is medium. Evenly spaced out tables and a couch in the corner. They even have a cute outside front porch and bar for seating. Service was good. Everyone was nice.

ldLOS6GCO5dMfU5_n52Yzw.text: Makers & Finders is my new go-to when I'm in Las Vegas. If I lived here, it would be a daily staple.  The coffee & espresso are top notch and the food is well above average. (Current favorite: Chilaquiles) The folks working there are warm, friendly and knowledgeable. The atmosphere is pleasant.  What more are you looking for, exactly?Looking forward to my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-viRkVxn8rZu96zAMvkj0w.text: Food is much better and so is service.   The coffee here has always been 5stars and the people are always friendly.   I will definitely be back again.

VWjWiqGzFg3NUI5tfWYbYg.text: For my money, this is the way new Vegas food  spots needs to be moving. If there is a micro trend downtown (or in smaller neighborhoods) please let this be it.  My hopes for this new trend that are embodied by Makers and Finders:  1. Great tasting food  prepared well.   2. Food with a cultural touch point that provides a flavorful influence on the dishes.  3. Helpful and attentive waitstaff that know the menu and seem pleased you are there.  4. Responsive management who checks on you when they learn there is possible issue with an order.  5. Delicious beverages.  6. Creative and welcoming decor.  I really like this place. I've found my regular dishes and have only had one "off" experience with them. Lots of places serve chilaquiles in town, but this is one of the few spots that ensures the chips are crisp and the salsa is flavorful. I think the salsa (when it's on point) makes the dish for me. There's some dimension to the dish and it's more of a modern interpretation---but the bits that make chilaquiles so comforting are there.   Makers and Finders is lovely. It doesn't feel like an attempt at an LA or San Fran style coffee shop. It feels like downtown Vegas with its eclectic art and complicated coffee all set to a Latin beat. I love eating there and I can't wait to get back.  EDITED TO ADD: I'm noticing less consistent preparation if one of my favorite dishes--the chilaquiles.  Each time I visit they are prepared differently. I love the new menu, but I'm less enthusiastic about this place than I once was. Right now they are a solid 3.5.

BiT5K5tRdGHERKeI6uMzlg.text: I really want to love Makers, but I don't.  PROS -Close to work -Great patio space -Not a chain store -some tasty sauces!  CONS -The coffee just isn't good enough to warrant the price.  There are muchhhh better coffee places within walking distance... -The food, too, feels overdone.  Everything I've had here has been very salty, and their empanadas are more like giant wontons (which, while nice and fried, isn't what I'm going for when I order empanadas). -Slowwww.  Whether sitting down or ordering coffees to go, it's not that quick.  Overall, it's fine and I'm glad it exists where it does, but leaves me a bit disappointed each time I go.

_qwDGHZq1l9DsKpUC5ln1Q.text: Came upon this little gem while we were antique shopping in Vegas. Wonderful food and service. Try the red arepa if you like spice and the lavender infused latte in general. Definitely recommend if you are in this part of Vegas. I would even say come off the strip or downtown and visit. Worth a trip off and your time.

_KaPicskVUg9vWE5leoeKQ.text: I was recently turned on to this new place by a co-worker when on a coffee run and under the impression we were going to our regular place. She says "we're going to Makers and Finders." We were promptly greeted and asked if we wanted just coffee or wanted food as well. We said we wanted drinks to go and were provided menus. We placed our order and had a seat in a cool little lounging area while waiting for our drinks.  The atmosphere was hip and had a good "hang out" vibe. They had a TV (turned off), and had latin music playing in the background. It seemed like it took it a while to get our drinks. The coffee was pretty good, though. I ordered a regular brewed coffee of Columbian origin. You have to select an "origin" when selecting your coffee.   The staff was friendly, but it seemed like they were a little "disjointed" behind the counter and a little confused as to who was doing what. I am confident the longer they are open, the more in sync they will become and it will only get better from here.  In addition to coffee drinks, they offer a variety of food. One in our party got a bagel with  a cream cheese type of icing. I was lucky enough to sample it and was impressed. I look forward to checking this place out again and will update the review accordingly.

z2H5lPWEekP-OIYyRXpPDw.text: Items Selected: Cold Brew Mango Caprese Arepa - Sliced Mango, Queso Fresco, Tomato, Balsamic with plantain chips Elvis Press - Sweet Croissant, Bacon, Peanut Butter, Nutella, Banana Ojaldras - Honey Orange Batter, Cinnamon Sugar, Lechera, Vanilla Ice Cream  Almost unabashedly targeting the hipster crowd with a clever name complete with ampersand it was just after lunch at El Sombrero Mexican Bistro that I entered Makers & Finders, the 'urban coffee bar' still in its soft opening phase just across Charleston on South Main Street and with a focus on roasters not yet featured in Sin City and a menu featuring loosely defined "Latin" cuisine the experience component still needs a little work, though the promise is great.    With owner, operator, and marketing folks working front of house while a team of three manned a small kitchen in back it was mere moments after crossing the outdoor patio and entering Makers & Finders glass door that I was greeted by a young man named Christian and seated along a wall with full view of the extensive coffee bar the service that followed was fun, informative, and efficient as can be - all questions answered and feedback sought on every item tasted throughout my nearly hour long stay.  Stripped down in decor with Botero posters lining the back walls as a mod-techno infused soundtrack filled the air it was with an clean, full-bodied cold-brew that the afternoon began and browsing free WiFi while a few already-regulars chatted at a table to my left it would not be long before the first of three plates arrived, an arepa with a piping hot bun so crisp that it could barely be cut with the flimsy flatware provided while the flavor of crisp fruit, vibrant tomatoes, and mild cheese tinged in balsamic was anything but meek - a restrained sweetness added to the Italian classic and a perfect option for vegetarians and those looking for something healthy and fresh.  Moving onward to things more sinful it was perhaps good fortune for Makers & Finders that I am not, in fact, a vegetarian as the whimsical "Elvis Press" was described on the menu with no mention of bacon and although I was admittedly underwhelmed by the doughy croissant - something the restaurant would be well advised to remedy via quick consult to Chef Ogasawara at Sweets Raku, perhaps - the constituents within were again pleasant, the crisp pork offsetting decidedly sweet flavors as molten hazelnut spread and peanut butter made the composition more fork and knife friendly than the sort of thing eaten by hand.  Still sipping the coffee while debating a caramel or honey infused espresso it was not long before a final plate of Ojaldras arrived and having never tasted this dish, thus with no precedent to judge, all I can say is that the crisply fried strips were excellent beneath a veil of citrus-kissed honey while "seasonal" vanilla bean ice cream was icy and inert, another outsourcing job to be considered...in this case a job for the team at Art of Flavors, or perhaps another 'unique' purveyor not yet featured in the Las Vegas market as it is with the focus of the brew.  At this point an imperfect vision tucked amidst the unique antique shops on Main Street there is little doubt that Makers & Finders is apt to grow with experience and time, the team obviously interested in the customer experience while the menu aspires to things far more interesting than the typical soups, salads, sandwiches, and pastries popularized by large chains.  Not yet ready to take on spots like Sambalatte or Grouchy John's but obviously much more convenient to the hip-urban crowd it will be interesting to see how this project develops, the brewery next door another clear sign of the direction downtown continues to progress.

T4N_Ats-WkcDe_ZDyQ9n5w.text: This place is sometimes packed sometimes empty. The service is great when it is empty but when it is crowded it you are definitely waiting for a long time for service and for food. The menu is great. The drinks are exceptional and the ambience is what we come for. The empanadas change depending on who is the chef that day sometimes they are doughy with a lot of crust and sometimes they are just filled to the brim and delicious. Nevertheless we keep going back because there are so little places in Las Vegas with this chill vibe.

FCtcPJ7xYNqXCxYzuucnMQ.text: The coffee is good: unique preparations, decent roasts, attractive lattes. The atmosphere is open, nice outdoor seating, and friendly staff. The food is expensive and not of high quality, in fact it looks much better in my mind's eye than in front of my actual eyes. It was just not good...it's a nice place, but over priced.

b2DtnmUJRrsqy2D3Ohluhg.text: Delicious Coffee and Crispy Fries! Very nice, casual coffee house! I love the vibe in there, great place for dates. You have the option of sitting inside our outside on their patio. When you and your significant other don't know where to go have lunch, give this place a try.

r6iIhTSSnPET5DLjC124MA.text: Cody was amazing and his service technic's we're fabulous. I highly recommend for coffee and food plus great staff!

Sin8BPKFh7tJfTtpYka58A.text: What a cute little coffee house in the heart of the downtown arts area. Walked in on a Friday afternoon and took our seats. Was promptly greeted by a nice waiter who took our drink and food orders. Food took a little long to come out, but more time for conversation. I got the cafe con leche, and it was a solid coffee for $5. If you're looking for a good coffee and a nice aesthetically pleasing atmosphere than go enjoy a drink or two here. Also had some empanadas, which were fine for $6. But I would recommend springing a little bit more because the main entree type dishes around me looked amazing. Would definitely return :D

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. small tables, cute plants
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cafe con leche

sea0yXJpeIlG6oL09PixVw.text: Outstanding breve flat white. My favorite drink!! It was so good I got a breve Gibraltar afterwards. They adjusted the bean to keep the same perfect ratio of espresso flavor to creaminess. Bravo!!!

pQMkOW515dpGzSdwtK4XrQ.text: Let me start by saying that this is some of the best nitro cold brew I have ever tasted. The coffee gives off a very smooth taste with possibly some notes of a milk chocolate! Came in to grab a quick coffee and the barista was very outgoing and gave me the suggestion of the nitro cold brew. Despite it's great taste the size you're getting at $6.50 is a little steep, but it's definitely something you should try once.

ME6i24aPtmxHbOE2EtNqjw.text: Okay food was super yummy but the service was sooooo slooooow. Also, I ordered coffee and a matcha latte. No. They should not offer those items. They tasted awful. My matcha latte tasted like cold milk and was unsweetened. It's $5.41 for that. Cmon. The one from Starbucks is 100% better and bigger. Stick with the food. We got a breakfast bagel and pancakes.

1BIbiLSA4RCQv00BO1vS2w.text: I checked in said 20% off latte but the server said they dont do that anymore.    We ordered: turmeric latte it was good  Vanilla latte was good  Mexican latte was not good  Veggie benny: was decent. The bottom part on one was nice and soft the other one was hard and not good. Some of the tostadas were soggy and some were crispy.   Sofrito burger was decent   Ceviche lacked flavor and not worth it, they dont give enough plantain chips   The young lady forgot to give us refills and wasnt very attentive.    For 3 people we spend about $70   Cheers

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GP5FeMtltN3p0aC-2Q0iBQ.text: Worth trying.  We came for the coffee and were a bit disappointed.  But we LOVED the food.  So think of this less as a coffee place and more of a breakfast place that does a great job at doing almost everything right with the food.  First off, the service was good.  We came in on the first day and they were busy and were willing to move things about to get us seated as quickly as possible.  Then, we realized that we weren't gonna get the coffee we wanted, and we had already eaten.  So instead of just sticking it out we let them know we were heading out and would be back the next day for some of the great looking food.  The next morning we were there, and we had a reservation.  We were seated promptly and our drinks were taken.  Now don't get me wrong, the drinks are just fine for a breakfast place.  Standard fair with some nice drink options.  But no craft coffee.  No snob coffee.  But the food was great!  With Vegas having so many places and with us getting into Vegas only rarely.   I doubt we will go back.  But if I lived here.  It probably would be a go to place when I want the unique breakfast fare they offer.  Plus, it was really cool of the waiter to offer to take a picture of us!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chai with Granola
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extra egg on this one
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IH8yirRS8nmd_kLMWN_DYA.text: We been coming here since this place started. It was good, but recently This place has been bad every time I have come here, it is not worth going to any more.  Servers are rude, Service is slow, to go orders take forever, food comes cold, food quality has gone down.  I will rather give my money to Publicus then here!

YM1X3lFt5APYLWS6MmcWtQ.text: Great food and coffee but the service left a little to be desired. The Mexican spiced latte was delicious.   Cool atmosphere and a great starting point for wandering through the Arts District.

HQ8q36AQsLnvmzS9vdCiYQ.text: This is the place to be if you want to eat off the strip, especially if you have a car.  The wait was not long and the atmosphere is great.  Real simple and chill, delicious organic food.  Prices are great ($10-12) and coffee/tea are around $5 as well.  So my grand total for lunch was $15 :)  I highly recommend this spot for those visiting LV for a good Saturday/Sunday brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hallway to restroom
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La Paisa with macha green ice tea

FTNTOig8PKGlyLcpFzLf9A.text: Came back to try this place out again and I love the changes to the menu. Good Latin inspired dishes and the best "Mexican Spice Latte" which is made with Abuelitas hot chocolate! It's beyond delicious, try it! Will be coming back to try out more of their dishes for sure!

uM_ez-fQPb7RKHCgzSll8w.text: I decided to wait a few days before posting this review.  I was here on Saturday morning with my boyfriend, and we didn't have a good experience, at all.  This was not our first time experiencing Makers & Finders. Usually we order from Uber Eats and decided to go out for breakfast.   As expected, for a Saturday morning it was busy, and we were told it was a 20 minute wait. That's where problems started, but not on our end. We saw 2 different people leave because they were seated and no one came to them to offer them water, give them a menu or even great them for almost 10 minutes. It took almost 5 minutes for a server to even realize they were gone.  This same thing happened to us when we sat down. The couple next to us were seated even before we got there 25 minutes before, and they hadn't even ordered.   By the time we got our drinks, we had been there for an hour. Neither us nor the tables around us were given spoons for the sugar on the table and had to resort to forks and knives in replacement.   Jacob got the breakfast sandwich, which he said was cold, and dry. It was flavorless, and for us having been sitting there for an hour and a half, were not too thrilled. I got the salmon Benny, which was missing a vital ingredient, salt. The arepa was extremely dense, chewy and bland. My poached eggs were hard in the center, and the mariquitas were unseasoned. The only thing good was our latte's and the breakfast empanadas.   I would not order the food here again. I would not drive here again, I might Uber Eats a latte, but I'd rather go somewhere else for that effort.   Happy Eating!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The salmon Benny, super bland, my poached eggs were overcooked. The bacon was soggy, and this entire dish needed salt.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Empanadas. Probably the best thing here

s72V2LfqEa8A-6ZP9aqXrw.text: I love that they have options for common allergies and more importantly, you don't have to compromise taste. Arepas are a gluten free bread/pastry/biscuit?? alternative from South America that are hard to find in the US.   I tried the veggie benny this time - it was like everything else here, delicious. Don't get me wrong tho, I'm no vegan. The short ribs and bacon are great too. And thank you for not covering everything in cheese!   They were able to make my caramel latte with coconut milk bc soy, nuts and dairy hate me.   Our waitress was very sweet and gave us helpful suggestions. THANK YOU Mishah!!   This is our 3rd time here. We always stop in when we're in town.   **Cows can sleep safe tonight bc no udders were harmed in the making of my breakfast.**

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Benny aka my new BFF
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The whole farm on a tiny skillet
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted Caramel Latte with COCONUT  milk

Ai4Wf30VLGJu9IxQ_xcrEw.text: This coffee place is located at the Vegas art district. We were all excited before coming in but then left with disappointment. Don't be fooled by the great reviews! I think most of the great reviews go to the cute and nice environment instead of the food.  I ordered the bon bon latte and chicken tinga omelet with a side of Brussels sprouts. The Bon bon latte (layered latte with condensed milk and coco powder) came in a small cup ($5). It was unique but too sweet for me. The chicken omelet was wet and the whole plate was watery, it made the chips on the side all wet, gross! The Brussels sprouts came in a cute small pot which is great in presentation. The dish was flavorless, I expected something roasted and flavorful but it's not the case at all!  The service was slow! My other friend ordered the house coffee (which I think it's simple and quick, may be I'm naive?) we waited for about 15 mins for that. We told the server to check for us and he did. Then we saw the barista poured the last portion of coffee from the container. It wasn't enough for the cup then he watered it down. I was like .....  I won't come back for sure!

vMKPW2tIjLOLOsoOvzGhjg.text: Great service. Amazing lattes and they offer vegan options. The vegan empanadas are so flavorful and tasty.

6aEaSROcd5yAfIRILRsIRw.text: Brought the family to breakfast here on a Sunday before we left town. We tried a range of items between us - the lavender latte (tasty), the caramel latte, the bon bon, and the kids' hot chocolate. Everyone was pleased with their drinks. I had a hard time choosing what to order for breakfast, but settled on the Latin hash 2.0 and was not disappointed. My son got the kids waffle and the whipped cream was delicious. I will be back next time I'm in Vegas - I want to try the whole menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids&#39; waffle. Mid-chew
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender infused latte

PlKxmnx0NPnMOatHoPTMpg.text: Had a lovely salmon "benny" at Makers & Finders today. Tasty and satisfying! We sat on the patio, which was comfy if a little bit awkward in terms of table height. The thing that stuck out to me was the quality: the benedict and cappuccino I had were both very well prepared. Personally, the smallish portion size was perfect for me, but I can imagine it might be a bit disappointing for the average appetite. The service was a bit spotty, but it was obvious that they were trying to handle the lunch rush. But these nitpicky complaints feel like no big deal thanks to the yummy food. All in all, an enjoyable lunch spot! I would definitely eat here again if in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. salmon benny with fried kale and plantains

28P0kQkzESC9LwwEagvarw.text: DTLV is home to plenty of cute and thriving small businesses, but as a local, I'm always hesitant to make the drive up because thinking about street parking makes me tired. Paralleling is not my forte.  Luckily, we slid into a spot around the corner even at a high-traffic time like Sunday brunch day.  It was a 25 minute wait, but that was expected. The place was packed with peeps getting their brunch on. There's some lounge couches outside so at least you're comfy while waiting. And if you choose not to wait, there's a handful of other brunch spots within the vicinity.   I chose the SMOKED SALMON BENNY. Who doesn't like some oozing egg yolk action? Savory and filling. The sauteed kale and tomatillo hollandaise gave it a nice twist. It also came with a few pieces of plantain chips, keeping with the Latin-inspired menu. My cousin opted for the GARLIC LIME CHICKEN off the lunch menu, which looked like it came with mashed potatoes amongst other things. Both menus are available from 7a-4p.  I read a lot of hype surrounding their lattes here, so we both decided to try iced ones: SALTED CARAMEL for me and LAVENDER for my cousin. Our waiter accidentally brought me mine hot, but said I could just keep it. When he brought my iced one, he took back the hot one. Indian giver! In fairness, I said I wasn't going to drink both of them anyway, so shrug. Also, they seemed to run out of mason jars for us, so it was brought out in plastic cups. It honestly just reminded me of a glorified iced caramel macchiato from Starbucks, but still enjoyed it. We forgot to check in before, but 20% off your latte if you do.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. smoked salmon benny with iced lattes in back.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hot salted caramel latte and iced lavender latte.

HgF034HZr7u3sYM_105Y5A.text: One word: amazing! It's a cool place, with good song and great service. The food is delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qrtsWgmF4o1aoFr0513wcQ.text: The food is very flavorful and the staff is very friendly. A more local experience in Vegas in comparison to the strip. We had the Arepa Benny and Latin Hash, both were delicious. Save room for dessert, because the Berry Empanadas are a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry Empanadas

tUmYPTXEUe-iVzL85EQvHQ.text: This review is based off of my experience with getting a latte to go, and will be revised when I return to dine here.   My favorite cafe closes pretty early, and my partner and I were out and about, checking out the vintage stores and antique shops in the area when I wanted coffee. Bad. Our friend had mentioned this place when we were out and about the other day, and she had raved about their coffee.   I hadn't realized it was a full on diner.   The staff was friendly, and we were greeted immediately. The place is cute, with a rad M & F sign over their bar.  I had a Mexican Spice Latte that was delicious, and totally gave me flashbacks to my nana' chocolate growing up. The service wasn't the fastest for a cafe, but this place was primarily a diner, so a bit of a wait is to be expected.   I can't wait to come back for breakfast.

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gRYSkKoymF_8PrhNglEM3Q.text: Me and my friend went for 1st Friday it was like  7 pm the place was kind of empty. We order empanadas and lavander latte tea and a cafe latte. My tea was kind of hot but not really my friends coffee was cold we told our waitress and he said oh sorry we will have to make it new but will cost you again.. like what? What kind of place will charge double for their mistake. Never again

t2p4_5G84CS2ggpJh98NuQ.text: First: I'm sure normal experiences are prob great. This is about a wrong item and delivery service. Ordered deliver through Yelp which was fulfilled by Grubhub...wrong order was sent. Tried calling phone number stapled on the order and it was an incorrect number. Found phone number and called to inform I was sent the wrong items and they said the item on Yelp was incorrect. It was described as smoked salmon, capers, cream cheese, tomatoes and red onion (pretty classic item)...instead I got eggs benny smoked salmon, kale, grilled tomato, and banana chip strips. Completely different ingredients one of which I'm allergic to :-(. On the phone I was told there's nothing they can do but for me to contact the delivery service. The gentleman on the phone was very nice, but they really need to update their yelp menu to prevent this. Called Grubhub and they couldn't find the order. Told they couldn't do anything either. So frustrated and hungry. So if ordering delivery, maybe call them first....

EYw3QC6ZMjqoRdOHSQ8Low.text: The Benny Arepas was delicious -perfect proportions of each ingredient -highly recommended. Had a latte with my breakfast -great coffee. Friendly staff, cool space.

pJ743-1-M9CPA3kwqWdrvA.text: Such a cute concept, but Makers+Finders unfortunately did not deliver in terms of food. My friend was taken with the idea of arepa benedicts, so we came here for brunch before heading back to LA. I had their Lox Benedict, and also shared the Empanada Sampler and Fries with my table.  We were super disappointed in the arepa part of the benedict - it was undercooked, bland, with no nice toasted color to it lol. The best part of my Lox Benedict was the braised kale, and it only came with 4 plantain chips. C'mon, y'all can do better than that! The empanadas were sparsely filled, making it mostly fried dough. The fries were probably the best part of the meal, with a delicious garlic aioli on top.   While service was okay, the kitchen seemed to be a mess. Our starters (the Empanadas Sampler + Fries) were the last to arrive, and it took a good 25-30 minutes for our food to come. Makers+Finders have a lot to improve on, but I can definitely see it as a great place to return to once it does!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanada Sampler - mostly dough
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Undercooked, bland arepa, but delicious kale lol

53oBdRlXDXosjASLPYrotw.text: This is my second time at Makers and Finders and I really love the atmosphere, coffee and food. Service was excellent the 2 times I've been there but my boyfriend mentioned how his last visit was horrible due to lack of service. I find the prices to be a little high for the breakfast but it is very good food.

tL-0clRXhLblS70uZ9YcBg.text: Came here since it was on my way to my office. I love this place, it is very unique great coffee place. I had cafe con leche and it was great. The service was good. Parking was easy and a nice walk to the coffee shop. I will come back to try their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

awcfKfRXZ5Wlt6SmnDpI2g.text: Sitting here about 30 minutes after we ordered our food, still nothing has come out. Orders the empanadas and a croissant sandwich. 2 couples next to us arrived much later (about 10-20 minutes after we ordered, had their orders taken and got their food within 10 minutes. Not sure how the kitchen works but this is a bit disappointing. Maybe it takes longer for them to make empanadas? Why not make a batch ahead and have them ready to fry? Server hasn't updated us either on the status of our order (i.e. busy making it, running a little behind, etc.). Unacceptable. The Nutella latte was eh. Didn't taste like Nutella. Chai latte was good.   Update: So we never got our food order because our server never put it in! He came back out asking again what we ordered and we were just floored. That was it. How'd he forget to put in our order when it wasn't even busy at all? We were maybe only the 3rd table seated when we came in at 12:15pm. Cardinal rule of serving - don't forget to put in your customers' orders! Needless to say, we were extremely upset and just asked to cancel our order. He tried to comp 1 of our meals, but at that point, we didn't want to eat here anymore. If I could give 0 stars I would, but at least he said the coffee and chai would not have to be paid for his mistake. Very poor service for a place we had high expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chai tea latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The coffee bar

4ZnfS6hlVC2qlBVCvTFyfQ.text: The coffee is always amazing! I typically order an iced honey vanilla latte or the Mexican spiced latte. They have a variety of non-diary milks (soy and nut milks) so that's always a plus in a my book (as I am lactose intolerant).   I recently had dinner here as well and ordered the lomo saltado and the empanada sampler. I was surprised when the food arrived it wasn't as good as the coffee. The lomo saltado is sort of a deconstructed version as the fries, steak, and onions are traditionally stir-fried together but not in this dish. I did like that they added an egg though. I was underwhelmed with the empanadas because they are made with flour dough as opposed to the traditional corn dough. I generally prefer corn dough or corn tortillas to the flour versions but I know I'm also the minority in that aspect. That said, the fillings were pretty well done! I had the chicken tinga (which was my favorite), carne mechada (seasoned shredded beef), and the cheese blend. I found the rice and black beans bland (which is odd because they're flavorful all on their own but maybe they didn't add enough salt). Although the rice was really fluffy so it had a wonderful texture so I definitely finished it!   Overall this place is still 4 stars (although if I rated just the coffee it'd be 5). The service is great (even at 45 mins before closing) and staff are friendly. I would go back and try other dishes for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deconstructed lomo saltado with fried egg on top
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The empanada sampler (from left to right: cheese, chicken tinga, and carne mechada).

DNszKWlKekYqn_wYpZRL7w.text: WAHOOOOOOOO!!!!!!  So grateful to find somewhere that has replaced my darling, inventive, hometown, thoughtful breakfast spot!!!!!  Can't wait to bring my hubby back next week.  My friend and I went for Sunday morning brunch and a catch-up sesh.  Service was indeed slow, but I feel that it was purposefully paced for the experience.  Had it been a weekday, I would have been out of my mind with the tortoise speed of service.  I had the Mexican Spice Latte (sweet, with a deliciously gentle spice) and the Chicken Tinga Benny (spicy, but not painful, PERFECT eggs, plantain chips, magic!).   My friend had the Cortadito and Arepa Benny and loved all of it.  Can't wait to keep coming back.... and can we discuss how adorable that block has become?  I love this city and all the gems like Makers & Finders that keep popping up!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BbwuqpIJL-35GycFjuRvGQ.text: The service is great and the drinks are definitely awesome. The arepa Benny was good and the kale chorizo omelette could have used more chorizo today it was just a lot of egg (sad face)  I would try it again for sure but getting the empanadas sampler or the arepa Benny

iss-2ZK_wn6c95eG86jXfA.text: My buddy Rob and I were in town working a music festival...long days, longer nights. We had been planning to grab some cold brew coffees from MFC on our way into work. On our way there, realized they were about to close. We called and said we were going to be cutting it close to closing time but let them know how much Rob had been talking up there cold brew that he was trying to get some for our crew. The owner was cool on the phone and even cooler in person, as he stayed and totally stoked us out by making sure we had everything we needed.   Now, as if their customer service wasn't worth 5+ stars, their cold brew was delicious. Everything that touched my taste buds that day guaranteed I'd be making another visit whether I was in Vegas for work or play.

31i3FQFCzqbC5yI-dzPkGw.text: I absolutely loved this place. I took my family to breakfast and we all absolutely loved it. Their coffee was amazing(I don't even like coffee) and the food was great. You have vegan and non vegan options. I like how cozy and cute it is. I'll definitely be going back.

t3T3dqXJPTv7TKXCvqBGSQ.text: I went here for the first time yesterday and really enjoyed my time.  I loved:  a) The staff - one waiter even brought over a table for me to easily reach my drink  b) The ambiance - the outdoor seating area is so cozy, lots of seats were available, and the customers all seemed high-vibe  c) The menu - lots of fun things here to try (most coffeeshops have the same boring things - I love the options here!)  d)  They use mason jars and glasses wherever possible  e) Fast wifi  I tried the honey-vanilla latte which was great and the coconut chai overnight pudding which was a little too strong on the honey for me.   I'll definitely be back - maybe even today. :)

ZYeG-Qqfb3_mCaeqeBtvsg.text: Good ice green tea latte with almond milk and friendly cafe a lot ppl bring laptop for work and chilling here.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hXCvS9_VZU900KehWdjAAA.text: I've been here a few times; and been to the one in downtown summerlin as well. Both always give me eh experiences. Today we went to the one downtown, for breakfast for my boyfriends 21st. We went up to the bar to ask the bartender for a round, and she proceeds to tell us they take our orders at the table..and goes back to doing what she was doing. Ok. So we sit down and eat our food, no salt no pepper, no one asks if we're ok, try to get ahold of some condiments but everyone is talking behind the bar and generally not paying attention. We wait way too long to get our check. Everything is just eh. Could be a better place.

3YA95yxbyMtFJc75r_9frA.text: Wow Vegas has came along way from when I lived there. This is forsure a great place for vegans.  Check it out.

RrgRZ6Erwgg6nlM2MwXq9w.text: This place was highly recommended by a few friends and I see why. The food was delicious, especially theit Rib Eye breakfast with beans, rice, avocado and egg. 3xkMwFSjBL55quL2Q99icg.text: Lovely. Super great staff. Quick and convienient and was really a nice experience. Will be going back!!

79Px4OAfW9lJCIT7Agh88g.text: First time ever coming here just stumbled upon the place walking down Main Street. 10/10 recommend their home brewed coffee is amazing and the food was outstanding. Definetly recommend

SoTqI-EemNCUFdI4rSWiHg.text: This place was a gem! If you want good food in Vegas this is the place for you! We were only in Vegas for 3 days and we managed to eat here twice. I will recommend it to everyone who tells me they're going to Vegas. They are that good! There was four of us and we managed to make a dent in their menu. We tried and ate many things and loved everything we ordered.

dZmFv9m52lDhK8e4p7xvCg.text: First time here for brunch, I had the empanadas sampler, it was good. It's not big portion, more like an appetizer but it's fulfilling. I really wanted the Cuban coffee but found out that it's not Cuban coffee beans.

hirB1w8vKUhyewzItuANBA.text: Like you need another reason to leave the strip, but the search for a good cup of coffee in Las Vegas is a real issue. Fortunately there was Makers solves all my under caffeinated needs. The walk from the Stratosphere also brought me through some fun antiquing.

A0FlIq6dTjuQ5rNUI9q8Pg.text: awesome! delicious food, friendly staff, nice atmosphere. good place to eat, hangout and/or get done work done. recommended.

zqC4W5gZtrslpkLXs8l0pQ.text: Creative, friendly and knowledgeable. One of those places you want to spend time in, not just grabbing a cup of coffee and running out. Sit at the bar or grab a table, kick back and enjoy some of the best coffee in town! And the food is fantastic, too. Try the ceviche, the chorizo Brussel sprouts, or any of the arepas. You can't go wrong.
