The coffee is amazing and has a delicious bold flavor .. and the food is amazing as well .. ive been there a few times and it always awesome .. i get the iced salted caramel its DELICIOUS !!! i definitely recommend this place to all my fellow coffee lovers! !!!

wQdsuN5EA3lfkRpJDIu-eQ.text: i found this cool coffee place by accident and it was surprisingly very cool inside. i was scared at first when i drove by the area and once i get in it was a cool place like you find in downtown San Francisco those very unique coffee places.  my latte was top of the line and the guys there are very nice and professional.

GstKamHjVcf8S_rgvjLOBw.text: My boyfriend and I came for Sunday brunch.. I ordered the Kale Chorizo Omelet and it was absolutely delicious!!  Amazing food, great service, awesome atmosphere. We will return!!!

uNTHjy0RljDd5cqLDz7Xmw.text: Just a great breakfast and staff. Very unique blend of the traditional with special twist. An excellent spot near the mall.

kOOEUL18BGRFClcJvrNhYQ.text: I found this place on my commute to work and was very excited and decided to try it on my day off which is Sunday. Oddly enough they are closed on Sundays. So I decided to try again yesterday. The coffee menu is very small and their prices are very high. My favorite place is Sunrise Coffee! Anyways my fiance ordered a small latte with 2 shots of espresso and I ordered an iced vanilla small size. The cups were I believe 12 ounces and they do not carry iced beverage cups so I felt very awkward drinking mine through the sippy lid. My fiance enjoyed his and mine was absolutely not delicious and not worth the $5.25 I paid for it. Now here's why I'm giving them 1 star otherwise I may have given a 2 possibly three. We arrived today, Christmas Eve at 7:52 as the hours state 7am-4pm and there was not any signage posted for holiday hours. We were turned away because they don't open until 8. We left as we had to head to work. Got off early today and decided to try again. Now there's a sign saying closed on Christmas which is very fair. Walked in and approached the counter and saw two male employees and was told they were closed. It was 12:30 I'm sorry but that is extremely poor business. And why were the doors unlocked?? For this place only being open 7 weeks you would think they would want to try and build a strong loyal customer base. But nope not here. Not going to be returning again. Prices were too high for the quality we received. $4.50 for the 12 ounce latte with only a single shot. For an extra shot it's $.50 more to add vanilla $.75 more. So my drink is now $5.75 for a 12 ounce cup that's not even meant to hold cold beverages.

xZUIB6fdKcgE36Qt7ritzA.text: Had James as a server.  Excellent across the board.  Perfect coffee drinks with ultimate food pairings

g8wMi5Eq889XV_F8gm5D4g.text: I'm super torn to rate and give a review of this place.  It is so cute and yummy that I want to say good things about it but don't because I don't want this place to get over crowded and lose it's charm.  Selfish, I know!  The outdoor patio in front of the shop is a perfect place to enjoy good company on a beautiful day.  It reminds me of someplace you would find in California somewhere.   Do yourself a favor and get the lavender latte!!  I usually order a cappuccino and don't put sugar or any sweeteners in it so I was afraid the lavender syrup would be too sweet.  But it's not, it's deliciously amazing!  I've tried it with almond milk but it slightly over powers the lavender flavor.   I've also had the shrimp and brussel sprouts which was good.  I just wish it was on the southwest side of town vs downtown so I could go more often!

Jv9uy8yRje75W0rDu_mttg.text: great coffee in a fantastic place more reminiscent of San Francisco or New York....something this town sorely needs....and the bagel sandwich was fantastic but a little pricey.....$15.00 for a bagel sandwich and an iced coffee?? I understand you want a good more upscale crowd here and I am all for it but be careful that you don't run off people that would come her a little more frequently if it weren't so spendy.. beautiful building and great staff so I will return but not as often as I would like

EK74-32ecRScKXu6dAe0lg.text: Hands down the BEST coffee I've ever had. There's such a great selection to choose from, but my favorite is the salted caramel latte. The place has New York coffee house vibe, and that combined with the amazing service (and even better food) makes this my new favorite breakfast/brunch spot. Try the Arepa Benny, it's to die for!

bRzfk9BQodcO3lVm67-qvg.text: Stopped by this morning for the first time- its pretty unique to have a host greet you instead of ordering at the counter, but it's nice!  Each drink (even drip coffee!) is made individually by hand, and my god are they good.  Easily the best chai I've had since moving to LV.  I also got the veggie bagel, which was surprisingly flavorful and distinctive for something that seems so simple.  Service is a little slow, but I think that's the vibe - a place to hang out and savor all of the interesting flavors this place seems to impart in every sip and bite.

Jb2ermfuDj9Pw4Zr4MAoRg.text: Great service & very friendly staff. Get the Arepa Benny with a Cortado to wash it down .

rm9w-lpUG5c9CeqdyHJ-oA.text: I come here a lot and I love the atmosphere and proximity to my house. But, the food and especially coffee are very inconsistent. If I get my coffee black, it's usually good. But asking for a cappuccino. I usually get a latte. I'm not much for doctored up drinks. So the flavored beverages don't really do anything for me. I just want perfectly steamed milk with an espresso shot that is extracted properly. I've had some good meals here, but I cannot say that they were great. I really want to like this place. And I do. But it makes it difficult for me to want to come back. I've tried a lot of apreas and I have had one here that was cooked right. The Greek yogurt was great, but again. That's a hard one to mess up. A salad here and there was tasty. But I've also had greens that tasted old and extremely bitter. Odd in fact. So again, there's no consistency. It feels like everyone is on their own wavelength. I will always be willing to give it another shot.

EVOjjIQcMAgT0AxZZxdqjg.text: It's a good place to relax and enjoy breakfast. Must try the salted caramel latte ! The Lavender infused latte is not bad too. According to the server, the lavender syrup is make in house.

Mf6RaINmYgB2jAiX32xWKg.text: Fantastic pour-over Coffee, fantastic food. So good I ended up going two days in a row on my last visit to Las Vegas.

eBNcjuZLyA6c2YUPgAn0qw.text: Nice place to chill and have breakfast. Friendly staff. I recommend the veggie bagel and matcha latte. Would definitely come again.

SiXYXOzgLKmjx0YwNM24xg.text: Best coffee ever!!! Service is great and very trendy. Staff is super nice and polite. Great place

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coffee is amazing!!!

8wMg5BU-m7DmwnJPzpFNgg.text: Here is what I love about this place. I've only eaten there once and the menu options are limited, but the one item I choose was one of the most delicious breakfasts I've had, the Arepa Benny: golden poached eggs, coffee rubbed beef, grilled tomatoes, salsa verde hollandaise DEEE-LISH-US  I ventured to try the Lavender Latte, which isn't my style to get flowery coffee. I am now obsessed over this coffee. I ordered this flavor at another popular place in Summerlin and it was an epic fail. ONLY Makers & Finders makes a kick butt lavender latte. Oh yah.. the staff is super friendly and yes, lot of so called "cool people" hang out there.   So sad I don't live near you guys anymore, but I will still come visit whenever near

kO-RvXhLF5AeNNW219v1Bg.text: Amazing breakfast.  Three of us went and all three meals were outstanding, imaginative, and flavorful.  Even the visual presentation was great.  Lattes were delicious and I wish had could of had 5 of them.  Another great Yelp find.

wejmzMVmuKyuHQEzGHKIcw.text: Worst service ever, the host was extremely rude we sat and the table was dirty he said he was going to clean it and didn't. He came back and decided it was ok to put clean napkins and silverware on the dusty dirty table. Even the silver ware was dirty. Steer away! the service is as bad as the food.

Yp3m8TGu5dwg2iwAE3kf7Q.text: Wanted a quality brunch, not too far off the 15 (headed to Zion national park). This place surpassed my expectations! Great tasting food, high quality coffee, in a really cool neighborhood with a lot to offer for vintage lovers.

WcYakcFhRSEo583uMfJXMA.text: The lavender latte is my go to drink, always so delicious and difficult to find anywhere else. Great atmosphere, and friendly staff. Trendy but, not obnoxious. Chill place.

tGwS2z2xD3MR9B_8tqZObg.text: This place was amazing. We came here for food before heading over to Hop Mule on an early afternoon trip to downtown from the strip. It's a short walk from the SDX or Deuce to get over here.  First, the coffee. We each got a cold brew iced coffee, which was a nice, satisfyingly cold beverage for a hot afternoon.   Then, the food. I ordered the Rajas Arepa, having never had an arepa before, but it sounded like something I'd be a fan of. Before too long, I was trying one for the first time, and... just, wow. Lots of great flavors mixed together, everything prepared proportioned nicely to the other ingredients. Plus, the sweet potato/yam/??? chips that were on the side? Those were amazing. I just wanted an entire box of those to-go, they were crunchy but melt-in-your-mouth with just the right amount of seasoning.  There's no doubt in my mind that we'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bZH41-Xh7dTt3__seQzf4g.text: Fantastic cafe in Vegas... away from the crowds, with great coffee and food. Staff are all very friendly... with an adjoining brewery, you can't go wrong!

OZ1Ut6Ekt6u1rlzeA3FrAQ.text: Really enjoyed Makers & Finders. The coffee's are great and the breakfast selection was perfect. Bonus for being dog friendly on the patio, a great morning spot.

Af97TPZVCuNBy1HgWBmIgA.text: When you first walk up to maker and finders it has a totally different feel. It's definitely a diamond in the ruff. Right when you walk in, it has an amazing vibe. Great place to meet people, study, chat. I ordered the lavender infused latte. I have to say it was hands down one of my favorite latte. For one it wasn't basic like most are. It had a great balance of sweet and the lavender wasn't over powering. Then I had the smoked lox. I probably eat bagel and lox at least once or twice a week since I'm big on seafood, but that has to be one of the best iv had. I'm really happy I actually came across maker and finders, and will be going back with all my girls.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5UiaFbIdpx8KobfVF_6lkQ.text: I am not a coffee fan (well, my stomach isn't) but I am a chai aficionado. This location has the best chai in Las Vegas in my opinion; it differs from everyone else in that it doesn't taste like artificial overly sweet vanilla. I also happen to enjoy hanging out in local coffee shops as opposed to the likes of Big Green.  From what I have been told, this is one of the go to spots if you happen to enjoy coffee and espresso as well; it sure smells good to me.  According to Yelp checkins I have been here twenty-four times. I can say that each one of those times the service has been good and the food quality is great. I typically get the breakfast bagel, Latin hash or one of the arepas; if they have a special omelette on the board I'll get that too. Portions are not overly large and that's fine because, let's face it, American's are fat...so, I sometimes have room for a second helping of the chai.

T0hD0usMJnsTO5se5cGVDA.text: I'm giving this place 3 stars because the food and coffee is good. I chose to bring Costa Rican friends here because they didn't want to wait in the long lines at brunch places on the strip. Although we didn't have to wait in line to get seated here it took 40 minutes to get our coffees and another hour to get the food. By the time our food came our coffees were gone and we weren't offered refills. I ordered a chocolate croissant. My two friends got their food and 10 minutes passed so I decided to ask about my croissant. The waitress told me they ran out of dough so they were making it and it would be another 10 minutes. Could you have told me that an hour ago? Or when you brought my friends food? I told her to forget it and decided not to eat because I didn't want to be there all day. So if you're really hungry -beware you'll be waiting a while for your food.

A58rg-J62SkJPdkZcNV-HA.text: Ordered a large cold brew for $4.50 and half of it was ice. It is a blend of three coffees not single origin and although it wasn't bitter, didn't meet my expectations.

Vk_DBZQOdTRLiob_XN1EmA.text: Awesome place!!! I love you every time we go to Vegas we have to have brunch here it is just amazing!  The food, yummmm... But I think they need to hire more people to make the service a bit faster...

cbPeNVO08ZIlt_UnfHMUFw.text: The breakfast at Makers & Finders was fantastic. The Red Arepa and the coconut and turmeric latte was a great combo. Service was great, atmosphere was chill and prices were reasonable.  We will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coffee Bar at Makers&amp;Finders

1PIcCe9uJhJVIUFC9IMiUQ.text: 45 minutes for a cup of coffee to go is ridiculous, and shows a blatant disrespect for a customers time ....to top it off,  coffee was lousy.  I will not be back.

hB5japr4uAILtjcAOa7Edg.text: Love this spot! Been coming here since they opened and its cool to see them changing up their menus and adding new things.  I usually go with the coconut turmeric latte and the bandeja paisa.  Definitely worth stopping in!  The vibe is relaxing and I could use that in my life sometimes...

Vu9y3oKTB3-tkrnWFUf7jw.text: This place is absolutely delicious.  Highly recommend it.  Will be back when on vacation again.  Service and price was perfect as well.

t5o4U5NrcRa4POLzoruFVA.text: Great service and selection. Had a great night with our hrc communications team. Thanks for having us and we will be back.

4Z3h8ZkagFMRAJFRxjgLbg.text: I like the atmosphere and would rather give my business to small, cute places like this than to Starbucks. It's definitely a place for young hipsters though. I'm middle aged and not a hipster (my children are) and I feel like when I went inside I was purposefully ignored. The waiter saw me, but I had to stand and wait what felt like a long time to be acknowledged. I finally told him I wanted a latte "to go" and gave my order to the guy behind the bar. Again I felt awkward and out of place, idk just got that vibe from the staff. My latte took an uncomfortably long time to be ready, and when I got it, it was cold! The place wasn't crowded at the time, so I'm assuming they're sending me the message " Don't come back! You're too old and not the type of cliente we want here!! Won't be going back.

njgWcJdGNmub3yfsGtEQpQ.text: My manfriend & I came here after lunch since we had a hankerin' for coffee. We both joked that the coffee would take 20 years to come out and we were definitely right. Both the table to the left and right of us got their food out before we got our coffee. He ordered a cappuccino and I, the Mexican mocha.   Once it came out, they gave my boyfriend a sweet drink that definitely wasn't his, and then gave me a Mexican latte. I told the server it wasn't what I ordered and her response was "it's kind of like it, it's still spiced." Mmm... okay I really had a craving for chocolate but I guess it wasn't going to get satisfied. She came back and said "I took off the Mexican mocha, and just charged you for the Mexican latte instead it ends up being cheaper." So many questions, but we shrugged. With so many coffee shops downtown, I'm done waiting forever for just a cup of coffee.

e0qyv_VhBwTVXwXonbj4AA.text: Last time I was here the menu was still a chalkboard.   Anywho, they've really grown and it's awesome to see. I ordered the iced matcha latte and salmon toast. Both were excellent but not my favorite.   My friends ordered the avocado toast, unfortunately I wasn't able to snag a photo but it was super disappointing. It was spread so thin I'm not sure you could even call it avocado toast.   Either way, I don't live near downtown so it's not a place I frequent often.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iced matcha latte.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon toast.

4kB2lrKP-gMEfv9FXn15Zg.text: I stumbled upon this hidden jem today after a court hearing.... I was tired cranky hungry and in need of coffee and nice people. I was not disappointed I had the egg white omelet and a keto friendly bulletproof coffee. The omelet was amazing they even substituted their regular side choices for a side salad with apple cider vinegar dressing (added by the server) without my request once I mentioned I was on keto. Very pleasent surprise. The coffee was rich and cramy not bitter at all. My boyfriend had the salmon and eggs he devoured it. So I can only assume it was delicious since it dissappeared so fast I didn't even get a taste . All in all this place is a must try coffee and breakfast spot. It won't dissapoint!!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rGm_KgU7rG_5wsxk2rzcbg.text: Came here based off yelp reviews and the urge for some lavender latte. Arrived around 8:30 am on a Friday morning and the place was pretty empty. The lavender latte did not disappoint! It was perfectly sweetened with a strong enough lavender that you can actually taste it. The lox toast was also very good. I would pass on the plantain chips and opt for some fruit instead. The croissant sandwich was pretty generic. Nothing special for the $9.50 price tag. The croissant reminds me of the Costco bought ones. Minus one star for not honoring the Yelp check in coupon. The waitress said they didn't accept it anymore but it's still on yelp. That's False advertisement if you came here expecting to be able to use it, but they wouldn't honor it. So a heads up!

2bmdJnvsj4kAn8bGB303Ww.text: Delicious food Latin breakfast!! Coffee made by people who supremely care and know about the bean!!

ThGRwp2KKGnfYMi_aNxmmA.text: #BradyEats awesome find for less crowded (weekday) non-touristy place. We enjoyed our food, barista selections, and conversation in a modern relaxed atmosphere.  Blown away by the Turmeric spiced coffee & chilaquiles (hint- ask for both the beef short ribs AND chicken Tinga).   Friendly staff... we'll be sure to be back on our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #BradyEats chilaquiles! For a small worth while up-charge.... Request it &#34;BradyEATS Style&#34; = Short Ribs AND Chicken Tinga! Deliciousness.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut/Turmeric &amp; a Nitro Cold Brew! #BradyEats

snD0Ra9qLPe6XNlzVe7L8Q.text: The coffee is delicious the prices are a bit higher than what I pay for for such a size but definitely worth it because the quality is wonderful. I'm gotten the honey vanilla latte and the bon bon layered latte both which are super delicious. But i advise you that if you get the bon bon layered latte to go. You shake it with all your life because i tried and I still managed to taste lechera when i got to the very end which was very disappointing because i wish the flavors were all mixed in together. I love it i swear just mix it a bit thats why it's called layered for a reason. On another note I loved their sofrito burger it was a very delicious burger  along with house empanada their pretty small but a good price.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sofrito burger with crispy fries.   Iced Honey Vanilla latte.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aioli fries
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels + bacon

TP1j9OIagt7eFqvDcmWGJQ.text: I actually feel a tad guilty leaving this place 2 stars. I think 2 1/2 would be more fitting, but my bf gives them a solid 2..lol  I was really excited to try this adorable little cafe after hearing what great vegan options they have. But considering how bland the vegan empanada bowl was, I probably should have gotten the vegan burger or vegan hash? The server recommended it so I got it. My bf thought his meal was pretty mediocre & also mentioned the poor service, but I didn't think it was THAT bad considering how busy they were. We weren't left without refills so it wasn't a big deal to me. I just think that considering it is a CAFE that serves coffee & tea, the servers could be a BIT more accommodating in regards to their coffees & tea. LOL  For instance - our first server gave my bf a cold tea instead of hot tea. My bf did forget to specify, but before he could get her back to correct her she brought an ice tea. Shouldn't a server at a cafe make sure you're getting the right tea?? And when I asked our second server about the flavor profile of this specific matcha tea, she couldn't describe the tea even though she's had it before??? Tasted like seaweed. LOL So yeah, that was annoying. They also serve their water in dirty, glass milk bottles. I'm a vegan so it wasn't appetizing to see crusty old cow t----- juice on the rim. (GAG). When I asked if they filtered their water the first server gave a very annoyed "no." LOL Uh, sorry that I like clean water?? We also thought it was really bizarre how the servers didn't ask if we wanted cream, sugar, honey etc. Nor was there any salt/pepper on our table or offer to bring any.  All in all, it's not a terrible place if you're stranded somewhere & there's NOTHING else around, but this is VEGAS so why settle & pay for medicore food??

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ick.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Definitely expected better tea. And the glass? Looks cheap.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meh. Salsa was the best part of the meal.

3dLfG7fVS8DMZf5ATT5Wow.text: Got a quick table and ordered the Vanilla Honey Latte. Quite satisfying if you want some flavor with your milk and espresso.  My wife; a very stern critique for the pour over; did appreciate the coffee but the brew wasn't there for her.  She noted it needed more grounds for a stronger cup.  We did have to ask for cream and sugar which is below par for such a high rated well reviewed coffee shop in the cool part of town.  Oh well the service is sometimes off especially being at the end of the day.  And I got a generic design in my latte felt like it was put together very abhorrently...looking back it would've been an awkward question to ask what exactly the design was lol.  All the cons are very nominal in the end and the flavor and quality of coffee is top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A strong critique for coffee; a very loving smile all the same.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey Vanilla Latte. Very much there

hpfs9yQzMnyzlsUoDWYETQ.text: I had the lomo saltado, and this was amazing. The egg was a perfect combination with the rib eye and the rice, perfect size too.  As far as the coffee the lavender latte is good, but the Vanilla Honey latte is delicious and highly recommend.

4DQj7dLw_4mO1jWSDMmpqQ.text: Absolutely delicious empanadas! It has a flaky crispy crust - deep fried. And the cofee was good too. We enjoyed the bon bon latte (sweet and smooth) and white chocolate latte was mild and smooth. Will definitely recommend !

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanada sampler comes with 10 pieces and 3 sauces. We couldnt even finish them all but they were so delicious!

iiZVMrdfpybJOXBYcpNzdw.text: Really disappointed in our experience here. My husband and I both ordered the Vegetarian Benedict and Bloody Mary's. The Benedict came out super sloppy and like they just threw fajita veggies under the eggs. The arepa was pure mush (it was more like polenta) and the chimichurri was so overpowering, it was just too much. The consistency of the whole dish was off. We also didn't receive our Bloody Mary's until we were 1/2 way through our meal. I saw that the bartender didn't even start them until after we got our food, and they still took much longer to come out. They were also unbearably spicy. We both love spicy food and by no means are sensitive to spice, but these couldn't even be consumed as it was burning our throats. It ruined the whole thing, we both left without drinking them.

BX3ZXrhtxQQ4b8B9xSpZjw.text: At some point the flavor and ambiance lose their charm when it takes an hour to put tuna fish in an avocado. The kitchen is either severely understaffed or they have little concern for customer's time. I've stopped coming during lunch breaks and at this point I think I'll stop coming all together. I assumed when the prices spiked and the portions got smaller that they were going to be improving the speed.

5eutgkt19d0ABo-dQC3OhA.text: Great spot, shady outdoor area, cool indoors, space for working on a laptop, or a table with friends.   Lovely staff, good range of food.   For the kiwis and Australians, they make a reasonably good flat white. You will have to ask for a double shot (or more) as they're otherwise singles, and fern designs aren't a given ;)

yu7jhJkzxisTj-oUD-56Vg.text: This place is a only few minutes outside of downtown Vegas and its a nice change of pace if you want to get away from the strip. It was really quiet and they have a nice patio area out front that is very welcoming. My partner and I ate here two days in a row, because it was so good. Plenty of vegetarian and vegan options on the menu and you can order from the lunch and breakfast menu a majority of the day. Lots of Latin inspired flavors and the plantain chips were a great side with all my meals. The wait staff and hostess were very friendly and attentive. The cortado and macchiato I had was delicious and both days the food was on point. This is going on my list of places to recommend to friends when they visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Benny and Salmon Benny

sZQdRTwvbxIgpIYkEPfNiw.text: Food is good but too expensive. One egg benedate is15$ plus 5$ coffee. ITS BASICALLY a sope in American  style which only cost 3 $ to buy .  When I asked for a bit more chips Instead of a complimentary, they charged extra4$  When I said I didn't ask to order just thought it's complimentary, they took my chips away, and canceled the charge, but I already was eating it so That's Lame.

_XM10S3VrepQa2AkjmdcbQ.text: As far as downtown Las Vegas goes there are plenty of exceptional coffee shops. I find makers to be more than just amazing coffee but the food is a hidden gem! If you are into Latin style food this is the place for you!  My favorite & most outstanding dish would be the SMOKED SALMON BENEDICT. One of the best breakfasts I've ever had!  Other than the great coffee the customer service has always treated me like royalty! CODY who has served me multiple times has always been on point with giving me an amazing experience! I believe he is may be the  manager because usually the baristas make my coffee but he always makes sure I get what I want & happy with my selections! If I could do more than 5 stars it would be 15! SALUTE to CODY & the makers & finders staff for being amazing!

KjjVswxvScXVYXBztxm0tg.text: A friend recommended this place to me for the coffee - and it did not disappoint. It's right downtown near all these cute vintage stores. The coffee was fantastic- the Mexican spice latte, matcha latte, and salted caramel lattes are so delicious. The food is also so fantastic- my favorites are the waffles and tomato basil bagel. The bagel has fresh tomatoes and balsamic and fresh basil- I couldn't eat it fast enough. The waffles are also so tasty and come with beautiful fruit and coconut!! The manager here and entire staff here is also so kind and gracious. I love this place so much I made sure to bring my mom here when she came into town :)

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican slice latte with cinnamon sticks and salted carmaker latte

fxKAbxLgx_mH2GPanXif3g.text: In a nutshell: Hip, fun, delightful.  Second time visit, did not disappoint either time.   This is a super charming, very hip, food and coffee hangout spot located in the happening Arts District Downtown. The interior is fantastically decorated, very modern and very conducive to conversation amongst friends. The bar area has plug-ins for your laptop or phone. Their espresso machine is also a really good one if you happen to know about espresso machines. The menu has a lot to offer, including vegan options and GF options, skewed towards Latin flavors. There is also free WiFi. Today I ordered a Salted Caramel Latte, a Hibiscus iced tea, and a Lavender Latte with soy milk. My Carmel latte was terrific, hot, perfect ratio of milk to espresso. I had a sip of my wife's hibiscus iced tea, which was not only a very pretty color, but also delightfully good. The lavender latte was a score with our friend as well, as she reported the flavor wasn't over powering as some others she'd had at other places.  At this place you have the option of simply walking up to the counter to order drinks and such to go, or you can be seated by the host. All the workers are very nice and efficient.   I like this place and plan on a time to try their food and sit. Will return and would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DaVtxHO812TAVdZHXtfEIQ.text: From Phoenix and in town for a conference and stopped into Makers and Finders for a late meal and cocktail.  The vibe was friendly and I found the menu to be inspired.  Sat at the bar and had great customer service from Tiffany.  I am not sure these guys are paying her enough.  Cheers!

UdkLckIwm4sfrMLPzjH_9Q.text: Ok place. They have an interesting Espresso with Tumeric I'd not found anywhere.  It worked.  They also have decent food. cHVqi1DOGQAoR7wZhfn_2g.text: One of my favorite downtown coffe spots! The cafe con leche tastes exactly the way my grandma's used to and never fails to bring back happy memories of my childhood.  In the past, I've never strayed too far away from the Avocado Toast but I've recently learned that I'm allergic to practically everything so I made a go for the Veggie Hash ... You'd never know that it was vegetarian!  The restaurant is very low key but incredibly welcoming and the servers are always polite. I'd definitely recommend calling ahead if you have a party that is bigger than 4-5 people as it's always busy.

aKZloyNVh6lFXTYOFXdztg.text: I was in Vegas for the weekend and got tired of the strip and all the food options there so I looked up this gem on yelp. They had great reviews so I headed there for Sunday brunch. They have an patio but it was too hot to seat out so I made my way inside. Service was prompt and I already knew what I wanted to eat. I ordered the Hibiscus mimosa, chicken Tonga omelette with bacon and avocado and the Coconut Tres Leches. The mimosa was just okay my think it would've tasted better with some syrup. The Omelette was the star of the show. The waffle was underwhelming but I guess I had really high expectations. It's still the best bfast I've had in Vegas so far so I'll definitely recommend.  Pros . Excellent  Service and omelette . I'll try other cocktails next time

Wy8U8ohFTg0nRspzRi8j_g.text: Makers & Finders was definitely my favorite restaurant I ate at while in Vegas. Great food and totally a hipster joint. The quality of food was so fresh and they were right on point with presentation. You could tell they really paid attention to detail with the dishes they were serving.  Also ordered a hot coffee to go. Wasn't as impressed with the coffee as I was with the food. But maybe the flavor latte I picked was a miss.  Would love to go back next time I'm in Vegas. If you're looking for a good joint don't pass them up.

W51CeRImHlumoJNIKzYKKg.text: Best coffee (and Irish coffees) shop in all of The Valley. I highly recommend their Sofrito burger and Irish coffee combo. Jesse killed it with over the top bar tending and service. I love bringing my out of town friends and family here!

0BvMq9kMPnDg2ndUfdqRCQ.text: I only came in for coffee but I'll be sure to return again to try the full experience.  For a Monday mid day it was fairly busy - was greeted instantly!  I ordered two iced coffees and one of them I asked the barista if he could make me his favorite drink and he did, and BOY IT WAS SO GOOD! All I know is it was a cinnamon bun flavor & it was delicious. Very sweet but that's how I like it! Will be back!

qJOS_wXfwpwSlyuuNR9CCA.text: Simply amazing. Found this cute little spot for breakfast on Yelp and we had heard good things from friends. They have many different flavors of lattes which were all delicious. If you like lavender, I definitely recommend the lavender honey latte! So delicious!   My boyfriend and I split a couple of different items so we could sample more food.  We split the tres leche coconut waffle, chicken tinga eggs benedict, and breakfast empanadas and they were all SO GOOD. the shell of the empanadas if cooked to perfection - so flaky and delicious.   I would love to come back here and try some more of the menu - maybe for lunch and dinner! they also have outdoor seating which is lovely for a nice day out. not to mention that the staff is so kind and attentive!

-O2Xi9Cy5eJZyVVwN4chBA.text: Visited on 7-16-16 at about 9:30am.  This restaurant is located on Main St. between Charleston and Oakey.  It is surrounded by antique stores so it was fun to eat and then go peruse for some treasures.  We were able to find free street parking on the side of the building.    $36.77 got us two coffees, a side of fruit for the boy, an arepa benny, and chilaquiles.  The decor is hipster but not in an exclusive way...the decor and service are very welcoming.  I like their unusual artwork on the walls.    $3.75 Iced espresso machiatto- I couldn't help but giggle when they put this thing in front of me.  It was served in a 4 oz. mason jar.  I am used to Starbucks' version I guess but this really threw me off.  My husband exclaimed, "WHAT IS THIS, A MACHIATTO FOR ANTS?" I guess Starbucks is like the Wal-Mart of coffees and this is what a proper machiatto looks like.  It was very strong.  I experienced complete awareness after I drank it.   $10 arepa benny- had golden poached eggs, coffee rubbed beef, grilled tomatoes, and salsa verde hollandaise.  It's the only hollandaise I've ever liked.  The beef was nicely spiced, salty, and tender.  I highly recommend this!   $10 chilaquiles- A small iron skillet with scrambled eggs, tortilla chips that have been dipped in chile sauce, black beans, and cojita cheese.  This was my first experience with chilaquiles.  It's basically soggy tortilla chips and eggs.  It was extremely spicy.  I'm glad I got to try it but I don't think I'd ever eat it again.  It had very good flavor, though.    This place is much more friendly than the other douchey hipster coffee shops and their food was really good.  I highly recommend this place.

7TpX-GLvH79AUbh-Vf7xPA.text: Hipsters be raving about the coffee here but there isn't a really a whole latte to talk about. I consider myself an avid coffee drinker and have become pretty picky about my coffee. I will say I am NOT A LATTE PERSON. I drink my coffee with a little half and half with a a dash of sweetener, but still like the flavor of coffee present. I had a regular cup of coffee which was nothing special, just like the food.  THE FOOD: The food is not that great... Pretty bland. My lady odered the Arepa Benny, which I could care less. We also tried the Lavender Latte which wasn't bad, but also nothing special.   THE PRICE: About as much as you would expect for hispters in a coffee shop.   THE VIBE: TOOK FOREVER! It was not super crowded but the food and coffee took a really long time. The staff was super friendly, but geez their cook must be cooking with one hand cuz that took way too long, although, if he was cooking with one hand I am thoroughly impressed. Nothing special about the decor. Not fancy but not dirty, just that typical... "hey im a hipster drinking coffee" vibe.  OVERALL: Nothing special... I have had better, and considering you are in vegas and off the strip, it is guaranteed you can find better.

Zj9T361Be566pkKcYyHcEg.text: They have the BEST chai latte here, it's so much better then Starbucks I can tell you that!! Amazing!!! ;)

jN8TZdSpmt1fDC_pISxY5Q.text: how have i not written a review of this awesome place?!?    my 1st visit was back in june 2015 when i was looking for places to celebrate my daughter's half (6th month) birthday with a few family and friends.    from the moment i visited to inquire about hosting at this property, i was treated with utmost kindness and care.  ultimately, i decided to celebrate here and i tell you, we were all SUPER HAPPY with this property's cuteness and cleanliness, the food, the drinks and the opportunity to gather and celebrate my daughter.  there was about 10 of us, and we all agreed how amazing this place was, including their food and drink offerings!  i've been back to visit almost every single time that i'm in town (i'm from LA), and i have never disappointed. in fact, I've gotten a few friends (also from LA) hooked on this place so much that they also come almost every single time that they're in town.  :)  makers & finders, thanks for a WONDERFUL first experience with you, and for all the subsequent and future visits.  please stay a long, long while, OK?  i like you guys a lot!  XO

dVkyTn83qRaFjpxwsBW5aw.text: Sad to have finally paid this place a visit to have had the worst experience with a guest from out of town.  Being a local downtown homeowner for 20 years, I was excited to finally have had the chance to experience this place. Needless to say that experience was so bad that I'll never give a second chance.  From the moment of checking in for a table which took 15 mins for a party of 2 to not being addressed at the bar for a good 10 mins, to not being able to order waffles since they didn't have their waffle machine to not being about to order a coffee with whipped cream since they gave up their whipped cream machine to their other new location. The only pleasant thing was the foodserver who was apologetic.  Obviously the 2 at the host stand knew we were leaving without ordering and should have addressed us as we left but all we got was have a nice day. If plans to succeed are in order, then this place needs to pull it together.

UdTVPGXK9MkbRYa9YfX__A.text: Makers and Finders is a gem in the otherwise weak art district offerings.  Come here for a hand made coffee drink or the excellent food.    We live nearby and I have never been disappointed in the inventive Latin American offerings.

mACDcMeJFmy3cxWX5WU5EQ.text: Came here today for the second time and loved it more than my first! Love love love the atmosphere. Overall cute place but many things are expensive but that's common in adorable coffee shops.  Things I've tried:  Tomato soup: WOW. This is sooo good. I love a good tomato soup and this one is a winner   Chipotle chicken sandwich-delicious delicious spicy chicken. Wish it was bigger or had more stuff within the sandwich   Plantain chips-eh   Maduros-sweet plantains. I asked for a side of these because of love them so much. Not on the menu but they were able to accommodate. YUM. Love love love   Kale ceasar-pretty good, wish it was larger for the price   Lavender latte & lavender vanilla lattes-both fantastic my favorite part of this place and reason I'll keep coming back. On the pricier side but worth it.   Raja  Arepa Benny   Both above were pretty similar. Love the sweet plantains with the raja. Wish it had more spice.

srSmN7gqNKFNTu-5tVkbqQ.text: Only had espresso drinks this visit. Omg! We're from LA & have our favorite coffee stop in Venice, Menotti's which we LOVE. So we can be disappointed often elsewhere. M&F exceeded our needs, wishes, desires & expectations. YYEEEEESSSSS! Thank you M&F! I got the flat white with two sprays of vanilla & a splash of the Mayan spice chocolate syrup!! Thank god. The espresso not burnt at all; sooooo yum. I also sampled the iced coffee. Very balanced. You'll love it here. Xo

oH8KIMn3cr0zTJwPjV7FCQ.text: THIS REVIEW COMES WITH A FUNNY STORY. (But it's still relevant to this review so don't worry)   A great hole in the wall coffee shop that offers delicious Cuban breakfast meals, sandwhiches, sweets, and a variety of coffee. I ordered the Arepa Benny $10 (which seems pretty popular via Yelp) and a Honey Vanilla Latte $5.50. The Benny was amaaaazing! The yolk broke perfectly and their hollandaise was delicious. The latte was also equally delicious. It was actually reccommended by our server.   Okay here's my funny story: When you walk into Makers & Finders there is (or should I say was) a wooden bench that's connected to the entire right side of the wall. Those seats are obviously intended for 2 people parties. Well anyway... my cousin and I have already been seated and eating for a good 30 mins, then a group of 2 men sat at the table next to us; 1 guy on the chair and 1 on the bench. A couple minutes after that, a friend of theirs walks through the door and sits next to the guy on the bench. At that moment I hear a loud "crrraaaccckk" and instantly think "This sh** is about to break." Then literally seconds after that, a woman they knew walks up to the second man on the bench and hugs him. Right when she goes in for the hug and puts her weight onto him the whole entire bench disconnects from the wall. True story. No one fell onto the floor or got hurt or anything, but the fact that the bench detatches itself from their concrete wall is pretty insane lol. The staff and the owner were extremely apologetic and kept making sure everyone was okay. My cousin and I actually got free dessert out of it lol. But the reason why I wanted to add that story in is because, although I had a near death experience (jk), I'm still giving them a 5 star rating lol. And THAT, ladies and gentleman, is how great their food, coffee, and service was! ... Just not their bench.

7DIukW1Qn6GmJyjvarkNqA.text: Very very good place. The food was off the charts came here after visiting Grand Canyon the night before. Best breakfast & brunch. Ordered the Latin hash and Mexican Spicy Latte

I89QSaxLETVvX4SAB_9FSw.text: Wanted to come here because it got so many good reviews ! Had the veggie bagel with a side of poached eggs. The barista was super attentive, but the food is very subpar. The bagel was soggy and was lacking flavor, the poached eggs were undercooked. I was scared to try anything else! I feel it is difficult to find good food in Vegas is general. I'm sorry makers and finders! I wanted to like you and I know how hard it is to run a restaurant, but I'm sorry I spent my money and calories here :(

KoVVZMxtEpHBSl0A0v4hgQ.text: Great downtown coffee slash food bar. The energy in there is great. A lot of people use it as a work space. So it's great for getting work done. Lots of people on their computers dialed into their projects. I like that because it creates creative energy.   Food was good. Coffee was better! A1 spot in the arts district of downtown Las Vegas.

ywWNszZcxxSuz9m-_q0utw.text: This place has amazing coffee and food! Everything was so flavorful and different. The service was excellent. Whenever I'm in town I will definitely come back!

n_OL2Xj3xbRZPq6ePlgYvA.text: Makers & Finders: Urban Coffee Bar  I was in the mood for something trendy and have wanted to try this place for a while, so here I find myself... downtown, hair still yet to be brushed unless you count my pillow as a brush, and in plaid pants and a shirt that reads "WILL RUN FOR WINE." I guarantee you I will do just about anything for wine.   The outdoor area is spacious for a small location and more importantly, not overcrowded with tables AND clean. Upon walking in I am pleasantly greeted and find a nice small seat. The decor is unassuming, clean, and welcoming. Again, spacious. There is plenty of room to move, unlike so many other restaurants that try to cram in as many tables as they can. The waiter is warm and soft spoken with a light accent.  I was pleasantly surprised to find a Hispanic theme to the menu (see how I do my research first...blindly) but needed some form of caffeine running thru my veins before I could comprehend words I feel like I should know but couldn't process while still foggy from laziness. My eyes immediately gravitated toward the Lavender Infused Latte. Done. Two shot of espresso on the side as well, please. And I logged on to the ever encompassing internet after not having it for a week, I am hoping my inbox hasn't self-destructed in my neglect. The waiter came back to ask if I really wanted 2 espresso shots on the side...I knew there was one in the latte right? He was still all smiles and sweet, he really was just trying to make sure I didn't make my heart explode, or perhaps accepted full responsibility for it. I assured him my ticker could handle the caffeine he was going to deliver.   The latte wasn't sweet. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. It is served with a little heart in the foam, I wonder if I am the only one that finds that humorous? The latte is magnificent. It is creamy and clean. No after taste and the lavender is gentle, it isn't like swallowing Bath and Body Works Lavender Bath Bomb. There is no pull of artificial flavoring and the lavender opens more as the latte cools to room temperature. The espresso...I don't even remember it. But I do know this...I don't remember it because it was smooth, it was properly brewed, and left no after taste. I remember it because I can start to feel its wonderful buzzing in my skull without the need to wash a bitter flavor away.  Ok. Caffeinated. Can digest menu now. Hah. Pun.   Ripened Mango Arepa. For those of you that don't know what an Arepa is, I have graciously googled it for you. It's a corn pocket thingy that is crunchy on the outside and still creamy inside. In other words, it's fucking delicious. The menu description is as simple as this: Ripened Mango, avocado, queso fresco, basil and thyme aioli. The flavors were surprising and dynamic, though I wish the mango was a bit more pronounced and the side of sauce they served with it was a bit heavy handed. The only real comment I have on this is to please serve with a sharper knife. The arepa is so beautifully done but it has to all get squished to be cut and the flavors are all lost. It's like a treasure hunt to appropriately self-balance the flavors on one's own fork, I assure you it was well worth the task, BUT...a sharper knife would have been perfect to slice thru that buccal artistry.  In conclusion. Get better parking. I like it here.   **disclaimer:No idea if they sell Lavender Bath Bombs but one would assume...I am not girly enough for that.**

QRcsq92Wb_8zqpyzWFbMjw.text: Coffee and food definitely 5 STAR the wait was unfortunate though. My family had a birthday brunch on a late Sunday morning and boy were my husband and I surprised at the delicious coffees and meals we had. VDNap5tnq_kSpbZlEP-dig.text: Came here early in the morning. Coffee was great, went for a flat white and Latin hash. It takes a bit of time for the food to be out but it's expected. Staff is attentive and friendly so that's always something to look forward to.

xU3vYkXTIDPUzZrLw8zkRg.text: No question the food is VERY good BUT the service is amateurish at best. If you have a hankering for something different then M&F would be the place to quench your pallet, except the service was terrible. TERRIBLE!  We were  seated promptly and the waiter introduced himself, said he would give us some time to decide and then everything went south. Timing is everything with serving and this guy had no idea what he was doing. We had to wait too long for him to come back and take our coffee order. So we ordered our food as well when he finally  showed returned. The food came out BEFORE our coffee hit the table, not good. BTW not all our food made it. A $15 order of empanadas never made it. So the order was comped. Because our coffee came late we only had one cup each and  that also cost the owner profits. No manager made it over to our table to see how things were going and given the price of the food you'd expect to see a little team support. This our second time here and both times had a similar experience. PROBABLY won't be back.

hLU-0VwdPpSJRrtd1BAZ4g.text: Oh sweet nectar of the gods! Mexican Spice latte has left my tastebuds in a state of pure ecstasy. THIS is the reason to never visit a Starburnts.

ycu889NliVWntkCOipLOtg.text: Excellent food in an up and coming neighborhood. I had the Latin Hash and the sauteed Brussel sprouts. Both were very tasty. My gf had the Veggie Benny. It was awesome as well. She said the Chai Latte was the best she ever had. Our server Erin was very nice and helpful in our efforts to order. Overall a great experience.

bMsYSEI-xzx-FvbmTAze6Q.text: Skip the long lines in the casinos and come here for breakfast/brunch! Everything tasted fresh and delicious and service was great. Definitely try the Mexican or lavender latte. The eggs Benedict were made to perfection! Will definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XRuYESneTwULezW9XwMn4w.text: What a great  place, already favorite of myself and others, I recommend to everyone. They were still having their soft opening our first time there and opened for us so we could have coffee which was amazing. Thank you!

gs6Otnd1ZqSqSBaKHZo9Sg.text: Service is friendly and responsive and that's the good.  The coffee isn't bad it just isn't much. I've given this place several tries and just can't justify wasting the time, money, or calories when so many good coffee shops are in town.

q6JWXHMCP8b7bZhe1LlTFw.text: Saw photos on yelp and decided it was worth heading to downtown. It wasn't the "downtown" I had in mind when I read the reviews (closer to the outlets than to Fremont St), but the place was cute and clean.   As a coffee house, I'd probably give a higher rating, but was disappointed in the good service - especially since we came in to eat. While my arepa Benny was quite good, my husband's croissant sandwich was lackluster. There were only 2-3 other tables of people while we were there, but it took more than 10min to get my Mexican Spice latte (which was delicious) and felt like another 25 min. To get our meal.   The coffee was great and different. I'd probably come back to hang out with a friend over coffee (and order at the counter)... if I happened to be in the area

SOOCc9C8rGspa_L3TWwLcQ.text: Had lunch today.   Service pretty slow but really enjoyed the arepa benny.  Cold brew coffee a little disappointing but an overall positive experience.

6a0PxZI29rip4efhaWs7-A.text: Came here a few weeks ago with a friend from out of town. The set up is very unique, and cozy. The coffee was a 10-10! But the food wasn't so hot. I had the caprice bagel. I didn't like how the flavor matched up. I felt like there was just too much going on fore such a basic order. And my friend had a turkey sandwich, which seemed to be a little dry. The staff was a little stiff also. Took our bar server sometime to even greet us. Then ignored us majority of the time we were sitting. Overall. I may have not liked the food or the service, but the coffee will defiantly make me crawl back. Willing to give them another try.

Mr2PSMZLVawxyJcOiMzP9w.text: I ordered take out and the phone was answered promptly. The person on the phone was friendly and make good suggestions. Upon arrival I was greeted by a few members of the staff and I only waited a few minutes to receive my order. The good is really good (ordered bagels and lox and a breakfast croissant). And they come with a side of plantains. I would love to go and have brunch or lunch one day when I'm not in a rush.

yoBkiRKjbXAyV7r7KQkT5g.text: this place is awesome, man! the atmosphere and how the cafe is set up! and I'm talking about the decoration, sofa, chairs, the plates, the dang Mason Jars they even use to serve water. it's all pretty beautiful if you ask me. the dirty chai tea latte was one of the best I've had in awhile too. it's hard to find a cafe that serves good coffee AND GOOD FOOD. I'm not a coffee connoisseur, but this beats a lot of local coffee shops in Vegas (not that there were very many good ones to begin with). I would definitely make this one of my go-to spots

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lavender infused latte &amp; dirty chai tea latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y4PDks6bTD4sSUwRNwmEKg.text: Great little place the service  too .. I highly recommend it! The coffe was awesome .. the food was delicious  .  The Makers & Finders Coffe is my new little spot  to go to worth the drive

vddURt1FE0sNSvPuI86HDQ.text: Loved everything about Makers and Finders! The space is light and bright inside with modern and simple decor... Outdoor patio on Main Street is available too. The iced lavender latte was perfect. Had the carne arepa with plantains, avocado, black beans and a runny egg on top. The corn arepa part was light flavorful n crisp, not heavy at all like other Arepas. The warm Brussels sprouts, mushrooms, shrimp and chorizo dish was great. Healthy and flavorful! Our server Celeste was a sweetie. Will definitely return and spread the word about this locally owned gem!

ytqfnUl0EGtIw3GpiZhXYg.text: We are very happy with the food and coffee here. We ordered the chicken tinga omelet and aprepa benny with a lavender latte, chai latte, and espresso flan. Everything was delicious. It's a great place to visit and get away from the Vegas strip. This would get 5 stars from us if the service was a little better. While the waitress did apologize for the wait and not bringing water immediately, it was a bit awkward to wait that long while there were several open tables. We will visit again when we're back in Vegas. Also they had one of the best chai lattes I've tasted.

7xpWflCkY5GHPvw7jmcwcw.text: This place has great Latin fusion breakfast and the tea & coffee options are very unique and healthy.

LvCOnDwnHwNoE5i-sFDmPg.text: This is more a brunch breakfast place then the straight coffee shop I imagined. The coffee drinks we ordered were good. The food however was mediocre. We shared the empanada sampler and the poutine. Both were small plates and the flavors just didn't quite deliver for the $40 tab I ended up with. Overall, I might stop in again if I were in the area but just for a coffee.

eoDP4tXFA4ogiO0bPum9Eg.text: My husband and I are very disappointed with our experience here. We were so excited to go because my husband is a huge coffee fan and loves trying new places in town - PLUS all of the great reviews that there were. However, our server Josie was in such a rush and saw us only to seat us and take our order. She even passed us multiple times after we received our meals and still never asked how we were or if we needed anything. I was pointing to what I wanted to eat when ordering and she still suggested something else which gave me the impression that the meal I originally wanted wouldn't be good enough. My husband said that his sandwich that he ordered tasted so bland and plain and wasn't satisfying at all. The only two good things that came out of this was our coffee and the gentleman that was helping us throughout our meal since our server wasn't helping. If I had cash on me I would have tipped him rather than our server. We both are in the restaurant/hospitality industry so we understand the importance of customer service - just wish our server understood that as well. We unfortunately won't be going back to makers & finders...

Ic5a3WxtjWMvma_PdQakyQ.text: The food was so great! The service was so welcoming & super helpful if it's your first time here. The food came out pretty quick , but they definitely don't make you feel rushed. Cutest place to go!

D-4MagHgJs5W5V1JZf6iVg.text: Food was great, lavender earl grey tea was excellent, staff were friendly and on it. Definitely coming back next time I'm in town.

LeY66qEVSPvX-xWovFbZSw.text: I went with latin hash and italian coffee  and to be honest the food is delicious and the coffee is really strong which i was looking for ... But its really expensive dont miss it out

9L3A5Yw3JrBxCIjUDQ8tpw.text: Flat Whites!!  After a week in the US without a decent coffee, we stumbled across this place in Las Vegas of all places. Great coffee, excellent food of normal proportions & great fresh ingredients. My friends said it was the best Chai latte they'd ever had! A breather from the Vegas madness. Come here!!

7i1LWvTDWC5jGkvm6AGcVQ.text: Best tomato bisque in town. It's a quaint, modern-aesthetic cafe downtown with a cool vibe. Their Mexican-infused coffee is pretty good, and just about any other thing they serve as well. Three stars because their customer service is subpar. I understand they're trying to create a more casual environment however that does hinder them at times since I did have to basically attack a waiter to bring me the check after I attempted to get their attention multiple times. They never once bothered to ask if I needed anything.

KeAOFDp9i5oyHHH528s-XQ.text: Loved it! had their lavender infused coffee; it was the best thing I ve had. Goes so well. We had the arepa benny; which had pulled beef, eggs and hollaindaise sauce. It was really good. Recommend trying this place for brunch

_MSLhOBmvWJeFgQd6gVoqQ.text: The service at Makers is warmhearted and attentive. This shop is a reminder of humanity and brotherhood. Oh and they have single origin beans and coldbrew :)

08vGqF5p0c9gPKOmdsbAYg.text: If this was on my way to work, I would get a Lavender Latte and Lox twice a day.

l1pxvO-z7e8AiOEjj92Jcw.text: Amazing! The ambiance was fabulous and I love the outdoor patio. I had the lavender latte which was so tasty. It was really busy, so the service was a little slow, but the food and coffee definitely made up for it! I can't wait to go again!

MG8hIFXzGNFqm4pKXhL_vA.text: Amazing coffee place. I am not a latte drinker but theirs are incredible. Cortado, cappuccino, and pour overs equally as amazing. Probably the best coffee I've had in Las Vegas. Food is very delicious too however a bit over priced. It's ok for small bites while enjoying coffee but not for the hungry. That said place is still amazing and new go to coffee spot.

Hk2myMO0E2FeoJLV05fWKg.text: Dope spot! Friendly service! I had the lox bagel which nearly knocked my socks off! Yummy!   Glad to DTLV has places to chill like this. I would def frequent if I lived in Vegas.

RNsAxlt6SWLpWmOSjb3nTA.text: I'm a local, and I am  always on the hunt for good, honest, again Good! local restaurants, but this isn't it. The food, I tried the chilaquiles never in my life will I ever enjoy my chilaquiles drenched in a fake lime flavored green salsa, as for coffee I'd rather the one I make my self at home and I'm not a barista. Finally the service, sucked! Server left we never saw him again till we aaked for him. I think I'm being fair by giving them 2 stars because maybe I had a bad experience maybe I didn't choose any of the right menu items, for the price all the food should be edible.

6qW_lhyyAhzV1zaSJv72gQ.text: Another lovely find off the beaten path.   Comfortable good WiFi.   Lovely menu.   Plenty of parking on the street.

ok9dN7dtxlvcSoQs6EKuug.text: Artsy but not pretentious. Like having s bunch of random people over for coffee. Great to go service. Fast and friendly. Got a dark roast pour over and a Cuban espresso! If it wasn't so far I would be a regular.

ikoXxKl4pLnP-QD8Wl3yOQ.text: This is an amazing coffee shop/restaurant. They have amazing customer service. The people are friendly and they really treat you like family. Their coffee is amazing. Absolutely spectacular. If you haven't been they explain everything in detail for you. They are so patient. So if you haven't been you need to come.

2fE-8l1nA3nI4_eZ1W_ukw.text: The food was DELICIOUS. I had the "La Paisa arepa" and I will be coming again for more of it and to taste every other thing on the menu because it all sounded DELICIOUS. Cozy place. Great customer service.

21MRp7rNf6N9mV5LwvYQvQ.text: We had a wonderful experience at Makers and Finders coffee! We walked in when they were just a minute or two from closing (not on purpose) but they were very sweet and didn't mind making us a cup of coffee to go. The decor is urban, rustic. I had a lavender coconut milk latte and my boyfriend had a salted caramel latte. I LOVE that they have a house-made lavender syrup. My latte was very creamy with just the right amount of flower essence. Both lattes were light on the flavor which I really enjoy. I still like my coffee to taste like coffee so that's my preference ;) we will definitely be returning to Makers and Finders!

eLyPuAVeVcacvVPdbdExFg.text: I had to change to a two star,  due to hours.   I have come here at times when it's closed.  Opens at 10 am on Sundays,  closes at 4 pm most days.     Expensive, but nice atmosphere.  My espresso seemed watered down a bit, but it did taste like a good bean and plenty of foam on top.  If you want to hang out, I highly recommend this place  The staff is very friendly.

wy8wLBVh9L4Q_7IgF8Xh1Q.text: Cute place and delicious food, cafe con leche was amazing! Staff was great and friendly :)

9shpjhKSM4r9ovYSMqKgXQ.text: Great pourovers, speciality coffee drinks, and food. Try the arepa benny. Good wifi and nice casual space perfect for breakfast or lunch or a coffee and work.

MioL7jD7FRfc5wh8xYejcg.text: Quite possibly the best lattes I have ever had. The lavender infused latte is unbelievable. They sprinkle fresh lavender on top, so you get the aroma with every sip.  Honey vanilla latte is fantastic as well. Never sweet and extremely creamy and well balanced.   Food prices are a bit high in my opinion, but it is delicious. Worth grabbing a small bite with your drink. The Arepa Roja was very yummy.  Fantastic staff. Best coffee spot in Vegas.

yC9FOuGhPT9emReTV3XyVw.text: Really nice breakfast spot in Vegas with reasonable prices. Our waiter was very pleasant and the food was ready in few minutes. Great coffee and very nice place to go before starting your day!

V5YWNAOOqxpRGXDTY7YNsg.text: Great unique coffee and amazing food that isn't your traditional coffee type style. Can't wait till fall so I can sit outside. I had the flat white and the la paisa arepa. So so good. I want to try everything on the menu. Super cute decor. Fun place to come and work, have a small meeting, or just eat and drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flat white

fxXd1toyV5PH2zzsvkdelA.text: The staff is very helpful and down to earth. Food is delicious and so is the coffee. They have plenty of seating (choose your seat) and strong wifi (ask staff for password). I will be back to this spot.

kL_6Am5KArmjG-1WVkhETQ.text: This place is legit!  Try it.  Save your money and skip the typically overpriced Vegas breakfasts.  The food and the coffee are amazing.  Every bit as good, if not way better, than any high end Vegas stop hotel breakfast.  My wife and I stumbled on it on the way to old Vegas and highly recommend a visit!

GWZCpIaRNZvgqKfOUY8EhA.text: This little cafe is a nice little secret spot to pick up some comfort food that is made with really high-quality ingredients and served relatively quickly. I was actually at Hop nuts right next door having a beer when I got hungry and I ordered off the makers and finders menu that was at the bar. Try the ceviche, chiloques, empanadas, & flan. Awesome

kMkM80_35dPZGjtzyUdxvA.text: We were in the Artist District exploring for the day.  We tried Makers & Finders Coffee based on the good reviews.  Was a very good experience!  Excellent coffee and food was good as well.  Service was extremely friendly, made us feel like regulars.

xurD-a-XzDKKWEUKThwOyw.text: So I came here on a recommendation from a friend.  Arriving it was a cute little place our server came over right away and took our order.  The food was great!!!!  Working in the food industry and customer service there are basic Do's and Don'ts that go along with working as a server and our server did a HUGE DONT!!!! before we even got our bill we got kicked out because they had people waiting.  They clearly have a patio area that they could open up and serve there but instead they chose to let their customers know they need tables cleared and people are waiting so we had to either hang out at the bar (which was clearly full) or leave.  This was all before dropping our check.  I've never been more insulted in my life.

kF-tTAFT6PyeUGZJpZiuYA.text: Clean with a little old downtown vibe. Simple artwork painted on the walls. The bar is visible so you can see what they are making for you. Which I enjoy the look of drip coffee. Everything is mason jars and glass wear. So your drink is visible giving that refreshing vibe. The space is very open so no worries about running into everyone. I highly recommend the lavender latte. If you don't want whole milk, they also have almond milk available. You can place orders online which is very helpful when you need to grab your drink and go. Thank you to the staff this morning for having my drinks ready. My coworkers and I loved them!

nzXKKH31i0bHkgWxWCgKgg.text: The Veggie Benny arepas were a stellar recommendation and much appreciated. I am very satisfied with breakfast and look forward to my next.    The dancing is great too. (Friendly attentive staff.)

3NVx7xPInhETPZMzqU0yCw.text: Stopped by from out of town. The only coffee in our hotel was Starbucks, which neither my husband or I like. I had the light roast pour over and my husband had the medium roast.  They were both outstanding! We are kind of coffee snobs and we loved this place. Ed helped us and he was so friendly. The food menu looked amazing, we wished we could have stayed to eat. We will be back next time we are in the area !

28bVA3zBtaDlHT_Dwp5jmw.text: This place specializes in coffee brewing methods.  Pour overs, aero press, monks pot, siphon, iced drip, Cuban, etc.  Several beans offered.  All organic fair trade.  Also several Tea offerings.  Food menu is equally impressive for breakfast and lunch. Service was great!  Above average.  The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because they don't roast there own coffee here at this location.  What a gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Specializing in Coffee brewing methods!  Food is great for breakfast and lunch. What a gem!

pwXevfqwWb2DyAj51KQDmQ.text: I would first like to say that the coffee and the flavor of the food is wonderful. The establishment has a very fun  hipster vibe to it. I have been here 5 or 6 times and every time I come it's more and more busy.  That being said the quality of the food and service has gone down.  My server was fine but he had quite a few tables so it reflected in his attitude and body language.  And since the front was understaffed I can imagine that the back was understaffed as well since I ordered a dish that came out cold. I asked them to please heat up my food and put it in a Togo container so I could eat it on my way home only to find that my food was cold in the Togo container.  I hope management gets it together to come out with a way to make the current staff function better or to hire more for front and back to relive some stress of the current staff.

wyDibE2k1LL5ETHIcPQrVw.text: Love this place! Everyone is super hip and I wish I owned most of the furniture. Their drips are awesome and they have very unique drinks for coffee lovers. My ONLY complaint is that I wish they were opened later because I'd come by more!

mcIhRLZEFNmZJs99NtAv5w.text: This place is super cool! The aesthetics make you not want to leave. The black coffee is amazing. Food is great and the prices are reasonable. I am coming back next time I come to LV!!!

R4F9KD4-4sR8cx9T_UzbGQ.text: The lavender latte and food was great! It is a cute trendy place to eat on a Sunday afternoon. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the Hostess could have been a little bit friendlier.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kY9jniTVZivEhwwyUqhkZQ.text: Went to Vegas for the weekend and decided to grab breakfast here before we went home. It's located at the arts district and the cafe itself had a good ambiance. Has a very bright, clean and modern latin feel. Loved the music.   We ordered mexican spiced mocha and the iced matcha latte with coconut milk. The mocha was delicious--not too sweet but also not bitter. The iced matcha isn't like the starbucks matcha--it's a little stronger and less sweet but not anything I couldn't handle.   We ordered the chicken tinga empanada. We loved it so much we ordered some to-go for the ride home. The pulled pork benny was also good--it came with plantain chips and I thought that was a nice touch to their menu. It is "latin comfort food" as they like to call it.  Service was great. We asked the server questions about the food--she was knowledgable and recommended some of the food she likes. There are gluten-free, vegeterian and vegan options for those who have diet preferences.  Parking wasn't too great, we got lucky there were some empty spots across the street and there was some construction going on. Not their fault at all so I will not dock any stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

344OI-adqxRmLYYHXiGBnA.text: After an appointment in the Medical District, my mom and I decided to head to the Arts District to try a spot that I had been to before. Upon arrival, the place wasn't there anymore. Sad face. I did my usual, go to Yelp for the next best place and came across Makers & Finders, which offers Latin comfort food, and glanced reviews about their coffee and lattes. We shrugged our shoulders and said sure, why not, it's a new place.  When we walked up, we saw there was seating outside, which the weather was perfect. When we walked in, we were greeted and seated right away. The lady gave us a run down of the menu, and the coffees that they offer. My mom ordered the Lavender Latte and it came out so pretty. I'm not a coffee drinker, but I tried the latte and said I should have ordered one for myself it was so smooth. I feel like we were sent here, because while we were waiting to place our order, what to my wandering eyes did appear, but Catherine Cortez Masto appear! What a pleasant surprise. She and two ladies had a seat right behind my mom and we "brunched" together haha! All the staff greeted her and she was seated. Nothing changed with staff, they didn't all suddenly change their attitude because she was there. If anything they were excited she was there. But they all were very nice and attentive already!   In no time was the lady back to take our order for food.  I ordered Roasted Rajas Empanadas and Yucca Mash which is yucca, green onions mashed. That sounded so funky to me. I had yucca before, fried and sauteed, but never mashed. I took one bite and that was it. I was sold. I said to my mom she needed to try some and after her first bite, she kept dipping her fork in to get more. The empanadas were tasty too. Peppers were perfect with the dough. Complimented each other well. Definitely comfort food, as I was very pleased with my food. Did my little chair dance.    When we were done eating, we got to take a picture with CCM and wished her luck.My mom and I left happy and comforted, and glad we came across Makers & Finders. The latte is one to come back for.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look who popped in!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Rajas Empanadas
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yucca Mash

Vj2JUnuDaKKWSi9vQusKIQ.text: The food was good, and the coffee was great. I had an amazing Mexican latte full of cinnamon. My friend had a caramel latte which was a little too sweet for me. We stayed there a long time while I worked onmy laptop (they have free WiFi). They were nice enough about it, but not full of smiles.  The seating is very tight so you can hear everything from the tables nezxt to you.

PIfYOSC00ZmfLgCETG_uwA.text: This place is really awesome. I'm not typically someone that gives out 5 stars but this is an exceptional breakfast joint.  The service was prompt and impeccable. The waiter was able to offer solid recommendations and checked on us frequently but not so often that it became intrusive.   The Cortado was a  perfect drink. It was one of best I've had. The food was really good. It's a fusion of breakfast foods with a Latin flare. I had the benny that was unique and filling. I liked the plantain chips on the side.   The ambiance and neighborhood is really cool to. It's off the main strip, so there aren't any long lines, loud people or exceptionally high prices. Over all I'd like to make this a routine breakfast stop every time I visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The benny is awesome. The plantain chips were a cool and unique addition.

T1gDc57TIoRbSCKULAvzKA.text: Skillets are small for the price... sat outside and waitress wasn't as attentive to tables outside... steak was probably 4 oz... so tiny had only 6 pieces!  Coffee is good and parking is difficult in this area.

ftIQIG8rCvK7yBffvAaFwQ.text: Heard such wonderful things about this place. We stopped by on Sunday for a bite. Great location as you can walk around before or after. Sat on the patio - It was cute with a few tables and pallet seating around, art on the walls. Although looks like it's time to update a bit since the restaurant seems to be doing well. Inside of the restaurant really cute.   Service was a bit slow. Drinks were delicious. We had an iced chai tea latte dirty (shot of espresso) and a lavender fog tea.   I ordered a simple bagel sandwich which I didn't like. It was a lot of bagel. And they went heavy on the avocado cream cheese which made it feel greasy. Table also ordered the ceviche which was light and fresh and the arepa benny which was also delicious. Flavor was really good. Both came with a side of crispy plantains.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepa Benny
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sesame bagel toasted  with egg, bacon and avocado cream cheese
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche de Camarones

j3K2ILcBTLYhwu5sQY_u8w.text: Honestly we have been here every time we come Vegas ! Best place great food the staff is sooo sooo friendly I love it ! The best here are the chilaquiles try ordering them with pulled pork omg so delicious ! Try them you won't regret it

-qhog4j67DZj04iEHZLvuA.text: My family & I enjoyed our experience. The service was legit. Almost 2 legit 2 quit. I got the Chilaquiles and a Latte and it got sent straight to the gut ya feel me. We're definitely pulling up again our next visit to Vegas. They treated us too good. I give this place a bomb bam shipshap snap!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cOtkuvSK8YOuIZXwt7MVxQ.text: Food was good.  Service was horrible!!!  Not busy enough to have such bad service. No greetings in or out.  Servers spent more time talking to each other than worried about serving their guests.

JSx3xk3zeZxqoUK3cbfV7g.text: Fav lavender latte yet. Cute atmosphere and great service. Recommend

z0b1GQmQtsQSPipLsSdWvA.text: Today was a nice day for a cup of coffee. I came here and I ordered a coconut turmeric latte, along with the Elvis press,  a croissant sandwich with peanut butter, Nutella and bacon. I didn't know what to expect with the latte, however I found it to be very delicious. The staff here is very friendly. She  promptly seated me and brought me water. The ambience is very nice I came on a day that was fairly slow which I prefer it that way. This place can be popping on weekends. Definitely a hipsterish vibe mixed with Latin influence

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut turmeric latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elvis Press croissant

KTlFyrio7TqNIXCxGcva5A.text: Breakfast lovers- here is your hidden gem. Upon arrival this place was quiet and a little tucked away. Once inside, a few more people came in, then  a few more, and more. The crisp, clean, decor had an artistic flare that while somewhat hipster was also uniquely styled and inviting. Since I'd read here that each day lavender syrup is made on site I ordered the lavender latte while hubby chose the coconut turmeric tea. Our waitress suggested a warm hot chocolate for our young one and the taste and temperature were spot on for him. From the menu we ordered the waffle with fruit for little one, breakfast hash and chicken Benny. The food was beautifully presented and flavors bounced to the perfect level. The energy was calming yet vibrant and I wanted to stay and try many more items from the menu though vowed to return another time.
