d-6hDf0oIsV9hbBndzvoMA.text: I have given this place so many tries... I can't continue to fool myself that the terrible service and the lackluster food is "just a fluke". I have never recieved prompt, attentive or even friendly service here. The hostess always seems bothered to even be there while the servers are either overworked or lazy with no sense of urgency or promptness.  This place will get by for a while because it's "cute" and "eclectic" but it's actually just pretentious and mediocre. They've lost my business, and as a downtown resident that should worry them.

kIfrazEZFZghTmZabtaV9A.text: Lavander Coffee w/ almond Milk was amazing. All employees were extremely pleasant. Great place to sit down and get some work done on my computer. One of the best coffee shops, if not the best, in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SayBqm6NpeczJXMi95AzDg.text: 4.5 Stars   My sister and I ordered the Arepa Benny and the Coconut Tres Leches Waffle to share. The Arepa Benny was the best twist on the classic Eggs Benedict that I've had in a while. I enjoyed the texture light polenta like biscuit, and the spiced up Hollandaise paired nicely with the Arepa meat. The plaintain chips that came on the side were also vert nice. My only complaint would be that the poached egg was slightly overcooked so it wasn't as runny as I would have liked. The waffle was also solid. I  Iiked the Tres Leches cream and blueberry compote, but in my opinion the chocolate bits kind of threw off the other flavors. I also sampled a bit of my grandma's Soyrizo Asparagus dish, and really liked it. The soyrizo's spiciness went very well with the slight bitterness of the asparagus.   As for drinks, I ordered the Lavender infused latte. As a latte it was good, but I would have liked more lavender flavor. I could smell the lavender from the bits sprinkled on top, but when I drank it the strong cocoa flavor overwhelmed the lavender.  Food and drinks took a while, but it was to be expected for our party of 10. Our waiter was also very helpful, patient, and served us with a smile. The decor is trendy and pleasant, and the "I like big cups and I cannot lie" sign outside the door was cute.  Make sure to check in on Yelp if it is your first time to get 20% off one of their specialty lattes! Overall, Makers & Finders was a great Latin infused brunch, and I would definitely recommend it to my friends.

QrdCMDGFYYcXSYunTHn35Q.text: Cute little coffee shop away from the strip. The menu has flavors of teas and coffees you don't normally see at a traditional coffee shop. I had a lavender latte and it was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dX85LMNCuuyC_YQM_EV-aA.text: What has happened to Makers&Finders?   Two years ago when I moved to Las Vegas, M&F was one of the first coffee houses and restaurants I visited. We had a Yelp Elite event hosted here, featuring all things coffee. It was spectacular.  Since then, I've been back a few times, including for my birthday breakfast a year ago, and things were still swell. I liked introducing visiting tourist friends and family to this local hub. A solid 4-star experience between ambiance, uniqueness and quality of food offerings for the area, friendly and attentive service, and fine coffee and alcohol offerings.   Fast forward to today, I wanted to introduce a friend of mine to coffee spots in the downtown area. M&F was at the top of my list. But it had been months since I last visited, so fingers crossed things would still be top notch.  Not so.  In short: - the barista, who apparently is new'ish, was a bundle of nerves, rapid-fire chatter. I don't care how toked up you are on your own product, but calm the delivery, because you're making these two customers feel rushed and a burden. - mad confusion over the use of the Yelp check-in discount. I was asked, "what's the name on the ticket?" What ticket? I don't work here. Just apply the discount. Or don't! I don't care. This exchange added some 5-minutes to delivery as they had to find someone else to untangle the register. And when I placed my card on the bill just after it was put in front of me? Ignored. Not busy...just wiping down some serving trays and idle chit-chat with one another while I stood there. Looking. Waiting. But when I said, "yo, can you run this?" one of the three now present sprung into action. Thanks! - confusion as to where sugar and other coffee add-ins were located for my friend to self-doctor her iced coffee. - said iced coffee was not of the quality I remember from back in the day. And $4 for a letdown?  Nah.  - my latte glass mug had a chip in it. Some idiot could cut themselves. Check that, maybe, before serving?  - it took some 10-15 minutes to make these two drinks happen, and to conclude the $ transaction. Good lord. It's just coffee. And less than $10.   All that is to explain why my first year's experience with M&F was an easy 4-star, but today's disappointment dropped them to perfectly average. I've always loved the food in the past and the atmosphere. But customer service was super lacking today and not impressive at all to the New one. I know she won't be back. I will be, but not without concern for consistency of delivery.

VSePRuFA7Xf5paJ_reJ4Sg.text: Finally got to try this place for Sunday brunch. Got there an hour into brunch and there was plenty of tables since the indoor dining area is small. The patio outside is cute, but the Vegas heat is not forgiving. I love the coffee bar menu, and the Italian espressos were a great wake me up to start my Sunday. If I didn't have mommy duties after brunch, I would totally have ordered some mimosas as there were so many flavors that sounded amazing! I got chilaquiles which was a good size portion and had a lime, spicy kick. I ordered the chilaquiles as is on the menu, but next time I might try to see if I could get a sunny side egg on top instead as the scrambled egg on the bottom was over cooked. Service was really friendly, and very attentive with no rush.

4W_I8ftFwEtm2oarFLgk8w.text: Drove down to Makers & Finders (20 min drive) to eat my favorite bagel. Come to find out they don't serve bagels after 4pm. The first server didn't even think to ask if they could still do it. I arrived at 4:30.... I was working on some stuff and I ended up asking another service and she said let me ask... she said the cooks would get mad if she asked. Ended up spending 23 bucks and left with my craving... tipped the girl because she kept apologizing.  Probably going to go make my own bagel with Salmon at home now. What a shame.

5LnbqjVhE58ELabJV9EnzA.text: Love the location! It's in the Art District, 10 minutes away from the strip. It's a very charming and trendy little establishment. We stopped for coffee and a quick bite. The staff were all friendly and they were very patient with us as we were having trouble choosing our coffee drinks.   I ordered the Honey Lavender Latte and it was very satisfying. The lavender really came through and I was impressed with the latte because sometimes, you can't taste the floral after taste. But here, you can really taste it in their Honey Lavender Latte.   The food menu was very appetizing, but I just got a bagel because of the time crunch. Based on what I saw coming out of the kitchen, I would definitely come back and try the food! Everything looks so delicious.

CgOHMD9XWXO4ced3lI3I7Q.text: Coffee; really great and fantastic espresso coffee is one of my deepest darkest secrets!  By the end of this review I might need to seek a priest and confess the deep desirable relationship that I share with this fascinating drink!  This particular visit was an interesting outing for me and the LV Crystals Group! The fabulous staff here reserved a huge table for 13 plus people and handled all of our needs most efficiently. The staff was virtuously and effortlessly able to handle ten plus separate or spilt checks and did it so elegantly!  Each month the crystal  guru of the group sets up these prearranged meeting months in advance, but the only condition is that they need to be Vegan establishments; or Vegan primary! Michelle's vision is to bring similar individuals together that share her vision with Crystals and Vegan delights in LV! Michelle is such a warm and beautiful person that represents the LV community in so many ways! She is such a giver and the unions that she comes up with for our monthly gatherings are always something I look forward too! Plus it is a forged path that she establishes with local businesses to showcase what they have to offer! Plus I get to review every outing and Yelp about it! It's a win-win!  As a member of the Yelp Elite I feel respect and responsibility to represent the said business that one is reporting or (Yelping) on! FYI: Yelping is a noun and a verb for us dedicated to the yelp universe; elite or not! If your yelp it's a fantastic family that loves and cares for each other! If your not then just download the app and go find a place to review. That simple!  Our order was handled in this fashion: the staff took all of our drink orders and then delivered them! Next was the order process; which is a great way to sample all the wonderful delights of the menu. The Vegan menu here is extensive and very delicious. With so many wonderful and amazing individuals around me most of us shared a bite here bonding even deeper over great food.   Deep breath here goes with my obsession again; with this lunch date I decided to have black coffee with an add shot of espresso. Coffee done black with an add shot is highly recommended here. One does not even need sugar to enjoy it; just a few ice cubes! With my meal I had the London Fog! I quickly found out what the fog part was when I found out that it was milk! Duh! This drink comes iced and they even remade it with no a word; swapping the milk for almond! Thanks for this! They are amazing here!  After getting my veins back to pumping with sweet sinful caffeine I had the salad for lunch it was so delicious. This salad was kale based Caesar salad! The Parmesan and dressing I asked for on the side! Croutons come on top too! The dressing of the kale salad was something that I enjoyed doing ! The dressing was a little strong so did not use most of. One of my crystal friends had the expanada sampler which was so amazing. This plate is Vegan and has four different choices all in one plate. Perfect for sharing! The vegi flavored empanada was my favorite of the four. It goes best with the hot salsa on top too! Spicy is always more delicious; and healthier I've been told!  So now that I have confessed to my favorite obsession and desire I no longer need to see the priest. I'll do three Hail Marys and return here for that secret desire that fills my life with glee. This is one of my favorite places to have my secret coffee desires fulfilled.  Come and see if they can make your deepest magical dreams of caffeine brought to fruition!

fE7ev5OJI6BMqt624N4WZA.text: Great atmosphere  Our server Skyla was great  My coffee was the cutest ever!!! I can't wait to go back and bring my daughter!

uRKxB0zw0FEogBvFlnaCkQ.text: I have always loved their coffee, particularly the cafe con leche and London fog. However, the service was so slow. Major lag time between ordering drinks and food to receiving them, so we didn't come here often.  As of late, the speed of service is much faster and we are coming way more often. I have also fallen in love with the cuban cortado, this is overtaking Publicus and Vesta for weekend breakfast.

oV457MEi4Z8vxy5L2iYrQA.text: What a great breakfast experience. While the tables were a little small, we all felt very comfortable. The drinks are creative as well as the food. We all ordered different iced coffees. I chose the Mexican spiced mocha. Very tasty. But their hibiscus latte, lavender lattes, and mimosas to boot. I also chose the churro waffle, but the Benedict's, croissant sandwiches, and power breakfasts were also enjoyed. The waiter was very friendly and didn't rush us even when it was very busy at the time.

cWlgZlZincHZQkNAMiuv1A.text: Grabbed an espresso here. Great place to sit down and have a coffee on the patio , then  check out a couple of antique shops in the area. We were in a hurry so we didn't have time to hang out. Looked like delicious food coming out of the kitchen, but didn't have time to try anyting.

-Cw0O-an32Mdd9MKBgyZRg.text: Sunday Bruch with my husband and our friends...  Husband and I arrived before our friends and they were nervous to seat us before our entire party arrived. Ultimately, she decided to seat us because we were only a party of four.  We all got bottomless mimosas. The regular Champaign and OJ is $22. If you want any other flavor, like hibiscus or lavender, it's $26 - I believe.  Food was awesome. We all cleaned our plates. The Benedicts were amazing, according to friends, my husband got the Lomo Saltado (because you can order from the lunch menu at 10:00 a.m.!) and practically licked his plate. I ordered the chicken tinga omelette with plantain chips. So flavorful!  The only reason I didn't give a full five stars is because of our server. She was nice and attentive enough. However, bottomless mimosas are only served for two hours. She gave us our check when we still had 45 minutes on the clock. Not to sound like a boozer - it's brunch - we wanted to take full advantage!  A little noisy, however, it's a jovial noise and vibe. Will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tinga omelette w/ plantain chips.

_U3ehwebnhe-4kTQNfU1Ng.text: We came to this place yesterday (Saturday) to celebrate a birthday.  There was 11 total of us and they sat us down. We ordered bottomless mimosas, our server marquee was really nice and attentive. However, it took about 30 minutes for our first drink to arrive.   Food came it was good and we were really having a good time. However about an hour into our meal we were told we were cut off. There was no warning whatsoever. Yeh we were a big group and we were keeping to ourselves and having a good time but if there was someone who came to us and mentioned we were disturbing other guests then we would of gladly complied. That didn't happen and we were asked to leave. For a whole group paying about $500 to be treated that way does not sit right with us as a group.   Other members of my group also made the same review, there is no way that we would come here again.

VUBMXz3hAElzxyQfmvokxw.text: Good clean spot. Great coffee. Staff was incredibly attentive and sweet ( except one server who we asked for the check and completely forgot, until we had to ask someone else 30 min later)  Came in shortly after 4. Sadly I missed the breakfast and lunch menu. But we got the empanada sampler. My favorite was the short rib and shrimp. The shrimp empanada was nicely filled and flavourful. It's about 5 different empanada with 3 different sauces. The outside was golden brown and crunchy with warm fillings. Unfortunately I was starving and didn't take a picture.  I also got  a honey vanilla latte with 2% milk and it was delicious. Honey was not overwhelming. Good mix.  My husband got the Mexican chocolate latte and he enjoyed. He's not a big coffee fan either.   Only reason I'm taking off one star is because their dinner menu is very limited. Not much to offer and nothing seemed appetizing for me as the other day time menus were.

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey Vanilla Latte

grGiCJoawSkDKWcJB-HRDg.text: This food is legit.  Let's start with the fact that it's hipster. Bust out your man buns and flannel. The coffee was good, we just had the drip.  The service. Our first server was awesome. Very knowledgeable and sweet. Then we were handed over to another that was nice but not real efficient. When our food was delivered, my husband asked for hot sauce. It literally took five minutes with his food getting cold. We had to ask her a second time. Not that many people in there so I have no idea why it took so long for two little shots of hot sauce. She seemed annoyed.   The food. I had the short rib arepas.  Oh. My. Gracious. Decadent. It melted in your mouth. The flavors were amazing. Hubs had an omelet that he enjoyed post sauce delivery.   There did seem to be a lot of regulars. So it must be pretty consistent. If you're in the area, it's a delicious and unique spot for some dang good breakfast.

Y42Y11YGtu0Np7OZMg89lw.text: It pains me to write this review because it's totally avoidable.  After this, it leaves a really bitter taste for everyone in my group of 14.  That is going to be 14 people who were disappointed and will be telling their friends. So the day  before at 5:05pm, I called M & F about our large gathering that will take place the next day. I want to give them a heads-up so that they are not going to be surprised by such a large turn out during lunch. Made the reservation for 14 people at 11:30am with the manager.  Thought everyone is find.  But to be sure, during the date of the event, I called again at 11:15am, telling them that we are still coming so please keep our reservation.  I am told by the person (maybe hostess) that there were no such reservation.  But since I am on the phone, she will save us a table for 10 and a table for 4.  My groups starts to arrive and checked in.  Surprise, no reservations and no tables saved.  I asked the hostess what happened, explained that I made two phone calls to ensure our space, she blame the previous manager.  Saying that last night's manager did not relay that message to today's manager.  I said, ok, but I just called, she has no accountability.  So our entire group had to abandoned our plans and go elsewhere.  Really?  How many times do I have to call to make you aware of our intentions?  If you can't handle the simplicity of holding a reservation, how am I suppose to trust your staff with the complexity of preparing my meal?  WOW, such losers.

hUyOxcJUbF6aUx5fpqzIFw.text: I want to start out by saying I WILL be returning in hopes to change this review! I have heard so many great things about this place, and I was thrilled to stop in to grab a coffee. I want to come back and try their breakfast as it looks scrumptious.   Four of us were wandering Downtown on a rainy/cold day and craved some warm drinks. We all decided to stop in and grab something togo! We ordered 4 small drinks that came to over $20 for all (and boy are they small).   My friend and I both ordered the Vanilla Honey Latte, my boyfriend ordered a Chai tea, and the last was a Coconut Milk Nutella Latte.   After waiting about 10 minutes, we received all four drinks. They messed up on the Chai tea and remade it. All of the other 3 coffees were hardly warm and were not even completely filled (I will say that my boyfriend loved his Chai Tea and it was extremely hot after they remade it)!   Unfortunately, after the Chai was incorrect we all silently kept to ourselves the opinion of each of our lukewarm coffees. It wasn't until we all got in the care and started talking about "if we'd go back" that we realized we all have the same complaint.   I just hope that this review reaches the store and they can guarantee HOT coffee to their guests!   Can't wait to try their grub tho!

Pjr3VjoGGfZ0Ln_AeigxMw.text: Came into this cute little establishment and it was a pleasant surprise. They have all the cool hipster coffee drinks that I love. We ordered:  4/5 Beet Root Latte - Has organic powdered beet root, zester agave, espresso and foam. Our server said that the espresso will be extra. I said wait a minute, it's LISTED in the menu that it's included, why are you charging me more? She said she would ask the manager about it because I'm right, it shouldn't be an extra charge... She then came back that she's not going to charge me extra and will let Management know about the issue. We'll see if I ever go back and order it again, haha. She said she thought it wasn't too sweet. It has agave so I knew it would be. It was sweet but still pretty good. I couldn't taste the espresso at all so I asked for another shot. The server gave it to me without charging me. That was nice. I like to taste a bit of espresso in my lattes.  4/5 Iced Lavender Latte - Pretty good. Nice hint of lavender without being overwhelming. Still a bit on the sweet side.  4/5 Lomo Saltado - I asked for no added salt because this dish is full of soy sauce already and I've had this dish super salty at other places. It was delish. I kind of wished there was some rice to go along with the soy sauce and make it less salty. But, per request I asked for the yuca fries instead of the regular fries. I am a sucker for Yuca. Loved the sunny side up egg on top.  4/5 Empanada Sampler - Comes with short rib, chicken tinga, garlic shrimp, queso & spicy mushroom, and dipping sauces. I had to ask for chimichurri too, on the side. I saw that I was charged extra for that on my bill. That's fine but would have liked to know that before seeing it on the bill. I love chimichurri and everyone makes it different and I like to try it every place that offers them! This was a good one too.    All in all the food and drinks was good and the long-time server was pleasant. She smiled the whole way and said kind words, like I hope to see you back. If I'm ever in that area when they're open, I will!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lomo Saltado with Yucca Fries
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet Root Latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iced Lavender Latte with Almond Milk. Yum.

p2X_05BWHlHBUHynbl2BEg.text: Makers & Finders definitely deserves 5 stars! This might be my new favorite spot for vegan breakfast and lunch in the arts district!  The decor is fun and totally hip with an industrial vibe!  My group (about 10 of us) had to wait for our table to be ready. This was fine since we arrived a bit early. While we were waiting, my friend was feeling light-headed and I suspected low blood sugar. I informed the hostess and asked for a sprite. She went to get it right away without hesitation! Now, THAT is wonderful customer service!  We were seated at a large table in the back. The server took our drink orders first and came back to get our entre orders.   The cold brew coffee was awesome (I added some stevia and almond milk)! Pretty sure I drank the coffee as quickly as possible! Lol  The plantain chips were very tasty! The chips had a nice crunch. They were served with black beans, green and red salsa. Definitely a unique dish. I would recommend adding additional chips to the dish (We had lots of beans leftover!).  I ordered the vegan empanada sampler. It did not disappoint! The texture was crispy/crunchy and flakey, with a warm filling. I enjoyed the soyrizo empanadas the most!  My boyfriend ordered the vegan hash. I had a  few bites, it was savory and filling! I loved the combination of peppers, spices, and potatoes.  The service was impeccable! The server was very attentive and the food came out fast. The server even took a few photos of our group!  I will definitely be back soon!

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full house!

fFAWnqz18zBjkS4fw2IT9A.text: The husband and I grabbed coffee here on our way out of Vegas. I got the lavender latte which was delicious and a chocolate pastry. My husband got a honey vanilla latte which really didn't have the promised flavor. Could've been a simple mistake in the coffee making but overall the place was great. It had a cool hangout vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool coffee place!

IRW8Y-vfSrUnYoDI183YpA.text: Lavender Coffee Yummm.  Very charming place with peaceful ambience and very friendly staff.  The omelette was delicious -- definitely fresh ingredients and a good portion.  The lavender coffee definitely stole the show.

QZ2sWAoKTEPIHKlFCL80KQ.text: I came here for brunch on Sunday with two friends. Even though we had to wait 10 - 15 minutes, the hostess was very communicative with us about the wait time and sat us quickly when a table became available.   There are a lot of options here - as a Venezuelan, I was happy to see arepas on the menu. The coffee was delicious, the food fresh, and the ambiance really cool.   We really loved the service, the quick turn around and delivery.   Parking is a little tricky, but just be patient - it's street parking and there are plenty of spots within walking distance from the restaurant.

WQB3jXTG9EAYeJ_V8QyDuA.text: My friend and I stopped by Makers & Finders for a quick brunch in the rain. This definitely fits the hipster coffee vibe that we've been seeing in Los Angeles for quite a while, and I don't mean that as a negative.   Decor-wise, I love the interior with its modern and clean look along with lots of Instagram-able items all over from its neon signage to the nice menus. Service for us was pretty on point and everything came out pretty timely. Let's talk food/drinks.   I got a cold brew. Saw some fantastic looking lattes but just wanted to opt for something more straightforward. No issues here - strong, smooth and not too overpowering.   I also got the Arepa Benny. Overall, I liked this quite a bit. The bread on the bottom was a corn cake which was fantastic. I loved the texture as a play on the usual Egg Benedict. Also loved the plantains it came with (wish we got a bit more!). The overall benny was good and tasty. I would love to see a bit more of a kick or the option for it as the flavor on it was overall pretty light. Otherwise, it was well-cooked. The overall meal was also under $40 for two which is solid.

AICqpn6OXQvAHnuidPDzbA.text: The food and drinks were good just kind of disappointed they didn't accept the yelp coupon for 20% off your first latte. That's partially the reason we chose this over another one near by.   Other than that Incident I would recommend stopping in if you're in the area

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bandeja paisa
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut turmeric latte and vanilla latte

U1EgOpQMuPxoP5nGRMy5hg.text: Lavender Latte! You have to try it. We ubered ourselves here just to try this coffe. Of course the food was good as well. I had the hash woth eggs and hobbies has an omelette. Nice roomy place and not crammed like most other places of similar style. I wish I can package that coffee and bring it back with me to NYC. We also got the fruit bowl that was a tad bit disappointing since the watermelon seem wilted and the fruited were cut into tiny dice. All in all a solid place for unique breakfast and waitstaff who don't rush you out.

lBF78t_HmpFfsqvyDgTbaA.text: My boyfriend and I went here for brunch. The black tea was very good. I ordered a side of fruit, there was nothing amazing about it, just chopped up pieces of fruit. The crispy fries were good. Service was ok. It took a while for the server to check on us. The atmosphere is clean, open, not too loud music, very comfortable. I'll go back to try the coffee.

M46Sf5Stg-hLEK10P3xE9g.text: 3 stars at best...the cafe is cute. The hipster vibe is cool but food was just ok. I'm factoring in that Vegas has a small up and coming trendy scene and that's why people love this place. GOOD- The cafe has a bunch of local Vegas hipsters hanging out and a really interesting selection of creative food and beverage items. Coffee drinks were great and clearly the highlight of this place. The menu had a lot of tasty sounding options. NOT GREAT- The prices were high for SMALL PORTIONS of food. The food itself was good but not stellar! Not for what you pay. My friend ordered more food cause she was still hungry after her "appetizer sized" breakfast.  Not great enough to warrant a revisit next time we are in town.

l_xyuh7A2tF0rheQIEunwQ.text: Great friendly place with a chill vibe. Highly recommend if you want to get away from the strip.

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican spice latte

ARuEGWQfEe6n-B2d73m_qQ.text: This place is bomb! Had brunch this morning and it was a perfect way to start the day. I had the arepa benny with a honey vanilla latte and my Auntie had the ceviche with the lavender infused latte.  It all tasted amazing. The coffee was some of the best coffee I've had in a long time. The atmosphere is super cute and trendy, and I love that they have outdoor seating. Saw a few dogs outside while their owners enjoyed their brunch. Can't wait to come back again and try something new!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender latte and an iced honey vanilla latte!

OdWQYgox6kC0N5jEDyklKQ.text: I can't believe I haven't written this review yet.  Makers & Finders Coffee is my go to place for any coffee or lunch appointment I set for work. I was initially introduced to it by a friend downtown, but I immediately fell in love with the quality, location, and staff.  I have tried a variety of things on the menu, but I always come back to my go to: tomato bisque with a croissant grilled cheese. It's not super large, but it is DELICIOUS. I also tried I believe there empanadas, and they were also extremely tasty. The loaded chorizo soup was disappointing as employees raved about it, but I found it small and not too loaded.   They also have some pretty amazing coffee (duh, it's a coffee place). I've never had a bad cup, and the one that I keep going back to is...grr...I forgot the name. It's like an entendido? Something like that. But it's made with condensed milk and espresso I believe, it's surprising smooth.  I mostly have sat at the bar and always get great service from the staff. Sometimes when they are busy and I sit at a table, service can be a little slow.  Overall though, great space, great experience, consistently delicious. Even better, they generally have super convenient free and available parking out front. Now THAT truly makes this an easy place to have a quick meeting.

DV6dJgcGqXN3oZXkTXIFPA.text: Omg sooooo good, it was truly food I have had but not like theirs. Everything was so thoughtful and good. It's not cheep but worth it. We had everything from pastries to coffee and all in between... just go! Our new favorite place in Vegas.  Oh be sure to make time to check out all the cool vintage shops around too.

EDhEsny6TNMSvQhr0klMOw.text: The atmosphere is so so. Feels a bit like a parlor shop. I came to check out their coffee and I wasn't a huge fan. Their coffee was a bit bitter, kind of like Starbucks which I'm not a fan of.

cwWCArFCSVhwDxV4p04iOA.text: Chill vibe, awesome food and coffee. Must do if you are in the area... If you are a Latte lover this is the place for you (great selection).  Latin twist to every meal for a great price.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2aFCA_nyBqyZozC_q-Gn1Q.text: Cute cute cute, but staff not friendly. Ordered a tea and my friend ordered coffee. Both good.

V3v2kP6OYNrd-7DOyQpUqA.text: Cute coffee shop in the art district of Las Vegas. Very laid back, indoor and patio seating. Arepa benny was delicious. Also had a lavender infused latte, perfect touch of lavender that does not at all overpower the latte.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepa benny- delicious!

kYq-edMb5NeLQ9KzloHbfA.text: Love the Steak Ceviche paired with the lavender mimosa. :D

Q9g8yq-s2IgGiOtCFb3euw.text: I don't know about this place. I was really pumped to come here and try the coffee, but I think my definition of a cappuccino differs from theirs. Mine is a thin layer of foam and theirs is about 60% foam. Serious! So I felt like I was drinking a badly poorer beer for the most part and then that just threw me off everything.  The food we had was pretty good. Croissant and a Latin American dish. And I'd definitely go back for that. But the coffee was a travesty.

IOqU84gLBwD3i5K3I2lQJw.text: The ambience reminds me of a cool hangout spot in New York. The lavender latte is a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender LATTE!

bPnSJKGYxWr1HfR8aM3uIQ.text: Eclectic and free - this waterhole represents the best that is the art district. Come in, relax.  Honey Vanilla Latte is divine. Coconut Soup is rich and nourishing.

g-W0oetT9H5a2wXZv7fKmQ.text: I like this new coffee shop downtown! Rating  is a little low because they're still new and have a few things that could be better, but overall first experience was a pretty good one. Lavender latte is delicious and the honey vanilla is like a warm horchata.  We got here at 10:00 but their kitchen doesn't open until 11, which is fine, just a little weird since we were planning on breakfast. It makes sense not to open it until later but it'd be smart to have the info up on yelp.  Another thing was I wish they carried soy milk. They only carry regular and almond milk, but I don't think almond milk sits as well with espresso as soy. Hopefully they bring it in if more people request it. Some servers were nicer than others when I mentioned it, if you know what I mean...

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I wish they had soy milk, but I got the lavender latte with regular milk and it&#39;s still good.

h_1VxE_6iuHVvCTFy3qUOA.text: Great coffee; Great service; I had the cold brew to go and it's perfect! This was perfectly refreshing to walk main street to shop for some good ol things; although some spots don't allow drinks in their stores... so I chose to keep walking. I'm not leaving this cup of coffee behind anywhere except into my mouth and into my belly

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Spot

VTULovG-qtu7vLXcgx5jEw.text: This place rocks!!!!! We enjoyed the coffee and food. Don't go here if you are in a hurry though. They have a huge line and take forever to make your food but it's so worth it.

qLbJZ1_eCKoIjZUeLs4rHQ.text: If I could eat here everyday I would, unfortunately I don't live in Vegas. I'll dream of my next Cafe con Leche with an arepa paisa and plantain chips until my next trip to the city. Delicious food.

fOqFKFecJjKrefd7dGQjAQ.text: Makers is truly the best! The food is outstanding and the coffee is creative and and authentic. The staff is gracious and efficient and cares about the customers. You gotta try the Arepa Benny for breakfast. Great for brunch, meetings, work, or an afternoon caffeine stop.

luAUMxJbKpfCmXANEqAWtw.text: Great food Great bang for your buck!This is what Vegas is missing. GREAT SERVICE...... if you have a long hard day and want to come and relax with great staff and food items that are not to heavy on your stomach and very tasty with a new twist on your coffee or teas come check them out!

F8l6Rl9MrC3k83v76UIy_Q.text: We only had coffee but it was a nice change of pace from our usual Saturday coffee shop! We tried the Mexican latte, honey vanilla latte and the salted caramel latte. All three had delicious flavors and were served at the right temperature. The price was right in line with other coffee shops.

CseG-EpY-g2x9iSJdeaXoQ.text: Excellent coffee, brewed siphon style, strong and smooth.  Delicious and authentic arepas la paisa.  Nice friendly service a big bonus.

KYtyfzANV3i85gf6GF5Tug.text: Visiting from Washington on a weekend trip to Zion, we decided to try Makers & Finders based on their reviews. My boyfriend and I prefer low key, so we wanted to venture off the strip. I had the Cortado, which was velvety and delicious. We had the Garlic Lime Chicken Breast, the Latin Hash and a side of garlic fries - all extremely good! I wish I could try more off their menu. We will be back!

YnYwueiw9Z3-SogEV6lT3Q.text: Fantastic Latin fusion! The best eggs Benny with arepas. The entire meal was great. Easy to recommend. A++++++++

4eOy8hx6rZqNaeOwIm96zg.text: Brought my mother here for a late breakfast... Moderately busy today.  Mom has the areppa Benny and the Bolivian coffee. I had the Latin hash and a salted caramel latte.  The food was excellent!  Coffee was rich and fresh!  Wait staff was polite and quick.  Two thumbs up!!

Mxl8vBs781VcYCgKph8m7g.text: I went here today and had a cordito and a pastry.  Price points were right on.  My other friends had different items like the empanada that the server seemed to forget to put in.  The server was sweet but maybe it was his first day.  He couldn't seem to remember orders and didn't know the menu- like I requested decaf and he didn't know if anything could come in decaf.  The cashier helped close all our checks out and she really seemed to know what was going on.  My girlfriend loved her empanadas and my other girlfriend loved her croissant that had bacon and peanut butter or nutella on it.  I ate all my chocolate croissant- it was not dry or stale and seemed very fresh.

3qubPHAk30H6ezkqYOgqCA.text: Didn't get to try much this visit because I snuck in around closing, but can't wait to go back. They showed me around a little and I left with a delicious iced coffee. I've read people saying how they pick up on flavor characteristics in coffee(like people do with wine) and that is something I never have done until today. The cold brew coffee was delicious.

2nlXtjd3ebK36FGoiV2wmg.text: We fell into this place after shopping in the vintage stores in the neighborhood.  It was yummy and low-key!  Not only did they have a good food menu, but the iced drinks were good as well.

0iu2oNLwrqBXMePrDqIz_g.text: As usual we found this gem on Yelp. Wanted to have nice brunch away from "the strip". We looked thru the photos and saw the beautiful presentation of the menu items and various lattes they have. We are so happy we tried Makers & Finders Coffee. They did not disappoint. First off easy street parking right in front. Can't say that about the strip.  We were seated right away and our waitress Jen came immediately with menus and water. We tried the La Paisa Arepa carne and Arepa Benny. Both so good and flavorful. Eggs were perfect and runny the way we like. The beef tender and moist. Wife had the Lavender infused Latte and I had regular pressed coffee. She loved the latte. Hints of Lavender and not over powering. The coffee smooth and strong. Not bitter. Just what we needed for morning after the casino. Oh yeah. Had cravings for French fries last night so we tried their crispy fries. Nicely seasoned and crispy. Great with the aioli sauce. Prices very reasonable for the quality of the food. Portions are very satisfying. Finally the service from Jen and her associates was exceptional. They came by several times during our stay to check on us and always with a smile. Very happy now. Will tell our friends and visit again.

0P3-ZtqzQjO1JblZN_zy-g.text: This place is amazing!! The lavender infused latte is incredible, my favorite! I have also tried the Mexican spice latte, delicious too!!  The sofrito sliders are Yummy and the tuna albacore sandwich my favorite, amazing!

qsWF_zac1uyKn-3amGIgpw.text: Stopped in several times over the holidays.  Lovely service and especially enjoyed the Lavender Latte.

FHfSfQsfyeoSnpfktTEPtw.text: Been traveling the states for a couple months now, haven't found coffee better than this joint in Las Vegas of all places. The beautiful girl at the hostel recommended this jem and I had to go back and thank her. (Even though I had already checked out!!) Per her recommendation I had the Latin hash and the lavender latte. (Lads don't worry, you can have a beer later if your manhood feels a bit tainted after uttering the words lavender and latte consecutively) I got to say she was right on the money. The hash was phenomenal and the coffee was beyond words. Cheers mates. If you're ever in Australia, ask for Chris, I'll get you some brew, but I must say it won't be as good as yours.

gNK-uyCWolCtE0pVNb01Tg.text: Oh. My. God. This places serves the only lattes that have ever found their way into my heart. I wish I could bring this place to Chicago because nothing compares to the quality they serve! I ended up stopping here twice on my trip, two days in a row, because I couldn't get enough of the lavender latte. They had such an amazing and expansive menu of coffee and espresso drinks, which from the ones I tried, were so unbelievably good. What really stood out to me was the consistency and quality of the drinks. Each one was made with a lot of care and attention to detail! I know I keep repeating myself, but every so often I'll sigh and reminisce about how wonderful the lavender latte was.  Aside from the drinks, the food was phenomenal. I loved the tinga and the arepas! Our waitress was lovely and very friendly. I really enjoyed everything about my experience here. I'm looking forward to returning next time I'm in Vegas!

r2RMn8d2iU5V2rA9EolxlQ.text: GREAT PLACE TO COME WITH FRIENDS!!!  I came here with my friend with only $11 dollars to spend. I ended up getting the rajas empanada, which was pretty good ( not the best empanada I've ever had but tasty nonetheless). The real star of the show is the fries, I find myself constantly thinking about these fries and contemplating the next time I will eat them lol. The good thing about this place is the vibe. 8/10 would recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dh8TbsB4U-kJXfk4jQp3FQ.text: I have heard about this coffee place for a long time but never tried it until very recently. I can't wait to go back! I tried the honey vanilla iced latte and my friend tried the lavender iced latte. I usually get lavender latte is wherever I go and even though mine was delicious I regretted not getting hers!   I did not know that they had such a big food menu. I thought it was just your typical coffee shop with maybe some pastries or small sandwiches but they actually have a lot of food. I am excited to try the empanadas as well as some of the other items that I saw On the menu. I will update my review once I try the food but the lavender latte was one of the best I've had! I recommend coming just for that if nothing else.   Also they're very close to a lot of vintage stores and a buffalo exchange so it's nice to walk around that area after lunch

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender Infused Latte

4EtkrpnQ-Vq89xMS-y0KTw.text: Makers and Finders Coffee, for me, is a place I would live at if I lived in Vegas. Everything about this place is hip and meticulously thought out. Everything about this place is not "Las Vegas." It is a great escape from the horror I perceive to be LV. This coming from someone who was raised there, and fortunately escaped when I was just shy of adulthood.  Their coffee is excellent. Their sandwiches made with the freshest ingredients and healthy delicious. Their desserts, equally delish, in a decadent way. They definitely take pride in everything they did. Makers and Finders is located in the LV's Arts District. This coffeehouse is a sweet little escape in a crazy town.

4TMDRfVHh2Q5BYJgUTKaLQ.text: I cam across this place while on IG and decided to come check it out! Cute little place in Downtown Las Vegas. Felt really cozy where you can catch up with friends and or have a nice Sunday brunch. I had ordered the lavender infused latte, very delicious and different. I had chose to use coco milk instead of regular milk.  Will come back next time to try out their food and other coffees as well.   Other than coffee there is an alcohol menu as well for those who dont drink coffee.

qZQc0ejdI5W3YUGMSqwOpA.text: Great vibes happen here!  We started on the strip but wanted to get out of the craziness.  We were so happy we did some exploring and found this awesome coffee/breakfast spot.  Staff was super friendly and we loved the laid back atmosphere.  Great cup of Joe and healthy breakfast.  We took an Uber from the strip and walked around old town after.

8mUdwPwNy0kIpHriVQGooA.text: I don't know what I was expecting here, but this is more of a sit down brunch restaurant than it is a coffee shop.  The overall vibe of the restaurant felt too dark and wannabe hipster to me.  It didn't feel very inviting and the staff didn't seem particularly thrilled that a bunch of us had come just for coffee, but after driving out of my way to get here, I didn't want to just leave either.  The coffee itself was good.  Pricey, but a unique drink.  I got the one with the coconut and the turmeric.  Worked quite well as a flavor combo together.  Service was really slow and it took forever to flag down staff.  They did seem particularly understaffed to be fair, but that's not really my fault.  I think one of the guys was apologetic about our wait and gave us a discount on our bill which was very sweet of him, but I definitely wouldn't be back.

0ZgeeHHRaW0-__-Kyzpjsg.text: This place is absolutely fantastic!!!  I don't think I've ever loved everything at a restaurant before. The location, service, decor and THE FOOOOOD Try the sofrito burger  ...the fries, rice and beans, empanadas, salad, the coffee

kXQkGErtWgXZRaQBHBNmig.text: After checking in to get the advertised 20 percent off of our latte they later told us they don't accept the code any longer and wasn't given the discount. This was part of the reason why we came to check it out. "False advertisement" guys. They told us it has been on yelp for a year. BEWARE.

Fht7NjwBz1D9c-77dwROmw.text: Makers and Finders. A brunch spot of dreams. Outdoor seating, delicious food, yummy coffee. I arrived as a four top, and asked the very sweet hostess if we could have the 8 top that said "reserved" because I was with someone who was pitching a presentation and we needed some laptop space. She went to management and asked, and they accommodated. Awesome. We sat down and ordered coffee first- I ordered a dirty chai tea latte with almond milk (that I later found out was A+). If you know me (and most morning people) you know I need coffee ASAP. About 30 minutes later we got our food still without our coffees... which was a bit underwhelming. I was hoping for coffee before food. Seems that the barista is (often) backed up. I ordered the Vegetarian Chilaquiles. They were different than the traditional chilaquiles, they were little crunchy tortilla chips with salsa verde.  They were REALLY tasty, though. Everyone enjoyed their food. Latin hash looked gorgeous, and the veggie burger had hash browns in it. Neato. Brunch Latin flare at its finest.

vcWh9SP4Mo-X6iktpYG91w.text: This a cute spot for Breakfast, brunch, or Lunch. Great food. Great Coffee. Love finding new place like this to try. Definitely coming back.!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Benny
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender Infused Latte

bDgVTQSLTUZ8YVuznFmV2g.text: My wife and I just got done with dinner here and it was outstanding, the food was great and the service was great everyone was so helpful and nice! I would definitely come back again!

0h2sczrCC4EaGj3UrU9OcA.text: I stopped in for a lavender fog tea latte before my restorative yoga class at Sin City Yoga.  The coffee shop has a cool vibe to it, the barista/bartender was welcoming and attentive and my tea latte was delicious although kind of pricey at nearly $6.  Definitely a great neighborhood find!

1_QCTcHNUU5IalwxiiRC8g.text: Love this place! Delicious food and quality coffee. Everyone on the staff seemed to really enjoy working there.  So glad we stopped here on our way out of Vegas. Totally hit the spot. Thank you for a nice visit, we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UZ5CTvUiO84ZibYrWVMvUw.text: Was debating 4 stars because to-go orders take 30 mins, but told myself it's because this is more of a sit down and converse cafe. Def not Starbucks! Thank God for that!  We ordered the honey vanilla latte, lavender latte, and breakfast empanadas.   Honey vanilla latte: Lightly sweetened with hints of cinnamon and honey. If you like more coffee than sweet, this is a nice option.   Lavender latte: Syrup made in house daily!!!  Ayyyyyyeeee. It was sweetened just right and it didn't overpower the coffee at all.   NOW FOR THE SHINING STAR! Holy shit!! The empanadas. DAMNIT!!! This is what we waited 30 mins for. I was waiting on the car with the babes and the hubby went in and ordered. I text him, "the hell is happening? Is the place being robbed?" He said, "they're making the empanadas to order."  I thought, damn, they aren't just THERE in a case? These things better be up there with AMAZING and THE SWEET BABY JESUS.   They were. Fuck. They were fried, crispy, with some type of orange deliciousness on them and filled with bacon, eggs, and potatoes. I was so sad that we only ordered one each. I almost ate the hubbies too, but realized he's driving us so better not.   If you can dine in, do so. Thirty minutes was a lot to wait for a to go order. Coffee was ready in 5 minutes.   Definitely want to go back and try the chipotle chicken empanada.

r0WuP95J8QAunfUmC-AusA.text: I had the lavender latte. It tasted good, I liked it over other places as the lavender was not strong; just right. For a regular size the price was a bit pricey, with all the bells and whistles included I can get something larger someplace else. I like the vibe of the place though, so I will come by again to try the Mexican latte!

wQUrcDkq_dflLKQIMFN4dw.text: This is my fav morning stop in the morning. Delicious food, great coffee, also the prices are good. The breakfast bagel is a must try, it has avocado cream cheese and was delicious. Also the environment is nice and clean and the servers are very welcoming:) Definitely recommended

yCB4iTjLApJGKgP1RT2SQw.text: I'm rarely this enthused to write a review for a coffee joint, but this place really fit my image of a perfect coffee place. It was spacious while also feeling intimate. There are delectable things on the menu. The drink menu is also unique and made with high-quality ingredients. And the people here were totally chill.   I sat at the bar and got to watch the magic happen. I really loved my coconut turmeric latte ($5.50), which was unique and wonderfully balanced. It was rich but not too heavy and really woke me up.  This is such a charming, off the beaten path spot. You should definitely check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilling outside
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious coconut tumeric latte

2NQSQSCY-r7040qDJ4QF9w.text: Came in yesterday and I though most of Vegas places were going to be like this place. Which is why I didn't post anything. I was wrong, this place was super slow!! I would understand if they were super busy and what not but no. They took forever to get us our food, give us our check, and take out payment. I was super annoyed at the fact that they weren't fast and efficient. That said the food was okay. If you want a better place go to PlubicUs.

Fe3J0OzVdow_s55OI1AtkQ.text: My new favorite restaurant. Interesting Menu. Relaxing & Clean environment. Serving Best Coffee. I had Caramel Cappuccino & Churros it was Incredibly Tasty Would Definitely come back again soon. Highly Recommend to anyone.

InGvxdUnvZ9Fmdsqm4hapA.text: My favorite place to eat in Las Vegas NV off the strip.  A coffee shop that serves Latin food. My husband and I always get the overnight coconut chia to share, it's delicious. The Latin hash is my personal favorite. The place has a fresh, fun, hipster vibe to it. And the service is always excellent. During our last Vegas trip, we ate there every morning instead of the strip. It's a must try!
