embveW49OqRJTZF9ff_rLQ.text: After yelping for a brunch spot near downtown Las Vegas, I was stoked to try Finders & Makers. Good coffee + latin fusion brunch food? SOLD.  First of all, this restaurant is such a cute space. From the neon blue M + F behind the coffee bar to the colorful goat mural on the back wall, the aesthetic of this place is obviously well-curated and on point.  I came here on a Sunday morning and it was crowded enough that we had to wait about 15 minutes for a table. There was also a bit of a mishap where a couple skipped a few places in line and was seated ahead of a few parties. I tried explaining the situation to the hostess, but she was pretty clueless and not super helpful. Also, the drinks we ordered came out at the same time as our entrees (bummer!). All in all, I had to subtract a star for their shaky service.   BUT, I still had a delightful brunch and the food and coffee were fun and unique! I quite enjoyed my arepa topped with shredded beef, black beans, sweet plantains, and a fried egg. My dining companion ordered the arepa eggs benedict which was also delicious. The menu contains a nice variety of traditional brunch dishes as well as Colombian dishes. They also have a stellar coffee menu. I enjoyed my lavender latte and was intrigued by the turmeric coconut milk latte (next time!). My dining companion ordered a matcha cocktail which was quite unique and refreshing.   Such a groovy spot! Can't wait to return next time I'm in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepa!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful brunch!

u3WOHipo_O669IT--OW99w.text: This is my second time at makers & finders but my first at the downtown/arts district location. This place is so cute with front porch seating, indoor bar and regular table seating. They offer beer, wine, coffee and cocktails. They even serve coffee cocktails! The service was attentive and friendly.   I love that they serve their breakfast menu later in the day for those who rise late. They have egg dishes, meat dishes, vegetarian and vegan dishes as well (which are clearly marked on the menu--thank you!).   I enjoyed the soyrizo brussel sprouts which came with plantain chips and I was happy with the large portion. It was delicious but I was wanting more vegetables instead of so much soyrizo. My friends were happy with the chicken tinga omelette and rajas arepa that they ordered. They also ordered the espresso martini which was too sweet for my liking but they loved it. I enjoyed the banana bread ale which was so delicious.   The bathrooms are used by both this restaurant and the neighbor bar Hop Nuts. Great location if you'd like to continue your day at local shops or bars.

SCac0DG6yj4oD6BgJULKgg.text: I love this place! Their food is amazing and I love their coffee!! I like coming downtown for them. Also the staff is nice too. They let me order breakfast even though I just had miss the cutoff lol

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender lattes

3AEROm85AoYyvoWBb5-jmw.text: Makers & Finders is one of our favorite food spots. On today's visit service was slow.   They have a plant-based menu which I'm particularly happy about. I ordered the Vegan Hash and added Soyrizo with a Salted Caramel Latte with Coconut Milk. My daughter wanted just hash browns and since they didn't have this they were kind enough to make her crispy potatoes.   The wait was longer then usual and our food arrived before our coffees, which is unlike them.   Nonetheless, our breakfast was wonderful. The Vegan Hash is a must if your a plant based eater like myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Potatoes
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Hash w/ Soyrizo
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted Caramel Latte

hM1GDoXR2N5mlWxHDE3KvA.text: I would love to have hung out and tried one of their breakfast items but I was in a hurry so that wasn't an option. Instead I got a chocolate croissant and an iced mocha. The mocha was fine but not memorable. The croissant was gummy in the middle.   But the thing that really got my attention was that I only got part of my change. The bill was $8.57 or something like that and the girl handed me only bills. I looked at my change then back at her. "I think you forgot 40 cents or so." She then explained that she could "totally give me my change" but that they usually round their prices up or down to the nearest dollar.   Well that's weird.   If you're going to round to the nearest dollar than don't bother to tell me that the price was anything except your rounded price. I've never heard of any other place that does this and there was no sign describing their rather unusual policy.  The 43 cents doesn't matter. But clearly communicating to your customers...THAT matters. Especially when you do a really uncommon thing with their money. Then it REALLY matters. And on that front this place failed miserably.  Passable coffee, mediocre baked goods and very poor communication. Total Fail.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q7qJMmyET0FdQMMdiJyPdQ.text: This was my first visit to the Downtown location in Vegas. I came with a couple of friends, and was really excited to try it here. The tres leches waffle that I tried was really good. It was definitely worth the price I got it for. In addition, I tried a bite of their chia seed pudding, and there was nothing off about the flavor, but it definitely needed to be a little colder than it was intended to be served. My only issue with this location compared to that of the Summerlin location was how long I waited between dishes my friends and I ordered. I'm assuming it has to do with it being the downtown location, so it could have been because it was busier than usual. Overall, the experience was good. I enjoyed the scenery of the Art District that was around this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres Leches

YlSOQXjRHstB1GNugi5yaw.text: This place is amazing. The server was super friendly and handled all my modifications so nicely. ( I'm eating Keto right now so I'm a little high maintenance ;)  The food was so good!! The coffee amazing. I - like another helper- ordered a second coffee to take with me. Get off the strip and have excellent food and coffee !! Even w he uber ride the meal was much less $$!!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4ZVxPUqZN7zxFYArUGR6OA.text: This is our regular spot. We come atleast once a week. Love the staff and Latin fusion food. One of our favorite cuisines. Sundays tend to be packed FYI.

aOsHCEGLsllUusr_FRcwjg.text: Came in on a Saturday morning and it was quite crowded.  Luckily for me I came in by myself and was seated at the bar immediately.  The restaurant itself is very chic.  Art on the walls, comfortable chairs, outdoor seating.  The service I got at the bar was attentive and not rushed.  Actually, the people sitting next to me on both sides were working on their laptops and I have a feeling that they were probably there for a long time.    I ordered a lavender latte and it was very very delicious.  It was very large as well and was able to sustain me for the entirety of my meal.  I am quite excited to come back in a try another one of their specialty lattes.  The food was pretty good.  I really appreciate that they label menu items for dietary restrictions and that there were a lot of gluten free options.  The only problem I had was that I ordered avocado with my Latin Hash and didn't get any.  I told my bartender and she was more than willing to get me some but I thought it was good without it.  And if that's my only complaint then I definitely had a great breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latin hash
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

bnAVHhY_VJqBURITix28Qw.text: Heard great things about this place and in an area full of cute antique stores, we HAD to try it out and grab a coffee before exploring! We were greeted as we walked through the door and shown to a table/given menus. The atmosphere is really cool, there's a little study spot which people were making the most of near the bar, pretty tile, neon lights and a great open space. The tables are a little close together but as it wasn't too busy, we had space either side. Israel was our server and he was very friendly and always came over with a smile. There were a LOT of options for coffee and they all looked so good it was hard to decide, but we went for the cortado and cortadito - mine the smaller one - and it was SO good! The food menu was again, extensive and there was so much - too much even - to choose from. Thankfully they had a screen near the bar with images of all their dishes and drinks that it became easier when you could see it all. We went for the breakfast croissant and the arepa benny.  When they both came, the benny looked impressive and the croissant a little measly, especially with no little side salad or even garnish, but the croissant was delicious! They didn't skimp on the bacon and the orange sauce it came with was so good we asked for a little more! The benny on the other hand was disappointing! The poached egg was runny but when I broke into it, a whole lot of water came out and made everything a little soggy. There was a good amount of meat but it wasn't seasoned and as such, was pretty tasteless. The hollandaise also pretty tasteless. Such a shame because I was craving a benny before arriving but didn't care to finish this one. M & F really seem to have their strengths along with the odd weakness, so I would try something else next time and either way, come back for the coffee!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cortado and cortadito. So good!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RslL4LINGJ6EOmQvVN0OUg.text: Food was creative and unbelievably delicious,I will make plans to return here every chance I get!

kAXXAXMddXrs_55w8XvG6Q.text: I'm giving them one star due to the principle of the situation it has nothing to do with the money it's such a small amount I don't like their business practice   They say they carry no change after the fact I bought a coffee for $3.50 I gave him 5.00 he gave me back 1.00 he says we do not carry change i   We are not going  to give you change  it was just a plain coffee they had their specialty coffees for 4.00  had I known they were not going to give me change I could've ordered something else I mentioned to him - he didn't offer to change my order.  So does this mean if you owe them .50 do they undercharged you so you don't give them coins or are they just scamming the public and taking all the extra change in putting it in the tip jar   Very poor way of doing business they should post it then you can give the exact change and they can stick it where ever they want lol  There are a few other places to have coffee in this mall I suggest going anywhere else.

ja557fB-XwYXvd1vwzlILg.text: My first visit, honey vanilla latte, delicious, bagel sandwich ok, service sloooooow.  Also our waiter dropped a fork on the floor and instead of discarding it he gave it to a customer to use. Ugh. This makes me very nervous, if he is willing to give someone a fork he dropped on the floor what other gross stuff does he do.  The coffee saved them, it was so good.

5EDxMFQPrX-eBdxfqqvLnQ.text: This place has a hipster vibe with some Latin inspired foods.  It is downtown so I wouldn't say it is great for big parties unless you made a reservation ahead of time.   My friends ordered the bloody Mary's and the lavender chai and there were no complaints. For our snack we ordered the empanada sampler which was amazing! It comes with all five of their different flavored empanadas with 3 different sauces. I don't know what it was but the orange sauce was amazing! My favorite empanadas were the cheese empanadas and the shrimp ones, yum!  We only came for a snack but now I will definitely have to make a trip back to order their food!

jXAV0ViIRl_gTV-AHMmF0A.text: Wow.  I was so disappointed.  It started off with a careless, rushed, and bad server.  She ran to tables us including.  Asking people if they are ready to order within seconds of sitting down.  No back and forth.  No suggestive-selling.  No emotion.  Just give me the order so I can run away.  Now if she is overworked, underpaid, or the restaurant is understaffed - fine.  But if that's just the way she is - then she either needs to go or this is just not the job for her.   My order:   I ordered salmon toast.  This is such a simple and delicate thing.  It is easily prepared and hard to mess up.  The bread it was served on was kind of like wonder bread.  There was nothing "toasty" about it. It was soft and gooey and simply too thick for the little amount of salmon and garnish.  The plantain chips it came with were - half hard as a rock and half were nice and crunchy.   I was very disappointed because I consider makers and finders one of the few places in Las Vegas where locals can enjoy a hip, cool, and delicious environment in downtown.  Public US is where I'll be going next time. I've had great experiences at M&F but this one wasn't it.  While our downtown is being renovated and it's growing it would be nice to see this place continue to flourish and not disappear.  Also, I asked for ground pepper for my toast.  A gentleman brought me a pepper shaker.  Get it together guys.

Ie-aEY4Yd43SGb422eeoOw.text: Always an amazing spot.  The coffee is better than public us and the vibe is just as hip.  They have the most amazing coconut turmeric latte that will be the best first step in your hangover cure.  Great for breakfast,  brunch,  lunch and dinner.  I also noticed they added a happy hour menu!!  Great outside patio and located adjacent to the best brewery in town so you can fill your growler after you caffeinate!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super cute to go window.  Great idea!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. avocado toast
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut turmeric latte.  So perfect all the time

PUFiek38QFyvs1CLTvWXWw.text: Awsome late night drinks and service! Can't lie night bartender is hella sweet and cute. His name is Micheal. We had chicken strips fries. And hand crafted drinks. Had a Americano with Kaluha omg tasty. We had 2 hibiscus mojitos. Tasty! Great place to chill at in the evening. Noisier in the day. Better in evening. Glad we came in.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Micheal is in left.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Michalada

b7sqzD1AuzNxr-sO5t7IrQ.text: This morning was my fourth visit to Makers & Finders. I ordered the smoked salmon toast and was disappointed to receive lukewarm bread, cream cheese, and one slice of salmon (no tomatoes/few capers). I returned the order and requested "toasted bread." The server was both quick and polite to bring me a better breakfast. This is a fairly pricey restaurant and while some items (such as my foamy latte was great), I expected a far better entree. With so many wonderful breakfast choices in Las Vegas, I'm going to keep looking around. Of note:  most of the customers looked like models! Good eye candy, mediocre food.

XooVgOQP3oLpX5wqYINf9A.text: Delicious!!!!  Wow - the veggie tacos were so freakin good and filling. The Bloody Marys were on point. And our food server, Israel, was so fun and cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie taco trio - yummy!!!!

BWyPELHT_SDaUv5kCxmG6g.text: The coffee was good. They have milk Alternatives so I got the coconut milk. This sweetened my coffee up quite a bit.   Vegan options on Sunday are a no-go. I had a bagel with peanut butter. It comes to me as a surprise that this downtown hipster place in the arts district doesn't have vegan options. Pretty disappointing.  If i came back, it would be for coffee but that'll be it sadly.

X_t4jnx-pNxtYzycTsf3kA.text: Oh. My. Goodness. 6 star option please. Fabulous service, ambience, coffee. Oh, the coffee. Mexican for my sweetie, coconut turmeric for me. Food is the perfect mix of Latin flavors. We went two mornings in a row. Best coffee and breakfast shop in Vegas!!!

IanF3ojVrk48xhC5-Dl-lw.text: Fun hipster-type of coffee shop, inconvenient location for me since I'm from henderson, but I was in the area and felt like venturing out from starbucks.   I think I would like to come back and try out there killer food menu...especially for breakfast.   street parking, otherwise, not sure where to park. Their are couches, and free WIFI if studying is your goal here.   I came for lunch to go and got: 1. Cold brewed coffee: large $4.5, very mild taste, didn't need to add mild or cream. Would recommend.  2. Spice mushroom empanadas $6 small, but unique  would recommend if your a vegetarian. Took about 10 minutes to bring out...

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanadas-mushroom, small but nice homemade flavors

8jLey87kOk3g2aHUgmw70A.text: Awesome spot worth checking out if you are downtown. Great set up, low key, and artisanal. Get the honey vanilla latte. Not too sweet plenty of taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey Vanilla Latte

vWGrPu_IuMkHLmy4p1v-Hg.text: This is definitely my favorite place for coffee and breakfast in town! I've brought quite a few friends and family here and have never had any complaints about the food or coffee.  I always get the same thing, the Chilaquiles, and my only complaint is that you can't get them for dinner!

fyeTzwGmNwmhcV265crCmw.text: Totally in love w/ this place! I've only had the chance to pick up coffee, and not actually sit down (which I am far too excited to do) but this place is so cute and from the minimal interactions I had, the staff was friendly. My friends & I got 3 iced lattes:  The lavender infused latte - OH MY GOODNESS! So good! I don't want to try this creation at any other shop (my friends are itching to go back to get their own) Honey vanilla latte - pretty good Cortadito - ehhh, I was super stoked over the condensed milk, but maybe it's just better served hot  Overall, you're paying a little more, just like any local coffee shop, but for the atmosphere and the product, it's definitely worth it. I hope their food will be good and the staff will be great upon my next visit.

yqkKHL7oLigNEFWybEScQQ.text: Keeping with our desire to try the great restaurants off the strip, we headed to Makers and Finders for Saturday brunch. We got lucky and the wait was only a few minutes for three of us. We ordered two of the specialty lattes that they're known for. The Coconut Tumeric Latte was the favorite while the Lavender Latte was just slightly too sweet for me. We tried the empanada sampler and it was great but the real winner was the La Paisa Arepa. The meat was incredibly tender and the arepa itself was one of the best I've ever had. It was served with black beans and the most delicious and sweet plantains. Overall, the only disappointment is that we were only able to eat here once on our trip.

Id3Yux4nQUwhwoeo5IsVUA.text: YES!  I finally got to check out this awesome spot in the Vegas arts district (for lack of a better description). Turns out it's right next to Hop Nuts Brewing--another relatively new business I've been meaning to try.  I wasn't sure if lavender anything would be good, but I gave the latte a try. It was fantastic! I'm definitely going to try making my own lavender simple syrup for homemade lavender lattes. If they are half as good, I'll be happy.  I also suddenly got hungry and ordered their Arepa Benny. One of the points of getting Eggs Benedict to me is for the Hollandaise. In this case, the mother sauce is replaced with Chimichurri and the English muffins are replaced with arepas. Eggs were perfectly poached. Bloody brilliant!  With their dog-friendly patio, Makers & Finders could be my new bi-weekly chill spot.

NGvh4w7xIqNEADsBO-fZsw.text: Limited menu during Sunday Brunch and we were disappointed that Sauteed Brussels was not on the menu.   When I unfolded my napkin, I noticed that there was a piece of chewed up gum stuck between the folds. It was quite revolting. The server promptly replaced it with a stack of new napkins. I highly doubt that a patron would reach over to another table and placed the gum in the napkin. More than likely, the patron probably placed the gum in one of the extra napkins that was given to him/her and the server thought the napkins were unused and redistributed them. Not a hygienic practice.    We ordered the Breakfast Bagel, Arepa Benny, and an Iced Chai Latte. The Breakfast Bagel did not look like the ones I've seen in the pictures; thin slice of egg, a smudge of avocado spread, few specks of bacon, and invisible cheese on a badly burnt bagel. It was flat in both appearance and taste.  The inside of the bagel halves was so burnt, I couldn't eat it. My companion and I were going to share the dishes. She was too polite to return the food so she ate the burnt bagel. The egg on the Benny was perfectly cooked but the arepa was so dry it tasted like cardboard. The $4.50 12oz Chai Latte with 1/3 ice tasted like a diluted horchata. I tasted way better horchata at Sweet Tomato.   Maybe it was just a bad day. I am willing to give it another try but definitely not on a Sunday.

MyD2bjQLIEAPwZ_jbCyegA.text: Food was okay, overpriced for mediocre bfast options specifically on the healthy section since that's what my table mainly ordered from. Basically another hipster place with a really awesome Latin cuisine twist, but I wouldn't come back. Coffee is on point, but left hungry. :/

oYQMw526_bTvPFbnifIxOA.text: Had a lavender latte & coconut turmeric latte. Flavors are too subtle for our taste. We couldn't taste the additives. Service was prompt & very friendly. I'm excited to try the menu options next time. Nice coffee house with alcoholic beverage options. Interesting decor & ambiance. Patio area out front. It was near closing, but staff did not pressure us to leave quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender Infused Latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Turmeric Latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z-zfM7ufYuoojcdiKTO1CA.text: Came to this place in late-June.   I want to give this place a 3.5 because it's a nice place but there aren't half stars on Yelp.   I love the service; we had a really friendly, chill, and knowledge waiter.  We ordered large iced lavender infused lattes, Mexican spiced lattes, and I ordered honey vanilla latte (after having spent ten minutes between that and the Nutella latte). The lavender kicks in after a while, so give it a while.   For food, we ordered the la paisa arepas and the ripened mango arepas (which were both okay). Lastly, we ordered two arepa benny's (nickname for benedict), which is probably the best thing. You will also feel full with this dish, whereas the other two might leave you still wanting more. The thin crispy fries with the aioli were good and I would get them again for $5.  When dining for lunch, several people there ate alone with their drinks and MacBook's. Couches available to hangout inside, as well as outdoor seating (choose wisely, like on a warm-not-so-hot day!).

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food menu
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beverage menu

_5g3r6ExMXzjBMC0Hfm3Uw.text: One of my favorite local gems in Las Vegas. The coffee is brilliant, made with love and there are great food options to go with it. I sometimes will bring my dogs and sit at the tables out front. The mexican and caramel lattes are two wonderful options, and my favorite food items are the arepa benny or la paisa. Everything is made with care here, just as it is all consistently excellent. Parking on the street isn't so difficult depending in the time, but it is worth it any time to steal away from the noise of the city and enjoy a relaxing drink.

7TfIlBtqwYfGVU6cORPnhQ.text: I don't think I was ready...  I came in with a Denny's expectation and left wanting an encore.   The service was great and friendly. I tried things I had ever even heard of and they were all amazing. Who knew Bacon and Peanut Butter went together.    If you're looking for a change in pace from the normal breakfast, I urge you to check this place out. You won't be sorry...

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elvis Press

LOEaCVna7LD-FCYRtP86EQ.text: Located in the Art District, this spot is an example of how awesome this area is.  Surrounded by businesses like Vegas-style second-hand shops and art collectives, it is a great place to stop in for a cup of coffee, chai, breakfast or brunch.   The service was excellent.  We sat outside, as it was a perfect fall day, and were well attended to.  My husband is a coffee drinker and said that it was delicious.  I enjoy chai, since they offer the option of lavender in some of the other drinks, I asked for it in my drink.  It was delicious!  They will make your drinks to-go, if you ask.   The food was great.  It was a fun mix of American and Latin flavors.  All of the food is fresh.  I had chilaquiles.  They had a lot of sauce on them, but the flavors were right on.   Definitely stop in if you are in the area and enjoy being just far enough off the strip to relax a little bit.

x7OpKSNQrWA0H8ZFqrYSpA.text: I went there today, and was looking forward to having the arepa benny, and chicken tinga empanadas. There weren't any 2-tops available so I sat at a 4-top. They do have a bar, but I hate high top chairs. Their sofas were full, and the chairs at their community table aren't the most comfortable. Sometimes I sit outside, but usually it takes longer to be served.   My server came to the table and asked "How many are with you?" I wasn't properly greeted, and then I was told I needed to move. I tried to explain why I chose the table, but he said "Yeah, but I need these 2 open. Can't really have a party of 1 here." I'm a local freelance writer. I enjoy coming here to write, and have even conducted interviews on their patio. I discovered M&F over a year ago, and have frequented the restaurant 2-3 times a month ever since. After this experience I will not be returning. I used to see it as a gem in downtown, but I feel everyone should know, the food is good, but the service level is not only lacking, but also incredibly inconsistent. Spend your money elsewhere.

bLLOy91DRjz3WakD9OlkoA.text: Makers & Finders is a terrific respite if you're doing some thrift shopping along Main Street. The atmosphere is hip, but inviting and photo-op ready. Parking is easier than I thought. The service is great except for a minor hiccup on placing our food orders.   The iced Mexican Spice Latte is fantastic--rich, slightly sweet and had the right amount of spice. My Latin Hash and fries is good too, but I envied my sister's arepa benny more. The real standout was espresso flan--a decadent dessert with great flavors. Overall, M&F's is a great place for a casual meet up for coffee and food.

o3A_zpRDsOEdwvSk_cTxRA.text: My friends and I stopped here to break up a long road trip. The venue was the highlight. It was spacious and well-decorated. The food was good too but not so memorable that I would make an effort to go back if I was a local. The food was s little dry. Their vegan options were also limited, leaving one of our group members hungry after a small strawberry salad. Finding parking was pretty easy too. Overall, would recommend as a cute brunch spot if you have an hour or so to spare in Vegas.

384TeuwYf4RHTDdjBW4wYQ.text: I've been living in the downtown vicinity for almost 15 years now so have seen the ups and downs of the area through the years so really appreciate the emergence of this part of Main street.  The folks here really care about what they're doing but unfortunately still miss out on some of the basics: e.g., seating people, refilling waters, taking orders, fulfilling orders, etc.  I'll definitely be trying them again in the near future and hopefully they will have had all of the kinks worked out.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latin hash
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coffee menu

w5bn-drgbEfPD6m6L_pv1Q.text: Wanted to stop somewhere for breakfast/brunch on the way to the outlets, and picked this place off of yelp. Best decision.   This place hasn't been open 6 months yet, but it's definitely an up and comer. To start off the hubby and I got the two unique lattes from their menu. The Mexican spice latte had mocha, cloves, and I think some other light spices in it. It was the perfect amount of sweetness (barely there letting the flavors shine), and and was wonderfully made (not too hot and delicious creamy foam). The lavender infused latte was a little sweeter, and had just enough lavender to titillate; it was wonderfully made as well.  For food we got the Arepa Benny and the Rajas Arepa. I'd never encountered an arepa before, but it's a little cornmeal patty with a lovely flavor and texture. Both dishes took a little longer than I expected to come out, but they were so worth it! The arepa Benny was similar to an eggs benedict, but with coffee rubbed beef instead of ham and the arepa instead of an English muffin. The hubby is a fan of eggs benedict, and said it was the best he'd ever had. The Rajas arepa was a mound of sauteed peppers and onions on top of an arepa, drizzled with an amazing avocado cream sauce; absolutely recommended for other vegetarians out there! Both dishes were served with long sliced plantain chips.  There was one mistake on a dish, and the owner came out to talk to us and gave us the most amazingly soft and fresh jam filled croissant (they get them from a bed and breakfast nearby I believe) to apologize while they remade the dish. He was very nice.  Will definitely be back! Want to try some of the tasty looking empanadas I saw a person at the table next to us eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom empanadas with spicy tomato salsa; best empanadas I&#39;ve had in a while--delicious!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hojaldras dessert; absolutely heavenly.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender infused latter and Mexican spice latte. Both with perfect foam.

GKbC3rw1L_bKNFvfEvU_nQ.text: This spot is one of my new faves in Vegas! Such great vibes and super cute spot. The food is delicious and so flavorful! Had an amazing Americano with Lavender syrup.  Such great staff as well. Can't wait to go back!

D6YPrDKeGj9d3oAsobT7Ng.text: Amazing coffee and super tasty brunch eats! This place is a gem in a city full of greasy spoon diners.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon Benedict

nh3xHGZD6BAi8-NZUHduJQ.text: Seated immediately during brunch hours. Honey lavender latte was delicious, as was the Mexican spice latte! The former is more aromatic and serene, versus the latter, which is sweet and spicy. They have such unique lattes that I want to try!   The La Paisa arepa was a sight for sore eyes. You get shredded meat, plantains, and rice, and I ordered eggs on the side. SO FILLING! MUCH PROTEIN! Also, service was great and the place is modern and cute. It's family-friendly, but also good for dates. Totally have a soft spot for this place, and want to return to try their other lattes and Colombian dishes!

XUn9lcMnK0jwG0akq7oLQg.text: It's weird walking into a place like this...I really feel they took a tiny scoop of a Portland coffee place and teleported it to downtown Vegas with a hipster twist. And actually....I'm ok with that. In fact, I kind of feel like my midlife-mom status goes up a couple "cool" points when I walk in the door. Like, 'good for you lace'...'go get your coffee face on'.  They are serious about the pour, flavor, and craft...it definitely ain't the norm. What I love is seeing all sorts of random folks in here: business suit types, yoga pants moms, and the college kids making us put ourselves in check...  What I've learned is to tell the staff what I like usually and then tell me what I should get based off their recommendations. They put a mean Latin twist on simple coffees, teas, and of course their bomb ass food!  So I let them "Make" me try something new...and I usually "Find" out it's awesome! Oh yeah, that's how it should be. Thanks for keeping me cool Maker's N Finders. You simply rock.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hibiscus iced tea. So refreshing!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hahaha!

wn5iJmYA4LRLsOJiG8Ky3w.text: This place is great!! Every time I'm in Vegas I come to get breakfast and great coffee. I don't know if any breakfast spot, including buffets, that I'd rather come grub at than here. GET. YOUR. ASS. DOWN. HERE.

mt41zGxwieSwYcZYSLtm2Q.text: Friendly service, remarkably fresh food, and coffee that will open your eyes and brighten your day. Makers & Finders was everything we'd heard...and more. I highly recommend the vegan empanada sampler. All were good, but the mushroom empanada will bring me back next time I'm in Vegas.

FEz0N1juON0Q19KO3qWoQg.text: We really enjoyed this little hipster cafe. All of the drinks looked delicious and we loved what we had. Food was really yummy as well, we tried the breakfast bagel and the avocado toast. Everyone that spoke to us was very pleasant.

K8vHzeCW8_hdL-stqR9otA.text: This is my favorite place to grab coffee. I really like their food and the staff (Diana is particularly pleasant). It has an intense wait time sometimes, but its worth it. 10/10 recommend the flan.

B5ic3qOx2SK7v4WxG0Op9Q.text: One word: Amazing! It is really hard to find a place with great iced coffee, but they have the best iced coffee. I went during lunch and ordered the chipotle chicken sandwich with bacon, it was delicious and flavorful. I'm definitely going back and I can't wait to try more items on the menu

ADUI2gbFwElLbwfO0j2-_Q.text: I love that downtown is coming with new places it's great  I finally decided to give this place a try   I got the caramel sea salt latte super yummy give it a few min to cool down I was in a rush kinda burned my tongue oh well my fault lol   I got the omelette super yummy  (next time I'll ask for more sour cream) lol I love sour cream   And the best part it's not super expensive it's not over priced which is wonderful a lot of morning people on phones and computers getting there day started so don't expect super silence   The workers are very friendly make sure you have everything you need water is never empty I will totally go back

UOCP8P4B2_dViwEmpHmTrQ.text: Delicious, flavorful food and tasty coffee. The staff was really friendly, the interior space is clean and attractive, and the covered front patio area is welcoming. I definitely recommend it!

wxiG8IpoWqbL3IMqmAh5qA.text: The first time I entered the doors of M&F's, the first thing that came to thought was... this place has CLASS.    This stylish and vibrant coffee bar introduces both comfort and amenity that smoothly yells, "Hello" to those who pass around Las Vegas' still-developing Arts District.  Parking, however, may be quite a challenge. But if you ever do find that perfect spot, get yourself over there right away and treat yourself nicely for finding that parking spot. And hey, let I remind you again that this is a coffee bar. So, if you decide to come by during a Summer's day, and you want to get something iced? Well, you will not be disappointed. Serving with the right temperature and a little sweetness from their lattes, you're in for a smooth and comfortable delight. Trust me on this one because of the service there?... Oh, Ladies and Gents, THE SERVICE IS EXCELLENT. QUICK, HELPFUL, PROPER, IT MUST BE MENTIONED WITH PRAISE.   Now, did I mention that they deserve Gluten-free breakfast and brunches here?   Oh yes.  My order: Arepa Benny Breakfast, Gluten Free Golden poached eggs, coffee rubbed beef, grilled tomatoes, salsa verde Hollandaise.  Verdict: AMAZING.   (And there is one more dish I'd truly recommend. The "Grilled Chicken Arepas". Trust me. You are welcome.)  Onto dessert: The Espresso Flan. You read me, folks. Flan poured with a shot of espresso, topped with whipped cream and strawberries.  Verdict: If you have a company... PLEASE DO YOUR BEST TO SHARE. I know I didn't want to. I WANTED IT ALL FOR MYSELF BECAUSE IT'S. THAT. DAMN. Good.   But of course, there are a plenty number of other delicious entrees and desserts worth exploring on their menu. Just don't forget that latte on the side because this restaurant has the spirit and heart to serve with great, excellent service (Also literally on your latte, too, if you ever decide on "hot"). It is a coffee bar after all. A fine, classy one.  So happy to find this place. You will be, too.  -AC

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So full. Soul-FULL. So fulfilled. (Mason Jar glasses served as well)

2SjUA0czZ651YwuKrjL_ng.text: One of my favorites in Las Vegas!!! the food is great and the service is awesome. Their cold brew coffee, and new Nitro coffee is great. the servers are friendly and attentive. They go out of their way to provide the best customer service possible.

dk2uegxXFnc_iy3Ntv582A.text: 15 minutes and 4 requests to get cream and sugar, nearly 20 minutes of asking for the check and 90 minutes for 2 people to have breakfast when the restaurant isn't even full. 2 stars because the food was decent and our server was friendly but she was certainly not competent. Will not return.

MfASpD0nUZQ8RWQR1546-w.text: Amazing vibes. If you want a place to relax and have an amazing conversation this is an amazing spot. We never felt rush the server was always on top of things even if we didn't order food. I told them that we would be discussing some wedding detail and we could just sit on the community table. They said whatever makes us comfortable. Can wait to go back for more beermosas

3UV3FGT_ngXTXdTYGSeY0Q.text: This place is awesome... Chilaquiles were the best I've ever had... Coffee is great, food is great, atmosphere is great... Our favorite place we ate in Vegas

2xaV1SqXvRfmwh5cnlAccw.text: This place is absolutely amazing, I tell everyone about this shop and take every chance to eat here that I get. I love that they have a variety of vegan options and they are all tasty. My favorite order is definitely the honey vanilla latte with coconut milk and a chia pudding, the fruit always tastes so fresh and the latte is the best one Ive had. The staff here is amazing and the atmosphere is welcoming and friendly.

pKpx2sOFYy8BcWCo5gcEuw.text: I want to love this place soo badly. It has vegan options, is in a great location, they deliver to Hop Nuts (more below), they focus on good coffee & Latin food, so we're all onboard for that. I read about the owner in the Weekly & his whole agenda is AWESOME. So much respect.  The problem is that in practice, everything is just so disappointing. All of the exciting coffee drinks generally aren't vegan friendly. I wanted a legit vegan cortadito, but basically ended up with just espresso with blah almond milk or something. I have that at home everyday, so nothing special there. Can't you buy some coconut condensed milk/evaporated milk, etc? I guess I could've tried a hippie lavender flavor, but I wanted something, yanno, Cuban.  The vegan empanadas were a giant letdown, because to put it simply, eggroll-ish wrappers are not fr*cking empanada dough. Most peeps won't know the difference, but we did. The fillings were very alright. Sigh. How can you mess up empanadas? The vegan chorizo tasted like just bell peppers. No me gusta.  Ordering was a semi-disaster. I ordered online, where it stated they closed at a different time than their online ordering. We were having a drink at the time at Hops Nuts, so I saw they were still open & kinda busy...so we ordered. I got a call from someone in a remote location saying they were closed, lol, okay...We went inside where they said we had to order through Hops Nuts. Ok. No big deal, I guess (we wasted 20min), but fix your Yelp page & online ordering hours because there's a discrepancy in those. Had to call & get a refund because I already paid online. Annoying.  Fast forward to after we ordered through Hops Nuts: we get presented a receipt, ummm...my card is with the bartender, as we have a tab going. Waitress looks put out having to get that. She proceeds to try & flirt with my man not knowing I'm the one paying (and I'm a cocktail waitress, lol!) so yeah, enjoy your pity $2. My advice when waiting on couples, be equally as friendly to the girl.

QaEz6CNYYXoSB0OOWaIZyw.text: It's not my fav coffee in town but Good coffee. Cool place to hangout. I like the turmeric drink.

HPHfHECVS67iIhyzlrmqvQ.text: I forgot my lunch at home on a school day, so my boyfriend was sweet enough to order me lunch from Makers and Finders. He had come to this cafe once prior and recommended that I try it myself since it was located in close proximity to my school. He ordered me a beef melt sandwich and Nutella latte. The beef melt came with shredded beef, caramelized onions, and peppers on top of a toasted baguette topped with mozzarella cheese and plantain chips on the side. The melt was loaded with flavor and so delicious to eat. I only wish there was more of it. For $9.50, the portion was pretty small. The Nutella latte was very bland. I wish there was more of the Nutella flavor. It tasted more like chocolate milk than anything. My boyfriend thoroughly enjoyed his latte when he dined in, so Im going to blame it on the to-go order. I definitely want to come back and dine here one day!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef melt sandwich and Nutella latte

WdjPFop5-ZGyT6ia4ytsww.text: Soooooo good.  The street it's on along with many of the side streets are under construction so beware, however, so worth it!!!  The food is amazing and delicious!  The drinks are heaven.  The Mexican spicy latte was my favorite more so than the honey caramel latte, but both are good!

3fLllVIWiHj0hXO6D7RNVQ.text: Take me back to Las Vegas, not for the gambling, not for the shows, just for THIS place!   The coffee, the food, the service, the ambiance.. Yes yes yes and yes!   Breakfast was amazing, can't remember exactly what I ordered but I remember it had eggs and I loved it.. But what I do remember perfectly is the empanadas.  The empanadas were to die for, we tried both the chicken and the mushroom.. In my opinion, the mushroom was better but both are just scrumptious.  And don't get me started on the coffee.. I literally ordered my second cup while I was still drinking my first, that's how good it was. I tried both honey cinnamon latte and the lavender latte.. Both delicousssss but I preferred the honey latte (a little less sweet).

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey cinnamon latte to the left and regular latte to the right.

lbhQVLPjh76lVRuJTo6nFQ.text: I absolutely love their lavender coffee, the food is very decent, And the service can be slow at times but is worth the wait, specially for my fav coffee

02VnvVHr5qeQeg8uM5iaSg.text: This is such a cute and modern spot nestled right into the Arts District. The service was fast and friendly, and the food was AMAZING. I got the coconut waffle, which was soft and sweet and covered in the most amazing fruit compote. My mom got the vegetarian benny, which looked and tasted superb. The plantain chips add deliciousness to every plate. Both of us had the "lavender fog," which I want to figure out how to replicate because it was the most amazing tea experience!! I can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut waffle - yum!

Do0oD0vnaWVthOhwadW_7g.text: Downtown Las Vegas has so many hidden gems. I gave this place a try for the first time today. Now I'm thinking where have I been and what took us so long??? Upon entering you get a really nice laid back vibe. With people laughing and talking and blaring Latin Music. This place is a restaurant/coffee bar which I find perfectly convenient. The Decor is hipster mixed with vintage. They have a decent sized menu with lots of new things (for me) to try. I had the Smoked Salmon Benny, and my husband had the Bandeja Paisa. Both were really good. We didn't try the coffee but definitely will next go round. We love downtown and if you haven't been, you should definitely visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bandeja Paisa... really tasty! Loved the rice and beans
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon Benny... Yum!

PSlCmmxaPtrpvV_KuQorbQ.text: We came across this place while searching for gluten free brunch options.  The service here was super friendly, patient and attentive. It was really nice to have time to discuss menu options with our server and have it feel like more of a conversation than a brief data collection. Really great service!  The place is very relaxed and has a nice balanced atmosphere that's alive, but managed well by keeping tables spaced out enough to avoid it feel like crowded. As a result we really felt welcome and enjoyed our food and just being in the space. The sound levels are a little above average, which meant leaning in a little to make sure we could clearly hear each other at our table, but it wasn't loud enough for this to be a problem.   Coffee, tea, water... were all amazingly good here.  The food was delicious and just the right portion size. Portion sizes here are about average for the US, which I find good. More is not necessarily better.   It was tempting to go back here two days in a row but we decided to try somewhere else. Mistake! We should just have come back again!   Parking around here is plentiful. No problems there. The area has a few other cafes and bars too, but otherwise appears kinda run down. Don't let that put you off, just like M&F proves, there are some gems in this area.

OYavw26O9C8bAacn1ddyFA.text: If your an Australian visiting Vegas. This is the BEST coffee youll find.. Taste like coffee from home. So good. We have coffee and breakfast. The food was fantastic. The service was excellent and everyone was friendly. We will back back for the duration of our stay. Come down and enjoy the coffee..

1-G_-1JFFzjkMz5g8RxRgg.text: Makers and Finders is located in downtown Las Vegas. The venue itself is very modern/Low key, some would even say that is located in the shady part of town; however, the food here it is quite amazing. Parking is quite hard to find in this part of town however once you do find a space and come into the restaurant you will be blown away. This is absolutely a good place to go brunching with your family or after a night at the tables or club. The staff was very friendly, however they weren't as attentive as we wish there were.  We had the pull pork egg Benedict was perfection, which also came with a side of plantain.  I also had the pull pork sandwich which was delicious as well. This place definitely has a South America influence on their food and if you like this type of food, you will love this place.

J-fOL94T0FuFM3Px_dQ_7A.text: I want to like this place so bad, but the crap service kills it everytime. This last time will have to be the last time we try. Ordered a bowl of soup at 12:15 and came out cold at 1:00. The rest of my parties order didn't even come, stuff was missing :/ my husband had to hunt down a hostess to even find a fork.  Come on guys. You can do better.

C5qLDTGYAgfn3OesaWiiYQ.text: Great little spot in the arts district. Staff were nice, atmosphere was chill and the food was delicious.

L4wyLYRmHL9fjA98hF5ghg.text: This place is fabulous, our attendant Faith was extremely helpful, the food and coffee was exceptional, plus the vibes in this place is amazing. Strongly recommended.

nrFExgTieFhgXDnw6QRJ0g.text: The ambiance here is good. The staff is very friendly. The service, although pleasant, was awful. The food was passable and not great. I do not think I will be back. Nice idea poorly executed.

9SJR8f_iUDOCRFvCV1TmVw.text: We shared the fried plantains, the pork plate and the ribs. My omelette was light and fluffy and the vegetables and peppers inside were sauteed just right.

jC3xGXuO2cqtf1X1xq7JzQ.text: Great music, food, drinks, and service! This is such a cute little spot. The coffee is bold and delicious. I had a coconut turmeric drink that was tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ll--1WmINRBCgV3R7w5kPQ.text: Since it's been a while I figured I should update my review. I really enjoy Makers and Finders coffee and their food is always fresh and healthy. I can't give the fifth star just yet because of their service. They are friendly when you finally get their attention, but super slow. It took a full 15 minutes for someone to even come over and ask if I needed anything. I feel like Makers and Finders has a slight identity crisis. They want to be a hip coffee shop, but they also want to be a Latin restaurant. This could totally happen, but maybe a different way of ordering. Maybe take a note from Public Us? You can have people stand in line and order, then give them a number and have waiters or waitresses bring it to you. Simple and easy.  Don't get me wrong this place is amazing for coffee! My favorites are the Cuban coffee or the Salted Caramel latte. As far as food goes you can't go wrong. They do have a different menu for brunch during the weekend that kicks ass. On my most recent visit I was a bit disappointed in the food. I tried the veggie bagel. It comes with dill cream cheese, avocado (like 4 little slices), thick cut pieces of tomato all on a giant half toasted/have burnt bagel. With a few tweeks it would have been better.  Will I be back? Yes. Will I make sure I have plenty of time? Yes. Will I just order coffee? Probably!!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie bagel
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cuban coffee

VoNshBskAyL8e_6xlec4Bg.text: I stopped by Makers & Finders since I had read some good reviews and was in the area.  I had the Lavender Latte with coconut milk and an order of the mushroom empanadas.  Both were really good.  Service could have been better.  I was acknowledged fairly quickly, given a menu and some recommendations and then ignored when I was ready to order until different person saw me and asked for my order.  I'm still giving it four stars since the food and coffee were good and the 2nd guy wasn't bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mushroom empanadas and lavender latte

IAT19H2MYIffHgvhZER9eQ.text: The restaurant is serving fresh food and it is very tasty. They have a variery of food, for vegetarian and vegans. The service is excellent with lovely and friendly staff specially Paige. A variety of coffee beans are exist here as well. I really love the food and coffee here.

EMr2izD6omc3CISWx4pi1g.text: We enjoyed our breakfast. It was definitely delicious. I had the Nutella Crepes, my girlfriend had Breakfast Bagel Sandwich, her hubby had Kale Chorizo Omelet and my other half had the Arepa Benny. Our only complaint, our service was a bit slow. The coffee isn't free refill. They do charge you for another cup so that's a great heads up to know or be aware of. The place itself is super quaint and loved everything about it!

jc8fUxEF8813UX5TCgjRtw.text: Cute place! Great lattes! Great food! And, amazing customer service!!   Went for the first time for breakfast and ordered the  Tres Leches Waffle, a side of potatoes, and a side of Maple Woof Bacon (Yeah, I ate it all by myself.) Yum! The Salted Caramel latte was delicious and the atmosphere was perfect. It was a busy Sunday!

UoUAybesqYDyaxS-zmcEYw.text: Heard so much about this place and decided to check it out during my downtown Vegas cafe crawl. The trend lives up to its reputation but they back it up with good grub to boot.

pJadua94hhBV0w9C2hrSlQ.text: This is definitely one of the best coffee shops in Vegas.  Located in the downtown area in the art district.  They have fabulous Venezuela food.  The coffee is just amazing.  These are A++ baristas here.

qKX9LmOqg9RTWqtS4oq1Ng.text: Lionel Richie sang of it when he was with the Commodores...   "You shared my dreams, My joys, My pains... You made my life worth living for And if I had to live my life over again, dear I'd spend each and every moment with you...   You're once Twice Three times a lady And I love you"  And so it goes for me with M&F... I really wanted to have a love affair with this restaurant, but I left heartbroken... Again!  Originally visited the restaurant a few months back for breakfast on a Saturday. The food was good, but service was awful! If you've ever been to a restaurant where there seems to be a lot of people hustling, but no one getting anything accomplished then you've been to M&F. Again, the food was good... but service awful! This is Las Vegas, and I can't understand for the life of me how such a service-focused population let's a restaurant slide like they do here.   So with another Saturday on the calendar, decided that maybe the first time was a fluke (We all have bad days, right?) Wrong! The second time was worse than the first...  While there were three empty tables, the hostess informs that there will be a 20-30 minute wait. For what I'm not certain? No problem... they have what looks like an awesome coffee bar. All the usual suspects are present, and few new ones. Order a Cuban Espresso and a Lavender Latte. Mr Barista is Mr Poopy Pants and informs that he can only take our order/serve us at the ToGo area... Huh? He fails to deliver the drinks by the time we're seated (10-15 minutes). Again, huh?  We're seated and no one comes over for 5-minutes. Not a crime, but waitress is going to other tables... What? She finally comes over and we order... Then I'm not certain what happens to our order, but it takes nearly 40-minutes to get our food. We go to the restroom and notice all kinds of orders stacked up waiting to be run to the tables, but no one is doing anything it seems.  The food was good... Not great. The service terrible. Oh Lionel... We're not gonna get to the third time as we vow never, never, never to return!  Here's the rundown:  Satisfied? No Return? No Advocate? No, No, No!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg-white omelette... Potatoes were blah!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cuban Cuban Espresso... Waitress never brought sugar?
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empty tables when walking in... &#34;That&#39;ll be a 20-30 minute wait&#34; says the hostess. Huh?

8pVWdwGast-jMoT_7RdLDw.text: This is a True hidden gem located in Downtown. I've came here several times and each experience has been a hit.  It is Latin inspired and it shows in their food and drinks.   They're empanadas are ok, though the portions are small and I feel could be better. They're lattes are amazing! Their coffee is strong and great quality. The presentation are gorgeous too. On my latest visit I had the coconut turmeric latte. Though small, it was tasty, strong, and worth it. The consistency of the latte and balance was perfect. Good job baristas   They have a happy hour where the drinks are $1 off. The inside is clean and there's interesting art to admire while you're there. The staff are friendly and accommodating.  Great place to hang out with friends or study. Prices are fair for what you get.   Opt for this place rather than the usual chain coffee shops. You'll get something much better for about the same price.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside patio area

iNdUVFQxkFjBQaRLt_vWKg.text: So many gluten-free options on this menu. We went for breakfast and everyone in our party really enjoyed their food. A friend had the smoked salmon bene and said it was the best he's ever had. He didn't even realize it was gluten-free. I had the brussel sprout skillet, it was delicious. The infused coffee's were also yummy. I can't wait to go back and try their lunch and dinner menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel Sprout Skillet

dXkxLmMpIzMk7KlNpNFwvw.text: Very disappointed. I've been here a few times and I've always felt okay about my visit. Mainly the coffee selection is why I keep coming back. My most recent visit will most likely be my last.  I love supporting small businesses. Especially when it's comida Latina.  This visit is based on my overall experience and food. But what did it for me was the food I ordered for my daughters. Aside from there fruit plate, I ordered them chicken fingers. I started cutting the pieces to bite sizes for my girls. After cutting the first piece and started on the second, as soon as I cut into it all you could see is pink super under cooked chicken!  whyyy..... this not only messed up my appetite but it messed with what my daughters were going to eat.  How could someone be so careless to not fully cook a plate for kids!? That's what really bothered me. The carelessness of it all.  Our waitress apologized and was nice but that was it. No hey I'm sorry what else can we offer your kids..? Can we make this right ?   To the owner or management, making things right makes a huge difference to keep you customers.  Sorry but I can no longer recommend this place.

DIVJb0xOh8vRYLKDIjGkWg.text: My new favorite place for brunch. I had the steak and eggs with Mexican chocolate spice latte. The best quick brunch with perfect service that I have gotten in a long time. Very impressed!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Ribeye and Eggs Breakfast (front and center) ceviche with plantain chips (right), and Chicken Tinga Empanada Lunch (far end)

oMCrwEoN33WZV6Cjp58Stg.text: First off I know is Monday on MDW2019 but if you know you are going to be busy why are you under staffed?  Second you have a host that doesn't know how to seat customers, you had a lot of two tops and 4 seat tables open? Not only that we waited 45 minutes to be seated we also had to wait right before hand a 30 minutes wait on the kitchen. You should have better communication with BOH and FOH. Letting you host know hey please advise customers that we are not just on a 45 minute wait we are also 30-45 minutes behind in the kitchen. All bad #Makers&FindersDowntown

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just water for now! No coffee yet still waiting

moSboMp1gxZlK_mPYem1Fg.text: From my brief experience here I liked it.  I was out shopping for some super sweet Vintage wear when I needed a place to pee. Most places in this area do not have public restrooms.   I saw Makers & Finders walked over and inside. I quickly asked for the restroom and bolted for it. I could have just left after that but the staff was nice so I decided to order something.  I got a Matcha shot. The strongest and greenest Matcha shot I have had in awhile. Matcha is an acquired taste and I've been drinking coffee and consuming Matcha as ice cream over at Maiko. So I did what any rational caffeine addict does and added so much sugar to the Matcha. Got it to go, brought it home and added almond milk.   The Matcha shot was made right and if I find myself near-by I will try some coffee and maybe a snack at Makers & Finders.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Matcha shot - very strong
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

laPqZsT0Xw9fbcJhvk-QrQ.text: I had high hopes for this place, but left feeling a bit disappointed.  DRINKS: The lattes were good, a bit pricy but good portions.   FOOD: For food, we ordered brunch (served until 4). We had the Bacon and Brussels skillet and the Arepa Benny.   The Arepa Benny did not appear to be made to order. It consisted of scoops of marinated pork on top of a slightly soggy arepa. The yolks of the poached eggs had congealed, suggesting either that the dish had sat out, or that the eggs were over cooked. Besides the preparation, flavors were otherwise good---I could see this fish being great on a good day.  The bacon and Brussels sprouts skillet had very little bacon, but the sprouts were well cooked and the sauces were good.   SERVICE/CLEANLINESS: A few service issues: we asked for the eggs on the skillet to be poached, and when the bill came they had added a $1.00 surcharge for poaching. Not a big deal money-wise, but I thought it was super petty---both because they didn't mention it, and because it doesn't cost more to poach an egg instead of scramble it. Also, the bathrooms were super dirty (at 4 pm on a Friday).

fh4sMDVytevfbWnliKIA9w.text: Been coming here since they opened their door years ago, and continue to love every visit! Oh oh oh ---it's magic (singing aloud here) from the smooth espresso lattes (salted caramel, and golden turmeric) and the savory signature dishes like chicken tinga omelet and Latin hash. They feature new menu items too, and prices are quite affordable in ratio to the portions served. On warmer temps enjoy sitting outside to soak up the downtown atmosphere. The experience here brings me to a happy state of mind each and every time. P.S. Kids/family-friendly too.
