Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted Caramel Latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tinga Omelet

gTf7W5RzGMRxApZOnLvzPw.text: Well, I only stopped in for a coffee. That decision quickly changed to a Latte. I was in the area and thought I'd give this place a try. I would say it's a trendy place, but I'll admit; I was only there for about 15 minutes max. I can say that I literally paid $7 for a latte, including tip. Way too expensive. Kind of mad at myself for doing it. The atmosphere in this place is okay, not phenomenal. Maybe, the price has something to do with the location. It's in the Arts District, which is pretty cool, but again not phenomenal. So who knows if I'll be back. Probably won't make a special trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5QqK1EXchynmlPzpzHT6_A.text: Easy street parking! They had great  coffee and the Food was delicious!  The only thing I wasn't the most thrilled about was the avocado toast.  It felt like just guacamole spread thinly on toasted bread.  The staff was very accommodating to our children.

PFXLGrNJUPYfPWKq5bctxA.text: Love this place! Service is always fast and friendly, the atmosphere is perfect, they always play lofi type beats to set the cafe mood.  Vegan friendly food, very Hispanic inspired menu & the flavors are always top notch :)  Definitely try the Turmeric latte with coconut milk! One of the most deliciously different lattes I've had.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. love the decor
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut milk lattes, Avocado toast (substituted the egg for mushrooms), &amp; breakfast skillet with added soyrizo  vegan friendly!

tD_4Cwp9N-u25lJlcU6g9w.text: Me and my husband went there with lot of excitement. Read reviews about how cool the place was and since we wanted to try a nice breakfast place downtown, we chose this one. I thought was going to find the place busy but I was glad that we were sat right away. Took a look at the menu and everything sounded exciting and appealing to us. After a few minutes, we ordered the Arepa Benny (Breakfast Menu) and La Paisa Arepa (Lunch Menu), also two drinks, the Caipirinha and their Bloody Mary. Food came decently fast. Both dishes were delicious, I would say the Arepa Benny was quite special. Also portions were perfect. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because both drinks were on the strong side, maybe not too enjoyable for breakfast time. Our waitress was a really nice one!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepa Benny , Caipirinha

Bbish6hQ-DtH9iK5_o1A8w.text: What a delicious and quaint Cafe/restaurant. Lavender infused coffee is a must try. Smooth coffee with a hint of lavender  waking you up with this floral aroma. Chicken tinga Chilaquiles has so many layers of flavors, spicy chicken,  freshness and tinny salsa verde, crunchiness of the chips with blacks beans and sour cream. All the flavors marinated so well together. The only problem was the chips got soggy very quickly, you ended eating big lumps of them. Arepa benny with short ribs was their version of eggs Benedict.  Short ribs was very  tender and top with a poached egg, and the base was the corn cake. What a delicious combination.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepa benny
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry empanadas with vanilla gelato

woAlIfjhwXhHj3-SyhAbQQ.text: I recently tried Makers & Finders for brunch and they did not disappoint! I was able to try the breakfast empanadas, tres leches waffle and chilaquiles. All so equally delicious in their own way! If you're craving something sweet give the tres leches waffle a try and don't forget to spread the coconut cream and blueberries. If you're looking for something savory order the chilaquiles with short ribs, the taste is truly flavorful. Also the empanadas were enjoyable as well. The texture was light and fluffy, and tasty with the filling and sauce.   Besides the dishes, the service was great as well. Our waitress was friendly and our food got to us quickly. No complaints and can't wait to come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PM00WS9G3VAnZjKhzkQuBA.text: Grabbing lunch here was a fun and relaxing experience. I chose to sit on the patio and enjoy the brief, beautiful weather we're experiencing before the truly hot temperatures set in. I tried the avocado toast and also a nice honey vanilla latte. Both hit the spot. The tomatoes and spices on the toast provided a surprising tanginess that was complemented by the gentle creaminess of the poached egg. Nicely done! Makers & Finders is located in a great spot on Main St - smack dab in the middle of some awesome antique shops. So it's perfect for wandering around, stopping by for a cuppa, and then wandering some more.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y1cIktii_mMZEdEb0Mb-AQ.text: Such a mellow little hangout spot. I have been here several times for some good coffee and food. Today I came to hang out while waiting for a friend to get off work. I don't always go places and hang out solo but if I do it again this is where I'll be. I felt so comfortable and the staff were so kind. I would recommend to give this spot a shot if you have been thinking about it.   I have really enjoyed their coffee selection and today I had a few cocktails which were super tasty. Their menu is also fun to test out. I'm a big fan of the yuca fries, the black bean burrito, and the desserts!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Equalizer #2

ixh1qvWam6CibTfCO261Pw.text: This place is 5 stars, for food & service! The chicken chilaquiles were delicious! The best I have ever tasted! Additionally, Jesse, the bartender took real good care of us; when Jesse overheard my GF and I talk about how it was my GF's bday weekend and we were in Vegas celebrating, he surprised us with a bday flan with caramel and strawberries! Thank you guys! We will be returning for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espresso Flan with strawberries

7Jo-Cght8H9BA_bPQLu7dA.text: Located in the Las Vegas arts district, we had to take a Lyft to get here, however this area is getting a bit of a revitalization and is worth checking out. Getting decent coffee in Vegas isn't difficult, but the lack of 3rd wave coffee shops on the strip motivated us to make the trek.  They are Latin cuisine centered so don't expect to find your standard breakfast/lunch items, it will have an unique twist to it such as churro or tres leches waffles. They have a nice choice of drip coffees, they are most famous for their lavender and Mexican chocolate lattes. This is a popular brunch spot so there might be a bit of a wait, our wait wasn't too bad because we caught the tail end of the brunch rush.  I tried the lavender latte and I actually liked it! I usually stay away from it because sometimes it can taste a bit like soap, however their house made syrup is delicate without being heady. I got the honey vanilla latte which was alright. I wasn't in the mood for sweets that morning, next time I would like to try the Mexican chocolate latte.  We ate family style which was a bit difficult since their tables are so tiny, but everything I ate was tasty. The food comes out quickly even though this place is packed and it is well made. I liked their chilaquiles; it comes with salsa verde instead of the usual red sauce and you can add more protein on top (extra charge). I got chicken tinga as a topping which was tasty and opted to omit the beans since they make me toot.   We foolhardily decided to walk back to the strip even though we were over 1 1/2 miles away from our hotel and it was in the triple digits. Someone (ahem, not me) wanted to meet their 15,000 steps/day goal so I was coerced; it was a bad bad idea. It was a desolate and sketchy walk, I would not recommend it anyone, not even in cool weather. Point of the story is, come out here for good food and coffee but don't even think about trying to walk back!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles Skillet Breakfast with chicken tinga
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender Infused Latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey Vanilla Latte

WOeDCpnVLHxSMJdziDR5YQ.text: Very fine Latin fusion cuisine and fantastic coffee. Of note were the arepas and the chillequilles (sp?).  The pour over coffee (Columbian) was smooth, flavorful and wonderfully nuanced.  On a negative note, staff seems to forget about patrons (coffee took over 15 minutes over time proffered and had to remind to boot). Also, in a 1/3 full Monday morning, was asked to pay immediately before finishing said coffee. Would have gotten another order but was put off by the abruptness of the check. Less in the register for what is otherwise an outstanding place in Las Vegas.

a4SplibnZKXackDtCrBLKA.text: This area of downtown LV, a few blocks of Main St, between the Strip and downtown Fremont Street, has become a fun area to shop for antiques, vintage clothes and retro Vegas kitsch. This coffee shop/cafe has a young, hip vibe that reminded me of Williamsburg (Brooklyn) or the Mission District in SF. Food and coffee were good (I had the eggs Benedict served on a corn cake), but service was slow, and they got my order wrong the first time, and I had to wait even longer to get the right order. Overall, I recommend for the food and location, and would try again.

xbOlSTlJvY-oZkPtSq5y0A.text: Food: I had high hopes for this place. Maybe it was because we had previously seen their regular menu and had anticipated ordering from it. We came on a Sunday so we ended up trying out their brunch. The menu wasn't as extensive and for some reason I wasn't really feeling anything on the menu. My fiance was pretty set on ordering the Arepa Benny and Lavender Latte, so I opted for the Latin Poutine. The Arepa Benny, which is pretty popular according to many of the reviews, was pretty good, but the meat lacked flavor and the highlight of the dish was the arepa. My poutine was good, simple, and flavorful, but not as filling as I thought it would be. My favorite item that we ordered was the Lavender Latte. It wasn't too sweet or too heavy, but a perfect blend of cream and just a hint of that floral lavender taste.   Environment/Ambiance: Definitely a modern hipster joint. There's a good amount of seating inside as well as outdoor lounge seating. From the outside I would have guessed it was a regular coffee shop. I really like the concept which I would guess is a hipster/Latin/coffee shop feel. It's very clean and minimal, although I wouldn't recommend this place for a large group.   Service: Service was prompt, but I must say it was forgettable. It got pretty busy when we arrived, so we rarely saw our server.   Tips: I think I may wanna come back on a different day other than their Sunday Brunch. If I ever come back, I definitely want that Lavender Latte again.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepas Benny
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latin Poutine

Wl1NjheHymJCT4q5M4L5tA.text: Wanted to like this place but the croissant Sami for $10 had literally a piece of bacon and bad tomatoes, iced tea was weird but cold brew coffee was pretty good. We went really early the barista while fast clearly was having a bad morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XhW8UlMOZaGyhZBcGxD2BA.text: We came here for lunch today, and I was really looking forward to coming here. We ordered our food and waited a very long time, more than 45+ minutes even though the restaurant wasn't necessary that busy. The table next to us who was served later even got their food much sooner than us. It was very difficult to flag down a waiter as well, and our server changed halfway through. I ordered the chicken sandwich expecting a filling meal, and was very disappointed to have two small crostini type sandwiches with very little meat. It didn't come with the avocado cream listed on the menu as well. To top it off, I ordered an Arnold Palmer, and I got a super sweet orange juice concoction that they charged me $5 for. We waited more than 20 minutes to get our check back as well. I am just very disappointed in a place that has high reviews here on yelp since my experience was not good. I'm sure this place has good coffee, but I don't recommend coming here for a sit down meal.

u2CvDGxiQKma_Pe8TyDmKA.text: This place is bomb! The coffee, the food, the service. They have a big variety of teas and coffee that all looked delicious. They also play great music, instrumentals to popular songs so that you can actually talk to people while you eat haha. Ok now the food. I ordered the Latin hash and wow! A delicious skillet with a mix of potatoes, shredded beef, cheese, and peppers. I recommend adding the avocado and bacon because it just makes it that much more delicious. You guys I could eat this every day for breakfast it's so good I'm going to have dreams about. For dessert I got the tres leches waffles, let me tell you these were the most delicious waffles I've ever had! It's like Jesus came down from heaven and made them himself! I didn't find much flavor in the tres leches part of it but I'm not even mad they were so good! The coffee bar is so cool too I love the decor. Service is 5 stars, our server was sweet and on top of it, then someone came over to ask about our experience maybe the owner but that's a wonderful touch! I'll be back to try some more things!  P.s. I love that they give your table a water jug so you can pour yourself water when you run out! Even the best restaurants forget to fill your water sometimes so this takes care of that no matter how busy they are.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella crepe with delicious whipped cream
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latin hash
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres leches waffles are delicious

DKYuM9Hr1wZLPxZpiaLTcw.text: Ambiance: with the location somewhat excluded, (as downtown is very artistic, yet run down), this place is very cute and rustic. The decor is your typical minimal, hipster-esque  Service: friendly but not very prompt. Our lattes took a while to go out as well as the food. They leave a water at the table so you can refill your own glasses.   Drinks: we got the lavender latte and matcha latte were so good! I liked that they had the choice of regular milk, coconut, or almond milk. I chose almond milk. My only gripe is how long it took to get out. Instead of a nice and hot latte, it was rather a luke warm that did not warm me up at all (it's chilly inside)  Food: I got the empanada platter with shrimp and mushroom. The empanadas themselves were amazing! It was almost as if it made from a puff pastry. Super flaky and delicate and delicious :) it also came with beans and rice and a small (I mean like 5 leaves) salad. All of which were delightful and flavorful. It also had a side of salsa which was perfectly spicy, tomatoey, etc and I asked for a side of cheese. My friend ordered the egg white chorizo kale dish. She said she could've made it at home, as it was rather bland and a simple dish. Butttt I think she should've just gotten a different dish. Because I absolutely loved my dish.  All in all, I am glad I tried this place but with the hassle of the parking and stuff, it might be a while before I come back! It was reallly good tho!!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kZEsx0hrTxIn68nzqQDyhA.text: This is my first coffee house in downtown Las Vegas and definitely did not disappoint! The lavender latte was amazing, as well as the ambulance was great! Went here for the drinks but next time coming back to try the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Jm6G90Pny0lcOxnUu1HP9w.text: Delicious food, good service and very accomplished. Plus, they have Bulletproof coffee. We stopped by for breakfast. I hd their Arepa Benedict. They have a nice twist to the classic.

d4old7JTodDc0O4vyi0LMw.text: After spending a little time on the Strip, my friend and I were ready to get out of that insanity and see some more of Vegas. Some quick Googling led us to Makers & Finders and it was just what we wanted: a taste of the rest of the Vegas world -- and a delicious taste at that. Service was beyond wonderful, the cafe con leche was expertly prepared with just the right amount of sweetness, and the arepas con queso hit the spot. I'm bummed that we weren't able to visit again before the end of our trip to try some of the rest of the menu, but I'm sure it's nothing less than spectacular! Stop here for a bite and then go antiquing around the neighborhood for an easygoing day that shows the color of the city without drowning you in it.

Ee30-pB1_NU4wOBKrLIuAg.text: Dropped in for a cup of coffee. Had a lavender latte which was good, couldn't really taste or smell the lavender as much as I thought I would.  Very trendy place, next time I will have to check out the menu.

I9-adqszfTw06w1YfoYNrQ.text: My husband and I were in Vegas last week and we visited Makers& Finders. We were standing for at least 5 minutes and workers walked by, no acknowledgement. We were getting ready to leave when this young lady greeted us with this big smile. Hi can I help you? Her name was Skyler. This ended up being a wonderful time. Our service was amazing, and she was SO personable. Just wanted to give an employee PROPS... Food industry can be difficult,  Skyler you killed it! We WILL be back to see you

zm0AHY-McFvvv3D4-lUugw.text: Food is great! Atmosphere is chill, and the overall feel is inviting. We tried the empanada platter today. I've always loved their coffee. Try the salted caramel latte!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tRxNwzqv16vXeUCg5iO57A.text: Unique and delicious. Try the lattes; eat some food. Just do it.  Makers & Finders seem to specialize in some pretty cool lattes. I mean, where else can you try coconut and turmeric with your coffee? Yes we tried it, and yes it was delicious. I also tried the lavender coffee which had some dried lavender bits on top. Strong, house-made syrup - not too sweet. It was very aesthetically appealing, BUT I really didn't want to know how those little dried bits tasted tasted.   Tres Leches Waffle. Chorizo Omelette.   Yup - both delicious. The whipped cream had tiny little coconut shreds in it! My only (very mild) complaint was that the omelette was somewhat oily, BUT that's to be expected if you're gonna eat chorizo. The omelette even comes with plantain chips! Mmm.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xY-HcBe5iQ8kVun03rEshQ.text: Love the atmosphere here. Deco, music, staff friendliness are wonderful every time and I'm never disappointed with the quality and diverse selection of food and drink. This particular morning, my meal came before my order of house coffee, which I wasn't thrilled about but I'm grouchy before my morning coffee and they were doing the best they could with the small staff on hand, so I can't knock them for that. All in all, it's becoming one of my favorite places for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Keep it up guys!

N0ippscojBiQRgVafkMxqg.text: Makers and Finders is so much more than just coffee. What a great restaurant for breakfast or brunch and drinks!  Some recommendations are the sea salt and caramel latte and their plantains with black beans!  Their drinks are great iced or hot. Sit outside if it's nice out. My huge gripe with this joint is their lack of nearby parking. This is due to construction, but it's a huge issue. It was nice to enjoy the weather and walk though.

BpT_cLlEsbcFqGBigjl-dw.text: I really enjoy the food here, you can't go wrong with the arepas benny and I like the atmosphere.  Their coffees are really good, try the lavender latte! My only complaint is that the service can be a bit slow at times, but the servers are friendly. Definitely check it out, though!

945kDfBbGu0MTF65xVjVSw.text: One of the hidden gems (to 80%) of people fhat live/visit vegas....  Went here for coffee only and it was one of the best i've had here in Las Vegas. They have a wide variety of different coffees and teas and the one I had was the Salted Carmel Latte....salt, milk, and coffee is so legit just like sea salted ice cream...Hopefully will have an updated review including food soon!

BKfE4fHPhjqTGMYWomy6bA.text: So close to work!  This is my new favorite lunch spot.  I could go here day after day.  As of now I've been two days in a row.  From coffee to happy hour all the way through dinner this place does it all.  And the crafted teas and coffees are my favorite in town!!  Did I mention the food yet?  Nope.  Please hold-I will!!  My newest addiction is a London Fog.  Lovely Earl Gray tea infused with lavender, sweetened with vanilla syrup and steamed milk (I get almond milk).  It is warm, refreshing and just sweet enough to satisfy my dessert craving.  My coworker gets the turmeric coconut latte.  Espresso, milk, and cinnamon give this drink a healthy delicious balance.  Like I said.  We are big fans   Food.  I promised I'd get to this.  What we have had so far we love with the exception of one.    Avocado toast- nothing super special about it.  It's a solid choice to share with someone.  Some cracked black pepper on top would be a mice addition.  S&p available on request....not on the tables. Avocado Relleno-Love this!  Avocados filled with Greek yogurt tuna salad, sprinkled with capers and a halved grape.  I want more grapes on this!   Vegan Maduro "burger" black bean chipotle patty with mushrooms and salsa verde-this part was flavorful but I feel like something creamy needs to be added.  I wanted to try this because instead of a bun it's served on a plantain.  The plantain however was plain and dry.  I was hoping it would add a bit of sweetness to the sandwich.   Darn.   La Paisa Arepas-  sooo good!  Meat, sweet plantain.  This was my coworkers so I don't remember everything on it but I tried a bite and I will order in the future.  Bandeja paisa-  so much food!  But so good.  Skirt steak, egg, sweet plantain, avocado, chicharone with rice and black beans. Enough to share with someone!   Vegan arepas- I think that's the title.  Arepas with mushrooms, asparagus and other veggies I'm blanking on, lol.  Served with beans and rice and avocado.  Yum yum yum.  Wish that's what I ordered again today!  Love the atmosphere here as well.  Very laid back.  Great for a one on one business lunch as well.

IhjXTT8mi7G-NGZzsLIz8g.text: Totally yummy and fresh! I had the bacon and brussels, so good! Their cold brew was amazing, I debated adding stevia (but I caved cuz I like the sweet), but it was delicious without it, smooth not bitter at all!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and Brussels Chirp Skillet Breakfast
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold Brew Coffee

k2papfcD_7z5UCXt2SbGOw.text: We walked from Freestyle Crossfit back to the North end of the strip and stumbled on this little gem on our way.  Amazing cold brew coffee.  It was smooth and super delish.  Just a neat little coffee shop.  If you are passing by, it's worth a stop in for sure.

kyIOnL_NLNKJC9p-mkKlWg.text: The coffee is fantastic. They customer service is suspect. Sat at the bar for 10 minutes before I had to ask for service. The place is basically empty on a Monday morning so being busy is no excuse.    Hope it was just a fluke because this place has great coffee.

37-vbSVFBXONX1ndXVT8AQ.text: Well since my beloved Beat Cafe is going the way of the Dodo bird, I've had to stake out other places for my caffeinated culture fix. Inspire Cafe is good, but the hours are too irregular and the cafe seems like more of an afterthought compared to that shady club upstairs. Publicus   has that comfortable level of grittiness in its location, but the place is WAY too pricey for what is basically Starbucks fare and the look of the place is too institutional to be really comfortable.Advantage? Makers and Finders! Granted, The Beat was on a main drag of a popular area good for people watching, and the neighborhood is what i refer to as "Hipster Row". Lots of laptop toting, Urban Outfitter loving, startup company tablet junkies. Still, its a mellow crowd overall. I've always intended to have just have coffee and end up getting a small meal. The truffle fries are nothing short of divine. The coffee is always good, home-ground, and served by always chatty and personable waiters. I've never tried any of the tea beforehand, but I'm sure its wonderful.  I would easily recommend this place.

YbULqt0ekipp8japjWOVkw.text: Place is cool, food was good. Aprepa with rajas was delicious! The shrimp ceviche had way too much lime! Price was little high for the portions. Orange honey latte was ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange honey latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aprea with rajas

kazeNuD1PsX_1YkYW3-DhQ.text: I highly recommend! A little off the strip, but do not let the surrounding area fool you. A very cool ambiance & loved the interior decor. Very hipsterish. We went for breakfast/brunch and were very happy with the overall experience.The staff was friendly and provided excellent service. The food was amazing.

xowLHGXom7qwT62cbEqNPg.text: I came in and bought a coffee, tipped the bartender and sat down and was told that I was not allowed to sit down if I was not ordering food. I've never seen such a thing in a coffee shop before.

vk3Gqvz36U-bck5GtWdmKg.text: Great Coffee, Inconsistent Service.  The Coffee and Food are of the highest quality, and sometimes the service staff is amazing, sometimes they are rude. I would recommend it to anyone for the coffee, but don't expect to spend a long time relaxing there around your coffee every time.   Great atmosphere, and about 1/3 of the staff is really friendly.

GsBwkuBQQxA_gjXk3xLyeA.text: Amazing service, amazing food and drinks, super cute place and nice to get work done here! Favorite new spot! :)

OHjzCwVplsbXDK1-kI_0Ow.text: I came for a brunch with Sarah-Marie V. I've been wanting to try this spot since it opened.   For beverages she got a cortido which was solid, but I liked my lavender latte better. It was balanced and really well made.   Loaded chorizo soup had good amount of spice from the chorizo and had potato and kale. It was a simple and solid soup, but at least something not standard. I'm in a soup mood and tired of chicken noodle being the only option everywhere.  Arepa benny I thought was great! It makes a lot of sense to use the arepa for this type of preparation as it sops up hollandaise well. I will order this again - and soon!   Carne mechada empanada was good as far as empanadas go.  I enjoyed the aji sauce on them, though the roasted potatoes and tomato accompaniment was a bit salty.  We also got the elvis press for dessert. It's a decent crossaint rich sandwich, but nothing you couldn't whip up easily at home. It works as a sweet option for a snack, but I dont know if I would call this "dessert". I love having nice beverages with something cakey. If they would fill the dessert category with patisserie items, this could be an even better place.   I like the easy going flow of this place. It's brand new so there's I'm sure some hiccups and a groove they need to get into, but the people are enthusiastic and friendly about what they serve which is the step in the right direction.   I will be back soon with the fiance. It's in a convenient spot near our cigar spot.

mbR-m4aYrhoaRYHbptedmg.text: This is a cute little spot in the downtown area. Don't let the "coffee" part of the name fool you. It's a casual spot, but there is table service (as well as counter service if you just want something to go) and a menu of tasty items. Breakfast is served all day. The lattes are fab. The breakfast items are my fav, but the arepas and empanadas are great too. The patio out front is a great place to sip coffee, eat lunch, and people watch. Feel free to bring your pup if you choose the patio. If laid back and tasty is what you're aiming for, this is spot is a good choice.

ecnHSrtg2rMO2by5NZfdHQ.text: This urban coffee shop totally knocked my sock off.  For staters. It is nestled in Las Vegas arts district, in a random spot with poor parking. But, this place is an absolute gem!! From their decorations, to the environment, the coffee they craft and serve, to their carne desmechada!!! (Not sure what this was, but order it, you won't regret it).  It's a coffee house that care about the quality of their coffee and tea, they offer multiple brewing methods that add to the experience of a coffee junkie! Their cold brew coffee is simply on point, no sugar or cream needed. Natasha (wife) ordered an iced lavender latte; a little out of the box for me, but this drink was seriously delicious!  The environment is chill and very welcoming.   But wait, they serve Mexican comfort dishes!! Shrimp ceviche, little empanadas with perfectly marinated shredded beef in them, even smoked salmon bagels ( a must try).    This place is unique and ran by people that care for the quality of their work.

UlHKI9HLoCPRbpNoxQ0GRw.text: So glad we found this place!! Great food and coffee! I had the el paisa arepa the sweet plantain was so good we also tried the sliders and they were really good also. Definitely going back! Coffee stop!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hello..
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender latte

lMlWFIyNQa-BGZzbBtcrCw.text: This is my neighborhood coffee shop and I absolutely love coming here.  Sometimes I even consider leaving work early just so I can go grab my favorite Honey Vanilla Latte before they close.  Actually, I'm considering doing that right now which is why I'm posting this review, because bae was on my mind.  Anyway.  Their bagels are amazing, I've had the lox and sprouts bagel, both are incredible choices and you can't go wrong.  The prices are great, the staff is friendly and there's an outdoor patio for you and your dog to sit (my dog usually gets all tangled up in the tables so I usually don't bring him often).  I recommend this place to anyone in the downtown area.

tFrabSHhJ_fN3vTV0agqKA.text: Update: I am updating this review since I've had six more visits since my original contact which prompted the review below.    Normally, I wouldn't update a poor review if my impression changed--I'd just leave subsequent reviews. However, given how consistently great my experience has been there and that I heard the company had a VM issue with its VM vendor, I feel an edited review is appropriate.  Let me share my three most important impression that keep me coming back. 1. The food here is awesome!  This coffee shop rivals most restaurants in town with their food menu.  The Latin-inspired menu is creative and delicious.  One of my favorites is the Beef Melt with mixed peppers, caramelized onions, and mozzarella crust. 2.  The service is great--all the time.  In addition to the great service, you can tell the staff love working with each other *and* enjoy their work.  It's a pleasure to be around people who are so genuinely engaged. 3.  The ambiance is inviting and tasteful.  I'll keep coming until I've tried their menu then move on to the next place on my list in this new town of mine.  Until then (and probably quite often in the interim), I'll enjoy this gem.  Greg

iaCT3qd9NcGgtmPp0aiWJA.text: (This review is based on the coffee and service only.)  I ordered a lavender latter with almond milk and I didn't know what to expect. After the first sip I was hooked. It's so different from any other latte I've tasted. Service was awesome. Me and my friend were helped by Val and she's the bomb. The interior was super cool, perfect for downtown. I'll be back to try the food soon because the menu sounded mouth watering.

q7U0GQbiEhZzX9PeWI_8Lg.text: Having lived in San Francisco and Brooklyn, epicenters of hipster America, this is the first cafe I've ever been to where my water came in mason jars. Whether that's a positive is up to your personal preferences.  The coffee is great, the food is terrible (my salad was watery and wilty, my friend's arepa was meh), but the space itself is airy and inviting, so three stars on average. A nice little oasis among the antique shops on Main St.

hG3FGRPYRZ02_4boeSu4-g.text: I'm a little biased because I grew up in Las Vegas while larger corporate hotels overshadowed the value of arts , music, food and local culture.  On my most recent visit to the Life is Beautiful festival in downtown , I spent an entire afternoon here with my cousins. I sampled 3 types of coffee all of which remind me of my trip to Madrid. I thoroughly enjoyed the iced honey lavender latte and a single shot of espresso .  I also sampled a lox bagel, empanadas , and several other conceptually dynamic appetizers. The food is tasty but it can use a little fine tuning.  More focus on composition of flavors rather than the presentation would take the dishes to the next level. The fried plantains make an appealing garnish but they add little to the overall taste.  Maybe soft plantains would make more sense.   Service was very friendly but slow and that's great if it is the vibe they are going for. Stay a while. Chat. Siesta!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

06gssnMpsnSgPkZuleAKWQ.text: Excellent atmosphere. Great great food, we had the Arepa Benny, La Paisa, Kale Chorizo Omelet & coffee. It was really great. Very friendly and prompt service staff. Doesnt hurt that the barista is really cute.

A0ykt-QdkgRN0NN08Cuo7A.text: This coffee shop has a really cute vibe and modern decor. My initial impression is a good one and I'm really excited to try the food and drinks. My friend asked our server, Kevin, what's popular and he tells her it depends on her taste. Which just seemed like a weird answer. I told him it was it was our first time and wanted to try the popular items. Our server just seemed dry and uninterested in helping us. I asked him about the chicken omelette special and he was so vague. I was like fine I'll just try it. I asked Kevin twice if they has pastries and he just ignored me. Our lattes come out. I got the Mexican spice latte with almond milk and I wasn't impressed. It was luke warm and lacked flavor. It was just bland. My omelette was good. It was accompanied with plantain chips which were a also good. My friend got the tomato bisque which was also luke warm but pretty good.  Our server left and we never had anyone come by our table after. Since I wasn't a fan of the latte I wanted to get an ice coffee. I had to get up and ordered from the manager. She came to our table and cleared everything off which we has already pushed aside. My friend got a chai latte to go and she said it was horrible. She ended up throwing it out.  I love the vibe in here and the good was good but the lattes suck, luke warm and bland.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. To go chai latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7EyK2lUYoqsiqcyQWd8Mdg.text: Great spot!! LOVED the coffee, my meal was delicious too I had the chilaquiles and pancakes so so good!!

NyYRaHwLZHM0dI7R3fF-Cg.text: I was next door and saw this coffee shop. The guy behind the counter greeted me immediately, shook my hand and introduced himself. He handed me a menu and asked if I would like any suggestions. I told him what I liked and he made me a Mexican Spiced Iced Coffee. So good! He told me next time I need to try the Lavender latte. The coffee was great and the service was even better! So far from my side of town but whenever I'm down town, I'll definitely stop in!

fAAXcDOqqB9Wq0sHiLuPYw.text: Hipster hangout in a up and coming part of town.  Service is with a smile and the owner greets all customer's.  Only had coffee to drink, wasn't hunger enough to try the food.  Great place to kick back, check some emails and do some people watching.

DCxF7m-hUULa9KWYqFu_5Q.text: After moving to Brooklyn I'm super picky about coffee shop quality. I absolutely love this place, it's by far one of the best in the city and one of my all time favorites. Definitely try the the lavender infused selections and for non coffee the iced chai. So bomb we will forever be loyal

HMZx0_dnhxAWtjehN27Pig.text: Great food and friendly service! A great place to start your visit in the new Las Vegas arts district!

zc8BfTqusYtlXaSHzgeJTw.text: This place is awesome! I had 2 totally different types of coffee and they were both the best. I highly recommend this great little place for all you coffee lovers... The food was also a nice treat, I enjoyed everything I had. You all need to hit this place up!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A must visit in Las Vegas!

dLbJQ3thjEL3fyCPdYsJzw.text: Really enjoyed our breakfast here. I tried the lavender latte, which was amazing. It was an explosion of lavender flavor in my mouth without tasting artificial or too sweet! My friend and I split the Arepa Benny and the empanadas platter. I thought the Arepa Benny was very unique. The empanadas were a little different -- deep-fried and almost like a pastry. Overall everything tasted very fresh and flavorful. Would definitely return!

ldstl6yoSbcgOz7PoVXzzg.text: Start your day with the mushroom empanadas and the coffee. The crust is tender and flaky.  The coffee is rich and smooth, and they have so many options.

j0ADV3mIkCNCSk24HF0AiA.text: Great atmosphere, came here for the soft opening. Everything i had tastes great, the banana chips are a great alternative to regular potato chips. Oh and theres WiFi!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot chocolate.

mEYDYINNKh4-AlPvyvOoPQ.text: This is the best breakfast I've ever eaten. The pork empanada was my favorite. The Bon Bon was good. It was decaf. When you are done you can sit on a lounge chair. It was AWESOME!

5h_VhLMbOAdj5N9tFF968g.text: Have been to this place a few times and have been meaning to write a review. Food is delicious and feels very fresh, but don't come in here thinking you will get out quickly, a cup of coffee takes a long time to make due to their process.  Also feel the portions are a little small for the prices they charge. But overall decent, I will be back when I'm not in a hurry.

OtlpZjI1-cz4hD9pEWxKtg.text: Had lunch at this, omg, who knew  place. Had breakfast bagel, so good.  Coffee was really different. Trendy downtown art district place. Yup, I'd go back.

29Z4e5PA908ms1hiq3FxGA.text: The place has excellent coffee, service and ambiance.  Only reason it's not a 5 star for me is because I had to fish my ceviche out of a pool of lime but my partner's food and was delicious!

YVgunJr1_ByhU7suC9mDrw.text: Hands down the best chai tea latte I have ever had. It was so creamy and smooth. I usually go to Coffe Bean for their chai tea latte because I haven't been able to find anywhere better, but this place beats them and any other coffee shop I've been too. I highly recommend them, especially if you love chai as much as I do. Also, the restaurant is just so cute and modern!

eNSRh8N6XuzjMJcP_EePrw.text: This place was introduced to me by my buddy Lonnie Love of near by gym Real Results . Incredible coffee and delicious food .

9f8rdEGUUnf-52xqlwwUCg.text: Incredible coffee, food and service. They carry a great selection of different coffees and have a menu that accommodates different dietary needs. I highly recommend this place!

RH7YB7h8i6ySRx9DCQ_gyg.text: Great service, atmosphere, coffee and food. I had pour - over coffee and the arepa benny. Delicious. Hubby had the salted caramel latte and the la Pais arepa, and we got some crispy fries to try. Coffees took a while to arrive, but it didn't bother me at all and were well worth the wait. We were there about an hour and spent under $35, which is amazing. I definitely recommend checking it out if you want to try something a little different than the typical breakfast offerings, and if you appreciate an excellent cup of coffee!

2dhm1sy6OBYMCoY4incvKA.text: The Arepa Benny is my favorite but don't miss out on the Espresso Flan. All of the coffees are delicious and the atmosphere is definitely super hipster. Fell short of 5-stars because the service is consistently slow but it is a hang out place so I'm guessing they're not expecting you to be in a rush.

PAVtvQy8WaroYwmzGIrE_A.text: Can only comment on the delicious iced latte I got from here, but definitely the neighborhood spot for a quality hand-pour coffee or espresso, and they have a food menu as well, I look forward to trying next time. So much better than going to a Starbucks and getting a mediocre-at-best drink -- support this and other Vegas local businesses, will definitely visit here again next time I'm in town!

5B9bvj0KDrpEv3w4mh2VLw.text: What a great cafe/coffee shop! Super clean, nice menu, good food, GREAT COFFEE, polite and attentive staff. The baristas greeted us the second we walked in the door and it got better from there!  5 Stars. We're local and we will definitely be back. If you're local or from out of town, definitely hit this place up!

Mqvf6T1-0VlJyPbNVWwrfA.text: Is it a coffee or a food place? It's both! And does them extremely well. When I first moved to Vegas from Europe, I quit drinking lattes because I couldn't find a proper one. Well first time in Makers they nailed it and have every time since. I'm back on the bean, baby! And is there such a thing as an arepaholic? Because I might be one. Also if you don't eat much meat, there's a great off-menu item called the Veggie Benny. Your mom won't have to threaten you to eat these veggies. So if you want to escape the omnipresent glitz and glam and rediscover your center with great food and coffee, head over to the Arts District and hang with the locals.

-MIRl_z1-mCfeu3a-s0HsA.text: Great staff, good food, Mexican mocha  on point, not very far from the strip, clean and friendly environment  I would come back on my next Vegas vacation

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Arepa Benny

qZXP7DxCdMqgBlLU3McgoQ.text: Great little local spot off the strip.  Had the tres leches waffle and a yogurt parfait for Sunday brunch, along with a siphon of their Kenyan Coffee.   I enjoyed everything but gave it only 4 stars because the coffee arrived after we had finished eating our meal (we wanted it with our meal) and baristas made a good cup/siphon of coffee but were not that knowledgeable about the coffees they offered (at least to a serious coffee geek).  Would definitely come back.

c1oTe8exxfBhtSeYKQ4-JA.text: My weakness for Lattes and love for hole in the wall coffee shops led me here this lovely morning.  We sat out front because the weather was gorgeous. That beautiful overcast after the storm type of weather that begs for a warm coffee and good conversation.  Ordered:  Mexican Spiced Latte- 5/5  Super flavorful! You definitely knew what you were drinking not like some places where your order a specialty latte and what flavor its supposed to have is completely hidden away under a heavy layer of coffee taste.   ***Bonus Points for having an adorable heart design on top of my latte***  Bionico- 5/5  What a wonderful way to kick start my morning! Fresh, seasonal fruit (Pears and Strawberries) layered on top of a decent bed of crunchy granola topped with a scoop of Greek Yogurt and finished off with a light drizzle of warm honey. Light and fresh, this was everything a breakfast should be.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican Spiced Latte

MowmTUmDFBU88x9Ae3oRMw.text: Found this perfect little coffee spot just walking around. The iced salted caramel latte hit the spot and I love that they have crushed iced! It's sometimes the little things :) I also tried the empanadas. They weren't traditional as the pastry crust was just puff pastry but they were pretty good! The carne was better than the shrimp. But the coffee was the star and I'll be back for more when I'm shopping!

fEur8vKi7ZJDxYpsBIUnJg.text: Very VERY cute spot!  I'm here as I write this. Even tho they open at 7am, I thought I'd be the only one here...let's be honest, who's in this area at 10am... I sit corrected because there were a few patrons at the coffee bar, community table, and a few tables on the floor.   I sat at the community table (as I am solo-dolo) & I wanted to get some work done.   Immediately ordered the cortadito as I order wherever I see it on the menu....loved the presentation with the HEART coffee art in the middle. It was strong and distinct in flavor.   Christian, the manager, offered me a toffee biscotti which they get from a local bakery & and ice tea with cinnamon on top, which they just made and like to play around with the flavors.  The ice tea was super refreshing and was an added kick of flavor with the cinnamon.  Biscotti, which I normally don't like, was good in todd flavor but, SOFT, which I especially liked. Reminded me of a cookie!   Ordered the chorizo brussel sprouts, which we're TO-DIE-FOR! Chorizo everywhere with few pieces of grilled shrimp. But, that pungent red wine vinegar taste was just up my alley!!!! Crunchy, savory, and very meaty. The only bad thing I have to say it, I think the shrimp were grilled too long because it was kind of tough.   As I ate that, barista Sean, offered me a spiced almond mint coffee and OH-MY-GAWD, it was perfect for this weather. Lots of cinnamon, creamy, and I think bits of mint in it. I could just picture myself drinking this by the fireplace and getting all cozy-wozy. Perfect for cuddle season :)   I would love to try more of their slow-drips but, I'll wait to go with my boyfriend as he's the True coffee lover!  Reviews talk about the long wait for items but, I haven't found that as such.  Workers are great. Super friendly and pretty attentive considering how must they've gotten since I've sat here.   As I sit here with 3 cups of drinks in front of me, I am happy!  ***15 minutes after I write this review*** UPDATE  This place is now buzzing with customers and my community table is now filled with a group of rather good-looking Aussie (some kind of accent) men talk about how to market their brand and how DTLV is changing culturally for the better... Totes hipster -- I LIKE IT! lol this place is something I can very well picture in San Francisco.   The manager, also, brings out Ojaldras (honey orange batter, cinnamon sugar, lechera) with seasonal #peppermint ice cream and fruits. It's one of their sweet treats and reminds me of a filipino dish with the cinnamon sugar fried batter chip thingies (Ojaldras). Paired with the seasonal peppermint ice cream it was L O V E!  I'm so full. All I came for was the cortadito.   I swear, I need to get a bigger tummy to inhale more food/drink as a Yelper!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ready for the eggs Benny!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spiced almond mint
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ojaldras (honey orange batter, cinnamon sugar, lechera) with seasonal peppermint ice cream

9MxavL5AKQXzYI_yDlI9aw.text: Awesome customer service here and the coffee is excellent.  Make sure to try the Cortado, it's a drink that you will crave. Make sure you keep ice in it.

gsVoaNC0SwLtfMpQNBDKJw.text: Great breakfast, very pleasant service, excellent coffee. Would recommend, great. It is in the arts district, so it's a nice break from the strip and from Fremont Street. I'd recommend the Arepa Benny, add the Bacon and Avocado.

jro5emp2JMrF_7tT0Jaz3A.text: Disappointing.  Review for Makers and Finders in Summerlin.  Avocado toast had overcooked poached egg, practically hard boiled, no runny yolk :( soggy bread, almost like the bread was plated on a wet plate.   Coffee was mediocre.  Seemed like they were short staff in the front of house, Server was hosting, serving and bussing, took extremely long to get the check processed.  Demeanor of staff was indifferent, needs work on overall execution in front and back more of a sense of care for guests.

elP-wryYSSD33akihjKz-A.text: This place is fantastic! Came in on a Sunday around 12pm with a party of 5. It was pretty busy inside but we were sat down at a table within 10 minutes.   For drinks we ordered an iced lavender latte, chai tea latte, and espresso con panna. Everything was absolutely delicious, I would highly recommend getting the lavender latte!   We got 2 Arepa Bennys, one chicken Benny, a yogurt parfait, and I ordered the Latin Hash. We all greatly enjoyed our meals, and everything came out in no time at all.   Our wonderful server was Ruben. He was super friendly and helped us out with anything we needed.   I don't live in Las Vegas, but if I find myself coming back to this city I will for sure be stopping by Makers again.

iXuNRYGK3wV9V75e4k6mLA.text: Best coffee shop in Las Vegas. I will drive all the way across town for makers and finders. Must try their vanilla latte and lavender latte. My favorite Latin dishes are the Latin hash and Arepas. Can't go wrong ordering anything from their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La paisa
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender latte. Honey vanilla latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic aoli French fries

zo0MQ-4yq33k5VYQlaoSPQ.text: Excellent teas in a very special cup! Over-easy eggs hidden under Bacon & Brussels Chips! Yummy! Friendly servers and cool modern decor. Eat here before you hit The Strip and merge into grand American money obsession!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice outdoor seating but it&#39;s 103 out so it&#39;s empty!

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Over-easy eggs oozing under crispy bacon bits and Brussels chips!

tICKudesDw2EXNSkbbHTXQ.text: Visited this location on 6.3.18 at around 1:30 pm. We had just been to the downtown Summerlin location the day before and we liked this one better. They have a nice completely covered patio, great coffee, good service and good food. This time I ordered the salted Carmel latte and downed it! It was so delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j6-KTtpWy7O9nPqnbXv9XA.text: I found this place waiting for my yoga class. There's a ton of construction so parking can be tricky especially during busier times. I went in just to get a togo coffee and first of all the playlist for this place was amazing..think Camp Lo, A Tribe Called Quest, Nas etcetera, so because of that I really wanted to stay and enjoy the ambience and try the food. All the dishes I saw looked really good. They have a Latin themed cuisine which includes staples like Arepas, Empanadas and a some other Latin comforts. I had the Chorizo Omelette with spinach, mushrooms and Parmesan and it came with some plantains on the side that I crunched up on top of the Omelette. Such a win since I was just expecting a coffee shop! Love this place and I'll be back for drinks before I leave Vegas.

DwDU9XbuE_BRb3kaEKe4fg.text: Great place for breakfast! Frequented by locals and very popular. The Smoked Salmon Lox and Cafe con Leche were Excellent! A bit of an Industrial atmosphere but still friendly. Highly recommend.   This is a Second Amendment Friendly establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dIT-cHOONaIqk_KqVzQbyA.text: Super friendly service. Delicious latte. I wasn't too crazy about the chilaquiles, a little to dry for my taste but other people seemed to be happy with the other dishes they got.   Beware, they take forever to get your orders out.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Whg1P7OMKODKi1r3lIcFpg.text: How can I give any less than 5 stars when a small business owner opens his doors for me before his business is actually open?  I stopped in to check out Makers & Finders the day before the soft opening, and I found the owner doing some work to prepare. I was just asking him the closing time for the next day, and next thing you know I'm sitting at the bar drinking a fruity pourover from Costa Rica.  This place looks amazing. Clean and modern, you almost forget you're in old downtown Las Vegas. They have a couple couches to relax in and a row of USB ports at the bar.  I saw a food menu and pictures on Yelp and can't wait to try the food, too.  As for the coffee, it's delicious. These guys definitely know their stuff.  I will be coming back as much as possible to try different beans prepared in different styles.  Apparently their hours for the first month will only be 11:30-3:30, but starting in December they said they'll have their full 7am-7pm hours. This will definitely be my new hangout to get some work done. Much more comfortable a spot then The Bean.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold brew

FxybEwRpPzZVP6T0wYEHuw.text: Terrible service took 20 minutes to serve expresso. Food arrived and it was cold. After asking them to heat up the food they said they can't. No offer to refund the food only after complaining did the manager do anything. Poorly run establishment honestly could do better going to a fast food spot.

33_LA2G08eZ7JLmziwP5ow.text: My friend and I were so excited to have found this place on our recent trip to Vegas. The staff were extremely friendly and attentive. The decor is sleek and welcoming. I fell in love with the lavender latte. I had a light lunch with "grilled cheese" and tomato soup, but everything was cooked great and was delicious. Overall a great breakfast and coffee spot. Wish we had one in Tampa!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese and tomato soup
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender latte

2mVHM_qC9MhetYaGiC-XSw.text: I'm obsessed w the beef hash with avocado and bacon. Literally best coffee I've had in thr country its flower coffee, the most aromatic coffee I've ever smelled then tasted, its lavender aka heaven & back, I'm going to have my friend go again to get more, perfection. And on top of it this was carryout and I was inside once before and they have a really beautiful hip chic spot w good chill vibes

kQCR9lz7uUgLpJY5gQrcfQ.text: This eatery reminds me of all the hip eateries in Austin, Texas but cheaper. We ordered chilaquiles, arepas benny, and house coffee. The chilaquiles were layered with scrambled eggs, black beans, tortilla chips, and a green sauce with just the right touch of heat. We ate it all up. It was a unique idea to use arepas for the base of the benny and it worked! The two arepas were topped with pulled beef, spinach, and runny eggs. The pulled beef needed more seasoning, but overall taste was very good. The fried plantains that came with the benny didn't add anything to the dish. Coffee was very good and worked perfectly with our dishes. Table service from the waiter was very attentive without being intrusive. We can definitely recommend this place with no hesitation.
