Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles - $10.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh brewed house coffee - $3.

OliI-fJdb_olIM6qvmpVDg.text: Food was awesome! No complaints there service was very slow... would I come back yes, would have gave it 4 stars but my waiterss gave my check and my card to a different table and didn't notice until I told her!

Yla8WeKVEDLM8Y8tEIf_Ng.text: Opened in late 2014 @makersandfinders has left it's mark on the developing Las Vegas Main Street. Less than a 15 min uber from the middle of the strip this little Latin comfort food restaurant and coffee bar gives locals and visitors a haven from the bustle of the strip. In the morning patrons can enjoy unique coffee infusions and amazing brunch specialties. Makers & finders is a pioneer in this up-and-coming area.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Makers and finders
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GiVsax_sNL93yr20YH3kLA.text: Sorry, don't really understand the high reviews. I do like the location, easier to park than other downtown spots. I also like the decor inside, very modern hip. Well I did not come for the location or decor though.   I ordered the Honey Vanilla Latte and I did like it but it is very milky tasting.   I ordered the Empanadas (it said it came with 2) so I asked for one of the chicken tinge and one of the carne desmechada. They said yes not a problem then charged me 50 cents extra. It is just 50 cents, but I think they should tell customers if they plan to charge more. The sauce on top of the empanada is overkill, not in a good way. It is very strong and took over the flavor of the meat inside of the empanada, or was there barely any meat? Oh, that too. There was maybe 1.5 tablespoons of meat inside the empanada, and I did not like either one. I thought the price was really high 6.50 for 2 tiny empanadas. The meat inside was flavorless and the empanada pastry shell for lack of a better word was flaky and not tasty, I ended up eating the meat out of the inside and didn't eat the outside because it was drenched in sauce.   On a side note it was 110 outside and I swear it must have been 85-90 in there. I am not sure if their air was broken or they are just trying to save money on cooling, but it was uncomfortable. I took the food to go because of it.   I hope their other food is better with these high reviews.   I would probably only be back for coffee and I am interested in the Lavender Latte.

UK2CnzpnCxcR8zDhlu9MjQ.text: This one is for all the parents out there...Today was one of those horribly embarrassing & parenting fail days with my one year old. Some friends invited me to have lunch & of course my little one had to come since I'm a stay-at-home mom. She loves to get out as much as I do, shes very good in public. Well I tried my best to keep all items on the table away from her except for her lunch snacks. SOMEHOW she grabbed my full cup of iced lavender latte & spilt it all over herself & and all around us! Then proceeded to scream because it was cold..go figure! I was so embarrassed, being that I was the only one there who had their kid with them..of course. Despite the chaos, the staff jumped into action SO QUICK! They politely helped me dry off my soaked little one, whilst wiping down her seat, mopping the floor, cleaning off her bib & replacing my coffee free of charge! That has been the greatest service I have  experienced so far as a new mother out in public! Every single staff member who worked today was so friendly & gracious! I will be telling all my friends about the professionalism displayed today! Not to mention how DELICIOUS my Iced Lavender Latte was when I finally got to drink it! They need a drive thru ASAP so I can give them my money without causing a scene next time! Haha no but for real I'll be coming back frequently now that I know they can handle anything my kid throws at them!

Q1Ms06BnIJHpez8NePxL9Q.text: Two words... FUC*KING AWESOME!!!!   Food, drinks, coffee & service!!! All impeccable!  I adore this joint!

zok_sQ-LzD0Lc1m_9Acsag.text: Got the chicken omelette and it was literally the most boring, sad meals I've ever eaten. It had zero flavor, and I literally had to pour tons of hot sauce on it to make it edible. I was extremely disappointed because I've heard great things about the place and the decor is gorgeous. Located on one of the more hip parts of town I would've expected a lot more. In the restaurants defense, the waitress tried to steer me away from what I ordered by recommending something else. Perhaps maybe she knew how lame that meal was? I would recommend it be taken off the menu to be honest. That way, no one else's first time there is a negative one. Any way, the coffee was great. I had the cold brew and it was nice and strong. If this was just a coffee spot I would give it 5 stars just based on the coffee, but it's not. Probably won't be coming back, I mean $23.00 bucks for a bad meal just sucks man.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A2H6Sr75nC-sNP3WWEAhng.text: Loved the coconut latte! The staff is very friendly and since it was our first time here he was nice enough to suggest the most popular items on the menu. Not to mention they have some Latin beats in the background. I will definitely be back to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Latte

LzOIDJkgHgLGxWfnjurXUQ.text: Customer service was excellent. Food is delicious. The Arepa Benny with avocado was exquisite and the vanilla latte was perfect! I am definitely coming back to try more items on the menu.   The ambiance and decor is very simplistic. I enjoyed the open area. You don't leave smelling like coffee if that makes any sense lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aprea Benny w/ avocado paired with a vanilla latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried plantains- Maduros

tON2QZAdlgnDiFkMWQub1Q.text: So many great food items....I love the veggie scrammie...I can't get enough of the arepas, and the lavender mimosa is yummy!!

kCcRYo-Vk9PR_Nl1AsXSNA.text: Came here for a quick iced coffee to go in the afternoon. There was plenty of street parking (2 hours) in front of the store. The place is pretty large with a lot of seating seeming to be available. They do serve food here, but I was only in for a drink to go. The staff was very busy, but still were able to explain their drinks. There seemed to be a large selection for beverages, but I like my iced coffee black, and it was delicious. Definitely will return for quality coffee!

Z1qcXarKCAu1pz9r_uqiSw.text: Cool cozy little spot, perfect place to kick off the day and get your coffee fix and some Latin tunes! The Bionica (yogurt, honey, condensed milk, granola, and blueberries) and cortadito coffee were on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cortadito

qy72KDHtNfMeBWZ4kTiahg.text: Me and my wife come here every Sunday for coffee and brunch. Service and food quality are always on point. Today I brought my family that is visiting and it had multiple situation with the kitchen(poached egg way over cooked and became solid egg and outside substance in the egg white) However, GM ed and server Johnny handled it very very well. Definitely the service made up for this trip. Will come back for sure!

_Ee_NfkqbyH7wIL0iz0ZZA.text: I love this place . I've been to both of their locations, I like the one in the arts district better, but the one in downtown Summerlin is not too bad. Good customer service. The coffee is amazing and I love their menu. I'm Venezuelan and they serve my favorite arepas , they are more of a gourmet version of our arepas but they are so good . I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a good coffee at a nice and cozy place with some food latin soul food .

oALrusN0ynWLGx1VOa3_Vw.text: The empanadas are fantastic, the vibe is chill and available parking is nearby. The outside space is a bonus. It's in the Arts District Downtown which is a bonus. Great cold brew and pour overs.

7msV7DjaLklYNEP6k3xIyQ.text: Tried this place out because my wife and I love breakfast. We arrived early so it wasn't crowded. Server was nice but it took 15 min for my wife to get her coffee and from that point we wait at least 20 minutes from that point to get her Benedict and my crossaint sammich.   My wife was very pleased with been Benedicts. 3.5/5  Loved her coffee. 4/5  I was not impressed with my sammich. Plain, not creative, and small pieces of bacon. 3/5 OJ- small glass, decent  3.5/5  Place was clean. Hippster style. Menu was tiny. Near the ghetto. Wasn't impressed all in all, especially for $28 tab.   Not going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Benedicts
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crossaint sammich

9NNq74LWNxgLwZA5BjOOPA.text: Everthing here is WONDERFUL. Wish it had existed when I lived in Vegas four years ago but now that I'm back and forth for work I'll come here as often as I can.  Their house-made lavender syrup IS as beautiful as everyone raves - try it in an iced (almond milk!) latte or a cocktail. Coffee in a V60 pourer is par excellence; although not roasted in-house it's sourced sustainably and fair-trade. I typically drink the Bolivian. There is a Stella Artois tap that is always tempting, but since this place closes at 4pm, I'm usually still in coffee mode. But the baristas have told me that 2017 is the year to expand: location #2 AND dinner/late-night hours are on the horizon! I'm pumped for that.  The la paisa is phenomenal. The perfect arepa-based breakfast complete with sunny side up egg on top and accompanied by rice. The other popular breakfasts food look phenomenal as well: I've never seen a Latin-fusion place with quite the flair as this one.  Spacious, including a patio, and a bar. The staff is all fantastic: pleasant, accommodating, conversational. Love this spot; will be back as often as I can.

JCfG7lCXaas9AncpdsY4Og.text: Totally worth every minute of waiting. Super-full, so it was loud. But not too bad for the outstanding food. We walked in and were seated in about 1 minute. Post-seating, we got our food after a brief wait.  The only reason I gave 4 stars is because the food could've been hotter. It wasn't cold, but you could tell it had sat for a few minutes.  The coffee was extremely bold, which I like. So if you like bold, then I recommend the Italian.  My father ate the Arepa Benny, which was absolutely delicious. I got the bagel with lox. Eating the entire thing was no problem. I would've liked fewer herbs in the cream cheese, but otherwise I loved it.  Great decor. Simple, but done well. I would love to return one day if I ever come back to Las Vegas. If you are going, I recommend parking on California Ave right next to the restaurant.

PL5cqT6dsUJpS_IoWYxoGg.text: This place was an average brunch place in terms of food and drinks. The place itself is very hip and trendy but it's a great place to just get a quick bite. Our server was nice and accommodated to our needs just fine. I ordered the salted caramel latte with extra shot of espresso but it was still a bit too sweet and not as strong as I expected. Then I got the arepa la paisa which I enjoyed. The serving was just right for me but I wished there were more avocados on it (looked like it was just a garnish - see picture). My friend and boyfriend got the arepa benny which they enjoyed as well. Then my friend's husband got the chicken tinga empanadas (also good) and the chorizo brussel sprouts (a little underwhelming). Overall, it was a good quick fix and a nice trendy spot to hang out in.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepa benny (4/5)
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tinga (3/5) - too little for $6 but good bite

8hvr3oE41_S_9PriFExEvg.text: This place is one of my favorites in the city. I like to come here on weekends for lunch, but I've been here during lunch break on weekdays as well. My first impression of this place is that I love the interior space. It's very clean, simple and modern. There is a variety of areas for seating, for casual individuals or conversational groups. The staff here is super friendly and service is great. Their menu has a good selection of food and all that I've tried have not disappointed. Additionally, their coffee is delicious. I usually just get a cold brew, black coffee or latte, but they've all been satisfactory. Love everything about this place. Would definitely come back whenever possible.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. arepa benny
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tuna sandwich
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qb2ki4gyvZQjN38mSu0wdw.text: So sooo good!!! I love this spot. Great coffee selection (I love the honey vanilla latte- and they offer a lot of milk alternatives for us non dairy people). The breakfast croissant was great and I enjoyed the empanadas. The vibe is very urban and trendy- perfect for downtown.  Price is affordable as well. I can't wait to go back and try more on the menu!

8klHZs7c5mHqPb3TPwJCpg.text: The atmosphere in Makers and Finders is amazing. Very relaxed and a chill vibe. It's has art on all of the walls. The customer service is impeccable. Our waiter was very friendly, even to my 3 year old daughter. They bring you a large bottle full of ice cold water, which I loved. I ordered the Chilaquiles and an Iced Salted Caramel Latte. Let me just say the Chilaquiles just melted in your mouth, so full of flavor. I devoured every single bite. It was also the just right amount of food. So you felt full without overeating. The Salted Caramel Latte was just sweet enough, rich and creamy. I could have drank several. And I know it's a little detail but the ice they used in the latte was perfect. Similar to slushy ice, not big ice cubes. They were very accommodating and let my daughter order cheesy scrambled eggs that weren't on the menu. She had their orange juice which was so fresh. They even gave us a to go cup for it. We cannot wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted Caramel Latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The awesome water bottle they serve.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our amazing breakfast.

1XN6d7Lq5jGX53azkH8qrQ.text: Best coffee and breakfast i have ever had. Went to vegas for vacation and found this place. Went 2 days in a row and even ordered coffee and food to go. Would drive another 8 hours just to go here.

Zc9PdXqkQpZY9Ftq1J0awg.text: I love this place!! I have been here half a dozen times now and every time I love how charming this local coffee place is. I love the Lavender Latte and Salted Caramel Latte. I also love their unique menu items. Last time I was there I had the Veggie Bagel and it was really delicious. The honey dill butter spread was so different but so yummy. I always love meeting friends here because of the fun atmosphere and great menu options.

gpanLIaqLl2eobn5FRuElA.text: LOVED this place. Cute, quaint, eclectic. Food is delish and not chainy or processed tasting at all. Good variety of choices. Loved the mason jar water on each table. Prices were very fair. We'll definitely be back!

Idwn7cIJ9hT5UV7w1siz8g.text: The food? Prepared well and presented appropriately for the theme. Read the menu and whatever you picture in your mind is what you'll get.  How good was the food?  So good that I ordered the chilaquiles, sat and sipped a French Press coffee for about 30mins, and then ordered a second entre.  Seriously, am eating breakfast and lunch in the same place.  The $10 Uber ride from the Strip was totally worth it.  The coffee?  A couple of distinctly different options.  The staff?  Nice, educated, attentive without hovering.  Coffee knowledge? I asked the staff to recommend one of their coffee's based on my taste and he nailed.  Free wifi throughout, comfy outdoor patio, dog friendly, and no smoking inside or out.  Menu is full of veggie and gluten-free options, full bar, lots of locals, and nothing but class.  I walked in and despite being a tourist I immediately felt at peace.  No slot machines, no neon signs, and no creepy stereotypical Vegas lounge-lizard types ... just normal people, nice people.

cxJALXTZB8FA0u9UT2_pjA.text: Drinks served in mason jars.... Black and white color scheme with lots of wood... 19 different ways to get a cup of coffee made... Sounds like just another run-of-the-mill hipster joint, right?  WRONG! This place flips expectations on it's head by serving Latin breakfast eats! Super unique twists on your classic breakfast favs, and it's all plated beautifully.   Highly recommended. Also, the prices are very reasonable.

rXCpKocdA60CISWpYiZNbQ.text: Poor service, long waits for food. Super overpriced! Tasty food but for the size of the portion not worth it. Got an empanada sampler with three small empanadas for $15 must be kidding me! I would go back for coffee only.

WTavd9A64dPWv2qUPwnzAQ.text: Coffee is Amazing. Just plain black coffee is to die for. I've tried the Mexican Spice and Lavender Latte and both were absolutely amazing.  Food is to die for. Sofrito sliders are perfect with the plantain chips is perfect.  It's a religious experience.

ykMZvWOks82_ulqIq0F4Iw.text: First time today. The ceviche was amazing!! I will def. will come back for more!! The empanadas were good but super tiny! Everybody was super friendly! The only thing is i found it a tad overpriced comparing the size of the meal.  But will come back!!

Wc9DaFpyCmyIoD2kgW8HrQ.text: The coffee tasted great (once we got it) and the food was okay, but we were told it would be a 20 minute wait to be seated. We went to the coffee bar to get a drink while wait, ordered drinks and were left waiting 45 minutes before we were even acknowledged again. We weren't even sat at a table yet after an hour. We asked where our drinks were and they told us we couldn't get them until we were seated. About an hour and fifteen minutes after waiting we were seated then ordered right away. It took an additional 45 minutes after ordering that we got our food. Nobody told us it was coming out shortly or anything. The food was okay, but being a local, I would not come back. No one even apologized for us being here for 2 hours or the slow service. We should have left after the 45 minute wait for our coffee but we wanted to give Makers & Finders a chance.

ONiOO5njKIuI0G3CqZlSWg.text: If you come to Vegas and you want a great breakfast and cup of joe this is the place! We had the egg and bacon on a sesame seed bagel with avacado cream sauce. It was delicious. They have excellent coffee and my said she had the best chai tea latte ever!

l1-jxaD_7nQU_TCannDpDA.text: We have given this place plenty of chances, but the customer service is just awful. I just cannot come here anymore despite the good coffee. On my most recent trip, I waited 20 minutes for one drink (and no, it did not feel like 20 mins, it really was). Waiting is bad enough, but the customer service is even worse. Too many other options that would be more than happy to take our business. Good luck in the future, you will need it!

dQ9fUvNRPQ6gpgPHU7SuVA.text: Please don't come here if you are in a hurry. It took me and my group close to an hour to be seated after they said it was a 20 min wait. Then our food took nearly as long to come. It also took my friends nearly an hour just to get a cup of coffee.

2gbwWrCjvnRCxWNBAA7Hrg.text: The service is terrible every single time. The waiters have no personality and are so slow!!!!! I am now standing here waiting to my chai tea latte and it has been 20 minutes now......Maybe I leave? The only reason I returned is because I think the coffee is good. This will be my last visit here. Sad that they can't hire another person to make coffee. One person making coffee at a coffee shop doesn't make sense...

SpeSheHnp86eaNUewx1qsw.text: Great spot for coffee and Latin comfort foods. The Iced Honey Vanilla Latte was awesome as well as the Mango Arepa and the Espresso Flan to top it off. Will definitely come here again.

eYsszi0TDXmzUwpnp0RqlA.text: So, I will not be coming back here again.  I stopped coming here about a year ago because of the extremely slow service I was getting plus the flavor of your latte's weren't consistent.  I decided to give them another try since I'll be taking training in the area for the next 3 months and they are very close.  I stopped by last week during first friday and the service was on point.  Very happy with the beverage I got as well, the Lavender Fog was yummy.  Today I came in so everything was great last week and I was very disappointed.  Bad service!!!  It took my server about 5 minutes to come to my table, I gave him my latte order and told him I was still deciding what I wanted to eat.  Well, the host that seated me brought my latte to my table and asked if he could take the beverage menu.  I told him yes and that I knew what I wanted to eat.  He looked up at my waiter to see what he was doing and then he took the order himself.  The waiter never came back to my table!!!  Someone else brought my food out and the original waiter never came to ask me how my food was or if I needed anything else.  I had to ask another host for my check. She went and told the waiter and he just laid it down on my table without saying a word.  I had to tell him to take the check as well when I put the card in their for payment..  I don't understand what his problem was.  They were busy, but he still had time to assist the two tables next to me, bring them their food and check on them.  My table he ignored!!  I will never come back here again...

Qv04svnCoQ6bLOFm5nCNeQ.text: The food is really good and the coffee is crafted well. I love the area in downtown Las Vegas too. Plus Norman Reedus recently stopped by.

1BmGWbI8t2inEv6-9QuJmA.text: The menu is a bit limited, especially for vegetarians. The lavender latte is amazing. I'd go there just for that alone. It's a cute restaurant.

Os5_ddXxwd41T1soau6pPw.text: As described, well prepared and very tasty.  Eggs poached to perfection and an excellent verde hollandaise.  Make the effort and travel for this breakfast.

6JHt6MFQ9vpMzMe-8C2gBQ.text: Best coffee in Southern Nevada!  By the way the wait staff is RAD and efficient.

jhiaU06syPIVpWcpHOL0Pw.text: Best culinary experience I've had in Las vegas! Coffee is perfecto and the atmosphere is just plain happy!  Find it! Live it! And be happy!  Oh, and wait, they just  turned it up a notch...espresso flan! Ya, you need to find this!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado mango arepa!  Mmmm!

owaIfxX78Nn3UDpM-XzYDA.text: I was excited about this place because of the reviews. It was tough finding parking but that's fine. The wait was over 25min which also would have been fine but it bothered me when the hostess sat another party before us.  The party pointed out that a table was open and she sat them ahead of us.. we also saw that the table was open but we were expected to be seated there when it was ready. Aside from our server, Cody, the customer service overall was pretty poor. When I asked the bartender for more ice in my drink, she gave me a look like "really?" and then walked away for the bar and asked me to wait. The ice machine was right behind her.. As for the food and coffee, it was ok.

xJXq_mPsT7O_mVq825RSmA.text: Wow! Smoked lox beagle was delicious. Was perfect amount of lox flavors were balanced perfectly. We also shared a Bionico was very fresh. It was sweet but not too sweet. We had a Arepa Benny. A different spin on Eggs Benedict with shredded beef and arepa bread. OMG! That was the Bomb. The coffee was crazy good too. The iced vanilla honey latte was A1. This was a Yelp gem find.

NVLA_ihIz0YuDIWswgf37Q.text: Super delicious! The service is great. The tinga arepas are delicious. Especially the coffee is so delightful. Good place to have a good lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super delicious!

yXXIUNqMvtuzt44OIFjkng.text: I enjoy a lot from breakfast it is tasty. I order the Mexican spicy latte and some dishes to share with my friends

SzDa6w2rTDoLJfAlekPKXA.text: Pulled beef on a Benedict?? Yes, please!!!!  If you need a break from the flavorless buffets or mega chain breakfast plates in Vegas, this little gem in the Arts District is just the ticket. A coffee shop with benefits... their meal offerings are limited but YUMMY! And, the vibe is super chill, bright and breezy. A little latin breakfast goes a long way!

I58IeYFqIgC8noY4oRWEYg.text: Wonderful food and amazing coffee. You can't go wrong with the ceviche or the empanadas. Definitely, one of my favorites Downtown and they are now open for Sunday brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iYiss65Rs6gQWnzkOMnKDA.text: Well worth the trip away from the strip. Great food and vibes. Lavender infused latte is bomb and the omelettes are delish

j2Ubvz3mGggpSkelBPHmaQ.text: Main Street is under construction, but when I visit First Friday, I always see this new restaurant in the Las Vegas Art District named Makers and Finders Coffee. This morning, I had a meeting with a local Artists that I met at Robin's Skin City Body Painting. Arriving early from the north near City Hall, I asked for the best signature dish in the restaurant. The place was packed at breakfast. Brunch, even more people came in, especially athletes from the health clubs around Main Street. Recently written about in the east coast newspaper, Washington Post, Justin Lepper had just finished working on a painting all night long. I felt bad. He only drank coffee. No sleep. No rest. I asked for the signature dish that defines the restaurant. The eggs with beef were outstanding. Everybody was really friendly. The servers didn't act like staff. Really they acted as if they were having a little party and you were invited to walk in and join them. Very comfortable, nice, kept checking on us. I really want to return for the salmon lox breakfast. Maybe next week.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kpa9NSkSPttUYN0N8V4BUA.text: A great downtown coffee house. Staff friendly and menu is great. The Brussels sprouts are delish and the salted caramel latte is the best!

1cggP6uidbAbsOWSb3FoTQ.text: This place is great!  A new fav here in Vegas.  The staff is incredibly friendly and super attentive in a non overwhelming way.  We came here because we heard the coffee was good...good is not how I would describe it...amazing, smooth, rich, just perfection in a glass.  Since we were here we also had some food and it was so good we both devoured it.  I eat eggs Benedict all over the country and I'd say they made one of my top 5 ever!  The albacore sandwich had this great refreshing taste.  If you don't try this place you are truly missing out an a great experience!

JZkGJ4mm0zW58JLgelwh5w.text: The Mexican spiced latte is legit.  Also had the Latin hash and the chilaquiles.  Both were delicious.  Great atmosphere in a cool little section of dtlv.

QO-7l2OpzfAQ3kYVWem6_w.text: Friendly service, tasty coffee and decent standard prices. Some unique menus items worth checking out. Clean large eating area and fast service despite a full house. A nice little spot if your in the area. Parking can be a headache but worth the walk.

ik--yDkOKIVt7JOpANErng.text: Wonderful place!! I just had a cold chai latte and loved it! A fabulous local-owned company.

JdKxtx0nvbrs3w2NYkLxlA.text: My wife and I moved to Vegas in July and I've yet to find a nice, quiet trendy spot to grab some coffee and get some work done.   My wife stumbled on this place a few weeks ago and kept it secret but now that Cat is out of the bag and I'm stoked. Great atmosphere, amazing food(Get the Latin Hash) and really good coffee.  You won't be let down.

HFPFnCheGOR8eB98eYitaw.text: Love love the coffee! I got lavender infused latte, their lattes price run from 4-7 bucks, Their brunch prices are from 7-15 bucks so it's not too bad.Their capirotada is good it's a bread pudding with Cinnamon infused honey and strawberries, it's a must if you go here. So the bad part. First time here I came on a Sunday eating alone it shouldn't be too hard to service me. First off I was the one who had to always always grab their attention to get me water, box to go, and my check. It took them awhile. So I had to ask another server by the way I'll put him on blast his names Johnny you suck very much I don't know what the girls name was but she was very nice a helpful thank you.

B9fA6niKepPu9o1qv-lmCQ.text: Nice cozy little coffee shop, very hipster. Staff was friendly. The coconut tres leches waffle was fluffy and very filling. The cafe con leche and Mexican spice coffee were very good! Definitely a good place to catch Sunday brunch. Will be going back for sure!

DKPXiTVxF4NblxRL_i6H4w.text: This was my first visit to this place and overall I think it has the potential to be better. We were not greeted as soon as we walked in, it might have been like 10 minutes before they asked how many in our party. The menu option is good. The cleanliness is something I would look into and make sure it's done correctly because the women's bathroom was completely nasty. There's only 2 stalls available, and the one that was available for my daughter the toilet was clogged. I had to unclog it and clean the seat for her. And the huge barrel trashcan next to the sink is NASTY. There were visible, bloody, sanitary products visible. That is the last thing someone wants to see before they eat. It took about 20 minutes for us to get our food. It was good for the most part. The fries were a little too oily, but good.  For my first time here I gotta say I had an ok experience.  Glad to say my husband and daughter enjoyed their time more then I did.

3Vu7n2qwkBghIX1glHvSEg.text: Wow! Love this place! Downtown chique, REAL coffee, friendly knowledgeable staff, and yummy bites

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie bagel!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender latte!

YC2AcwaJYzCf8HG4Jf1zWQ.text: We love good coffee so we searched around the Vegas area for a good coffee shop. Luckily we had a car this time and were able to drive here. It wasnt too far from the strip and would probe worth the cab fare. I was intrigued by the lavender latte and decided to give it a try. I wasn't sure it would work but wow was I wrong. It was so delicious I had the hubby drive me there the next day before our flight home. It was so good even he got one the second time around. The menu seemed interesting and we would have ordered if it hadn't been for the free buffet we were offered with our hotel deal. Next time we stop into Vegas we are definitely gonna come back for a nice breakfast and a lavender latte.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cortatido. Made with condensed milk. Love the small jar.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender latte. A must try.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their to go cup, love the logo.

xuW7TQaw0eqGoGYmvw4IbA.text: There food is sooooo good!!! Any time I could me to Vegas I want to come here. High quality, unique food and coffee.  The waitress was super sweet and there's casual seating and couches outside where we stayed and worked after we ate for a while.

YBCwQlgNT_SByCulaFe3Cw.text: This place needs two listings!!! The coffee here was 5 star all the way, super inventive and tasty. The food was fairly awful, probably a 2 star experience.   Let me start by saying the food menu sounded great and I was pumped for some eggs benedict. My friend and I got there and were seated in their super cute dining room (tres hipster chic or something). We got coffee... I had the latte made with condensed milk, she got a special - lemon latte of sorts. That drink could have gone one of two ways, great or horrific. Obviously, it was great. Like coffee with a light lemon cookie inside, so tasty. My coffee was also primo delicious. Sweet, but not too sweet.   Now the food.... we both got the eggs benedict, described like a Mexican eggs benedict with the bread being an arepa and having some kind of slow cooked meat on top and a jalapeno hollandaise or something... sounds good, right? Wrong. The 'arepa' was not what I have known to be an arepa in other restaurants (aka a flat masa type pancake with a filling inside that is soft, warm and delicious), this was hard, like it was made a day or two ago, kind of chewy/dense, and not filled with anything. The meat was tough and obviously not cooked long enough. The hollandaise was mediocre at best. I didn't even finish my plate, I was so disappointed.   Take home point: Come here for coffee, skip the food.

HyiKOs6t85dgHAi_L71HUA.text: I come here every time when I'm in the downtown area. We were first recommended to try this place by Crafthaus Brewery, and the cold brew coffee here is fantastic. I also enjoy having the albacore tuna sandwich when I'm in dire need of food. The wait for food and drinks may take a while, but it's definitely worth the wait. I love this place!!

lJ__fLoMVGP7-IclbrfhFA.text: This place is only been here two years and it closes at 4 everyday so I recommend coming in as soon as possible because once the words out without great this place is going to be so hard to get into

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They have gluten free vegetarian and organic

gVsRHEGjBHPrYKrhtC6-BQ.text: I had the arepa benny with a iced lavender infused latte and my boyfriend had the garlic lime chicken breast. The food was pretty tasty & it was probably one of the best eggs benedict I've had in a while! The bf was satisfied with his order as well!   Only 4 stars because we were both disappointed in the size of the portions, especially for the price we were paying for each dish....

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepa benny, garlic lime chicken, &amp; lavender infused latte

j0ur_CbxJt0fyMkgcP813A.text: Well, it's a hard one to write. I wanted to love this place. Feeling forever disheartened about the lack of enticing or unique places to eat or sit with a cup of coffee in Vegas, most places generally located in ugly and/or plain strip malls or in areas that are visually less than appealing, I'd hoped that Makers and Finders would be that enjoyable spot to meet up with a friend. Located on Main Street over in the Arts District area and across from stores such as Retro Vegas and Buffalo Exchange, it seems that few city blocks are beckoning the artsy, hip and eclectic to come join the gentrification movement like over by Container Park. Keep working on it... The outside offers a few tables and sofa to sit under a covered patio area. Inside has black wooden tables and plastic, white chairs that sit opposite of the coffee bar area, illuminated with a neon M&F sign.  I ordered the Lavender Latte which was rather nice. Thick foam mixed with subtle floral notes of lavender was a different, yet pleasant change from my regular vanilla latte that has become my daily staple.  My friend ordered the seasonal coconut-turmeric latte which I sampled and while coconut is not my favorite flavor, it was in fact, delicious.  We ordered Chicken Tinga empanadas which honestly, were a bit oily and did not hold the typical Tinga spice which to I am accustomed. Having lived in Mexico and have traveled throughout central and south America, these empanadas did not hold up to my past experiences.  The kale Cesar salad was good, however the kale could have been chopped up a bit more, the leaves were ginormous.  My friend ordered the chorizo and brussels sprouts salad. I did not try it, but she said it wasn't as good as her previous times ordering it.  The service, very pleasant, very friendly, but seemed a bit slow or off. My friend asked for salsa  or whatnot multiple times. Our lattes took over 15 minutes.  I'd probably return for a coffee date. The food I'd have to try something else next time, as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo and brussle sprouts salad
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut-Turmeric latte

hGqkFFcPsAHXh8TGKF578w.text: Great variety of lattes, great tasty food and atmosphere. It sums it up!  Far enough from the strip crowd and made for locals. Very nice and friendly staff that knows their menu and loves their coffee. I wish it would be more places like that

HwCO5MKAIrBguR-JIqKd7w.text: I came here for brunch on our last day of Vegas before heading to the airport. It was convenient because it was on the way, but I felt like it was in a bad neighborhood. The cafe, however, was clean and hipstery.  I got a recommendation by the waiter with beautiful hazel eyes to get the lavender latte, so I did. It was the best decision I made that morning because it was delicious. I got the Latin hash which was ok.. not good but not bad.

pCEjQJbCo21pCKoscVBESA.text: Loved this coffee place! Their breakfast croissant sandwich I got was really good. It came with banana chips with some sauce that was good. My only complaint is that I waited about 30 mins for my coffee. My food came out before my coffee. And my coffee was cold. But the ambience was cool the food was good and the vibes were nice for the rainy day I went so I'll go back and try again

7Nss70Mq7mW_7DDWPMFFrw.text: I gotta say this place is amazing! The proportions are perfect and the flavors are extraordinary. It's Colombian based food. I ordered the chilaquiles with over easy eggs. The eggs were perfect and really complemented the crunchy tortilla chips for the chilaquiles. The black beans were so creamy and soft. The sauce had a great consistency. And wasn't drowning the chilaquiles. Over all just had a great experience and atmosphere of this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The coffee wasn&#39;t burned it was perfectly warm and hot and the top layer was just amazing. Best coffee I&#39;d had

O1bykr6ROF6QpEaGztiN5A.text: The only reason I stopped was for the steak croissant. Since it is no longer sold, I did sausage. It was burnt and dry. I won't eat DD again. Good luck!!!!!!!

SVvVZUI86Q1Awa5FYHJ8GA.text: Amazing customer service along with delicious drinks and food! The vibe is perfect inside and out....would highly recommend to anyone and everyone

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lavender infused latte is delicious

C12Asd_JvP7gmUhNeS56cg.text: The music and ambiance was great!  The lattes are delicious. The chai latte lacked a bit of flavor but was still good. A good place to hang out and have delicious food and drinks. The

5TdF9-Bqy5sYYP-JsfhFVA.text: We decided to go off the strip for breakfast and coffee and I am so glad what we did! This place is absolutely fantastic! I'm sad that there is not one in San Diego. I got the lavender latte (yummy!) and my boyfriend got the cortado (strong so be careful). For breakfast we had the Arepa Benny and Latin Hash. Both were superb. If I lived in the area I would be here at least once a week.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Cortado and signature Lavender Latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepa Benny awesomeness and Latin Hash

dJGsXI8Gak34IIBcV18t_g.text: What a great find this place was! Went here for breakfast and coffee with family visiting from out of town. Nice patio area which was dog friendly *thumbs up*. Food was really good. We all tried something different and there were definitely no complaints! The salted caramel latte was a great choice as well. Would definitely go back to try some of the other things on the menu!

yGv0p16sgZNZuI8WhWnpMQ.text: This is one of my favorite spots downtown for lunch. I have yet to order something on the menu that isn't delicious. A bit pricey but totally worth it. My go-to is the lavender fog, or the fries here are delicious. The empanadas are all amazing as well as the tomato bisque with a delicious, buttery cheese croissant. I've also had the chai tea latte, tastes like a warm churro. Yum.  There's a charming little area where you can sit outside in the shade. The chair are really uncomfortable, but there is the option of sitting on the couch.   If you're ordering coffee to go, it might take a bit longer than you'd expect but still so good and it's worth being five minutes late to work.  Side note, all of these artsy little coffee shops downtown have that vibe where it seems like they're going to forget about your order. This hasn't happened to me yet though.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chai tea latte &amp; lavender fog

W9JH1QcAC6eJ8yN2hAZPrA.text: Delicious! We had the coconut turmeric latte, the salted caramel latte, the lavender infused latte, and the Mexican spiced latte. Then we had empanadas galore. We will definitely be back.

RNGkxV62fNYqa3kLk9_-Rw.text: Lol. I was a little skeptical with the price but I have to admit I am impressed.  I just came for the lavender infused latte.  I like trying new, different and original flavors especially when it comes to coffee.  I've had a lavender latte before but it's hard to find at coffee shops.   Their lavender infused latte is actually really good! 5 stars for that. My husband was skeptical but interested in their lemon bar latte. I made him try it. He loved it. I liked it too.  Their coffee is not too sweet or overly strong. It has a nice subtle hint of flavor.  They use crushed ice like Coffee Bean and tea leaf. Their iced lattes are perfect for this hot Vegas weather.  Interior is clean. Service was nice and pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Try it... Lavender infused latte

Q2ZsR8QIzTeLUYA_kVZltw.text: Absolutely amazing! Food was great and never disappointed!!! Was in Las Vegas May 11-15 and ate there everyday. The chicken tinga omelette, hibiscus iced tea was delicious, fruit parfait was to die for!!  Only disappointment was on Mother's Day when they were busy, my husband and I waited almost an hour to eat. People that came after us were waited on first, we were bypassed over and over, waiter barely interacted with us.

sAqZjMzw0hzuxXqOfOg6YQ.text: Arepa Benny ($10): Golden poached eggs, coffee-rubbed beef, grilled tomato, salsa verde hollandaise. Overall, slightly bland, which is surprising considering the ingredients. The arepa wasn't very tasty on its own and neither was the beef. Even the hollandaise lacked oomph. Everything just lacked flavor (or salt).  Chorizo Brussels Sprouts ($12): Grilled shrimp, crispy onion, sauteed mushroom, ground and sliced chorizo. **We were told that the chef refused a shipment of Brussels sprouts that morning, so they offered Kale instead.** Perhaps this dish is best with Brussels sprouts and only with Brussels sprouts. Although the kale was nice, it was just an odd concoction and needed a lot more chorizo. The grilled shrimp was really wonderful.  Chicken Tinga Empanada ($6): Chipotle chicken, lime avocado sauce. This was probably the best item we tried. Great flavors and composition of the empanada. I would eat it again.  Crispy Fries w/ Garlic Aioli & House Sauce ($5). The fries were really great. I didn't care for the sauce drizzled on top - I guess it was supposed to be the garlic aioli, but it tasted almost like honey mustard (weird). The house sauce was good.  Lavender Infused Latte ($6): This is probably the most intriguing item on the beverage menu and both of us couldn't resist. You would smell the lavender, but you couldn't taste it. Subtle is an understatement. Perhaps it's best that way, but it seems that if you're going to make a fuss over a coffee infused with something, it better taste like that something. It was still a nice latte. My friend also ordered a Cuban Espresso ($4) at the end of our meal. Holy cow, that stuff will put hair on your chest!  I really like the space and the menu seems so fun, but the food was disappointingly underwhelming. I was definitely expecting a better food experience. On the other hand, the coffee was good and the staff was fantastic. Overall, it was a nice place to hang out with coffee, but I would skip the eats.

xyzjAAKBhxkrhj8ooQJiNA.text: This place is more a sit-down eatery than a coffee shop. To-go coffee orders are taken at the coffee bar, which was a bit overwhelmed. Ended up waiting about 15 minutes for four coffees.  Highlights: Lavender-infused latte: you can taste the lavender, but a bit dear at $5.50 for the small size  Didn't like: Coconut turmeric latte: we only had ourselves to blame, but it tasted sorta like how you might expect it to, which wasn't very good.  During the cooler months, the patio would be a cool place to plop down and get a bit of work done.

Wl7bWz8exC05u6fR7o-rTQ.text: Being first to a market has it's advantages. Maintaining quality and growing a business takes consistency, and a systematic approach to all layers of service.   When "Makers" first opened in the Arts District of Las Vegas in October of 2014, we were thirsty for a neighborhood coffee spot, and they delivered. Plus, they brought an amazing menu with incredible food options.  How lovely it was to be part of the first group of regulars. Daily hugs and smiles.   Always a great place to get coffee with a laptop, or meet a contact for a lunch meeting.   As an original customer, I'm a bit biased, but in all honesty, I'm constantly amazed with the plethora of new faces that come and patronize my favorite spot. Endless networking opportunity.   When the team decided to extend the hours, to include dinner time, they extended the menu. The new menu kept all the classics, like my favorite Arepa Benny, but it also added a handful of more affordable and filling options. They also added great Happy Hour options, and alcoholic beverages.   Rumor has them opening a new location in Summerlin this fall, that'll be great to meet my peeps who don't often frequent into the downtown districts.   Keep it up Ya'll

Y7sslQsDUJR0RTv6jtMacQ.text: This is my absolute favorite coffee shop in Las Vegas. The food, service, and drinks are phenomenal. Josie, is always so kind and sweet whenever I stop by for breakfast, or to study. I recommend this place to EVERYONE and they end up being regulars like me!! I asked Josie for a recommendation on an iced coffee and she recommended the Mexican spiced  latte iced. It was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AlVAKARciPyjRmOk268w0w.text: great place for coffee off the strip with a hipster, bohemian twist!  Vegas surprisingly has healthy places that Seattle doesn't even offer and this is one of them. Basically it's a new american/cuban restaurant with yuca, tumeric chai lattes, lavendar lattes..and even sides of brussel sprouts or asparagus :)  The prices are a bit on the higher end but worth it if you try something unique off their menu.

pNCW8dMiDDUWxuo8RzImAQ.text: Great food, best coffee drinks I've ever had! Staff was awesome and so friendly. Will definitely go back.

AAoKQvRpfgy6baR1mkB5Lw.text: Coffee and food are delicious, I also like the ambience with the settle music and their drip coffee device. Very hip and in the heart of downtown. Parking can be difficult, but that's just downtown.   Comfortable indoor/outdoor seating area with lots of room for groups. And there's a bar next door!   I appreciate the water service to the table and the attentive staff. I was here for a business meeting, about an hour, and the waiter asked us too many times if we needed anything to the point where it interrupted our conversation.

0gybwIv9B5dFeJusXdp74Q.text: Drop the "Coffee" part in the name and this probably would be a great experience. This review is based on a singular drink to go visit. Milk with a splash of matcha, and milk with a splash of lavender infused coffee. $10 with a yelp discount. Honestly the lavender latte isn't too bad, but the matcha... Wtf, I'd go to Starbucks for their matcha before this place ever again. Plus this place seems soley designed as a sit down restaurant vs a grab and go coffee shop. Both drinks also had a chalky texture, not sure what that's about...

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wtf did I pay for...

-jFqYU2ts5UZvLabzerKMQ.text: Decided to try the avocado salad because I was craving avocado and chicken. I ordered for delivery and will say the taste was great but this was a tomato salad with a light bed of lettuce, four strips of chicken and less than half of an avocado. Mind you I ordered extra avocado or an avocado salad and still didn't come close. It suppose to have cotija cheese on top and I can't even say it had a sprinkle. I don't know if they were in a rush or what the deal was but very disappointed with what I was given.  I will admit the flavor was amazing and for that reason I would try it again to see if prepare it better if I'm at the restaurant instead of ordering for delivery.  I also ordered te chicken tinga empanadas which were delicious.  I can only imagine if done correctly how amazing this salad would taste.  Defiantly worth another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My salad! Oh yes, I added bacon.

KgDMyjWmsGbBEjs-yC47CA.text: This place seems a little over-the-top with the whole vibe they're putting out but whatever, seems like a cool enough place and (pleasantly) the workers are nice/friendly vice stuck-up which is a bit what you expect when you walk in. By this I mean it's clearly hipster and hipsters aren't nice to people.  I needed some caffeine and it was too hot for coffee so I opted for an iced coffee. I had to ask for some cream and sugar as there is none hanging around as you might expect. Once I got my levels situated the drink itself was good, nothing too remarkable about the taste of the coffee really.   Of note however was that I emptied it in about 5 sips. As it turned out it was more ice than coffee. This was extremely aggravating when I paid just over $4 with tax. Ouch. I went back up to the counter and requested a refill in order to get somewhere near more than 2 oz of actual coffee - they did this without hesitation and with a smile so that was nice.   I might check this place out again as they seem to have some innovative drinks and the food looks/sounds pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tell them to take it easy on the ICE if you get an iced coffee.

P6S15EC5jARQ3GH7Q6B1Wg.text: Great quality food...so flavorful and well portioned! Tried breakfast: chicken tinga+ avocado AND chicken chilaquiles. Staff is very friendly and attentive, our waiter Chris was very nice. Also they're lavender latte is amazing! Would absolutely visit this place again when I come to Las Vegas.

k8NaptROjzOL_5EEArO0mg.text: Their chai tea latte is really good. Their Benny was okay. We've had better, we've had worst. I enjoyed my Latin Bag way more. Don't forget to add some Chelula. They are on point with keeping your water filled, even when busy. One thing they didn't do such a good job at is getting our food out in a timely manor. It's a small place so not sure what the hold up was but they had to apologize three different times for how long it took for our food to come out.   They have outside seating which is a plus. The service is good and they are overall friendly. Their hours are limited so check before making the trek downtown if you don't live there but at least if you miss them you can go next door to Hop Nuts brewing and grab a flight or a pint of some quality craft beer!

OuHXG2U3fvFycpoTCFhAcQ.text: this place is not all it's hyped out to be. every time i come here the employees are always rude or sassy. i can't ask for anything or be talked to without annoyance from them. the first time i came here it literally took 40 minutes to get a london fog, tea with milk. why did it take so long? there were only 4 people in the place entirely & when i asked for them to fix it because it was not good, all i got was attitude and an even worse london fog 30 MINUTES later. ridiculous. not a fan of the food but i guess that's on me. i just don't like how rude the workers are & how bad the drinks are. i am a barista myself, no drink should take you any longer than 5 minutes.

phnD4ESDIl1Rr32472q74g.text: Soooo yummy!!  And the service was so great!  Brought my puppy and they were so sweet to her.  The hostess brought water for my pup before I asked!  Had the pulled beef Benny and it was AMAZING!  Coffee is on point too!

fF-xxGj1mEvQrTCdk6mFzw.text: Update:Omar has contacted me, offered some compensation for my experience. I will update my stars after I return.  Came here to meet a friend, wanted to try this place for some time. Worst service I've had. Worst service I've seen given to others. I was ignored upon entry, 2 parties were taken to tables before me, even after I held up 2 fingers and said "party of 2", the waitress walked past me, didn't even acknowledge me, and then took the people who came in 5 minutes after me. Then waited outside for water (it's 100 degrees plus out) and got nothing, people who had been sitting out here longer didn't even have their order taken when I got mine taken (still no water). I'm only giving 2 stars because the food was OK and the place was rather busy. Need a stationed hostess or manager to make sure people are served in order, or at least seated in order.

cSJSkpoP87rtqaRaCqeuow.text: Never have I waited so long (20 min) for a take-out sewer looking matcha green tea latte. I can appreciate a good cup of matcha iced or hot, but never grass-tasting, chalky-feeling hot milk.

F-jRx0cnqTMWuQLsUOOaPw.text: It's finally time to write a review! (After coming here 30 times and ordering everything !)   Arepa Benny is a MUST! It's a dish that I get specific cravings for. Every dish that I've ordered has been tasty, fresh, and delicious! Oh and they might just have the best fried plantains. YUM  The coffee is the super hipster, fancy coffee... Which I'm not complaining about. From a black iced coffee to a fancy lavender honey late, there are ZERO complaints. The quality of coffee alone is worth the drive downtown.   My service has always been outstanding, whether sitting outside or up at the bar, it's always a great experience.   I'm not one for hipster joints but this one has my heart with amazing dishes and coffee! Definitely worth trying! Although watch the time because they close a bit early !

9qIIKsPekQGJgCnxbDO2Qw.text: Food was simply fantastic !! Cool place. Can't wait to go back. Service was great too !! A+

ALreLbTbCgfpJz8dsdR-bg.text: Where coffee is an art form. Try the coconut, turmeric latte either hot or iced, it is perfectly spiced.  I also had the salted caramel late, the perfect balance of sweet and salty.    The eggs Benedict are served on an arepa which is Gluten-free,  yay!  I had the Salmon Benny.  The egg was perfectly cooked and the Salmon lox quality was great. It came with plantain chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2cty61SR_knKGjuyY3ldRg.text: Coffee was fabulous!! Had a very smooth iced latte which was one of the best I have had.   Food was hot, made with fresh ingredients, but not my style. I like a more traditional breakfast.   Will indefinitely come back for another cup of coffee.

vzSi8dhqNWeppEP-f8iN1A.text: Absolutely a must!! Looks like it might not be but the food was delicious lots of flavor and great presentation. Definitely worth it. We tried the Avocado Salad, Garlic and Lime Chicken and a Soyrizo empanada.. very friendly service as well

bPhDb_Od_tG2_OHAk4InaQ.text: I am not a coffee drinker but this place makes me want to drink their coffee every time I am in town. The lavender infused iced latte w/ coconut milk is to die for and absolutely amazing. The food is great as well. I'm particularly in love with the plantain chips. Even if you don't consider yourself a coffee drinker, you will find something here for you. You're welcome.

RAZdYFAjBgORGIcBhrRe-Q.text: look this place has some pretty good coffee, and I'm really excited to see good things happening downtown Las Vegas. But their coffee is severely overpriced. Coming from Seattle I would never pay five bucks for an Americano. And honestly the Americano would be better. But again I'm glad to see good things happening downtown Las Vegas

7S9T2dpPFv1npiIRQHppLg.text: Nice place, cool laid back atmosphere but if you have a appetite, don't expect to fill up here.

xiTLppo0njCGrr0Es2Ocqg.text: Stopped into Makers & Finders before my flight, and parking was convenient in front. The atmosphere was quiet and relaxed with a nice hip vibe.I had a cup of Cold Brew and a croissant sandwich. The coffee was good and very refreshing and the sandwich was pleasant with a flaky croissant and fresh eggs. Flavors were on point with the peppered bacon, and the texture of the sandwich was nice. Coffee was good but slightly watery (this totally could have been my fault for not drinking it quickly enough though). Next time I'm in town I'll be sure to try more of the specialty lattes which appeared to be delicious though!

e4SGzwL9xjMjnblXC7WbCQ.text: This place was highly recommended on Yelp, so we decided to try it out. When we walked in, no one greeted us or told us that we seat ourselves or someone would seat us. We grabbed two menus and sat at a table. A few moments later a guy from behind the counter came and brought us water and took our drink order, which was a latte and a coffee. To make a long story short, we sat and watched other people come in and sit at the counter and receive their drink orders while no one came with our drinks or said ANYTHING at all. It was AT LEAST 10 minutes. I get really tired, real fast of this hipster, barista, cliquey-ass, bourgeois attitude and air at a lot of these places. We walked out. And here I am aggravated and writing this review. I watched "United Shades of America" with Kamau Bell on CNN and he was in Portland, which is full of hipsters, yet no one admits to being one. Own the douchery. And, do yourself a favor, think twice about going to Makers and Minders unless you are an obvious card-carrying asshat hipster. Then, maybe you'll get treated like they want your business. Oh, and the chairs are cheap. And they suck.

2tkra_sBgd-J_ECyeH5Vcg.text: Great coffee that is very very unique. The salted Carmel latte is delicious if you like sweet stuff. def go there if you are a coffee lover like I am.

pRPjbczaL29avKalQk7q5g.text: Yummy comfort Latin food and tasty lattes, hot or cold. Sit on the covered patio with your dog! Chill place.

svkd7t8hTPtRHEgHCWq2dQ.text: There is a reason everyone raves about the lavender latte. It's perfect. I ordered a hot one with my veggie bagel(pretty good, would get again). The lavender latte was so good I ordered an iced one for the road to keep me perky on my trek down to AZ. Our server also did a perfect job--didn't catch his name, but he was the one with a tat sleeve on his right arm. I plan to stop here again when I pass through Vegas on my way home next week.

Axpq0eHadX0HuUAi2VC-qg.text: Wished I lived closer so I could grab some lavender coffee more frequently! Amazing food!

mLuk4JnjzjXgsY6yuqu25A.text: I haven't even received my food yet, but with the awesome staff, atmosphere and menu I know I will be back!

18lfS-bBgZ2mz8hABHcMnw.text: Great coffee! I dropped in before yoga class, and I had the lavender infused latte and it was so smooth and delicious.  Highly recommend it! Cute spot to just hang out with friends or yourself.

SP3LMSL8AmdrHdof_8trwQ.text: Super cutie ambiance.. Delightful customer service. The waitress' worked as a team it seemed.. Serving all the tables.. One took our order another one brought us condiments, then the first one brought our drinks.. As soon as we were seated we immediately were poured water by Josh. I had both my children and though the place is extra trendy they accommodated my kids very well.  Food was above average. I had the kale mushroom chorizo omelette.. Chorizo was a little to salty for my taste. But the kale was cooked very well! Bf had the carnitas skillet.. Again above average taste. portion wise though he could have had more, but not a big deal. My son had the croissant sandwich w/maple bacon; egg was fluffy and he ate a whole half.. which for a 7y/o was more than enough. The issue was w/my daughters chicken tinga omelette. :\ she got about halfway through it and then she discovered egg shells. Seemed very strange but we let the waitress know she offered another plate, but it would have been a waste. So she just took it off our bill. Not sure what that was about, but overall enjoyed the white chocolate iced latte and hope to be back with the bf for a cute breakfast date.

66Zar4HK9laY_UykEdFvpA.text: I'm a self proclaimed coffee snob - so after the rave reviews from both locals and yelp alike - I thought I couldn't go wrong at M&F. I enjoyed a leisurely (and by leisurely I mean sluggish service) salted caramel latte and a cortadito. Both were good...but by no means were they the best versions I've ever had and they certainly weren't worth $6 a pop. Cool ambiance, nice staff, but not recommended if you're in a rush or are looking for a coffee that will blow your mind.

jAlDj1jbaIVV5rBjRldVHQ.text: This place is an absolute gem. My mom and I stopped here during her vacation and fell in love. The atmosphere brought in a very diverse group and the service was wonderful. Greeted with a smile the moment we walked in and both our servers were delighted to explain a Latin dish we had never tried before. Even selecting it was difficult because the whole menu looked amazing. The lavender latte is a must, though!!  All in all, my mom is upset that there isn't a Markers and Finders in FL for her to regularly enjoy and I am excited that I am able to return for more coconut soup on a windy day :) The scene, the service, the presentation and taste of the beverages and food were all combined to make this the perfect place to stop and relax at.

YTiJOh9Onz_-bx393HYdoQ.text: Well, this place just lost a great following.  I understand service animals should display tags especially when entering a place serving food. It is, however not ethical or required that I give explanation for my service animal. If someone brings in a child which stinks of the poopy diaper its got; will you ask that parent to remive their crappy baby for sanitation purposes?

SAYA6I9S5CAnY9pHXdGKLQ.text: This place is a find! Contemporary, relaxed, Colombian infused cuisine. The yucca smash-superb, had the Benedict done with veggies, was amazing. The Lavender latte is a must! Great service and staff! Definitely going back for more

ihwaIIEPnctqyZjXE3aKaA.text: Yelp people overrated this place for sure!! This place took a long time to make our food and my coffee. The place wasn't even busy. My BF and I weren't very happy. I would say the staff was friendly, but everything else was a disappointment. I only went to this place bc Yelp due to good reviews. I was very disappointed. It was close to an hour before we got our food. It took the waiter a long time to come back, if it was to take our order or bring our food. When the food came, it was warm close to cold. My BF order the Latin Hash (skillet type) dish and it was cold and the potatoes was hard. I ordered Arepa Benny (an egg Benedict type) dish. Both dishes was seasoned well and it tasted good. However, it felt like it was under the heat lamp awhile so it didn't taste fresh. I think we watched our waiter talking and eating his own food. I also got an almond milk latte and it had a strong coffee taste, didn't taste any thing like the name. I would say close to no almond flavor in it at all. Lastly, we went to the bathroom before leaving and walked by the kitchen and we could see, it was well staffed. And at the coffee bar, there were two more staff and another two as waiters. I don't understand why the heck my food took forever?! Probably would never return here due to the wait plus the food was so so. Overall, this place wasn't worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepa Benny
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latin hash

PH684QtWyv69tsWa5L1xHg.text: kept going into this place cause its close my my office by im done.  I just realized this hipster flaming dushbag establishment is selling MONSANTO GARBAGE GMO PRODUCTS dispensed out of a fountain drink dispenser.  yes lipton ice tee.  really go see for yourself.   and for 3.25 for a small to go cup.  SCUM

BITymXdNG_SZJ3XZwdGOYw.text: Cold brew was pretty good, definitely beats Starbucks any day (no burned taste) also had their Latin hash and was not disappointed at all! Whenever I'm on this side of town I will be stopping by for my cold brew coffee.

P1iyqe9eymWFN_I4xrSPSA.text: This was a great find!  I had the Arepa Benny and a regular coffee.  The coffee was amazing!  All of the latte options also sounded delicious.  The Arepa Benny was delicious with coffee rubbed beef and plantain chips on the side.    The service was fast, kind,  and attentive.  The environment was relaxed, and the price was very reasonable. I would absolutely come back here!

zkA7Nitms9WL0vncJcHGdA.text: Nice addition to Main Street.  First time coming was during their soft opening. Ordered the salted caramel latte and lavender latte both with almond milk to go. If you like lavender, then it's for you. Personally, it was too floral for me but definitely as it should taste. Salted caramel was delicious. At the time, there wasn't a cup sleeve with my drinks. Don't know if they've added them now.  Second time, sat in to get work done. Since they've officially opened, place was much more busier than my last. A couple and myself were just standing around the entrance because we didn't know what to do! Was it seat yourself or did we have to wait to get seated? Noone approached us as everyone was busy serving so I approached a server then got seated. There's a "community table" where I guess most of those who are solo and with a laptop go. Since it was full, I sat at the couches that was conveniently next to an outlet. Once seated, someone took my order immediately.  Ordered the chorizo brussel sprouts and a honey vanilla latte with almond milk. Both came out in a timely manner. The brussel sprouts dish was pretty amazing. Pieces of meat, mushrooms, some grilled shrimp topped with crispy onions in red wine vinegar. Mmm. Latte was good too. So far, the coffee drinks have been a hit.  Place is cool and music is spot on. I enjoyed hearing Flume, Flight Facilities, What So Not, and Disclosure. If you're into that type of music, no need to listen to your own. Parking isn't bad and there's usually spots not too far. There's also wifi but be sure to ask the pw for guest2 because the open one sucked.  I understand that they're still fairly new and working on things but checking out took me a good 20 minutes from when I asked for the check and actually left. I still give this place 4 stars because the products they represent are good. Just needs some work on service and organization but it's nothing too major that would stop me from coming back.

VzybFwbMUwtl-XMcZmY-KQ.text: Went back here back in early January, but getting around to the review now. But I got to say this is one of thee great coffee places I've been to in Vegas. The lavendar latte was really good, I'd not only recommend it, but I'd say I'll be back for sure !

7W3KBiO0zBYiK-P2cgb8oQ.text: Great brunch spot for vegetarians. You must get the their veggie bagel and arepas. All the dishes come with plantain chips--even better!

Q2MApIEYcCYE_kTkJWv9_w.text: Second time here and the service is horrible. The lattes are good. Food is ok, a bit of over priced. I wish service was better I would come more often. :(

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender and Mexican latter, arepa Benny, rajas and chorizo and Brussel sprouts

NdpxYe0M9BzpWkiPSFGZlg.text: In the revelation of the fact that this private event and the food, kitchen staff and space was the only provided "staff" from Makers & Finders and the bar tending was a different thing I will re review.  The space was amazing with a industrial feel on the inside but it was still inviting, outside had space heaters and small tables to enjoy a beautiful day here in Las Vegas.  The food was really really good, the sliders were moist and very flavorful even after sitting in a warmer (we went back for thirds)  The fact that they had Truffle Fries with truffles amazed and thrilled me, the bonus is they were legit and delicious.  There were lots of other food items and all were good.  Space- Amazing Food- Flavorful, Thrilling, Delicious... Kitchen Staff (people who actually work there) pleasant, accommodating, helpful, fast, and good cooks.  The front of the house was not the staff and that is who I reviewed, now that I know the front of the house staff was rented I advise the owners to review that choice because I did not review all I saw behind the bar.  However you in the back of the house did amazing.  The food service was top notch and the food taste was amazing.  Thank you for clarifying who I am indeed reviewing, you.

yR0VuX6QzyZHVj5ZuJsInA.text: Cool place located near Antique Row. I tried the Rajas arepa, which was only ok. I liked the plantain chips better.

MyndsGPFZy3Mkx9rUthm5Q.text: This place is ahead of the curve. Located in Las Vegas fashionable Art District.  The food is flavorful, and unique to Las Vegas. Everything is freshly prepared, and the vibe of the establishment is extremely uplifting. Definitely bring your guest to this hidden Vegas Secret.

RFdYKkBkewDIJBbLkTIoOw.text: Love this place! Great tasting food and a friendly atmosphere. Started with the Lavender infused Latte. Amazing and delicious! Server suggested a maple and bacon Latte, so I had to try. One word, awesome! Tried the tomato soup that has chunks of potatoes, kale, onions, and chorizo. Had a bit of heat to it, but was hearty and delicious. Main course, I did the Arepas Benedict. The Arepa part of the dish took some getting used to, but it worked. With a grand opening on December 5th, this place is already super busy. Talk of a dinner menu being added later on down the road. Sounds like a great plan! Servers were superb with very attentive service. Suggestions were offered and smiles were a flowing. This place is definitely worth the trip and is a great addition to a dismal area.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey and bacon club sandwich.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tinga Omelet.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender infused latte, my favorite.

EU2_lWsGK038CY6xIr68rA.text: I had no idea what to order and knew absolutely nothing about Latin food. I wasn't sure I'd like anything on the menu and when I ordered, I felt nervous that I was not going to like the food. I have left only 3 reviews before and I hope this review helps people make decisions. I ate the Paisa and it was so full of flavor! Absolutely delicious with a touch of sweet from the fruit and a touch of salt from the bacon! We also had the Arepa Benny or something like that. It as well had such a brilliant bold mix of flavors. Just fantastic! the staff was friendly and eager to have you enjoy your experience. Highly recommend you try it!

BaNCr00rooHaJlYUluCEpw.text: Best. Coffee.  Period.  Some of the best coffee I've had and such a great atmosphere in downtown to hang out.  I'm from Portland, the mecca of coffee shops, and this place lives up to all of those and hands down out of their league.  The lavender latter is my favorite.  Customer service is on point and I haven't had anything I didn't like to eat off their menu.  Congrats to M&F, keep on, keeping on!

b6EUkgtc-tvfd7yW2FsBrA.text: This place advertises gluten free and vegan and I would bet a million bucks that it is no where close to meeting those requirements. We ordered the empanadas because they said GF. We even clarified with our waiter about the doughs ingredients. He went back to the kitchen twice to double check and said they were made out of corn. They came out and they were fluffy, flakey, buttery and delicious tasting, thus NOT at all GF. If you can eat anything without repercussion, this place will be fine for you. If you are targeting this place because of the Vegan or GF options, I would not trust there dedication to these dietary needs. BEWARE!

D2-WYpCeYjMF-3IOKbNR0g.text: This place is the perfect combo of retro, old Hollywood with a Latin twist. The food flavors are to die for and the coffee is something I dream of getting again. You can't go wrong stopping here to get a coffee to go or to stay awhile and get some work done or just relax on their patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender infused latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, egg croissant

koSi4HfVB77wlW2ltjuoKw.text: Makers & Finders is the best latte in town! I have tried the Oney vanilla latte, the turmeric coconut latte, and the Mexican spice latte. Each were perfectly made. I only wish I could come by everyday

ddNj1jcJUNo2klXNOIky4A.text: This place is great! Had a delicious salmon lox bagel and my husband really enjoyed his chorizo soup for brunch. Not too many items on their menu but everything that was on there looked amazing.  Several people who worked there stopped by our table to make sure everything was okay...and it was!   You have to try their Elvis Presley dessert... so yum!

aXX7DV9UEuiItmyKyIt2iQ.text: Eclectic menu, chill vibe, excellent service! The coconut turmeric latte is definitely a must (I was hesitant but am thrilled I took the risk!)

pW7nAw7TtcqVvssw45A9bg.text: Amazing lavender latte!! This place is so cute and the people are really nice. I love coffee places that aren't Starbucks and actually feel like they have a coffee culture! I would love to come back and try food!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hgrlFWC0KoGWWgL-F_M6Ew.text: So, first let me say I really liked this place. I ordered a cucumber mint iced tea and a kale salad with grilled chicken. Every thing was delightful my only gripe is I thought it was a bit pricey. So the tea was 5.5 and I am ok with that because it was delicious and I am sure not super simple to make. It was very fresh. The salad however was 11.5 plus 3 dollars for grilled chicken. It was tasty, filling, and I would get it again because I can't get anything healthy near my work BUT 14.5 for the salad feels over priced. I would come here once a week at least if the prices on food were more reasonable. I will be back for coffee though!

1DVkTHOk2GLQrYL9lLF9Zg.text: My expectations were either too high, or my taste buds weren't impressed. Customer service can be better.  Coffee was excellent, food was average. I had the empanadas they were average at best, there was no crunch to them, but flavor was decent and they were on the cold side. Also ordered was the latin hash, it was good, had a home cooked flavor. Also got plantain chips I am assuming they buy bags of this and serve them. I thought they were actually frying them. Coffee was awesome, this place is definitely a coffee house ...my cortadito was excellent not bitter, not too sweet, temperature was good, and I like the glasses used. Over all go for the COFFEE.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanadas, plantain chips, and cortadito.

JMnhESv0TqB6qPxyudtWkA.text: i love this place!! there iced coffee is clean n smooth.  i fell in love with there cream cheese... the atmoshphere is great and employess are friendly n knowledgeable, and its cool you see the owner valerie coming out talking to people n bringing food out awesome love it,,

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. its breakfast time

a2dfybu5Ar1yEIpCsuRMOQ.text: Don't get me wrong. The brew is very good and it's actually well priced. But 15 minutes for two cups of coffee?? Not siphon. Not french press. Just two cups for my wife & I, that arrived by the time I was half way finished with my breakfast. It was literally the first thing I asked for. Both the hostess and the owner(Josh) explained to me that the coffee was "made to order from scratch"(which kind of annoyed me, because it was repeated word for word) but this excuse can only go so far in a breakfast-lunch restaurant.   The saving grace was my waiter, who could tell I was agitated by the length of time and gave me a discount on my already considerably low bill. I can tell it has potential, but "soft opening" or not, if you have the word COFFEE in your name, you should hire at least TWO baristas to handle your demand for it.

KAIHiaHlvDYOAVBIKNfgMQ.text: Extremely slow service. The ambiance is nice, staff are very friendly. But slow service is unbelievable! I dont blame the servers but I think they are quite understaffed. We waited 25 minutes to be seated which I guess is fine for a trendy place on saturday morning. But it took them another 15 minutes to take our order and about 40 minutes more to bring our food. I had Latin hash which was pretty good. My friends had garlic lime chicken and arpena Benny which were only mediocre and more importantly very cold. My food was right temperature though.  We wanted a pastry so we ordered a chocolate croissant. We waited for it for another 20 minutes, on top of all of the other wait. Finally they came to us and they said they don't have it and they reimbursed us for it. I really think management should add to the number of staff.

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latin hash with maple bacon

5Hiffc36bYcxwjTv-_VAKQ.text: This is a must go for us every time we're in Las Vegas. Coming from Los Angeles there are tons of indie coffee shops but this is probably my favorite one. I always get the arepas benedict and my fiance gets the vegan hash and a turmeric latte. They had the turmeric lattes before it was trendy everywhere else. I got the honey vanilla latte this time and it was excellent. Fast and friendly service. Until next time!
