Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maple bacon
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie hash

DuEm3VNdsNs53OapiqcYQQ.text: One of my favorite coffee spots to hit up when ever I am in Downtown Las Vegas! The atmosphere is incredible with a clean bar design. On this trip I went with the Latin Hash! (Sadly wasn't in the mood for coffee, but will be back soon) The hash was delicious, and highly suggest to splurge and add the avocado on the side! Couldn't have had a better breakfast with the squad!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Incredible!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Incredible Latin Hash!

VA1P5FjQK7MJ0o9McrgRXQ.text: This is probably my all time favorite coffee spot here in Las Vegas. During the spring/summer I usually order their iced lavender latte but during the winter I order the salted caramel latte and OMG it's sooooooo good. I usually also will order their empanada bowl for lunch which is really good.

d1TtEQMr8kBiAF83ny6LSA.text: I went there a couple days ago for the first time, and had their Chilaquiles, I really liked them, the test of the food was fresh made, I would definitely go back, there's a couple more things I would like to try out.

2aTcxjr2rw-Tl16tl4TWbg.text: I love little brunch/coffee joints like this! I've had this bookmarked for over a year and I was excited to finally come try it one fine Sunday morning. You get this casual, trendy, hipster kind of vibe.   Coffee drinks were delicious! I ordered one of the most talked about drinks; the lavender infused latte. Not too sweet and you can definitely taste the caffeine. Got a delicious hint of lavender. Yum! I've got my eye on the honey vanilla latte or the coconut turmeric latte. Next time, for sure! My iced latte came in a mason jar....so cute!  I ordered the kale chorizo omelet, hold the mushrooms. Comes with plantain chips. Typing this is making my mouth water. Portions were just right. Boyfriend ordered the croissant sandwich. We both loved what we ordered and it would definitely be a repeat if we're not up to trying anything new but I want to try the empanadas next time.    Street parking only. We were here around 11 ish and we managed to find the last spot close to the restaurant. I can imagine it may be a bit difficult to find parking during peak lunch hours. Indoor and outdoor seating. The patio area is dog friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary &amp; Lavender Infused Latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of March 2017
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of March 2017

gkE18FfNlrOXTx7rlYEVbg.text: I had a meeting with two friends and this was where it was suggested we get together.  I ordered a salted caramel latte while I waited.  It took longer than I thought it would be--almost 5 minutes--but it was brought just as my friends were entering the shop.    Salted caramel will get me anytime and this was no exception.  A good tasting coffee with the right amount of flavoring and salt.  There is wifi offered by I didn't get the password so I went without using their wifi.  The place was fairly quiet when I went in for our 2:00 pm meeting, but by the time I was leaving a short time before 4, the place was fairly crowded and quite lively.  This is definitely worth another visit to try for breakfast or to get an empanada that I saw on their menu.  I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The patio and entrance.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar area.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of interior.

p1CM0ktOSXdNatvv3IgLEg.text: Such a cute spot in the heart of Downtown (Main Street). I was only here for a business meeting, and we ordered beverages (I, lavender latte, my client, Cafe con leche).   The lavender-infused latte (added a shot because I always need the extra jolt) was so yummy. Complete with the cute little heart image created in foam (didn't get a pic because I didn't want to be THAT girl lol). But it even has a few sprinkles of lavender on top. The drink was so smooth and the lavender infusion was subtle and didn't taste like I was drinking a flower.   The service was wonderful and she checked on us often.   The menu looks amazing, as I will definitely be back for the delicious Latin dishes!   Go quick! Drink the lavender latte! Sit on the patio (not in the summer) and people watch- I know I'll be back to do that :)

vw3lhBroWs5CBg6UIcg4JQ.text: Love the coffee, love the food, the atmosphere is amazing! Definitely recommend to anyone interested in eating in a hipster Latino kind of joint.

iuKXbQPQAwrUvTqPVsvt3Q.text: I had this place bookmarked for quite a while, and finally got to check it out when a friend from Chicago was visiting. There was a little bit of a wait for indoor dining, so we decided to sit out on the patio. It was cozy outside and the weather was good, though the table was a bit small for two.  Our server was very attentive and friendly, but I could tell that he was pretty new and inexperienced.   The menu is fairly large, and there are a lot of interesting items on the menu. I ended up ordering an empanada sampler platter, and my friend one of the benedicts. The food was all very tasty, though portions moderate and I wasn't completely full at the end of my meal.  Overall, a very quaint breakfast/brunch place with unique offerings.  P.S. Street parking only.

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanada sampler.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender latte.

dKVXL5AtgiMea5ezipBKQw.text: Great coffee.. great sitting area ..playing some good beats Latin .. tried the skillets with the avocado .. will be back

2T-T2ipaT6R_tklf67hcGg.text: This is honestly my favorite place to eat. I come here at least once a week, seriously! I love the breakfast! Dinner is good, wish they would add more items for dinner though. Coffee is amazing!! Kind of pricey, but it's worth it so I don't mind. Employees are helpful and nice. I don't think I would change anything about it, I just love it here!   Also, they just opened new location in Summerlin...so check them out if you're in that area.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Chilaquiles w/ avocado. (There is also chicken and veggie option.)

lpNwOipD_fxEIsWs9YnsNA.text: I tasted much better than the food I ate on Main Street. The croissant sandwich and the kale chorizo omelet we ate were perfectly matched. It was really nice to have brunch with a cup of latte. The service of the staff was very kind. There were so many people who looked like locals in Las Vegas. If you want to eat delicious brunch in Las Vegas, please recommend this place over expensive hotels!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croissant Sandwich 2.0 Breakfast
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latte Croissant Sandwich 2.0 Breakfast Kale Chorizo Omelet Breakfast

ypxa9X-FdGcimuo_VEjgqA.text: I love a good empanada! Sometimes you just need that fried crispy goodness. While I would definitely NOT consider myself a vegetarian, I absolutely love these black bean empanadas. I ordered them as the platter with a side of Spanish rice, beans (you can never have enough beans in my opinion), and a side of corn salad.   Also, the ambiance at Makers is just lovely. Even in the hot summer months, their outdoor patio is cool and comfortable with cushioned seating. Be sure to also check out their yummy hibiscus mimosa.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

daIbiZ6BTHGlFSA9tG9XAA.text: I really LOVE the food here and the coffee! But the service is so bad. I've given this place 4 chances so far  and they fail with the service every time. The employees are all very sweet and friendly, but they are not attentive. Waited for my bill for 40 min, my plate was empty and no one picked it up or asked if we wanted anything else.. it's sad because they have such a great menu and the food itself never failed me :)

X9p_WwFNkSZ7uSo5dmagPQ.text: My co-worker and I stopped by Maker & Finders for a quick brunch one Saturday and our experience did not start off so great.  We were told by the hostess that it would be a 5-10 minute wait for a table for two.  However, the wait turned into a 30 minute wait with people who came after us being seated first.  It wasn't until my co-worker located a manager did we receive seating.  Once seated our serve came over and asked us if we were ready to eat.  At this point, because of our long wait we already had an idea of what we wanted to eat.  However, it would have been nice for our waiter to provide us with a few suggestions on things to try.   During our visit I ordered the Empanda Sampler  and the Turket Club.  My co-worker ordered the Arepa Benny. We both enjoyed the Empanda Sampler, that had Short rib, chicken tinga, garlic shrimp, queso & spicy mushroom + sauces.  Once we received the sampler, we wish we didn't order the additional items, as the sampler was more than filling for the both of us.  If you are Downtown in the Art District, stop in and try this place out.

R6CJspYt6P8qJ35OTDP6lA.text: Finally decided to check out this unique coffee shop in the Arts District of LV for brunch on Sunday. We were welcomed with an amazing aroma and hip exterior/interior. It really is a gem of the neighborhood. I had the smoked salmon benedict and love that it was gluten free- their cold brew was delicious as well! Everything had a hint of cayenne and spice but not overpowering. My only complaint was that service was slow- the hostess, the waiter, and the barista (my coffee took forever- never something anyone wants!) Will definitely try out their Summerlin location and want to return for their violin brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nh19HnhlSQJJ2zJOHJEO6Q.text: First time here. Went there with laptop in tow, ready to have some brunch, coffee and then do a little work. When I got there, it was much more "restaurant" than "coffee shop" so my girlfriend and I ended up just having brunch and then left. Not too much space allocated to the "coffee shop crowd". They are definitely maximizing the space for dining.  The service was quite slow, that was the start of things. I had a cold brew coffee which was pretty good. I also had the Latin Hash which was really tasty. My girlfriend had the empanada bowl. She said the empanadas were really good, the salad that came with it was good, and the beans were good. The rice however, was super bland and not great.  She ordered a cafe con leche to go and we waited about 10 minutes to get it. Then when it came, it was made wrong so we ended up having it taken off the bill and left.

5DO2HcTEAUxbeiQYs4xDXA.text: Such high expectations for this place, but left kind of disappointed. We ordered the arepa benny and Latin hash, from all the recommendations. Presentation wise, the food looked great but I thought it lacked flavor.   The arepa benny was just okay, the hollandaise sauce could have been better. The Latin hash was on the smaller side flavor wise didn't really stand out. My favorite items were the plantain chips...

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latin hash
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepa benny

emI1dQwe4qLIPGNSP19tIQ.text: I have yet to try their coffee, but I can tell you their food is unique and delicious. You can find this cute restaurant in the Arts District. I stumbled upon it after my visit to Buffalo Exchange across the street. I have been looking for Latin and Carribean food around the desert and I'm glad I found this place. I tried their empanada sampler and it did not disappoint. It came with rice and black beans. I had one of the beers on draft since it was happy hour. Next door is Hop Nuts Brewing and they have some of their beers on draft. I sat at the bar but I love the outdoor/patio seating too. I will come back again to try their coffee.

aEv2Kks7dijIqX4zVRDVFQ.text: This place was very delicious. We had their assortment of empanadas. All were delicious, crunchy and great dipping salsas. I had their avocado toast and it was ok. The bread was too thick so I could only eat one slice. The egg on top was over cooked. I love their coffee drinks though. A great selection either hot or cold. We ate at the Fremont downtown location. It was funky and eclectic.

sExwd0iTgIB8q4Dnzm3Q9A.text: I came for the coffee and I was not disappointed. Cool little spot away from the strip which I loved. Pour over, French press, or drip. 3 choices of pour over and was very pleased with the quality. Avocado toast was great.... but hard to mess it up right?

-pgq_60T5DOClxolR1lPwA.text: Ahhhh, this place is a hidden gem in the Arts District. Despite this part of town being really secluded and sometimes full of sketchy people, this cute little cafe makes its mark. The exterior has cute twinkly lights with a sofa, while the interior has a cozy hipster coffee shop vibe.   Ribeye & egg: 4/5 The steak was thickkk and juicy, cooked to a nice medium rare, topped with a savory chimichurri sauce. The only downside was that the portion wasn't very filling.  Latin hash: 4/5 The potatoes were crispy on the outside and the meat was really tender. The bell peppers added a nice sweet hint to the item. The egg was cooked perfectly. Our food came out on small little skillets but the skillets seemed like decoration since they weren't hot. It'd be better served on a hot skillet.  Salted caramel latte: 5/5 Salty and sweet coffee- what a perfect combination.  Coffee Con Leche: 3/5 The coffee wasn't very strong, and it could have been sweeter. It just tasted like steamed milk. I would pass on this next time.   Service was excellent with our waitress being a super sweet girl who checked on us frequently. Our food came out hot within 8-9 minutes. Prices are a bit on the high end with each item costing $10 or more and the portion sizes weren't that big. Overall, this was a great place to grab coffee, a bit of brunch, and hang out in a cozy cafe. I'd recommend checking this place out if you're ever in Vegas. They offer interesting items such as bulletproof coffee, matcha bulletproof, and (a highly recommended) lavender latte.

Pp6t9jRjaZ-UFAvQDBzkFA.text: A real gem in the Arts District! Hubby and I were looking for a diner-type restaurant and ended up here. It was pretty busy when we walked in but there was room at the bar so we sidled up and were attended to immediately. We were given a couple menus and ordered coffee. The bartender gave us a tip that we should order small coffees and get refills instead of paying more for large coffees (and he even set us up with coffee to go when we were done!).   Hubby ordered the Veggie Benny (2 poached eggs, asparagus, mushrooms, roasted peppers, onions, chimichurri sauce, tomatoes served with plantain chips - $13) and I went with the Smoked Salmon Benedict (2 poached eggs, sauteed kale, red onions, tomato, chipotle hollandaise served with plantain chips - $14). Our dishes were plated beautifully and were delicious! I especially loved the unique ingredients - so different from your typical eggs benedict. While hubby isn't crazy about plantain chips, I am a fan so ended up eating some of his.   We loved everything about this place! It was nice to escape the "glitz and glamour" of Las Vegas for awhile. This place felt more like one you would find in San Francisco - with a cool, laid-back vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You&#39;ll see this guy on the way to the restroom...
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our view from the bar.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon Benedict

0ASAKTsa8K1Yj3Gfwr7rmg.text: Vegetarian and gluten-free friendly, great coffee and huge portions. The place was pretty packed at 10 on a Monday which says a lot. It's got a sunny hipster vibe and friendly service. Skip the hotel buffet and eat here with the locals. Free street parking.   The dishes are Latin inspired comfort food, packed with flavor. They made the Arepas Benedict vegetarian for me on request, subbing in loads of sauteed vegetables for the meat. They were so filling, I didn't need to eat lunch that day. The added avocado was actually overkill, as the eggs and Hollandaise sauce were already so rich.  The home fries were crispy and perfect, I couldn't stop eating them, but goodness, it was so much food.   It would be nice if they added a vegan option or two, hence only four stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepas Benedict made vegetarian- amazing!

poIzcxTfznkoAoL9wgn08g.text: SO happy I came across this cafe!!So lovely and delicious! I'm here in las vegas for a work conference and I stumbled across this cafe and tried their matcha bulletproof tea! And tried their vanilla latte! B ok mb.com. Jesse and Evelyn were super nice and quick to help me. They had great attitudes and smiling faces. I will visit this place again when I'm in las vegas. Very pleasant experience. Right next door to hop nuts brewery and dog friendly too! Had to visit! I hope to return for their food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3OmZE2nRow3pPsu6r9efYA.text: My first six months in Vegas I was at Makers and Finders so often. It felt like a slice of home (California). The Nutella latte is the bomb! Brunch service is efficient and of very high quality. It is s place to be seen as it's in the hip, fast developing Art District. So, come prepared with shades and a jacket collar popped for the scene.

6RKJrZbc0N72uZgwHmHfDg.text: Came in to kill time before an appointment close by & was surprised to see this among rows of antique shops. Located somewhat in the Arts District, this restaurant is a gem. Rare to find a place that serves coffee & tea AND beers & cocktails as well. They have a full bar and the dining area is decent. They also have a community table.   Interior is a mix of modern & retro. I especially love the bench seating along the wall. Nicely designed space. We didn't have enough time to have a full meal, so we ordered some small plates... the sauteed brussel sprouts (in lime juice with parmesan & pecan - this tasted like it was sauteed in butter, so good), the crispy fries (topped with crispy kale & side of their pink sauce AKA thousand island dressing). I have my eyes on their Latin comfort food menu like the lomo saltado & their empanadas for next time. Also, plantain chips... I'm coming back for you.   Service was okay. Food was decent and came in a timely manner. Definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XAOzW078QYSJZl-PP62WTA.text: Best gourmet coffees! I've had the lavender latte, salted caramel and the coconut tumeric latte. All absolutely delicious.   My favorite breakfast is the Arepy Benny, the egg is pouched and it's on an arepa that's gluten-free. The egg is perfection.   Ok, and then I came for dinner, sat outside, watched  downtown life go by. And sipped on a Bees knees. Oh yes, life is good.  Then I got hungry and shared the lemon chicken with mashed yuca with El Jefe. We loved it. It came with asparagus and a chimichuri drizzle for chizzle.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bees knees

42sI3SDxianVRVpnuR9JCQ.text: We were visiting LV and decided to get some evening coffee. It's a dine in coffee shop which I find pretty strange. We were given a seat by the 'host' and we sat down.  We ordered 2 Bon Bon's which is a chocolate espresso with steamed milk and a condensed milk base. After about 15 minutes or so (quite a long wait for just two coffees) they arrived and they were fairly underwhelming.  The coffee it's self was bitter but stirring the coffee with the condensed milk made it way too sweet. I tried to find a good middle ground and failed. I just don't think this particular beverage was to my taste.  We were handed the check and the waitress took a long time to come and collect it so we just decided to take it to her and leave.   Overall, the general experience isn't what I'm looking for when I just want a coffee. If that's your thing, go wild.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bon Bon.

MQcXykq8rqaUDyUeq-Sa0g.text: I stumbled on this spot while looking for a place to get some work done and avoid another damn Starbucks. It can be a little odd walking in because they offer to seat you, like at a restaurant. But there is a "bar" where you can sit, order just a coffee and get some work done.   I sat at the bar and ordered a wonderful Americano. I worked for a bit and decided I was hungry. Ordered the empanada lunch bowl. This is where the rating dropped.   The spicy mushroom was tasty, but greasy. I know it's deep fried, but it seemed overly greasy and almost unpleasant    The short rib was even worse, likely because of the fat from the meat.   The black beans had no flavor and the rice was uninspired.   I really wanted to like the place and the food, but it simply did not deliver. I would try it again in hopes that it was an off day, but I can't say I'd recommend it based on what I had.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eppnZH-99VSPv6YAG4F3LA.text: Been wanting to check this spot out. Looks super cute every time I would pass by. I finally had some time to try this place out. I ordered a latte and some chilaquiles. I love chilaquiles, I saw they had them on the menu. The food was good, the only thing was that I was expecting for the egg to be the same as how the picture was displayed even by looking at other yelp reviews and photos, but I wasn't either so I figured the egg would already come out that way. Also my food came out before my latte came out so that was kinda disappointing too. Food was great, just wish they had some hot sauce options to put on top, and on every other photo I've seen, the chilaquiles had a sunny side up egg on top and mine didn't.

kQ-LtleThTSPsArbRKmgww.text: If I could give more stars I would, this is one of my favorite breakfast spots in Vegas!  The coffee alone makes this spot worth the visit. I would consider myself a coffee-aholic and everything I have tried from the coffee bar here has been wonderful. That being said don't skip the food, you'll regret it. With a Latin inspired base this is one of my favorite breakfast or brunch menus in town. The empanadas are drool worth, I will never understand how they get them so crispy! The Latin Hash is another morning favorite of mine, it's excellent. They have enough options to provide variety, but not enough to overwhelm. The place is always clean, the decor is adorable, and the staff has been excellent on ever visit. I have always been seated quickly even when it's busy and I have never be disappointed with any of my orders. I highly recommend stopping by if you have the chance.

jMCCiTwA-vZulCVdIeF2ZA.text: I previously wrote a review for this place as an omni...now I'm vegan, and I still absolutely love this place!  They have lengthened their hours and now include more plant based friendly dishes! My favorites are the iced lavender latte, iced chai latte (both with almond milk), vegan empanada bowl, & the maduro vegan burger. Needless to say, I LOVE LOVE LOVE that they have a vegan menu. The service sometimes is a little off, but 90% of the time, it's great.  Whenever I have friends in town, I bring them here, and so far, it's always been a hit. I mean what's not to like about authentic Latin coffee mixed with some great Latin cuisine?!!

ohPCGvKlwnacOge3KHZdHg.text: One of our favorite places. If you want breakfast with flavor and great coffee, this is the perfect spot. We love not just the food, but the employees & the ambiance. The Arepa Benny and the Bon Bon latte are my favorite.

WGNSJsvtvgn4Vq-ASpDlzQ.text: This was my second visit to M&F. I like this place. I like the location. I like the food and the coffee. So why the 4 stars? Service. Slow. As. F*ck. Don't get me wrong, personable, friendly, but SLOW. And on a Saturday there should be a sense of urgency with the wait staff. Like I said, I like this place, I work downtown so I'll be back. But work on the service.

vA-tHhcxqQ2Ar80BCjdLbQ.text: I was looking for a great breakfast place close to downtown Las Vegas, and this cafe was recommended here on Yelp.  I took my mom and her friend on a Saturday morning after a nice outdoor yoga class at Symphony Park.    For it being a busy Saturday morning, our wait was minimal, which was a pleasant surprise since we planned for a little of a wait.  They also have a great front patio area with heaters to wait on.   The hostess was sweet and friendly, but our waitress was curt and didn't pay much attention to our table.  The food and coffee were amazing.  I had the chorizo omelette and my mom had the avocado toast.   My omelette was not overly spicy, but just the right amount of flavor and taste.    On street parking is close and convenient, but there wasn't a lot of it to come by, so that could be a challenge.

-tnQqt0JcRMS53qEQ-ROtA.text: I'm not necessarily a breakfast person unless I am super hungover or have friends in town but hands down this place is 10/10 Lockwood restaurant rating. For this is the best breakfast spot in the city. I've only ventured to the location downtown, but I absolutely love the place. Josh and the Makers & Finders team keep outdoing themselves. I would only hope in the future they build something in Chinatown because downtown gets a little grimy =)

DGCXPXkkHdzS-rJ4tGp_xA.text: Fun little spot for getting coffee and breakfast. The servers were super friendly and the cold brew was really good. I'd recommend this if you want great coffee and a light breakfast.

qSqVmlUkBq8ZpMSsxjQvag.text: Omg this is the best place ever! Coming from Chicago this reminds me of Hot Chocolate with their amazing hand made coffees and other drinks! Their food is amazing , any of the Benny's along with their chia pudding

jhKDxUL_HVaAQ3-Tex8F4A.text: 2 stars for the good coffee and food. Bonbon was delicious.   Service was what everyone else was saying. Non existent at best. We waited maybe 30-40 minutes for eggs and a burger and the place was maybe half full.   The table next to us got their food and pretty much finished before they brought our coffee out! Server didn't even come around asking how the food was or how coffee was tasting.   Food was delicious and flavorful but I couldn't taste the smoked salmon under their that chipotle hollandaise sauce. What a bummer!   Hipster place  Good for your Instagram photos Good for your taste buds Bad for your time. Walked in at around 11 and left around 1. That's not how long it should take to eat a quick brunch!

409GAs13ywT0-oFGYz86lw.text: Dude this place is awesome!!  It's across the street from buffalo exchange and retro vegas.  Their chicken empanadas, arepa benny, crispy fries, coconut soup and hisbiscus tea are to die for!!!!! I also love their coffee selection. They offer this really cool one (forgot the name) with condensed milk! Everything is made super fresh and to order.  Such a cool concept, Latin and a coffee bar! Everything is reasonably priced, it's always busy but people eat quickly so you're not standing around forever. Johnny is the best server! Is he always attentive, accurate, and gives the most immaculate service ever. This is probably one of my favorite coffee/restaurant combo! Thanks guys for keeping my tummy full and my wallet happy!

7-BFn1YMVyD6e4eo-GF4tw.text: I don't care about, nor do I really comment on food prices/value - BUT... in Vegas, it matters.  For some reason, photos of the dishes here are deceiving (even pics of my order!). The prices do not fit the small portions. My lavender latte was FANTASTIC, but it was lukewarm, immediately after they handed it to me...LUKEWARM!!!!!!(almost cool!) The food is flavorful! But breakfast is not complicated, so no extra stars for that. The word "coffee" is in the establishment's name...how do you serve it lukewarm????? Some people may ask, "Why not just let them know it's lukewarm so they can correct it?". My answer is... "I paid you for something that you claim is worth the price. So you are giving me your best already. If you didn't give me your best - what did I pay for? I should be paid to give you a second chance, because now... I'm training you!" This is a business transaction, not an attempt at a friendship.  Now I have to go and get some hot coffee and a meal somewhere....

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Lavender Latte was full of flavor, but it was not hot - at all. Portions were rather small.

90wrt8wGL_zlSbGVu9JD4Q.text: I can't wait to come back here!  I had the lavender latte and the sofritos burger. Both were delicious, the atmosphere (and playlist) was great, and the baristas were so friendly.

TPIyKB9xmmXEFpRicrcQ6g.text: I was desperate for a good coffee when I visited Vegas.  It's just really hard to find.  So I trekked 3 miles to M&F. It was well worth the trip. House Mocha was excellent. I rarely have two mochas in one day, but had to order a second because the first was so good.  Ask for Diana. She took good care of me.

B5yDU0Wl43mAHvJFAeNTlA.text: Trendy Latin hangout. The food is delicious and is suitable for families. It's a great place for taking insta-worthy pictures. The waiter was very nice to me and adjusted my coffee as pleased.

2BQrHKDLNqUpUBuPBOvDeA.text: Sort of an odd place, because while it looks like a coffeeshop, it functions more like a restaurant--there's a sign asking for people to wait to be seated, for example. And the food menu is before the coffee menu. I had a breakfast there with a veggie scramble, which was solid, definitely above average. The coffee was solid too. Service is friendly, a little slow though.

hpgZ7RHNh4XlZDPMciMdsg.text: Omg the best chai latte I've ever had. I tried it hot and it definitely marked a great impression!

QGUoeQexXm9J1yObNqea0Q.text: Wonderful place all around! We had a group of twelve early in the morning before doing a photo walk and they accommodated us all with a smile We even had the bill split up individually and our waitress never flinched...it's tough to find service like this anywhere! I had a breakfast croissant that was simple and fantastic. Fried egg, bacon and cheese to go with a superb cup of their house dark roast. My friend had a salmon eggs Benedict with chipotle hollandaise that really surprised me, the whole thing was good but the sauce was amazing...I will be having that the next time. Great ambience and a cool location on Main St right downtown in the art district. They have an outdoor seating area that is half tables and have lounge with comfy couches to enjoy some good coffee and people watch all the vintage stores surrounding it. Definitely try this place and support a solid local business!

NmZ5vJexHO4qthpkQpCKww.text: The Arepa Benny and Lavendar Latte were really good.

x7_wHLBE-IAwNl7EH0EyAQ.text: Delicious food, had bulletproof coffee and breakfast burger. It was very good. We brought our puppy and sat outside. Very nice restaurant. We are coming back next time in Vegas

fGhwf8NqWd588HawOiMZBw.text: Makers & Finders is pretty much ideal when it comes to coffee shops: good selection of fancy, pour-over coffees and actually delicious tea drinks, too (side note: why does any shop NOT have matcha??). Great hip location downtown, next to a brewery. Cool patio. Good food, ranging from pastries to 'latin comfort food.' (other side note: I like anything latin), and including greek yogurt with granola. I've enjoyed taking my out of town family here for breakfast, meeting my run club for post-run drinks, and just hanging out with my green-tea loving daughters. Only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because the prices are a li'l high.

bibzXGqC-Fs5gr7OXbYScQ.text: So, me, my sisters and my cousin who lives in Vegas wanted to go cafe hunting. This was found by my cousin in Instagram and some decided to come here for lunch after a thrilling ride in Stratosphere.   The location is in downtown Las Vegas but in Arts District. Not a lot of people know where Arts District is because Las Vegas is still in the process of developing the area. Parking is difficult for only you could park along the street. It was a Saturday, so it was kind of expected that it will be a busy day for Vegas but I didn't expect that there's no parking lot nor structure.  Nevertheless, everything became so pleasant. As soon as I entered, I fell in love with its "urban-artsy" ambience. Coming here with only few customers on a Saturday, kind of gave me some itsy feeling to eat here. But oh boy, their food and drinks are AMAZING!!!!! I ordered Grilled Chicken Arepas and I was speechless how flavorful and delicious it was. My company ordered egg benedicts and Chicken Tinga empanadas and they were bomb!!   For drinks, I got their latte. The temperature was just right and with a little sweetness...thanks to the caramel drizzle on top. The froth is inadequate but not bad. My company ordered matcha latte and salted caramel latte and they are the best!!   For dessert, I fell in love with Espresso flan. It's a slice of flan poured with a shot of espresso, topped with whipped cream and strawberries. I wish I could've saved more space for dessert because I would've tried more for sure!!  Service is so fast. Food and drinks were served right away. Our server (forgot his name sorry, I'll do better next time) was very knowledgable and helpful. There are also artworks displayed and being sold. The place is so cute and I couldn't stop taking pictures! I just love how low-key this place is but has better food and service compared to a lot of overrated restaurants in the Strip. I'm so glad I found this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latin egg benedict
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken Arepa
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries... No need for description

ekTWx0Pm9ayQR0qBl1zGAg.text: Really awesome place with a great soundtrack, amazingly diverse menu. Parking is easy and the service is attentive. Vegas needs more places like this.   I had an iced coffee and the La Paisa arepa, definitely tasty filling food. Portions are small and the prices are higher than average (think $6 lavender lattes, and $12 chorizo Brussels sprouts) but it definitely is a unique, modern cafe which are definitely missing in vegas.

17WgeBZFXzzc-gg95xkbcQ.text: This place is pretty hipster. I had the lavender latte with almond milk, and Benedict (I forgot which one). But the food and coffee was excellent! I took off one star since no one really checked in on us, but that was fine. The latte was wonderful. My fiance had the iced matcha with almond milk. It was somewhat bland, cause we thought they would mix in some sugar, but nope! I enjoyed this experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KFsLzmgwynffrd0rPrzxPw.text: For a first time visitor, the service was amazing; everyone was very nice. When I first walked in the door, I was greeted by the barista who asked me if I was expecting anyone else (I walked in alone). He gave me a menu and told me to take a seat and my waiter would help me out. The waiter was very friendly as well, asking me if I was expecting anyone and whether or not it was my first time there, helping me with suggestions on what's popular and what he liked.  I got an iced Nutella Latte and Arepa Benny. Both were delicious! The latte wasn't too sweet and was almost like a chocolate milk with some crushed ice. The Arepa Benny was delicious and I'd definitely have it again. The biscuit(?) it came on was a bit crunchy. The the beef was very well seasoned and flavored. The egg yolk was runny and delicious as well; perfect for being scooped up with the plantain chips.  Price is decent: around $5 for my latte and $10 for my eggs benedict.  Overall, good service, good food, and decent price. Good atmosphere for studying as well! Definitely recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella latte and Arepa Benny!

4O0d7twkyAYliNR3j13Enw.text: I been waiting for table for over 20mins when they said it would be 10 and then they gave my table to other white couple first. This is terrible service and I will never step my foot back here again and be treated without any respect.

FnuQkTsTw2TZ2FOO94btbw.text: Yep,  this is the real deal.  Cool vibe plenty of space, great tunes,  outstanding food.   And the coffee is amazing.   I'm a huge fan.  This is NOT Starbucks.   This is craft coffee at its best.   Don't be in a hurry here.   And a huge shout-out to Ed for making my first trip to M&F fantastic!

3eHdbxEdeab1Kg71Kg2qDQ.text: We stumbled on this coffee shop by chance while looking for a nice breakfast outside of the Vegas strip chaos. This place was perfect. They have a very inventive menu of coffee and tea drinks - I had a coconut turmeric latte. The food was spectacular as well. This seems to be a local favorite. We will be back!

wyq12A_oDHYe189kLN_baw.text: Excellent service & the coffee is the best I've had in Vegas.  I had the steak arepa & it was amazing... Very flavorful and perfect portion.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak arepa  very yummy!!

mluuoyLYq_sP1TdUYuCYQw.text: Ordered the areba benne and loved it. Accompanied with a cold drip coffee, chill ambiance, and low prices. Check it out!

IJVvS0FW4l8j27sZWGZlLQ.text: Awesome coffee hang out great cortadito so smooth if you love expresso. And the yucca mash is to die for, if you love yucca with garlic. Like mundungo yummy.

First off the atmosphere was really cool and relaxing, the staff was really nice also. I ordered the Latin hash and a cup of the vanilla latte and it was absolutely the best cup of coffee I had in awhile! The Latin hash was also good a lot of flavor but the coffee was hands down the best! I will definitely be back!

kFPIFkzzvBXsKCuPITyB2Q.text: Love this place. Free wifi and a great work area for laptops. I had the Brussels and Bacon. It was delicious. I had black coffee and it was great. Staff if friendly. Space is clean, open and comfortable. I will be back for sure.

0e4r6UxJmDKYBPuRJeD8Gg.text: Last time I came the service was downright RUDE. I always mind my Ps and Qs and tip 20% or more. What gives? Used to be friendly. Food quality has gone way down too. Over this place.

9AR_Bb3ITGvn0LyAa0Vpug.text: I had heard of this place by my friends and it did not disappoint. I went in and had a salted caramel latte made by a female barista, I believe her name was Maria, and it was amazing it woke me up and it hit the spot. I also had an arepa Benny and the flavors were delicious the service was really great I had gone in on the weekend and you can tell it was busy but she kept checking up on us and coming up to us to see if we were ok. Our server who had blue hair was very friendly and made us feel welcome. I recommend this place to everyone who I talk to.

iFq5G5jpVdat8rT-OpB0Sw.text: Loved this place. Super cute, good service. Different food to choose from and great drinks and coffee. Highly recommend

LezLANH34MVbQXUONPAGXA.text: Fantastic find in the art district of Las Vegas ! Good quality , well priced and excellent service .

UPF-LLjzTOTh9TxmLibkSw.text: Urban coffee shop DTLV at the arts district. Good Latin food and friendly service. Can't wait til' they opens up for their regular hours.     The place looks amazing there's patio seating, and a lounge area inside.  Try the honey vanilla latte and AREPAS (see pictures).

F-J-k3-3jzxxXWU7Prwl9Q.text: For the past few months I've passed by here on the way ho.e from work. Finally made it over...and LOVED IT! Hubby and I shared a benedict and LOVED the Lavender Latte,  not to mention the atmosphere. Looking forward to trying the beverage iced. Barista Shawn was very helpful and friendly. Truly a great find!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender Latte...Yum!

HcIpHnYk5t9S9SKL0fPBaQ.text: Amazing coffee and food! These people take their coffee seriously but have maintained a chill vibe as well! The kale, chorizo, Parmesan and mushroom omelette was fantastic! The sauce on the bagel sandwich added a twist to a standard egg sandwich!

TLsNTsvOiXOztYINVsz0AA.text: The waitstaff seemed stressed out that I was a solo diner that would be taking up a table instead of sitting at the bar.  This is super annoying because I dine out by myself pretty regularly due to business travel and I tend to spend quite a bit of money to make up for the fact that it is just me.  But to get that sense of frustration is ultimately annoying.  I was very interested in their lavender latte.  I don't generally like the smell in bath or home products but I've found I really enjoy it in food.  While the latte had a nice lavender flavor, the milk was a bit overpowering and i ended up feeling like i was sipping milk that was gently flavored with coffee and lavender.  In that sense, I would say it was "okay".  The food, however was very very good.  Not listed on the menu, but you can ask after pastries.  I had a chocolate croissant that was soft and delicious.  They did not warm it up and didn't offer to so I ate it cold but it would have been nice warm.  (to be fair i could have asked for them to warm it up).  I had a second drink just to try another menu offering and it was the same overpowering milk flavor.  I'm not sure if it's the coffee beans they use or that they need to add another shot or what.  I would still return and encourage others to try it out - it just wasn't a "wow" experience.

YaCnHXunLx_D0qR3J4QlSg.text: I live downtown and wish I could support this place.  The coffee was good.  They charged me per each cup of regular drip coffee.  No coffee shop on the planet does that for standard drip, so that's just insulting.  The coffee was good, but nothing special.  The server recommended a berry pastry.  It tasted like it was bought from the grocery store.  It was cold, rubbery, and nothing special.  The service was okay.  We asked if we could sit outside and the barista said yes they'll send someone out to take the order.  It took about 15 min.  The furniture was cheap and not very comfy like a good coffee shop.  As far as I could tell, no WiFi either.  Missing all the elements of a good coffee shop.

lp1-GuvcCwPu8hFhv8ZKDQ.text: First time in! Coffee was yummy.. Atmosphere, inviting. I'll be back for some food! Menu looked really good

iezRFDLXnBPv_sCQUSmpfw.text: The aesthetics of this place are amazing . Perfect for people who like to photograph there food and sh** like that. Buttttt if you're here to Find delicious Mexican breakfast, you are way better off going to the casa Don Juan next door. I ordered the Lomo Saltado, with a Matcha Latte. I had so many hopes for it to be delicious, but it tasted like NOTHING HAD SALT. idk if it's because they were trying to be healthy or something, but it didn't impress me at all. The matcha also had a very chalky taste to it. But the presentation was beautiful. The waitress also looked like she needed an extra hand when it was really busy. Like you can ask for her a check and she would just get pissed off. But I don't blame her, I hated working for food service too. Anyways, super cool looking but wouldn't come here again (:

1MbJ-u8UbwvwLobwnawTtQ.text: Benny's were great! Coffee was alright. Check out the cool graffitti on nearby buildings. Made me feel at home

FeCA9QJ3j6eHoYffvEAj9A.text: Great vibes and delicious food. Tried the salted caramel and Mexican spice latte... Great flavors!!   Being a first timer I had to try the chorizo and Brussels sprouts and was not disappointed everything was perfectly seasoned with quality ingredients.  You can't leave without trying the Elvis press. Nutella, bacon and strawberries pressed in a soft croissant- I was full from my entree but I definitely made room for this!!   Attentive service and great food, will not be my last time at Makers!

G7jvpLNFa0u6FdYhMnKFnA.text: Stopped by for a bite for breakfast and some coffee. Wasn't expecting to be blown away, but was. The coffee quality is terrific. The latte is equally impressive. The arepa is solid. So far everything I've had here is good. Great find and recommended!

j3J2koj_v0OUTXOtONkYkw.text: I really want to give this place 4 stars but the service lacks which keeps it at a 3. Love the small eclectic food menu and of course all the coffee options which is what brings me in. If the servers could be a bit more attentive I may be inclined to increase my rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Current menu options.

NKyKfBS0J4De5dI3-JN8Hw.text: Hidden gem in The Vegas Arts District. When we drive in from L.A., we have to stop for their Lavender infused latte, honey vanilla latte and yummy empanadas. This hip and happening place is amazing and will not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. To go lavender infused latte better than no latte :9
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Line &#39;me up for the drip!!

X696eUF9K2DE79pDDiWlUw.text: I love this place! Super cute. Not in the best part of town. Great service. Of course the coffee is absolutely amazing. I was really impressed with the food. Laptop friendly. Child friendly. Even dog friendly!
