Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lGKMwl9el479Wbb8U1J04A.text: This little cafe is nestled in the art district of LV and is definitely not somewhere I would normally find myself, but due to the recommendation of our uber driver my fiance & I decided to check it out......best decision.  This place had amazing food!  I ordered the croissant sandwich & he had the chilaquiles, which we still talk about.  We didn't order any of the specialty coffees or teas, just the basic pressed brew but it was still delicious......This was hands down one of our favorite places of our week long trip to LV.

cmN9AMYLUEi6OWhgt08NHg.text: Great service , great food, most important great attitude !! I don't know anything about coffee and I got a full lesson with out making me feel stupid lol !! It always great to see local people going into business I'm very proud of these guys !! Keep up the good work !!    Cheers to your future success !!

eCWmC6pCIB2IBwpphRZAvA.text: Such a hidden gem with amazing coffee and lots of great food options! On our way through Vegas and so glad we decided to make the stop.

-MZTONGbJBXYwF2aiNd55w.text: M&F is wonderful, their food and coffee is awesome. Must try their Lavender Latte, it taste really good

TJFeZu2u6aBFEI68OEpvnw.text: EXCELLENT place for breakfast!  Hip vibe in    a cool kinda industrial setting.  Incredible coffee.  And breakfast selections (and lunch too) were Latino - lots of arepas on the menu. I had the Arepas Benny (eggs Benedict) and the Mrs had arepas with mango and avocado.  Both really good. Great job, Makers!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yC5qxQljTl9M5YiKGj-t-g.text: In a word, uneven.   Service was weak and forgettable. Food was delivered Luke warm and the coffee was delivered at least 10 minutes after the food. We asked for hot sauce and never got it. We wanted desert but couldn't get waiters attention. Took a long time to get a check and pay.  Food was just mediocre. We ordered lox and bagel. Arepa Benny, and croissant sandwhich. The benny did not match the description on the menu "salsa verde hollandaise?" No salsa verde anywhere. Very basic. Grilled tomatoes?  Nada. Bagel was ok but simple. Coffee was good but nothing special.  Our bill for 4 was $70 and we left hungry.

PshKKbXFKnBbl3S3I5fgVg.text: Love this place!   It was easy to find since it wasn't too far from the busy cross streets of Main St. and Charleston. We were lucky to find a parking close to the location which was right outside of the restaurant. They don't have an actual parking lot in front of the location like you normally see here in Vegas. It was more of a location that was on the street and you would have to find "meter parking" if that makes any sense. They might have a parking lot behind or in a different location, you might just have to walk a little.   The restaurant was very clean and down to earth. Very simplistic and not beyond crazy with decorations. We were greeted the moment we walked in and we pretty much sat ourselves to the closest table available.   I tried the La Paisa dish and it was delicious! As soon as I read the description of what the dish consisted of, I was sold. The plantains chips that it came with was amazing! I mean the whole thing was just amazing!  I also tried the Lavender Tea Latte.. No words can express how wonderful this cup of tea was. I read the reviews before checking this place out and quite a few people recommended it so I just had to try it. I'm glad I got it because now whenever I come back again, that will be my go-to tea I'll be getting there forever and ever. Okay, maybe not forever but for awhile.

WoyFYL0OrCsGEyAKN5uLsA.text: Loved the ambience and design of this spot. The coffee was pretty good - not AMAZING, but still good (maybe a bit overpriced). The staff were lovely, although we had to wait a very long time for our food, and then when it arrived it was sort of cold. It looked delicious and I liked the menu, in the end the food was not very flavorful. Would have hoped to get my second coffee on the house since we waited over 45 minutes for the food.

dOux_Xa0m947RgjT8O6L0Q.text: I'm fairly new to the area and a work contact asked to meet here on a Monday morning. It's in a very non-descript location in between some Mexican restaurants and mattress stores. Oh and it's next door to a Brewing co. so that's cool.   I was pleasantly surprised at the pleasant, polished atmosphere as I walked in. Well dressed people were sipping coffee and eating at tables in the all white, chic decor and plopped at the bar reading newspapers and chatting.   I was also surprised that I had the option to sit at a table, given a menu and had full service for a coffee date. They even had food too, had I wanted breakfast. (need to try the food next time).   I didn't know what to order, but the server was helpful, friendly and suggested the Cortadito. I said "sure why not". Oh, man was it amazing. It was tiny like an espresso drink and served in a mini-mason jar with a pretty heart drawn into the foamy top. I started sipping slowly and while a little bitter at first, it finished smooth and sweet. By the end of the drink, I realized this was probably the  best coffee I've ever had. Needless to say I live in Henderson but have gone out of my way to stop by and try other things. The next time I tried the honey & vanilla latte after asking for a drink that wasn't super sweet. The staff is so courteous, professional and polite!   Seriously, just do yourself a favor and go. Treat yourself.

l2HlB2a7sffQ0H6LwyIDlA.text: Found this place on our road trip to Utah! Awesome find! I had the chipotle chicken sandwich and my husband had the turkey avocado sandwich. The French bread is perfectly grilled and both sandwiches were delicious. The chicken is perfectly shredded with the perfect amount of spice and lettuce. The sandwiches are a perfect size. And the coffee is delicious. This place is a must stop.

FiXGhBRDmqZsL7M9wzLswQ.text: Delicious ,delectable, superb is the best way to sum up this place .  Came here for my birthday, & had a great relaxing time. Cool atmosphere, located in the art district of downtown.. from the numerous reviews saying there's trouble finding parking, wasn't exactly True, found parking right around the building. Cute patio outside to sit out , when the weather is duable. Was greeted by a gorgeous worker, who was super friendly, always making sure we were pleased. I would recommend going early, like ( right when they open ) you can sit on the counter, which seems to be the most popular place to sit. Ordered the long awaited Lavender infused latte, with Arepa Benny.. Let me tell you something, it was amazing .. No, I don't even know if that's how you could describe it... how about .. made with love. The cilantro with the hollandaise just transported me to another dimension. Its a must try. Also a little note: the gentlemen waiters here are as yummy as the food.  Also my mom ordered the salted caramel iced latte, and that is A LIFE CHANGER ! As for the atmosphere, I do wish it had a little more funky, neat art inside.. but that's just my request. I am 110 % sure I will be coming back, they also have comfy couches, plenty of seating. Plus , a couple more outlets please. Thank you Makers & Finders for adding another well awaited dimension to my life.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from seating
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepa Benny , fresh and a life changer
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inlove w/ Lavender Latte

XBUKbKfLgbOXFwRexQ_R2w.text: I spent most of my time in LA studying at different cafes.   I've been missing LA a lot lately. I knew that if I could find the right cafe, I wouldn't miss it as much.   Welp, I think I finally found just the place! Love the layout and size. It was small, but everything was well spaced throughout the restaurant. There's a good amount of outdoor seating on the patio. Inside, there's a counter, seating area, and a couch tucked away in the corner. Different settings for different purposes!   My sister got the lavender latte, and I got the honey vanilla latte. The espresso was roasted perfectly and the flavors came through really well in the latte! The honey vanilla basically tasted like horchata with coffee. Service was also pretty friendly.   If you're into cafe hopping or just a solid cup of coffee, Makers & Finders is worth checking out. Definitely plan to revisit to brunch soon!

qA4s0O4NzvjN_7X-lspm1w.text: Such a great little find.  Love their coffees/Lattes: Lavender, Lemon, honey, shall I go on! Very unique tastes.  Baristas have always been helpful.  Atmosphere is fun and inviting, even the outside patio!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Doesn&#39;t it look inviting?!

e8EJAKN8R0JapqRk0fMkhg.text: Stop reading and just go order M&Fs delicious coffee and food.  I come here about ever other week and can't get enough.  M&F thank you for delivering a great cafe!  See ya next weekend.

lFA9_6iD7KKQa2kmOKIr2A.text: I was disappointed with Makers & Finders Coffee for many reasons. First off, after spending an extra 16 minutes driving across Las Vegas to this supposedly great coffee establishment, I find 1. A rather frosty reception from the maitre d'. Makers & Finders is more a  restaurant than a traditional cafe. As I intended to take the coffee to go, I had to give my order to the unfriendly maitre d' (you can't even really step into the "cafe" if you are not getting food)  2. The coffee was expensive ($5 for a Cortado and $5 for the larger cold brew). I am willing to pay for coffee because I enjoy a good cup of coffee. But it was really not that great. I had Cortado that was tastier and, even in San Francisco, cost only $3.50. If you are already in the area, yes, perhaps try this place out. But if you are a visitor (like me) who is in town and craving a fantastic cup of coffee, don't bother going across town just to make it to Makers & Finders. It is not worth it.

arYjApEOeV2kUI1VyG4ixg.text: My go to place - breakfast, lunch or dinner - when I am visiting Vegas. The food is mostly good, coffee is great and staff is nice. One time when the meat in our dish was overcooked, they replaced the dish and gave us a free dessert.

-hI_bmOLyIWBJqpA30LQmA.text: First impressions speak volumes...Everyone's spot on with the lack of service and the uber hipsterness of this place. We were left waiting too long to even get a menu (while the staff all stood behind the counter chit-chattin') so I didn't even get to try the 'overpriced lackluster food' & 'lukewarm coffee' (as others have mentioned) - I didn't even make it that far.  Maybe if it can get over itself for just a minute the restaurant might be worth a try...it's really unfortunate that being cool is much more important than providing proper service.

-nytobrP3NxlkBRtLBvKJA.text: Good matcha. Service is super friendly. Atmosphere is music rock trendy. Lots of colors and they are brewing something in the back!  The space is huge both inside and outside.  You can eat here or just chill here. They have a bar and sofa area.

q6CnIgWJjD3v1phW5sU8Og.text: If you are going to order delivery go directly to Makers and Finders' website and not through the yelp delivery option. I tried to order delivery through yelp and after clicking on the items I wanted to order it automatically changed the order to pick up. I went through this huge hassle, by fault of grubhub not the restaurant, before I could get a refund. At least an hour on the phone with grubhub. However the food was very good. I loved the arepa benny. They don't short you on the meat. Huge amounts of beef on it. I was full half way though the meal. I also got the empanada sampler and wasn't impressed. It was very greasy but the inside was packed with fillings.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ebjkiKCVu6hwvtVRXtJu1Q.text: I love that you can get brunch until 4. It's unrealistic to end breakfast foods anytime before that in Vegas.  My friend got the lavender coffee and the only adjective I can think of is "divine". She's a smarty pants so she asked for less sweet with simple syrup on the side.  Portions are perfect for one person and everything is so fresh. If you're with a big party, you'll be sitting for quite some time before receiving your food or beverage. Come not hungry and by the time you receive your meal you'll devour it.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tDp5amV02WNRG97LhOCv2g.text: Makers & Finders Coffee is the place that offers you the heaven coffee taste. It has the vibrant atmosphere with the upbeat environment of coffee crafting. Visiting this place once in a lifetime is a must thing to do. It has the flood of inspired Latin food services.   The setting of the hotel is worth unique and brightly lit with. Positive affirmations throughout are giving out the lively atmosphere that attracts a large fan base.   In its main menu, you can order daily specials, coffee plus tea, breakfast, lunch, dinner, and beer or wine and cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gNljZ3nKZYqDeEPfNp38mA.text: Stranger to Las Vegas. Here for two days on business. Totally wigged out by the freaky trippy soma laced non-reality of the strip. In urgent need of a competent pourover to restore my equilibrium. On a whim (thanks Yelp!) take a 20 minute Uber ride to an actual, humans live here and have actual real lives neighborhood. Am rewarded with coffee of many stripes (had both a pourover and a latte) and sweet cheap and cheerful homey latino influenced brekky. The goods are across the board more than good, they are excellent. The best part is that's it's welcoming, non-pretentious, and no pun intended, grounding.   My equilibrium restored, the only remaining challenge is how to not give in to the urge to order another coffee and just skip out on the rest of the conference that brought me here.  Thanks Makers and Finders. See you in November when I am back in town :-)

C3aTaJ4xP-0GdsfZtIaBaw.text: Good vibes.  Amazing food and really nice staff.  Defs the perfect place to have breakfast after a big night in Vegas.

FWGnPCe4o73EnQbgXrWt7Q.text: "Coffee for pups ... why not ?!"  Yelped this hipster coffee bar located in downtown Las Vegas. Perfect for locals and tourists who want a more low key/local spot to enjoy away from the strip!  The place makes their own syrups and have an amazing lavender latte... swear it's the second best I've tasted ever (next to steel town cafe located in Pittsburg, ca)  Other highlights:  - puppocino- $3 drink for dogs (basically whipped cream) - Happy hour (4-6pm) and $7 breakfast special before 7am - A pretty cool cocktail menu for a coffee spot - Latin influenced meals  - Outdoor seating/patio with couches  - animal friendly  - Friendly crowd (a lot of Californian transplants of course)   Note: - I'm pretty tiny so their serving size for the Latin hash was perfect for me (must add hot sauce!), but if you want a more hearty meal for $11 - you might wanna look elsewhere!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good / fave #2.. bacon croissant with egg and crispy plantains .. so good !
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La paisa arepa ... the Benny ... substitute homemade corn bread (bottom) for traditional muffin ... the best!!!!!!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latin hash with hot sauce (needed a little. Ore seasoning and a larger portion size)  and a delicious lavender latte

098FgCmYL5oUCdarlr89ug.text: I'm not sure why I never left a review after my first visit here. This place is amazing. The atmosphere is cute and upbeat. One word to describe it, hipster! This area is around hipster shops!   Great service and great food! Calling all my vegetarian people out there to give this place a shot! It is a struggle looking for a place that has vegetarian food that is as tasty as this! You have to try the Arepa Benny Vegetarian style! I felt like i was eating real meat. LOL! Hopefully my body doesn't react bad to it! The Soyrizo Brussel Sprout was tasty as well! Seasoned with vinaigrette and so much more! My favorite drink is the Lavender Infused Latte! This drink is like crack.. Well for me at least. I used to come by before school and grab this drink to keep me going.   I'm also not quite sure why this place is $$ when it's pretty cheap and it's the typical price as every other place!

5o6BT980ca8MN4xafBEPiQ.text: One of the best restaurants I've been to in a while. I was promptly seated at the coffee/bar top with a friendly smile and greeted by the barista. I had an idea of what I wanted to try but I looked at the menu for a while because everything seemed so delicious. I had the arrepa benni because I was there for some morning munch downs and it was so delicious I can't wait to bring my so here. Paired with the black beans and two delicious Bloody Marys (so damn good. second one came with chicken skin. sorta similar to chicharron) I was definitely in a good mood. Classic English breakfast with a Latin flair and it was amazing. I am impressed by the vegan options, just another reason to come back and bring my gf here. Cant wait to be back.

SAiUT3BNzxuVFY5S6z6QMQ.text: I love the coffee here. I think it's outstanding and they have a simple menu, but has something for everyone. I loved their waffles and the fries. Overall it was yummy and the staff was friendly. I'd definitely check it out for a quick bite or drink.

JPtTFPPdMnzY5unWI690xg.text: Slow service. They are hovering your table every 3 mins to order but when you finally order takes 15 mins to get your coffee.

lp3g9HkmpkOZwPyhDyt8fA.text: I was only here to pick up coffee with my partner to go but while I was waiting for my order I looked over their breakfast and brunch menu. Looked pretty good I will have to check it out another day.  I have to say though my favorite latte in all of vegas is at this place. I'm not big on coffee honestly my partner is but man am I glad I ordered this.   Sea Salt Caramel Latte (4.5/5) I added extra caramel and salt  I really enjoyed this drink. I can't wait to go order my new favorite coffee drink :) Service was really friendly but a tad slow for how not busy it was. Those things can be worked on but not changing me coming back here because all the staff was attentive and seemed to be happy to be there!  Yelp check in reward (% off a Latte)

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted Caramel Latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shorty
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plantains with beans and salsas

BjVBD-ibxHshrQcDqqO4_w.text: Congrats on 3 years, I happened to be here when they were being recognized and celebrated for it.  Damn, have I been coming here for 3 years and only now writing a review?!  I'm just getting back from Seattle where coffee is around every corner but really good coffee shops in Las Vegas are a dime a dozen and there are few that offer food that matches the quality of their drinks.  I've been here numerous times now, to sit in/out, and take out and I've pretty much know exactly what I want now.  The Smoked Lox (salmon bagel), and a cooled off lavender infused latte.    I love salmon bagels and the one they have here I have to say is one of the best I have ever tasted.  And for your lavender latte, let it cool a little bit before you burn your tongue and can't taste any of the lavender.

bhVcNlO_NrUD9MvnaTykeA.text: I tried the bandeja paisa and it was good, the service excellent and the place perfect for an awesome breakfast with friends on a Sunday, be early since the place gets crowded fast ( We got there at 9am and by 9:30 half of the place was full). The coffee was really good but the cooking can improved in taste...please see this is from a personal point of view. I like bandejas with arepas, yuca and chorizo, but I also understand that every restaurant has different versions of the bandeja.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JWYPvz4BEjoMV6COfouvTA.text: Usually a fan of this restaurant, but now hesitate to return. Upon walking in, I was greeted at the door and requested to sit at the bar. The hostess never gave me a menu upon sitting down and I wasn't acknowledged by the barista staff until I purposely stared at them. I was finally able to get my order in. Durning my wait, a friend of the barista came in and was promptly made an espresso shot. The food (Latin Hash) came out before my coffee was even made. Three bites into my food, I discover a long strand of hair. Management was notified and was apologetic about the issue; the bill was subsequently taken care of. I believe there is a reasonable expectation that every guest be treated the same whether you are a new face, friend of an employee or usual guest. In regards to the food, mistakes happen, however it was just another hit to an already disappointing visit.

fDmMt9nZSbX5VbIgn_FDfw.text: The coffee and food are both great, but the service could be better. We've tried the house coffee, a couple of the lattes, and the cold brews. All wonderful. The empanadas are a great texture. I'd come back for the chicken tinga alone. The Latin hash and chillequiles are top notch.  The only problem I've had is that when we've been here it always feels understaffed. The staff that's there is always friendly and helpful, but it just never seems like there's enough of them. So water and coffee don't get refilled and everything takes longer  than it should.

vsCfZ2TsU1uUE5ZyhZTsAw.text: The arepas Benedict with salsa verde hollandaise and short ribs were amazing. Solid coffee as well!

boU7A4MDO-DoksI4X7u6NA.text: I went here with my friend for the first time and she was raving about the empanadas. I tried the beef, chicken, and shrimp one. The chicken one was by far the best. The shrimp one lacked flavor but the shrimp was cooked perfectly. Their empanadas aren't the traditional kind and I couldn't pinpoint what the... casing (or dough? the stuff that held the meat?) was but it absorbed a lot of oil and it did not hold in the meat well. They're made to be eaten immediately because they get soggy and gross really fast. But those weren't bad. The empanadas are $4.50 each so be weary of buying them individually.  I got a big plate which had pork belly (amazing), the tiniest ribeye ever (like a quarter of an inch thick and it was cooked well-done [eww]) with some nice tasting chimichurri, an egg, rice, beans, and plantains. It was around $18. I like being able to try everything and since the serving sizes were smaller I say it was pretty good. I wouldn't get it again though.  My friend and I tried 4 of their drinks. I got the matcha iced latte with coconut milk which was nice. Nothing to rave about. I enjoyed their hibiscus iced tea more which was really pretty. My friend got the white chocolate iced mocha latte (I think?) which wasn't too sweet, which was perfect. She also got the lavender fog at the end of the meal which was really good. It'd be perfect for a chilly morning.  The bathrooms were shared with the place next door. It was kinda gross in there. The soap dispenser was broken and there were plastic tampon pieces on the ground. People need to clean up after their own messes. You nasties. (Not the restaurant people, the people who leave bathrooms a mess!)  Sorry, I got a bit off track. The aesthetic of the place was very trendy and hipster. It was really cute. They have photos for sale in the hall on the way to the bathroom. I didn't catch the name of the artist, but they were really nice. The employees were really nice and laid-back, but not to the point where it was unprofessional.

UOBXeUnIOSrv4-91Zo3ukg.text: My go to spot before work! I honestly jump around from other spots, but makers and finders is always consistent. As far as good goes, I always try to order something different. And I have yet to be disappointed! Their plates are particular wonderful for the gluten intolerant! Lots of gluten free options! My go to cup of coffee is an almond milk latte. No sugar needed! That's how good the coffee is! One of the baristas mentioned they're learning to hand roast their own beans? Something along that line? Either way, their coffee is sourced locally! Which I'm a huge fan of local businesses and supporting them!!!   Food? Love the arepas. Avocado toast. Plantain chips... Brussels sprouts. Just had the chilaquiles today! Sooooo good!! With a tomatillo salsa  and beef!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Almond milk latte
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles with beef

DIVA4EeheLzoqyOIDNQv-w.text: Cool local spot.  Doggies are allowed in the court yard.  Friendly and professional staffs.  Most of all, great food.  It's towards more to heavy side, but, hey!, it's great!  Nicely crafted layered bonbon is my personal favorite.  Must try. 10/10

XJRdXwX36Sv7vOcNc0u1SQ.text: I've been coming here since they've opened and I have to say it is one of my favorite urban cafe/eateries that I have ever been too.  The atmosphere is industrial/urban with a cozy patio area for those days when the weather is just right.  The staff is uber friendly and attentive.  I've never had a bad experience.    The food is definitely unique and delicious on top of that.  I've tried to try new items but I find myself always going back to the arepa benny which is an egg Benedict on top of tinga and english muffin.  NEVER DISSAPOINTS!  the lattes, cappuccinos and coffees are equally as delicious and everyone has an amazing unique flavor.  I strongly recommend to anyone who is in the area to stop by..and even if you're not in the area, take the drive down.  It's worth it!

spbVcgJDocHB4pI2uQmJgg.text: Fantastic coffee and picturesque food!!!  The atmosphere and food makes it an amazing place to hang with friends! Would highly recommend the Tres Leches Waffles and Tacos sampler! Bonus is the brunch menu on Sundays that goes until 5pm!  The best part of the downtown location is that there are also plenty of places around to explore after you've had your fill of the delicious food.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Tres Leches Waffle

h2LWudHIKV-9r9boT_MIdg.text: For 09-07-2019: I just want to say a big thanks to staff that was working this day. I had my post wedding gathering here and the staff was quite patient and accomodating. We reserved a table for 12 people at 5 pm. Comments from my guest were:  - cool interior, especially the painting of the psychedelic goat -cocktails were delicious (caiprihini, sexy rum girl??) -happy hour empanadas, arepas, and sofrito burger, and trio tacos were yummy  And although most of us were full at the end of the night, someone ordered the esspresso flan..we all starred enviously at my roommate who quickly ate it in 4-5 bites.  Makers and Finders is one of the "off the Vegas strip" places you want to visit for a good bite.

pkqDnOGIR0ghes8vtLxQRQ.text: Did not know what to expect from this beautiful establishment but I'm completely happy to have came here!  I came here with My SO for a meet up with her Volleyball Club. I truly enjoyed myself and the food was delicious! I had the Cilantro Steak Salad Lunch!   I will be coming back here, thank you for the service!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cilantro Steak Salad Lunch

AtnnyCT5GuA66CCQ9Y6G3Q.text: This Arts District coffee shop is off the beaten path for those visiting the strip -- and totally worth the drive/Uber!   Decor: bright sunshiny coffee shop with an industrial flare with a cozy "here's where the locals hang" vibe.   I wish I'd taken a photo of the empanadas to encourage you to get an order to share, but this latte pic will have to do!! Here's my advice  -- don't skip the Arts District, don't spend your entire time on the Strip and please for the love of god go get some REALLY AMAZING coffee and some enpanadas at M&F!!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latte

rjk2ffWj2zSqp_3piNVG3A.text: I was going to write a pretty bad review about our experience at Makers & Finders, fortunately the manager did try to make up for our lackluster experience. In all honesty I'm hoping today was just a bad day for them.   My family and a few friends dined here for a late brunch this Sunday, we were a party of 7 plus two kids. The place was pretty packed, but that's to be expected on a Sunday. Finally after sitting down we ordered, everything was going fine until almost an hour went by and still no food! We actually noticed that no one else in the restaurant had received any food either.  Clearly  there was something going on in the kitchen. I get it stuff happens but when dining with kids we all know how hectic it can be, and the need to get food in a timely manner.   I would've appreciated if the waitress had come over and explained what was going on, and offered us something for the kids but that didn't happen. I had to flag her down and speak to a manager to finally get food on the table,  which took another 15 minutes! I find that ridiculous, I am a former server myself, so know how important hospitality is!  It's important  to explain  what's going on to guest, and at least asking if she could get us anything in the mean time.   The manager did apologize about the situation, and finally we were able to get some food  on the table, still only my daughters meal and our appetizer. The food was a bit of a disappointment to say the least.  My daughter's pancakes were burned,  my boyfriends eggs were runny,  the bacon was not fully cooked. My girlfriends meal was cold, and everyone's  food came out at different times. It was all one big mess. I myself, order the short rib hash, the potatoes were salty and it needed two eggs rather than one. Once again we had to complain!  We did come to find out that there was a new cook, so the kitchen was pretty backed up all day. I wish we knew before we sat down. The Manager took the pancakes, eggs, and bacon off the bill, which is to be expected.  It was nice of him to send over two complementary desserts, and a bottle of champagne, for those drinking. We all appreciated it so thanks!!  I hope in the future they get it together, service is so important, especially if you want returning customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Runny eggs! Not good!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Normal cooked eggs, they forgot the cheese so they added it after.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt pancakes for my daughter.

fstlxUpRs6ZHa1fsmmwk6g.text: I've enjoyed this place over the years, but in the last few months I've been under impressed with the quality of service.   For it not being very busy, I didn't appreciate being skipped for seating, Waiting to still be seated that I had to ask, Waiting another 10 to order. Having to ask the host for condiments since I can't find the server. Finished our food and waited way too long to be comfortable that I got up with our payment to pay anyone at this point since I can't find the server, Again.  Food was good. Not worth the wait. Service should be as good as the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YOlZYsKDBV8YB12BMhveFw.text: Love the little patio.  It has plenty of tables and a little couch to relax on.  The coffee was freshly brewed and brought out in a clear mug so you could see it was nice and dark.  There was fresh cream brought out in little pitchers and added to the flavor.    We had the chilaquiles and they were very tasty.  It looked small at first, but was very filling even for two.  It was different then we are used to, but still good flavor.  I do wish the egg had been on top and I could have chosen the cook.  We like runny eggs and the bottom was an egg patty.  I loved the black beans in it though.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh coffee
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. China quiles Breakfast

5gZgIkVYgKTb5YcCfpljlg.text: Pretty excited to try a new brunch place. I tried the breakfast empanadas and the short rib eggs Benedict, both were really tasty ! There is a lot of options, many with a latin twist. My friend loved the berry waffle and her turkey sandwich, she wasn't planning to eat everything but did !  The coconut/turmeric coffee wasn't good, the combination of flavors were a bit off on that one !  The restaurant is situated in the art district so it was lovely to sit outside and people watch. Plenty shade also, so it was pretty comfortable.  Service was a little rushed, and messy but I was a good experience overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle and Fresh Berries Breakfast
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepa Benny
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 Breakfast Empanadas

OCV2a-jZxpJcjRBmrftlaA.text: OMG. This place was so good. I haven't had an empanada in years and there's did not disappoint. Sorry I ate them and forgot to take a picture first.  If you're in the art district of Las Vegas you have got to try this place. I promise you will not be disappointed.   The service doesn't disappoint either. When I walked in I was greeted at the door and seated right away.  Nice ambiance with good music.   This place is a must go to.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cilantro Steak Salad. Excellent
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceiling

j4onzbjRZdkRZbJFwi-muQ.text: My first time here and I will be coming back. The empanadas are savory and I love the puff pastry they use. Not too excited about the side salad that came with my empanada bowl. It was very much plain mixed greens, no other veggies and no dressing.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanada bowl. Loved the beans and rice, not impressed with the mixed green &#34;salad&#34;.

cV388HztkaCQfMIezw7MXA.text: I will preface this review by saying we came here early evening on a Saturday which I don't think is the normal busy time for the area - hence being short staffed or under-trained. So with that said, the food was good but the service was off.   I order a hot green tea latte and it took 15+ minutes for me to get my drink, after I prompted them for it. The drink was good.   I also ordered the Sofrito burger. The burger was also good. But the server initially brought me out the wrong order (tacos) after waiting 20+ minutes. I told him to cancel the burger but it turns out the burger was just a couple minutes more.   I like the place but hope the service is better the next time I go.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sofrito burger
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea latte

1mZNwWS4xl61ze4krPCohA.text: I like coming here for breakfast. It's rare finding good vegan places in the morning. This place has several options. It has cold or hot brews. There's also a better than expected food menu.   My favorite drink is the cold brew. It's just coffee with your choice of milk. They have several non dairy milks. It has almond, coconut, and some others. It's about $3 for a regular. It also has a good amount of food. There's a few vegan choices here too. I like the chia oatmeal. It's about $5. This is a good light meal without sacrificing taste.   It has a nice atmosphere. It's located next to Hop Nuts Brewery. These share the same bathroom, which lets you move between each without going outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold Brew And Vegan Chia Oatmeal

aL_qqpgGnZOnPDRXJIG3qQ.text: Painfully slow service on a not very busy Monday morning. Such a bummer. I absolutely love their decor and the patio has a huge couch that gave this family plenty of room. But our waitress (the only one I saw working that morning) was constantly disappearing.   We ordered the chilaquiles to share. There are two different meats options you can upgrade to and our waitress suggested the chicken. I think I should've gone with the other one because I didn't find it to be super flavorful. Also, they asked how we'd like our eggs - I said medium. It arrived VERY well done. I would've mentioned such a thing to our waitress but, we'll, you guessed it, she disappeared and we were quite hungry after already waiting longer than expected.   Oh! We also ordered a side of bacon that was never delivered but still ended up on the bill. Just one for thing for me to track down the waitress about. So frustrating.

XJBsxCsQPPqCtDCETSULFQ.text: Mood-  lunch  Upon entering was quickly greeted with warm and friendly customer service.   Our server Mihsha was truly the MVP. I say this, as I love a London Fog iced, but most places unless it's on the menu won't do it. She made it happen for me. And yes it was wonderful.   We were chatting up a few of the patrons as we were getting ready to place our order which was nice, regarding food and the overall ambiance of the restaurant. We opted for the croissant sandwich, tres leche waffle, London fog iced, and honey latte. Nothing disappointed at all.   Interior is modern. Plenty of booth/ table seating. Outdoor patio seating, bar seating, and even a lounge area if your not ordering food but having beverages.  I would def recommend. Pricing is reasonable.   Location Main/ California  - street parking,  or lots.  Be careful when driving many streets are 1- way.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exterior
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front entrance
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor sign

k9ppeC5vs51rpSWpQSlHPQ.text: So we were driving through Vegas and wanted a cool place to fuel up that wasn't on the strip. I searched through Yelp and found this place, which I saw had a ton of great reviews and the food sounded amazing. We parked right across the street and got seated immediately. Throughout our entire meal, we did have great service and were well attended to.   I ordered the lunch empanada bowl and subbed yuca frites for the beans and rice because as a kid I remember my mother's cuban friend making amazing yuca frites. These definitely didn't live up to the ones I was thinking of, but I can't fault them for that, just wanted to give my mindset. I chose the short rib and tinga empanada: really liked the chicken tinga, really was not a fan of the short rib. But both by the end I was feeling like they just were covered in sauces, and as the saying goes, if covered in sauces its not about the ingredients and meal itself. After getting my bowl I realized how greasy my entire meal was- the empanadas were overly greasy (yes I know they're empanadas but I still felt a lot of oil) and similarly to the yuca frites. I wanted to have something light as well, so I ordered the asparagus later, later to find out its drenched in oil- like literally drenched. It wasn't super well cooked either, so just overall not a huge fan of my meal.   My boyfriend ordered the Latin hash- and totally was underwhelmed. He said the ingredients came together as a mush, and it was just an overall salty flavor which he had to drench cholula in to give a different taste. He did order the cortado and enjoyed that though. Both of us at the end of our meals were still hungry and paid $12-13 dollars for each (not including the asparagus I ordered) and not including tip.   Overall, cute vibe but the food did not meet up to the expectations at all. The staff was attentive and nice, but they couldn't make up for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latin Hash-pretty mushy and pretty much had all one taste.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib and chicken tinga empanada bowl with yuca frites and aoili- not a fan of the aoili and the small salad is definitely small.

doijKFl2xkMRqPI9Q83DHQ.text: I love this place! It is at the heart of Las Vegas and a must stop if you are in town. The lavender coffee is a must! If you're a bit hungry try the arepas or empanadas. They have happy hour from 4-6.   The turmeric coffee is also a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-Px_xhzrODri778FcwHM2A.text: We had a bunch of appetizers which were all very satisfying. The cocktails were of good quality and the prices were ok for that. Even though the staff was super friendly and patient they seemed to be overwhelmed by the big group of ours (12). Means it took some time for some drinks while others were already chucked down... but that would be the only drawback I could think of! Great place

dHpYjGKc2AddBTjU5tVW7A.text: We were initially told to move off of the large table since it's reserved for large parties only. There simply wasn't a large party coming in and we were near closing time so it could have been handled perhaps better but the server apologized and life goes on. Jesse subsequently provided solid service at the bar!   Thanks for recommending the espresso martini as it was quite delicious! My wife enjoyed her turmeric coconut lattes and life is good!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espresso martini, shaken not stirred
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut turmeric latte!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed yucca

h6v4fbhITn7e8_ROy338_w.text: This location is very trendy. I instantly felt like I was walking into a hipster coffee bar. The hostess was very welcoming and we were instantly seated. Unfortunately, my server forgot to put in my hibiscus mimosa order and came back 20 minutes later asking if I still wanted it. We ordered the tres leches waffle as an appetizer since we'd been traveling for 12 hours and were hungry but everything we ordered came out at once. I'm not gonna lie, I bit into that waffle and it was amazing ... until I found a long hair in the compote. I was so grossed out and of course our server was no where to be found AGAIN so thankfully the hostess was able to help us. The manager or supervisor introduced himself and offered to give us a new waffle to go free of charge - of course they put the the same compote on top and I just didn't even want to try to eat another waffle with that hair because I'm sure they didn't make a fresh batch right after we all found the hair. The mimosa was very refreshing. If you're going for a champagne brunch,  I wouldn't go here for fun. I went here bc they have plant based options advertised - I got a mimosa simply becauSe I was in vacation and I'm glad I did because it was my favorite thing at the restaurant. The rest of our food was good but it's hard to enjoy a meal when you just found hair in your first course ya know.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very modern  decorations
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very hipster and trendy
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside view

AQS4W1cjYF9jCvJl52w8Bw.text: This was by far one of the most exciting and enjoyable experiences in Vegas.  The Latin Hash was to die for.  It should be shown on all the food networks.  The flavor exploded in my mouth.  The yucca mash was so unique, I am hooked.  Great staff and prices that made me smile.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Latin Hash with egg scrambled
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yucca Mash
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Benny

jDAQ8EXzhUodnrGnVjGiFw.text: I LOVE this spot. I'm staying at The Cosmopolitan and came here to escape The Strip. Makers & Finders is amazing for Sunday brunch. It's packed at 12:30p on Sunday (get here early for no wait). The lavender latte with almond milk is my new favorite coffee drink (homemade lavender syrup)! The Eggs Benny with Hollandaise (modified from the red sauce) and the Avocado Relleno (w tuna and capers)... really?? This spot is a dream come True! Thanks Makers! Keep up the great work!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender Latte with Almond Milk! Cmon! Yum!!!

bC0aEmSC1UvkD27ZVAGncA.text: I was excited to try another independent coffee house. I was disappointed. When I arrived, my friend and I were deciding if we wanted to sit at the bar or outside, well the hostess decided for us by saying she would find us a table. No one came over for at least 10 minutes. The hostess came back and stated, "I'm doing my sidework because I'm leaving but I'll get you your drinks". After another 10 minutes or so, she came back with our drinks and told us she was leaving and this guy would be in charge. He didn't introduce himself to us or check back with us even after 30 minutes. We were on a time crunch after all the delays. So we both got out our wallets. That got him coming over.  My Lavender iced latte was good, but not good enough to put up with that service.

zWDmghlpW6XTJHUS0NnO_A.text: Hip place to go for breakfast or lunch has a good vibe with unique food and Specialty coffee. The staff is very friendly and kept checking to make sure everything was just right. Went on the recommendation of someone I met in Vegas and I'll definitely come back each time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yCLpDHG2tfV5J07qQE2w4w.text: I was recommended the arepa benny from the menu and it was "THE BOMB"! I was never a breakfast person until I tried it. I will definitely come back. Also, they have unique varieties of coffee/lattes/ teas and a comforting interior/atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arepa benny

vScRazpFcPcC8Dcziam4jw.text: Great vibe, excellent music, and most of all some seriously great food and drinks.  For anyone who has ever been to the Montrose district in Houston, you'll feel right at home.  10/10 would eat here and recommend.

Lxoxg4c5WJO49ndVecNw2g.text: Love LOve LOVE this place. The Salmon Benny is my go-to. Hands down, amazing if you enjoy eggs and salmon. I wish it were a little bigger but the size is definitely not too small. It's consistently delicious and that's what matters  Another thing I love is the Avocado and Tuna salad. If you like both those things then add in the capers it comes with and Bam! It's bomb and is my 2nd most favorite. I've never had a bad meal here and their coffee is solid too. That's all you need to know! Come here and check it out next time you're on main St. or heading downtown.

PoF8n1SGg6d880rrd2mQ-w.text: The menu is fantastically Latino eclectic.  There were at least 10 other items I wanted to try.  Coffee was superb, with recommendations for the Honey Vanilla Latte, and Lavender Latte.  So glad I grabbed the bus from the strip to check out the arts district.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled lime chicken.

0I9Wfaek_NmUiGk3Fh-SIg.text: Went on a Saturday around 11am, food was very delicious.  No wait.  Good coffee.  Unique breakfast dishes.  We ordered empanada sampler, salmon benny, poutine fries, and shrimp ceviche.  All the dishes were good.  I think I would have added more plantain chips to the ceviche though.  Everything was very fresh.  I think the poutine fries were probably my favorite even though the dish was the most simple.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Benny
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche de Camarones Gluten Free
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanada sampler.

RTIz12WrvzUOKlOXVFwcdA.text: My favorite coffee shop in the city. Haven't found another place that compares. Every single beverage I have tried is delicious. My favorite thus far is the coconut turmeric latte my sisters favorite is the dirty chai latte. The food menu is amazing also. They offer plenty of vegan options! Must try the vegan mushroom empanadas. The service is a little slow but the employees tend to be very friendly and nice.

oVEtBkmuxsqdLtABuGtAlw.text: Super tasty. Their fries and cuban espressos are amazing.  I only wish they called their guest wifi 'Makers & Wi-Finders'

0UmHhZCMViYClxyKt_XFYQ.text: Man, this is some bomb ass food. Dishes have various latin influences.   From Colombian to Mexican to Venezuelan amongst others.   This might be my favorite brunch place in town now, and I been to many great brunch places here.

ZHBLfAM2nHwEhuPCc8oPFQ.text: I've loved this place since they've opened. They recently expanded their menu and offer dinner as well as breakfast and lunch. Love the staff, they're very efficient. They never stop working!   There was a small issue with my order, but the staff was quick to fix it.   They offer a variety of different brew options for their coffee, as well as some creative latte options (Coconut Turmeric is a must try).   Highly recommended!

aYswBx7Tix4pbvqNa_ELLQ.text: Such a cute place employees were nice. The food was great drinking lattes instead of mimosas was a nice change of pace. I loved all the Latin flavors incorporated. I will definitely be coming back.

qfaQtW1QpF_RMI_C7vl49w.text: As little as I am a Downtown Las Vegas fan, this place got me hooked up and I am definitely coming back. Great variety of breakfast/lunch food with an obvious Latin influence, cozy atmosphere, and creative coffee drinks. Plus a large pet-friendly outdoor patio that I can't wait to make my next new Sunday brunch hang-out spot as soon as the weather cools down a bit.

RMt9yVp9LGSDZIitVddZ1Q.text: This is a great blend of coffee and food. It's pretty hard to find a place that serves food and also knows the legit coffee scene. This is definitely that place.   That being said, their coffee didn't wow me, but it was very solid. To get a pour-over with an omelette is pretty cool.

nkQPRKIQ1saRGWDfhaM2uw.text: I've been here many times. They have some of the best coffee in town and a cool vibe. Unfortunately they have some of the slowest service.  I would still recommend this place, but just make sure you have plenty of time because they will not be getting your order very quickly

i6JiOXWbLdZ5AawHcsVOnw.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. We decided to have lunch before checking in at the Palms.  Cute patio. Cute bar. Good food. Menu looks big. Presentation of the menu is unique. Lots of choices. Hard to decide... bathroom is clean, outside, and shared with the brewery next door. Cool graffiti outback. Cool photos on the way to the restroom. Wait staff is friendly and helpful. We want to go back and try more!  Only bad part could be the parking. I told all my friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm... shrimp
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanada heaven

2aZ-BFSyMqEvbwq4UUsdUQ.text: Went on a Monday afternoon for lunch - the place was really busy but our server was very attentive. Had the rajas arepas, didn't love it. Lacked a lot of flavor and I actually found a piece of plastic in my dish. Yikes! My daughter had the coconut tres leches waffle and didn't really eat it -- I felt like it had a funny taste to it too, and I love this kind of food. Latte and Matcha are really good! Wouldn't go back for the food.

Gbh8YmN07c0llSmt0UJrdQ.text: I really wanted to like this place more because it's super cute and hipster. They were busy; but not packed; and our service was very slow. It took forever to get water. We ordered a French press coffee and it came at the same time as our food. I ordered the chilaquiles. They were average. Not outstanding. Definitely order meat with it because it's a small portion. I'd like to go back and try their arepas, I hear those are good. But, it was pricey and slow, so I'm not rushing back.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lFqiIOauHO8cg0uQxlj38g.text: We walked in little before 8pm, and noticed the visible annoyance of the barista. We were asked right away if our coffee was "to go". Then we were told that they were closing in 20 minutes,  but the door clearly said 9pm. Not sure if they just really needed to leave, but out of common courtesy a sign on the door might have helped. It would've given us the option to make a decision to not even walk in.   That being said, we were told we would have enough time to drink our coffees in house.  Hostess let us sit outside and brought us water. She was very pleasant and made recommendations for something we've not tried. The coffee came back shortly after,  which we drank quite quickly. When you know you're on a time constraint, you try to get out asap. Both were very pleasant,  but since we felt rushed, we really couldn't enjoy the flavor.  All in all, we might go back,  but not anytime soon.

92sdbwAUo0xhkAJf23Uv3Q.text: Food was incredible. Pleasant environment. A Little wait but expected for higher quality.

WNg3J0aqxUpPcmI_7_xM3Q.text: I really love the vibe of this coffee shop/restaurant. It has a pretty spacious covered patio with a good amount of seating and a to go window in the corner. The inside is a good size as well with a coffee bar or table seating if you prefer. They have happy hour which is from 4 to 6. We've only gone for late lunches (between 2pm - 5pm) and each time was quiet with only a handful of people, there was no wait to be seated or to place our orders. Not much items to choose from for happy hour but we were able to try what we wanted in the one visit, so that cancels out if we will order again.   I would come back here more for the coffee than the food. I'm not saying I would never eat here again or the food is terrible, I just wasn't blown away by the food like I thought I would be. I would definitely be open to trying new dishes the next time I go though, so there is still hope the food could wow me! I'll say this though, if you're a person that wants the fancy shmancy crazy flavored/blended coffees, this is not the place for you.  For drinks I ordered the cortado, which I thought was a nice blend of espresso and milk, not overly strong. My boyfriend ordered a speciality coffee cocktail, the espresso martini. He really liked it, I found it a bit strong (liquor wise) for my liking but I'm a lightweight and don't like to taste it in my coffee.    For food we ordered the 2 house empanadas (shredded beef & shrimp), the Latin poutine, and the sofrito burger. I found the empanada crust to be more pastry-like, very flaky and a bit messy which I am not used to. Also, the shredded beef was a little hard to eat. One bite and all the beef came out. I basically had to bite through the wad of beef in my mouth and cut up the rest to place back inside the rest of my empanada.  The Latin poutine was so so. I'm Canadian and I'm used to the scolding hot gravy that burns your entire mouth off and cheese, lots of cheese! The gravy was luke warm with barely any queso or cotija cheese as it claimed. It was basically fries, gravy, an egg, with bits of bacon. I didn't have high hopes for the poutine anyways. I find it difficult to get a decent poutine here in Vegas, but curiosity always gets me when I see the option on a menu. As for the sofrito burger, nothing bad to say. It was a good burger made with Angus beef, very flavorful and juicy. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed it.  All in all, I do enjoy the atmosphere and the drink selections and will be back to try some more.  I just discovered they are opening up a location in downtown summerlin (when exactly I am not sure), but this will be much more convienant then driving to the arts district and looking for parking!

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Contado
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside Makers &amp; Finders

5IXSsohOJ5D-iZEYfMxfEA.text: I was pretty disappointed with this particular visit. My food (chilaquiles with beef) was delicious, but my mother had a bad experience ordering off of the al la carte menu. Her eggs were fine, but the bacon she ordered was burnt to the point of inedibility. The side of potatoes was very cold and soggy (ridiculous considering the $4 price point). As always the coffee was delicious, but I can't help but feel underwhelmed this visit. I would like to see more care taken with side orders. I myself have experienced the cold side of potatoes in a previous visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hoawnMu9XDUkH5UqhvMqiA.text: What a gem! Loved going off strip to the arts district for this oh so perfect weekend brunch. The coffee concoctions are heavenly. So much that we had one each during our meal, then ordered another to go for our drive home. They are sweet and more like dessert, but a must-have. I personally loved the coconut turmeric latte, it was flavorful and inventive. The food is Latin- inspired dishes. We especially enjoyed the chilaquiles and empanadas.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey vanilla latte (left) and coconut turmeric latte (right)

gtwCEUmhr8Z8Y-6wEf_4tg.text: First time was great was second time not so much I got old coffee and the music they where playing was horrible, plus our waitress was very rude. The only okay thing was there Arnold Palmer. I don't recommend

G_U5exkfKhFCcHmeknmFDQ.text: Quaint little nice place. Service was slow but the food was good. I had smoked salmon Benny. It was very tasty but was not very warm. I would probably give it another chance

THzT7FDXmDtAFx9nF9yjbA.text: This was such a great find. We were in Vegas for the weekend and went twice for brunch. The empanadas were delicious and the lavender coffee was amazing! This will definitely be a regular for us when in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious coffees and food!

dF6MRQbBtS0tfGnUy9fKDg.text: The food is great. Today the silverware and glasses were filthy. We had to ask the waiter on multiple occasions to clean our forks, knives, and glasses. After he brought back a glass that was fresh out the dishwasher, we noticed it was the same glass splashed in water and not dried. Still dirty!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Fresh out of the dishwasher&#34;

xzkwFmLYHK5oTEc8RCfUlw.text: Very hipster. It's downtown so you get that vibe for sure. It's very modern but really comfy.  Great coffee. I had the Honey Vanilla Latte.  A lot of great Latin comfort food. I had the Sofrito Burger. It was very testy, it made a great brunch burger.  Would definitely come back.

VY2SDiZ5--xTBNAi6Lh1_A.text: I've been going to this place since they opened and I've NEVER been disappointed! They have a great variety of hot and cold coffee beverages and their menu is just perfect! It's not a long menu so you won't have a hard time deciding what to eat and the best thing of all is that they serve Latin comfort food. I've personally tried the Arepa Benny and the Arepa Paisa and they remind me of my trip to Colombia - delicious authentic food! The personnel that works there is also very courteous and always so attentive. This restaurant is also in a great location as it's in the Downtown area close to where I work.  Keep up the good work guys! You have a customer for life.

DJEoQs-Vi-Xs5FNr0oPvHg.text: It's the best thing in the world, just do it. Shout out to Jesse and Ruben for the amazing espresso.

duWs6wB4gik9NYPJ5IsE_g.text: Best lattes ever we came for breakfast it was so hard to decided everything sounds so good.  We had the arepa benny and el paisa arepa and both were awesome.  Looked like small portions but was more than enough.  Service was great too it's clean,good, chill atmosphere . Will definitely come back every time we come to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gd9mMgToVzPGnbnNa5_rmg.text: I'm definitely a fan! I had their Ripen Mango Arepas and the Mexican Spiced latte...both made to delight my taste palette. You have to go and see for yourself. The food was so fresh and so delish. The mango arepas go well with a side balsamic sauce the server handed me like it as a secret for my taste buds only kind of thing. I'm sure he's given it away to many before me, but hey don't harsh my mellow. Haha. The coffee was very subtle and creamy. Everyone there was so welcoming and attentive. I would definitely go back especially knowing its 10 mins away from my work!!!

el8OS4HUToN3x-ILtNtU_g.text: Not located in the best part of town and I was not sure where to park at first (probably best to find street parking across the street and walk over) but I'm so glad I didn't give up on this place!   Delicious brunch cuisine paired with an impressive coffee menu. I ordered a cold brew and breakfast arepas Benedict. The arepas were so good, not like  the ones I have had before. It is rather heavy though. Most their savory dishes sounded good - i saw many be served in cast iron personal pans.   Plenty of seating in this space. Free wifi, Friendly knowledgeable staff. Would definitely come again!

WopgHmHfL1W2A8yHecdt1w.text: Cute coffee shop with great coffee and desserts. Had lunch before this so just stopped by for a quick coffee and snack. Tried the iced lavender latte with espresso flan. Will definitely try the food from the kitchen next time im in vegas.

1xoHNv2gthonPmufx4igBw.text: The food was INSANELY delicious, I got TWO different lattes which were both so yummy & everyone was very friendly

4CWYERBZOav_bRpIihDw8A.text: Wonderful gem in Vegas. If you wanna get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, and get a great cup of coffee and some Latin cuisine, this is a place to check out. Located in the arts district of Vegas, towards the downtown area, makers & finders has a wide selection of premium coffee drinks as well as some awesome Latin eats! Arepas, Empanadas, oh my!  The honey vanilla latte and arepa benny are standouts!

j4EKO_PQ9W1UT21Xh3KqWA.text: I came for the coffee. They don't make their lattes with condensed milk on ice bc the condensed milk doesn't dissolve. So that was a bust on the semi hot day. I did decide to get a different latte, as did my friend. Both seemed too milky, the ratio of espresso to milk was off. They served the lattes in mason jars but if they aren't going to add an extra shot then they should get smaller mason jars bc I'm not a cow man.   The food was yummy. Sliders and fries for the kiddo, I can't recall my dishes name but it had mango. I wanted the plantain chips and it was served with only 2. What's that all about? I need a crunch with my meals homie!   My friends dish was good too, sorry I can't place the names of anything.   It felt like we were in LA. The patio was wonderful and perfect to accommodate lunch with my 4 yo and a friend. I loved this hipster coffee shop.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I don&#39;t know the name but I loved it! Needed more plantain chips. What a rip
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders with fries was a winner in my kids eyes

VRgh8oTyRL9xzT9GCDrDGw.text: Great food and coffee. Arepa Benedict all day.   Great staff and customer service. We had a big party of 8 during Life is Beautiful and I called in to make a reservation. They told us they couldn't make a reservation but would try  to save us a table. They were able to seat us within 25 minutes when we got here. Thank you Ed!

hYm6Kl3myvVFJkJnM4GD2g.text: Excellent Latin inspired coffee house on Main St. I come for the the empanadas and my wife comes for the Lavender Fog. Great to see this spot in the neighborhood thriving!

4dh0a-2pu9VWrUWMEDw8oQ.text: I will never come to this establishment ever again. My friends have mentioned that they have great coffee, but horrible service. Today they made me a believer! The place wasn't even busy and the busser tried to take our order and he was the only one who checked on us twice. Other than that the server was M.I.A. Oh!!! But he dropped the check.. Then disappeared! I over tipped because I didn't have change and I needed to go. Imagine if I needed to use my card, would've sat there for an eternity. I never write reviews, but they deserved one!

kswugvkcY58-A5lKbem3dQ.text: Overpriced food with no flavor. Ordered the veggie bagel sandwich, below average. Stale wheat bagel that was not even toasted, dill honey cream had no dill, puny slices of tomato.   Maybe their strength is their coffee?  Oh well.

V-LsADg2SpeQ8xxAFF02Qw.text: I ordered a smoothie to go and they said "sorry we can't make that to go." What??? What city do we live in that you can't order a drink to go??? Haha The barista let it slide this time but once we paid she said "just know next time, we won't be able to do that." Ok, so if you turn down $8 smoothies all day to go, you're loosing business and future returning customers. Drinks were ok at best.

88CysOIDC5ALb9hs_MeDHQ.text: I love this place! Especially since I can have brunch on a Monday at lunchtime. It's golden in my book!  You have to try their lattes! I had the lavender latte the first time, and I always get it now.   My favorite brunch item? The arepa benny! It is so worth the calories. Portion size is perfect. You will be full for the rest of the day.  The only negative is the service. It hasn't improved after several times being there. That is the reason why I haven't given 5 stars.

4FoUFF9TdJ0C1HEMjOn1XQ.text: Really comfy n art gallery is my fav point.smoked salmon benny was sooo good!!  I'm not big fan of sweet drinks.But when I orders slanted caramel coffee wit lil bit sweetener was the hit the point!!love it!!!

YwlxuEd5nNyrp5YwrntJBQ.text: To whoever is in charge of the music in the morning, LOVE the Rock en Espanol. LOVE LOVE LOVE. Never change.   Food wise. Delicious, great atmosphere and solid coffee. Favorite spot in Las Vegas when visiting.

IU5fjSVSP-6wSSak659ztg.text: Love this spot to work on weekends. Their food is very good and the place has a great vibe. They have a very nice patio where you can sit and enjoy the good weather while having a drink or getting work done.

fLWvcxwfaP8_fYSwy1_6jA.text: Authentic flavorful food!  Great atmosphere and service. It is something a little different. Try it when you are in Las Vegas!

lTgPWtj7lzvT0aB1MAC3Tw.text: Very calm small location, very friendly staff and refreshing drinks. Highly recommend to make your husband chug a cortado on a Sunday morning to get all your activities done with no complaints. :) worked for me! Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overnight chai pudding and I ed chai latte

c9c6tK4U1V2W2YsVJDTxPQ.text: I was wavering hard on a 3 or 4 star rating. I feel a bit torn. The coffee was very good. Had a nice variety on the menu and all felt like the prices were fair for coffee. I also like the option to purchase alcohol if you desire. What really left me unsure about this place was the food. While the food was not terrible, it also wasn't great. I also genuinely felt like every food item on the menu was about 2-4 dollars over priced. 10 dollars for a bacon egg and cheese bagel is ridiculous. And it was very average. All and all the environment is cool. Staff was friendly. But would not want food again. 3.5/5.

hqbD_0Ka6M2Wzk-hiU1pgg.text: The friendly staff seemed overwhelmed but they calmed our impatience by jokingly attributing our lack of service with me wearing a brazilian soccer shirt (rival teams). Well done.  Usually, I am not a fan of fancy coffee and espresso drinks, except for the classics. I was however blown away by their signature drinks featuring an expert mix of spices, coffees and condensed milk. I also had a delicious Iced Matcha latte.  The food was also excellent. My wife and I shared a benny and a hash, both with succulent pulled beef.  Nice!

FO7n4QX54tBDQ_lbgSo2Dw.text: Looking for a great breakfast place during a quick trip to Vegas and this place did not disappoint. The coffee selection was unique and delicious - we enjoyed the lavender latte and Mexican chocolate latte as recommended by others. The breakfast items were a little different than the usual- which was exactly what I wanted. The flavors on our dishes did overpower our beverages, so make sure to savor them a bit before biting into your entrees.

uiY2PXI_67LkjmPX_vikYQ.text: Super good food and great coffee.  The empanadas are sauced up and they come with rice, a salad, and beans.  The fries are good as well.  ...dont forget your coffee! I went with the vanilla honey latte with almond milk Mmmmmmmmmmmmmm

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanada plate with beans, rice, salad and of course I had to try the fries. Soooo good!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey vanilla latte with almond milk

owafPPxCCwnWMaRnh8doxQ.text: This place has a very trendy vibe to it. I went in for an espresso but I'll have to come back for some food . I noticed a bar with charger outlets and also some couches in the back. The place had a cool interior design. They also had a patio. Fresh little spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cuban Espresso

lc5IyoZzIRqnR1PHS5gxpw.text: Me and my girlfriend split the Chicken Tinga Benny, the Breakfast Empanadas, and the Coconut Tres Leches Waffle. Everything was SO good!   First time eating in Downtown Las Vegas and I wish that I lived here so I could come back more often! I would highly recommend this place to others

8ty6LKsygtqOUyiXQO7YNQ.text: This is a cool little place on Main St in the hipster "Arts District ".  The food is latin influenced and quirky but tasty. I can't speak to the coffee part but the food and vibe are decent and the beer is cold. The area is growing and in a sort of redevelopment phase. Good people watching spot outside.

uzD7pZ944Broc9wXmkDYhA.text: As a Colombian, Paisa to be exact, I ordered the Bandeja Paisa this morning and have never been more ashamed that a restaurant would promote this sort of misrepresentation. The meat was burnt. The chicharron was pork belly marinated in Hoisin sauce. The beans were black with cotija cheese (COLOMBIANS use cargamanto beans and NEVER put cheese on top). The rice was long grain yellow. So offended by this misrepresentation of Colombian food. Let me not even get started on the "artwork" of Pablo getting shot. A poor imitation of a Botero and just using gangster culture to their benefit to sell bad food.

0q5167dRlmPeL-h-8W59gw.text: I ate there twice in one day. Their brunch is amazing! Great omelets! Friendly staff, beautiful ambiance! I'll be visiting again!

n09Gm5CIcVCYbNRNwYyl2g.text: This is the best coffee in Las Vegas, hands down. Very unique and well-crafted coffees and coffee drinks. The coconut turmeric latte is creamy with the bold color of turmeric and a fresh coconut flavor (I'm not a huge fan of fakey coconut flavors that one usually gets:). I'm also a big fan of the dirty chai latte. Kind and helpful baristas. Looking forward to trying breakfast there next.

VSSQOd8qYscHwc9jQA1LlA.text: My boyfriend and I spent a long weekend in Vegas last month. We mostly ate off the strip and ended up finding all of the best restaurants, including this place for brunch.  This place has a hipster feel (apparently, my thing), unique latte selections like a lavender infused latte, and a killer menu complete with arepas and lots of gluten-free options. Everything was outstanding. The entire experience was a reprieve from the flashy Vegas experience. This is definitely staying on my Vegas restaurant list. Next time I'll take some pictures and hang out longer!

NQB8QctOF8L92YAKBPkPbw.text: Had the Chicken Tinga Omelet here, and it was great.  They do a really good job with their pour over coffees as well.  I went back again and had the Turkey Club which was also fantastic.
