br4bRAElbut5Ev4UBcVxNw.text: Been here several times, always have good food and coffee. Friendly staff. And it's kind of hidden from the tourists so it isn't always crowded. Recommend highly

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sexkd5B_6HLwnUwzhWKkRA.text: Fun place to hang out in the Arts District. Food and coffee were great. Parking can be a pain but we lucked out.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KbnAdbSV0Wi_dYVSdYOsCw.text: Took my mom here for breakfast today first off- LOVED the ambiance!! Its something you'd see on Pinterest. We ordered the Salted Caramel Latte, Mocha Latte, and Latin Hash. Food was mediocre, coffee was delicious and came with cute coffee art.   Unfortunately as we were waiting for the check both mine and my mothers stomachs started to cramp and started feeling uneasy. I'm pretty sure this has to be from the food or maybe the milk in the coffee... we both ended up spending a little extra time in the restroom.   Not sure if I would come back... maybe just for a coffee date. Service wasn't the greatest- waitress talked fast, hard to understand and wasn't consistent.

f7P9In0jnrvUVYcQl-Tmxw.text: This was one of my favorite Vegas stops. The service was fantastic for a group of 13 and the food pretty damn amazing. I loved their system of taking orders by numbering each guest. It made splitting the bill so much simpler!  From the photos on Yelp, I was expecting heavy, basic Latin American twists on traditional American brunch items. It was far from heavy and basic, the food was just enough to get us full, clean-tasting and incredibly fresh. I only took off one star because we ordered a lot of the eggs Benedict dishes and the eggs were all fully cooked. We we're disappointed when it wasn't at all runny.    And for me, the flavors of the La Paisa lunch item fell flat after a few bites. The server kindly suggested his favorite Salsa Verde which definitely saved the dish for me. I did not take off any stars for this because it is personal preference.

7f0b8RThRmKIFjs5NbRzUA.text: Went to try this place out with my husband during the week. LOVED it ! It's a small place but very cozy. Their lattes a DEliCious ! And I absolutely adore the designs they creat with the foam! I also saw a person next to me have a purple latte! Pretty cool! My husband had their breakfast dish with Tinga and I had their popular hash dish. They were both really good I just wish the food could have been a bit warmer. Kinda felt like it had been sitting out for a while till they brought it out for us. Also taking one star off due to the length of time it took for us to receive our food(we went on a Tuesday and it wasn't really full with customers). Also I had ordered my latte and the server forgot about it! But still loved the place and will for sure come back! They also have WiFi and an outdoor area to relax and get some work done.

BzlvLcaEs_HFkGoWPSfjpg.text: Lavender infused lattes and their veggie empanadas are amazing!!!!  That is all you need to know.  Oh wait, their arepas are also good.    Great selections for vegetarians beyond the usual salad or microwave heated veggie patty slapped on a bun.   Nice place and it is easy to find parking.

i81u1bJ1KSALCMans4mQlQ.text: My friends and I walked into Makers for my birthday brunch. We've never been before but assumed they would be able to handle a 10 top. As we walk in a server says she has to go inform the manager that such a large Party has come in.  Things were good till Faith the server approached us. She asks if we are aware of the complications they have been experiencing today not being afraid to show her frustrations. We unaware of anything let her know that we've just arrived, and another server was helping us with our ten top. She then Proceeded to say in a fashion that implied 'I do not want you here' that the internet was down and they now have to hand write their orders. She then told us that it would take an hour to seat us and even longer to receive our food.  Being very frustrated with the way this woman spoke to us I stepped outside to speak with my friends and inform them of the situation. My wife then followed me outside and told us that faith had said "Today is the kind of day we wouldn't be afraid to turn away a ten top."  This is now why I'm writing this review, after serving for 10 years I have never seen such a poorly communicated situation to customers. If we had been kindly informed that the wait time was long and systems were down. I would have said thanks for letting us know and left thanking them for not wasting our time.  We will never return here and I hope you all work on your systems and processes.

fEJH3EMgXxZ7z6eHReWTrA.text: I had lunch here with my mother on a weekday. She had the Empanada plate with a side of Brussel sprouts and the lavender fog tea. I had the empanadas sampler with a side of french fries and a salted caramel latte. We both enjoyed our meals and beverages and the service was good. The only downside is accessibility to the restaurant. I was able to park a block away and that was no big deal but my mom had to park 2 blocks away and she has bad knees and can't walk long distances.

MXhXdE9fKly2qUUR0S3QVg.text: I loved their Bon Bon latte. I ordered it with Almond Milk , and it was a flavorful coffee. Very cool place to chill , specially in a hot summer day . We didn't know they service food as well. We will go back definitely and this time for sure will try their food menu. Recommend highly!!!

neyIH_JgsMEtktidROPLTw.text: We stumbled across this place while in search of a guitar shop. It's in a funky little part of town between the strip and downtown. I found it on yelp and decided to give it a try and it was a find! I was feeling adventurous so ended up ordering a coconut turmeric latte to see what all the hype was about and it was beyond my expectations. I ended up dragging my husband back there 2 more times and was disappointed that I wouldn't be able to get this drink until the next time we go to Vegas.  If anyonr knows where I can get a good turmeric latte in L.A. or O.C. let me know!

N-1z-01zPepm3WmCRK8tqg.text: This place is super cute! It is a hidden gem amongst the shops along Main Street in Downtown Las Vegas, right off of Charleston. It's completely flushed with light due to the large windows in the front of the shop. They have enough tables inside, outside, and at the bar/counter for you to sit at.   The staff is super friendly as well. They are always willing to have a genuine conversation.  I ordered the Honey Vanilla espresso. On the menu it is described that it comes with a cinnamon crust and a vanilla mist. (Your server actually comes out with your drink and mists your coffee with vanilla. Super cute.) It was definitely made well.  They have a full lunch menu here that I have yet to try but I definitely recommend to check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DADhEx1zmQ37f6yPWSfPJg.text: My  friend recommended this place. I have never been to a place yet where I was totally satisfied with everything. I had the Nutella latte iced which was amazing. I also tried the chicken empanadas which were even more amazing. My friend is super picky, she got the beef sandwich and she was in love. It's truly hard for her to really like a restaurants food 100% but she was as equally impressed. We will be back soon for sure!

cyXvicy411noX0ZNzOg6HQ.text: Beautiful hidden gem near downtown Vegas in the arts district.   They have such a beautiful space with unique artwork and quirky touches such as neon lights and mason jars as spice holders.   I went for the lavender infused latte and the arepa benny and both were so flavorful and delicious.   The lavender in the latte was strong in presence but not overpowering, and not too sweet.   The arepa benny blew me away. I had never had a Benedict with a Latin American twist like that. Pretty sure I blacked out from happiness because before I knew it, it was gone. My only tiny wish is that the eggs had been more runny, but that's just personal preference.   Will definitely venture off the strip for this next time I'm in Vegas. So worth it!

2jJXH1Pxd16iZXj1nVic3Q.text: I came here today for the first time as we were looking for a place nearby for breakfast and I fell in love with it. I want to try at least 1/2 the menu right off the back. The servers are very knowledgeable of the menu and attentive. They have an indoor and outdoor sitting area and cool with dogs outside as there were people there with a very friendly pit bull. Lots of Latin influences including Cuban coffee. They have a brunch menu and soon will be opening for dinner I learned from the waiter. The only downside was the shared bathroom with other stores but it fits right in with the overall atmosphere of the place. Also they give a military discount. Can't wait to come back here again!

_AL0tPtM_CbRpc9Al1xZkw.text: Being a downtown resident, and a fan of M&F coffee, I brought a friend visiting from Los Angeles to a Sunday brunch here. Man, oh man, was it an embarrassing representation of local dining in Las Vegas. Although the restaurant wasn't busy, it took our waiter more than 15 minutes to approach our table. Once we submitted our coffee order, he assured us that he'd be back to take our actual order.   Sure enough, he did return, 20 minutes later, sans-coffee, to ask what we would like to eat. He was cold and abrasive, neither of us felt comfortable enough to ask for recommendations and he certainly was not offering them.   I ordered the salmon benedict. It came out cold, but our server didn't follow up until he dropped the check...so no hopes in sending it back to be reheated.  I'm *ALL* for supporting local businesses, especially in Las Vegas, but not for the sacrifice of service. There are plenty of other local eateries in the downtown area with ample service - check them out before you make the mistake of dining here.  I would, however, recommend stoping in for a coffee! Cute aesthetic, great for Instagram, full bar and lots of interesting drinks to try!

vPi4tHovXiZ_pl8Wnmb58A.text: 3/26 i got the kale salad again and they burnt my chicken it's the second time and having burnt chicken sucks taste horrible.   I order the kale Caesar salad for lunch and added chicken for my protein. It normally doesn't come with chicken but you can add it and it was bomb. The salad was so good and the dressing was the best part because I was eating healthy but didn't taste it. I love this place also had the empanadas and they were good. I will for sure be going back and trying something new.

16a273OMEcpr4yGWv70kAw.text: Have visited place twice coffee is amazing and food is unique, and flavorful. Great healthy portions...wish I had closer location to visit more often.

zjefJwczFW6qB_kWqm2Uqg.text: Interesting menu and incredible food.  We ordered 3 different dishes and everything was delicious!  Their coffee was excellent - not good, excellent.  And I'm pickier than I should be about coffee.  I loved the atmosphere of the place and the staff were very friendly.  Prices were a little high but about on par for Vegas dining.  I'll definitely be back.

A0fLPPm8yHh6Ajf9fFoV6A.text: I paid $5 for a cappuccino to go and it was not worth that much money. My husband and I watched the barista make a latte with beautiful latte art on top for an dine-in order. But when she handed us our drink, the lid was already on it, concealing the foamy drink that had just been dumped in the cup. I am very willing to pay $5 for a well-crafted cappuccino that tastes good. This was not that.

vhGNG0OtghiO1bmXG3uPCg.text: My amazing husband and I were on the hunt for a good iced latte this morning.  After trying a couple other places downtown that happened to be closed (stupid hours), we came upon M&F Coffee.  It's a restaurant but also has a "coffee bar".  Our order was simple, 2 iced vanilla latte's to go.  Now understand, I am a coffee snob and in turn, my husband is too all because of lil ol' me.  Our drinks were poured over crushed ice (awesome in my book).  The presentation was great too.  Milk and vanilla on the bottom, espresso on top.  They mixed easily as we walked back to our car.   The drinks were awesome.  I opted for half the vanilla flavor they typically use as I don't like my drinks overly sweet.  It was perfect.  The hubs felt his was a bit sweet for his taste.  The location and parking are ideal.  Just South of Charleston on the West side of Main St.  It's like a half block before Casa Don Juan.   Prices were a bit steep.  We paid over $12 for 2 larges.  It's expensive but I guarantee, we will be back!!   Do yourself a favor, try the food but definitely grab a latte to go or better yet, have one while you eat and take one home too!  I lamented on 4 vs 5 stars because of the price.  I decided they deserve a full 5 as the drinks were just that good!

2zU-a-OHwBwQvIMcmoBIRw.text: What happened to this place?  Used to love Everything about it but things have changed...  Called in an order but was told no one put it in when I showed up to pick it up.  No big deal, I'll just wait another 10 minutes.  15 minutes goes by, my food is ready but the flamer making the lattes who took my order still hasn't made the drinks.  Another server asked me what I was waiting for he overheard me  give my name and basically said he forgot what the drinks were and can't find the receipt so could I just tell him again.  SMH.    It's just a different overall vibe or that one dude's just got to go...

NseVTz5zCTx2Df3wF3mg8A.text: This is my first visit to M&F. It was a really pleasant experience. I came in on a Monday afternoon and was immediately greeted and seated. I ordered the honey vanilla latte with coconut milk (YUM), the avocado salad, and an order of fries. Everything was delicious. I was going to give this place 4 stars ( it is a little pricey) but as soon as I saw the purse hooks under the tables I immediately elevated them to 5 star status. It's all in the details!

9HhJJfjzOMSFabB_sxYCqQ.text: The place was busy for weekend lunch, typical and my party and I were patiently waiting. We ordered bottomless drinks, it didn't arrive until an hour after? To add on, they brought out the wrong drinks. The food we ordered was the same way. Trying not to let it ruin our lunch, we were being social to our server and trying to pass the time. Our server was nice and tried his best to provide service. We were celebrating a birthday, naturally our party would be lively but we were asked to leave an hour into our meal. No warning!!! Ridiculous. That was the last straw. Seriously no warning? If we were possibly affecting other patrons, why weren't we notified. WE ARE PATRONS TOO!! Paid for bottomless plus ALOT of food. And that's how we're treated? Won't be coming back, thanks.

8TudisKEm-G1JNIUMp9WiQ.text: Makers and Finders is my favorite place to grab a coffee or a delicious meal. The food is spectacular and the aesthetic is great. I always feel comfortable here; the staff are great at recognizing and appreciating their regulars. I would suggest coming here as a local and out of towner, any day of the week. At times there is a line out of the door, showing just how desired this place is. The manager and staff are also kind and attentive. All around fantastic restaurant. My favorite drinks: Lavender mimosa and Lavender latte. My favorite dishes: Latin Hash with avocado and the Croissant sandwich.

cM7IWyGgUfy2wov77NCUWg.text: Fantastic Latin American food and tasty drinks, great place to stop near downtown Las Vegas. Cool antique stores nearby

d164SO20n_dpypasATLzig.text: Came with my mom and they sat us at a two top. We wanted to sit at a four top because we wanted to talk comfortably without bothering the couple next to us. They said no so we just sat at the community table. Fine. We ordered coffee first from the lady that sat us down. The waiter came around maybe 5 minutes later and we ordered food. He asked if we wanted coffee. We had already ordered it, he said, "I may have forgot but maybe I didn't."  It took 20 minutes for the coffee to be delivered. It WAS NOT BUSY. The coffees arrived cold. Oh and guess what they allowed a couple to sit at a four top. Whatever service sucked. If you don't take care of me, I won't take care of you.

8y68bjNLHu6yId_1pqtGNw.text: As Las Vegas locals and servers my boyfriend and I love Makers and Finders. One of our favorite places to get coffee and brunch/lunch. However, our last experience was very disappointing. Our server visited us a total of three times in the hour and a half we were there, neglect is the only word I was use to describe her service. I ordered the Croissant sandwich with fries and he ordered the Chipotle Chicken sandwich. When the food came the croissant sandwich was delicious! I highly recommend it, as for his chipotle chicken sandwich I cannot say the same. There was way too much chicken and it was flavorless, literally just tasted like dry chicken. On top of that both halves were so soggy it was like biting into a sponge. I gave my sandwich to my boyfriend and placed his plate in front of me waiting to hopefully order something different or at the very least just have it removed. The sandwich sat in front of me the entire time not being touched and she never even checked in to see how the food was once. I finally had to wave the very nice hostess down through the window and briefly explain the situation, then gave her the plate and asked for the bill. Our server then showed up and dropped the bill without saying a word and from behind me leaving me with no chance to politely point out a few things. When I saw the sandwich still on the ticket I then flagged the host again asking to speak to a manager and possibly get the sandwich removed as we did not eat but two bites. Our server then dropped the new bill without an apology or even explanation. No manager ever visited the table, I glanced inside at the host stand before we left to see what looked like a male manager (I could be mistaken) talking to the hostess. It would have taken a minute to walk outside and apologize and at least leave us with a better taste in our mouth then we were left with.   That being said, we will return because every experience leading up to this was amazing and I still love the food and exceptional coffee. I am hoping this review serves a purpose and these issues are addressed and fixed.

SLK8HknOWhRK0b-UlpSEMQ.text: I ordered the lavender mimosa, elote cupcakes, taco trio, and fried lime chicken breast (over yucca mash- ADM so good). They were all delicious and very filling! xXX-XcFlnMKMd2yITILK3Q.text: Less of a coffee shop in the Starbucks or Peet's sense than a full sit-down restaurant that happens to have a coffee bar, Makers & Finders offers inexpensive Latin-inspired fare and is a solid downtown venue for brunch and light bites.  The arepa benny, for example, is a nice twist on the usual eggs benedict by incorporating arepas as the foundation for the poached eggs, all while adding rubbed beef and spiking the hollandaise with salsa verde. There is also a variety of coffee drinks served or prepared in different ways, whether pourover, French press, siphon, or espresso.   While the venue might look like a humble storefront like many others along this particular street from the outside, there's lots of space inside, whether at tables with folding chairs, or a living-room-like area towards the rear. Overall, a good attempt at creating a cozy, community-oriented gathering spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. arepa benny: golden poached eggs, coffee rubbed beef, grilled tomatoes, salsa verde hollandaise

mBZdI4iLQT3y4YYkQRglGg.text: This coffee shop was recommended to me by one of my friends a couple days ago.. It wasn't what I was expecting. But it wasn't bad.   Parking was on the side of the street, and had a two hour limit from 8am-6pm.  I showed up at the shop with my friend around their opening time at 7AM. There was a cute patio area at the front of the shop that I would have loved to sit at but it was a bit chilly today. We walk in & I noticed they had a hostess stand.. But no one working at the stand. It was different because I've never seen that at a coffee shop before. The space was bigger than other shops I've been, which is pretty nice because by the time we left at around 9AM, it was getting pretty busy.   I ordered a Mexican Spice Latte and an Omelet Pericos to go with it. I was completely satisfied with what I got. It was delicious. Except I paid $5.50 for my latte which was served to me in a normal sized mason jar and thought, wow that's all I get for what it costs?!   But besides that, my experience here was great. Service from our server Josh was good too! He was helpful and made suggestions and explained things they had on their menu. This is a place I would come back to and visit.

PlWIyghT3MAfEmCXCNsSfQ.text: I was really excited by the pictures, and the that they had siphon coffee meant they had some immediate cred. For our drinks, my girlfriend got an iced honey cinnamon latte and I got the Lavender Fog. Both were perfect temps, respectfully, and my tea was exquisite. For food, which was hard to choose from a thoughtful and varied menu, we chose what seems to be a house specialty, the arepa benny. It is a really cool take on a traditional egg Benedict, subbing out the English muffin for the arepa, a fluffy corn cloud. The proportions were perfect and it wasn't over sauced like many "bennys" can be. We also had the smoked lox. Perfect. Again, the proportions are what gets me, wonderful spread on the bagel, the capers and onions in good order, and great salmon. I also really enjoyed our empanadas; chicken tinga for us today. They were a crispy texture, almost like they were made of wonton wraps. Everything was awesome, including the service. Very, very happy I came here.

hB6qqLV9GiBNXttwTvNZ2A.text: My friend and I drove all the way from the NW to try this spot. Based on the reviews I was eager to be amazed. I ordered iced London Fog which was a STASH Earl Grey tea bag in a mason jar with lavender and milk. None of the flavors stood out. Apparently it started as hot tea then ice was added to the mason jar glass. The melted ice watered the tea down and was served lukewarm. I expect iced tea to already be chilled so when poured over ice you don't water down the beverage. If this is the method they use to make iced tea then add 2 tea bags to the glass so enough tea flavor is released to accommodate the extra water from the melted ice. For $5 I want to taste the tea and lavender. For food I chose the Mango Aperas. What a disappointment! If the word mango is in the name of the dish then put enough mango in it to showcase it. I got 5 matchsticks of mango that measured about 1.5" X 1/4" thick. The portion of mango looked like there was only one mango left in the kitchen and they were using it carefully to last the entire day. The sliced thin tomato, and 3 slices of avocado hardly makes this dish worth $9! Considering the location and the neighborhood their prices are way too high for the portions. I left disappointed and hungry!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iced London Fog, served lukewarm and watered down. :(
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $9 Mango Aperas. Mango.Mango? Where is the mango? There is so little of it tucked under the avocado.

2F3U7DWsFgC0q37Q-3dywA.text: Alongside their signature drink, coffee shops usually offer pastries and small salads. You can find some of the same fair here but with a Latin infusion, and those dishes are only in addition to their Hispanic inspired cuisine. Actually, this flavor flair even blends with one of their speciality coffees, the Mexican Spice Latte, which is an artful mix of subtle seeet with a savory touch. It is a refreshing change that is one of the main features that sets Makers and Finders apart.   The service and warm reception is another important element of Makers and Finders' atmosphere. The staff is always curteous, friendly, and completely skilled and knowledgeable in regards to the coffee they brew. When I first arrived, I ordered an espresso, and realizing I was new, I was told, "Just so you know, we serve doubles as the standard here. Is that fine with you, sir." Yes, yes it is. In fact, that is exactly what I want to hear from a coffee shop.  Makes and Finders offers a great environment for groups or individual dinning, providing a bar counter, formal seating, and open areas with large tables and lounging sofas. Additionally, upon request, they can serve French press coffee or stove top espresso. I will definitely visit with a group of friends some time.  Whether you are stopping in for lunch during the work-day, or visiting for a casual afternoon coffee, you will always feel comfortable, welcome, and pleased at Makers and Finders.

DfFLVpXu5Jzg2tQNrFHNuA.text: Short review: I love what they are trying to do here and the quality of their product is great. They seem to just have the typical hiccups of a newer place and that's ok. I think they're a great spot and I will be coming back.  Drinks: They have a great balance of variety versus over-abundance of choice. They have all of the standards that you would expect to find at a coffee shop, as well as choices that play more to their style (ex. the Mexican Latte). And while they do offer a good variety in drinks and brewing methods, they do not overextend themselves with choice and instead seem to focus on making a quality selection of drink. And, their sizes were great for the price. We ordered the Lavender Latte and Honey Vanilla Latte...both were delicious and the table-side drink spritz given as part of the Honey Vanilla Latte was fun.   Food: They have a good selection of food. Unfortunately, we were full and only ordered the Elvis Press sandwich, but it was awesome. I definitely get the sense that many of the menu items  were family recipes passed down and truly are comfort food.  Service: Make no mistake about it, when the staff was attending to us, they were super-friendly and helpful. But, it seemed like it took them a while to get to us. I understand how crazy things can get but it seemed like there were a couple of staff members doing some kind of work on computers off to the side of the coffee bar rather than helping guests. This was an early Saturday afternoon and still pretty busy, so I would expect an all-hands-on-deck approach rather than leaving several staff members to juggle the whole restaurant by themselves. I don't get too worked up over this because I am in the industry and I understand, I am writing this mainly for them.  Our server was fantastic (I am so sorry I do not remember his name...but I know what he looks like). He was willing to help us out, gave us suggestions and seemed to have fun with things. The busser checked with us several times and re-filled waters. And even the co-owner (if memory serves from the article I read) even stopped by and was very welcoming. Even the hostess chipped in at clearing our table and got us our check...though I felt bad for asking her for it.  Facilities: The place is well-organized, clean and vibrant. I dig the industrial, open-ceiling look that's popular right now and they do it well. They have a good amount of seating, both indoors and outdoors, and can accommodate big parties. I wasn't really a fan of the plastic seats they use, they weren't uncomfortable, just sort of gave an odd sitting position. but that's whatever lol.   Overall, this is a cool spot, I fully expect them to iron out their service and I will definitely be back again. I need to try me some comfort food while I hammer down another massive mason jar latte.

Rs-JB-2HeSOABrZbOfNBnQ.text: I love this place. Super cute and chill. Usually play good music. Coffees... bomb. Food.....bomb. The barista dude that's always there is super cool. So happy this place exists lol

wxk_BgUwqnlmY04UldgODg.text: A must-visit for any Aussies in Vegas on holiday.  I recently got back to Vegas after spending a couple of years in Australia where I ended up becoming a coffee snob due to the huge coffee culture.  Now that I'm back I realize just how difficult it is to find a decent cup of coffee in the US.  Where most American coffee places fail (especially the chains), Makers shines. I'm so glad I have this little sanctuary that reminds me of Oz. Macchiatos and flat whites made in the right size and proportion!  I've also been able to try some of their single origin brews and they've all hit the spot.  Shout out to barista Sean for a consistently amazing cup of joe and the whole staff for taking good care of me.  Haven't had a chance to try much of the food yet but when I have ordered food they are more than happy to work around any dietary restrictions.  I also love the industrial decor, the neon sign and the patio seating.  Dogs are welcome on the patio.

QO02k2ryubQHFTWjeyvmxA.text: Definitely one the must try locations for specialty coffee and satisfying American/Colombian food

1QlPCTsZ5Rolu3lF3bXutw.text: I have been in the service Industry over 20 years and making any customer wait 45 minutes for a cup of coffee is rude, inconsiderate,  and shows a total lack of respect for its customers.    Don't waste your time coming here!

JirbLFoT9sYdx-ws27iLEQ.text: I had the Kale and Mushroom Omelet which was really good.  My Salted Carmel Latte was delicious. Our sever was excellent. We will be back. I want to try  the dinner menu.

fryUmvaWB4RlvtZMRXuFEA.text: So, I love Makers & Finders. It's some of the best coffee and lattes you can get downtown. The atmosphere is incredible. The food tastes amazing. The baristas and waiters are friendly. Great location, super walkable.   The issue is, every time I go to M&F, I wait. I wait a long time. We ordered 4 drinks this morning and waiting nearly 35 minutes to receive our drinks. I ordered a cold brew. Coffee, and Ice. Cold brew. I left after 30 minutes of not receiving our drinks because I had to go to work. 15 minutes later, my friend was delivered to me at work by one of the 3 others that visited M&F with me. There were 3 other customers other than my group in the building, and all of them already had their meals/drinks. It's not that the barista or waiters were wasting their time goofing off. It was just insanely slow.   Another incident occurred when taking a lunch break for coffee. I ordered a bagel and coffee and had to wait nearly 40 minutes for a coffee and a bagel (with no meat or cooked ingredients).   I'm not a fan of yelp reviews, because, Makers & Finders deserves a 5 star in EVERY category, except for efficiency. The food is perfect. Coffee is incredible. I just can't spend an hour waiting for a coffee.

pBqsqLQInsxtq5gv6uUmsw.text: Food and coffee is superb! I love all the substances at this place. However, they need to pick up the pace. Service is ridiculously shitty. I've ordered Togo & dine in and always waited half an hour for either my bill or my order.  Not a good look and I wished their service was great otherwise I'd be a a regular on the daily

JW9InKIV36RI029Fw9CfDA.text: Best Mexican coffee and delicious food. Wish they were open longer so I could enjoy an evening coffee. Workers always friendly and make good recommendations.

tTSpjPTIBb6hBMGCLobniA.text: WOW! Their lavender & honey flavored lattes are to die for! Good little breakfast items to complement as well.

FK--oxXC9YP80-eSSa5NDw.text: I ordered the Mexican Late, and my expectations were definitely exceeded.  I accompanied it with the Arepa Benny, and everything was delicious!   I will definitely come back to try the rest of the menu!

N_aWv5Ls6H4ddrDtJY-4bA.text: YUM! What a random find! Not usually on this side of town since I am an out of towner but stayed at the SLS and wanted to find some good breakfast and definitely found it. This place is fantastic! Great coffee and DELICIOUS food! We had La Paisa and Chilequiles and loved them both. Best rice I've ever had in my life. Highly, highly recommend. Parking sucks but don't give up!!!!

03n15wFh-w8GkyA_gQh5Qw.text: Absolutely amazing! The neighborhood is kinda sketchy and the parking is almost nonexistent (just street parking and not a lot of those), but do not be discouraged by that. Service is excellent and the food is out of this world!! Very pleasant  and relaxed atmosphere. Give it a shot, you won't regret it!

lbrVAAkfD_iTkRlFgjcQew.text: The lavender infused latte is completely off the hook. The staff is friendly and so were the other customers around. A truly local feel. This is the kind of place that builds communities.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender infused latte

GFkXgdbaR4LRfrefyfFvKA.text: I stopped in after the gym for a breakfast sandwich and coffee and wasn't disappointed! The atmosphere is pretty cool, not what I expected in a good way. I got the breakfast sandwich and it was really good, just enough egg to bacon ratio on a delicious flaky croissant. I got a Mexican spice latte and was blown away! Hands down the best coffee drink I've ever tasted, I drank it slow as to savor the goodness! Lol I will definitely come back to try their other drinks and eats!!!

B56Ld0VdhagMgLM6tSBQmA.text: Enjoying my Day with my Gran, decided to ride our bikes today. Feeling Hangry, and in need of coffee. I love this spot for meetings and brunch. Happily, the warm smiles from the staff made me relieved that a 5 year old with a bike is welcomed. I love sea salt Carmel latte.My grandson loves tea Chamomile is his favorite made with a twist we both were impressed. We both love the hash and the croissant sandwich . A must the fried plantain chips gave us the carbs to complete our adventure.

gtBvOsvPN8ILPZGJycdZVA.text: We stopped in for breakfast and coffee on a Monday morning. As many other reviewers state, the lavender latte is delicious. We also enjoyed the nutella. They came out at the perfect temperature and strength. We had a breakfast egg sandwich on a bagel, and it was really good. They had this avocado cream cheese spread that added some flavor to the typical bacon egg and cheese. The guy next to us had a hash, and it looked amazing. The barista was really nice, and we will definitely return for lattes on our next trip. I can't wait to try more of their creative flavors.

s7G_koDxOC8NkrhL_MkXqA.text: Love this place!! Wish it was closer to me. I had there breakfast and it was fresh and the delivery was good. The chef even came out and checked on us. Pretty cool spot! Wish it was closer though ;(

2uaROM_X3_30ZWZHpcegPw.text: With local spots like this why do people still go to Starbucks? Stopped by for a quick coffee this afternoon, will be back to try the breakfast/lunch menu.

qZLA1h8wKuG9G3Tqq0NmFQ.text: I've seen the other reviews and photos of this coffee joint and couldn't wait to try it.  Makers & Finders Coffee is located in the Arts District and the modern decor fits right in with its neighboring proprietors.  The inside is bright and fresh and the staff members are all very welcoming.  I had brunch with my sisters and we each tried a different iced latte.  We ordered the lavender infused, honey vanilla and Nutella lattes and were dying to take a swing from each other's cup.  We were all pleasantly surprised that each one tasted wonderful.  These alone would make us come back! Which is a good thing because the food we ordered we thought was good, but nothing remarkable.  We ordered the shrimp ceviche, Arepa Benny, the veggie bagel, & the Capirotada (bread pudding). When the food came out, no veggie bagel showed up.  Instead a second Arepa Benny was placed on our table. The ceviche has a couple of shrimp shell pieces left in the dish and the Capirotada missed it's mark with the orange marmalade on top.  With that being said, I would still go back for the coffee and maybe next time just some pastry.

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Ceviche

pt4K58XPY_yAOtHz3O6Inw.text: Amazing. You have to try at least once, and I promise you'll be back again.  My husband and I had breakfast here today.  Shared a French press, and had the chicken omelette and the bacon and Brussel sprouts egg dish.  Both were delicious and so different than what you can find at other breakfast spots.  Our server Cody was awesome too. Top notch!

mlC_CY1oZHwTb-8DERoxpA.text: Everything is delicious and there's so many items on the menu to try. I got the Latin hash and the salted caramel latte. The hash was amazing the meat was super tender and the peppers were sweet and together it was awesome. The latte was so smooth and not too salty like most salted caramel items can be.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PqWI6_N8fowKl6jDHyPl0w.text: The menu is limited and the service is always slow. Expect to spend about an hour and a half there, even if you're only ordering a bagel. The coffees are good.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender latte

uZknIFnN8Ejlt4gxTY8QWA.text: Always up to try a new coffee place!  This place is located on Main St off Charleston in the Arts district area.   I had the Mexican spiced latte as wanted to try something different than a regular cup of coffee, and wow it was awesome!  Very nice flavor and spice.  Also was greeted as I entered and the overall service was good.  The only slight knock is their prices are on the high side but if you like good coffee, trendy environments and supporting  local businesses it is worth trying!

CDLGPOqlLi57PYoVRbOxmg.text: I couldn't get enough of this place! Went 3 times while we were in Vegas for the week. Bomb breakfast and coffee!! Servings are perfect I had the Lavender infused Latte...Delicious! I need to find a place by where I live that makes the same thing. I did have their regular coffee on my first visit and it was good but strong. Their chilaquiles were my favorite. Amazing place...we'll be back on our next visit

skuiZ4l6ABeH2q7zXMjWgA.text: Love their food and lavender latte. If you're in Vegas you gotta check them out! Great atmosphere and clean! Lots of different foods to choose from and like nothing else. They pair foods you would never think of pairing and it creates an amazingly wonderful taste and experience. This place is a must try you will not be disappointed, unless you don't know what good food is!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender latte yum

m6V8VA4kHUs2sOcg3MKToA.text: Requested a table rather than a seat at the bar. Although restaurant was less than half full, six + empty tables, I was told 20 minute wait. I went elsewhere rather than sit on uncomfortable stools with little space to eat. May try again if I am not alone. I suggest avoiding this place unless you are in a group.

ox7PQwOdweHdBWX8I-jioA.text: Came for the coffee, stayed longer for the breakfast. They have a great selection of coffee, teas, and other drinks and their breakfast menu caters to any cravings. We came on a Saturday for brunch and our table got the tree leches waffles (it's a wet waffle), the Latin hash, and the chilaquilles. Portions aren't large but it's enough to get you full.

Vo14mpu1zssb1bbRednY2w.text: Great find in Vegas. One of the best lattes I've had around the world. Redefined American breakfast. Busy place and I would recommend anyone to go there.

N4fDW0IQh9P5g1gB3wb8gw.text: Here's yet another establishment that thinks it's better than it's customers. First, I was expecting a more relaxed, Bohemian coffeehouse atmosphere. Instead, It was a restaurant where a pretentious waiter (complete with an attitude) wanted to tell me where to sit - really!, there's only one table occupied - There was a small area with two sofas for the chill crowd. Both sofas were occupied and I didn't want to sit in an uptight table alone. So, I sat outside on the patio.  The food was good, but it was expensive for the portion you get. The coffee was luke warm.  Too expensive and no communal feel - I'm still waiting for a cool coffeehouse to make its way downtown.  The Beat it still the best going and PublicUs loves itself more that this place does.

i7839EneBFuG5K_zn6kX0g.text: The food is good but the service was very disappointing. I sat for nearly a half hour watching the servers check in on everyone around me but had yet to even offer me a glass of water let alone take any portion of my order.

4wKWv3NRuVRgSAlwXd1nnw.text: Coffee drinks were amazing.  Hot Mexican spice latte out of this world, iced honey vanilla latte fantastic.   Don't hesitate, just try it.  Great atmosphere, coffee and food.  Chicken tinga bene was a really good choice.

TS0RY6hfeFAh6QvWEv2vNg.text: Awesome food and coffee. The staff is really helpful. It's a great spot for breakfast or coffee. If you're in the area it is definitely worth checking out.

xjMzxtFQjodeVdFHGNVrHQ.text: The best! I always get the croissant sandwich. I've been meaning to branch out and try new things, but whenever I go, I always want what I usually get. I'm a big fan of the honey vanilla latte too. :)

tSmQ3BLSNtWpVWf_dJ4QAQ.text: Our go to brunch/coffee spot in Downtown Las Vegas. Great coffee and amazing Latin food. And now they even have dinner....and their burger is to die for. Highly recommend even if you don't want coffee/food.....just say hi to the friendly staff.

DSqtbvXtWilePUrSL3af_w.text: My husband and I were visiting Vegas for a week and stumbled across this place while thrift shopping. It has a super cute patio and very nicely decorated interior.   The first time we just tried the coffee, he had a cold brew and I had their special latte of the day "honey almond latte with crushed pecans".  It was the most amazing latte I have ever had in my life. Creamy, nutty, and not too sweet. Would highly recommend.  We came back the next 3 days we were in Vegas. Mostly for coffee but decided to try out the Arepas for lunch. They were both very tasty and the plantain chips were delicious but it was a bit pricey for the serving size.   Overall I would highly recommend, especially the flavored lattes!

8GuRFx9sWfwJsaXT3geNuQ.text: Some of the best coffee I've ever had. This is a great spot on the southern side of the Arts District in Vegas that has authentic Latin comfort food as well as coffee/espresso. The space is relaxed but stylish with both indoor and outdoor seating. I stopped by for breakfast and had a delicious breakfast croissant, but almost regretted ordering it when I saw someone with the Latin hash (it looked amazing!).

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast croissant w/bacon, egg, and cheese.

kxL9gNTA0nmqiniWUXrSUQ.text: Honestly the best breakfast I've ever had. I'm in love with their ambiance AND their patio! It's definitely cool inside and cozy outside. What a great place for a meeting or breakfast with a friend. I had the beef and avocado hash. It came served in a cast iron skillet and was absolutely delicious. Is it weird that I think it was awesome to have a normal human portion rather than something I could never finish? Got the honey vanilla latte as well and it was awesome. My friend enjoyed their breakfast as well! Great idea to serve them in clear mugs. It really complements the wooden decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey vanilla latte

Lc9g2dfVdCc2TWTPQXNpBQ.text: So my drink, had the chai latte.. ehhh it was okay nothing special. I also had the empanadas and if anything that is what is getting me to return. So good, great portion and i thought they were prized correctly. Heard they have an empanada flight , getting that next time!

G3z2KCtyrQyYtdtcZZyprQ.text: Loved it, only wish I knew about them sooner. Great coffee selection yummy eats and reasonably price for Vegas.

iwLwZrKoguKsLyWadHPIow.text: One of the things I've always loved about Los Angeles, is all of the unique coffee shops. When I came back to Las Vegas to live for a little while, I was sad about the food options. I've always thought Vegas' local culinary scene needed a game changer. Makers & Finders Coffee is exceptional! Check Out My Full Review Here - youtube.com/watch?v=6dpt...

669W5vc02bl-CmK9W5CUEQ.text: Amazing breakfast and the Mexican late is the best EVA! Don't sleep on this small cozy intimate spot. Love Love Love it!!!

RammPzZtkM-cK-PGFS6mTA.text: Unique to Vegas.  A mix of Latino options for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.    Suitable local vegas craft beer options, including from the brewery next door.    Carefully prepared espresso drinks that include.  Creative takes on traditional cocktails.  Nice mellow vibe.    Friendly staff.  A nice break from the strip

t_HdsV_jWcHHf99-sfxpXA.text: This place was amazing!  The Mexican & lavender lattes were fantastic starters.  Faith took excellent care of us and then there was the food!  We had a chicken tinga omelet and a bagel sandwich, however I opted for croissant.  Both excellent.  My husband literally licked his omelet plate clean!

nToUHZXpDUzZtcE19lOA3A.text: Tried to get this 20% off the first drink check in but they don't do that anymore. Drinks are good. Food was ok. Wait time so so.

WT4i2d8DdwJjGTdntAYY3g.text: The flavor is on point when it comes to all the food but the only issue is their portions are extremely small . The pictures are deceiving lol.

50Mn5Zanb6MtVqOJRKdDmA.text: If you're anything like me you need coffee to function. I can't express how amazing their coffee and food is! There's such variety and food tastes authentic with an environment that makes you feel comfortable and relaxed. If you find yourself searching to try something new this is the place. You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SkaHw6ypPtgGctDRoBM1cg.text: M&F is a great place to start your mornings.  My son and I sat down at the bar and enjoyed watching the baristas rev up the awesome stainless steel coffee maker.....costing more than some cars in some garages.......for near perfect espressos.  If you want a substantial meal to fuel your day.....try their Bandeja Paisa platter.....comes with grilled skirt steak, fried sweet plantain, over easy egg, avocado slices, artery clogging fried pork chicharrones, spanish style rice, and black beans.......and that is just the appetizer......J/K. Seriously, though.....this is my favorite dish!  Did I mention the awesome coffee maker??????  Will come again!

oSpk9Ye8JMkH2H2rcKJpyA.text: Two words:  AWE SOME. The Lavender infused Latte was amazing. My husband had the Coconut Tumeric Latte and the Chilaquiles...eggs with tortilla chips, salsa verde, black beans, and Quedi fresco.  I had 4...yes 4 empanadas, because the first 2 were SO GOOD!   We leave this fabulous city tomorrow, but will be back for breakfast in the morning.

33MtJCqtdmDrg5UGiKRk0g.text: Good Coffee, Good Food, Good Atmosphere, the perfect farewell to Vegas after days on the Strip. The Arepas were delish.

hff7brf26B_1ggKy1E_lfQ.text: I've been dying to try this place out .... decided to give it a chance but the service wasn't all that. The food wasn't that appetizing either , the tomato soup was the only thing I enjoyed. If the service was better I would have probably enjoyed myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A-9SwJSt6NesQZ9BPy35qA.text: Such a cozy atmosphere and great food  selection. I had a Mexican spiced coffee that as wonderful I got 2 of them. Brunch is good there. They make fresh teas as well.

EGwNAoVVc_WLB90-405zpw.text: Ok. I am a fan of good coffee. Walking into the place, very impressive. I love all the different styles of coffee that you can have made for the customers' enjoyment. I ask for a specific type of coffee, being a coffee place silly me figured they would be able to assist as I like coffee but I am not an expert. I asked for moka, the coffee that is made in the special top part pot, I am not sure if he or I pronounce it right. He ask what origin, which in turn I ask what's the best one.  He offered no assistance and seem like he had better things to do. He even turned me off of wanting by saying coffee grounds would be in my coffee, with no explanation to why. Just did not feel as if the worker was up to par as this place looks amazing for coffee. Now I will probably ever know because of the customer service experience or should I say lack of.

ut7PyO9409uZSur4YNQCpw.text: Makers & Finders has a really good happy hour (that's why we went lol) and an amazing espresso martini. The food had a Latin twist to it and was pretty delicious. Their avocado salad is really refreshing and tasty, the empanadas were flames and my crew really enjoyed the poutine.   We sat outside because it was warm but it got chilly pretty quickly so they turned on the heat lamps for us which helped a little. Bomb customer service and tasty food. \  Oh, and their coffee is better than Starbucks. Yea I said it. Try their lattes and see what you think.

Xk5_gN3eXrzRajP91VJ8jg.text: Over hypered, over priced, and underwhelming  I had food delivered from this location so I cannot speak for ambiance.   However first off, took near two hours to get my food. Second the portions in relationship to the servings are terrible, they apparently think way to highly of themselves.   Now the food. I have never had such an underwhelming pile of disappointment placed before me. Took 2 bites and threw it away. I ordered an omelette with diced tomatoes, roasted peppers and cheddar cheese. I did not know you could roast peppers and remove all traces of flavor from it. I felt like I was chewing solid air. There is no flavor, variety, or even care put into this dish. Heaven forbid they be bothered to put even salt or pepper on their food. Next time I want a watery pile of mush, I will go to the store buy some canned vegetables drop in on cardboard and let it sit for a couple day.  I should of gone better food by going to the dumpster behind Dennys.    Too much money for overpriced garbage. I do not understand the good reviews. The location must look nice because they have no talent hacks cooking.

ZV42HhvqYIa8RPBpRC_bXQ.text: My husband and I had breakfast here today I read all the wonderful reviews about this markers and finders but totally totally disappointed first of all my husband ordered the latin beef hash eggs and potatoes the potatoes were sour this is a $13 dish  came with no toast paid another $3.00 fot toast that wasnt even toasted$ 5 coffee lats  I ordered regular coffee  with no refills  also which is another 3 soI ordered the empanadas which were so greasy it was running down my hands and arms I can only say that it was quaint it was clean the service was okay but very disapointing and some what expensive for what they offer and serve potatoes that are sour I'm sorry this was a total disappointment I'm a chef of 25 years and I know good food I don't need the glorified coffee that they advertise and spend so much money that it tastes just like any other place sorry

waENaljSrw2LGNRHWy3_yg.text: Quick turn and burn trip to Vegas. Searching for a good breakfast and came across this wonderful little spot. Not a long walk from Fremont.  We had the arapas Benedict with a tomatillo sauce. It was probably the best Benedict I have ever had. Also ordered a machaca and spicy chicken empanda. These were on point as well. If we were not leaving the next day, we would have came back. I will definitely eat here next time i am in vegas. Chill little spot with great customer service

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R_6v6HbdSIhHa1huSpe8Mw.text: This place is for coffee lovers! The food is good. We loved the Empanada sampler plate. A great thing to share for brunch with friends. The atmosphere is hipster casual. We had the Carmel Latte with sea salt and a French Press that serves two. I was  happy to experience a Sunday brunch in the arts district. If you love great coffee this is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Croissant Sandwich Breakfast
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanadas sampler plate

-ZA6Lpqjp2v8Vb2ZGeCkpQ.text: Love love love this place. Came here multiple times during our vacation because the food, coffee and service were exceptional.   The chilaquiles on the breakfast menu are amazing and the espresso flan is perfect (not too sweet).  The manager, Ed, chatted us up and didn't hesitate when we asked for recommendations for other places in the area to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles with soft poached eggs and avocado. They put salsa verde on the tortilla chips and it is divine.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espresso  flan

3RFquUE386PScIMVOzYPbQ.text: I'm being generous.  Turned into a 2 1/2 hour ordeal from the time we entered.  Sloooow service, marginal food.  The empanada bowl was disgustingly deep fried and greasy with barely a meat content found and was flavorless.  Best part our meal was the coffee.  Maybe that's the revelation? It's a coffee bar hangout and the food is secondary.   Waited for our waitress to bring our check then take our pymt, forever.  She seemed more interested in the convo with the hostess at the front.  Will not be returning.  Wish I coul get those 2 1/2 hours back!

sAbr11yhzlKYc_kGBrozSg.text: Latin hash has me wanting to go back.  Such a nice chill spot. Didn't get a coffee, cause I already had one at home but the quality of the service was excellent. The food was so fresh and warm. Comfort food for sure. I put the avocados on mine. Eating this dish was a reminder of sitting with my grandmother in Puerto Rico and was perfectly sized.  Amazing meal and experience.  Help local business. Great place in downtown Las Vegas.

J2OP5Ms9H8kWnj25Q174NA.text: This place is an amazing breakfast, lunch or just coffee spot with a Columbian flare!! Great atmosphere and easy to get to. They have unique coffee and breakfast options, I had the lavender infused latte and fell in love. One of the owners, Valerie, was so sweet and came to tell us about their place and wanted our honest feedback and we had nothing but great things to say. This will be our new work meeting spot :)

RK3nq-JmT84Vz4aW8vqI9A.text: I'll have to come back for a proper meal, but just had my first cup of pour over coffee (a medium roast of Bolivian origin) and it's an early frontrunner for best cup of java downtown! Staff is super friendly and place looks great, looking forward to brunching there this weekend.

fdTpzxEJRLLCAxqIUPqosw.text: Firstly, any coffee shop that offers almond milk gets extra points from me. Second, a place that can introduce me to something as novel as a Lavender-infused latte with said almond milk gets 5 stars. Well done!

Rk3zO5rcKCGUeb0hpKLXaA.text: A cozy spot off the strip that seriously exceeded our expectations!! We had the Mexican spicy cafe, shrimp ceviche... The best we ever had!! The Breakfast arepa, maple bacon, Brussel sprouts & tomato bisque... Everything... Each & every bite was freaking delicious!!! We even took 2 coffees to go... Our total bill was $63!!! We'll be back tomorrow morning! Support local businesses first!!!

G2Y1O4Qmuz4ZIQWMLHuXpA.text: Coffee is amazing.  And food is outstanding.  Super friendly service.  Would recommend to anyone in Vegas.

c3S6TmLXm0t1PMk3-VDrSg.text: The employees seem friendly but not as friendly as Publicus.  The food is pretty good and the coffee and other drinks are spot on as well.  The atmosphere is okay, I think it has potential for being a really really good place to hang out.  The parking in front is first come first serve.  I don't know if they have extra parking behind the building.  The shop is right off of busy Main Street not the best area either.  I like the vibe better at PublicUs but the food is better here.  I'm not into the sterile white tables and chairs.  It needs more character seems bland and ambiance is almost everything.  They are young so let's see what they grow up to be.

xdNxcyP-mapvNaru0BiC7A.text: Great hipster atmosphere, clean and with good wifi for working remotely. Amazing lattes with housemade syrups and tasty Latin breakfast foods (try the Latin Hash!)

WgFeTWN2NKhxWSx6aoSWQg.text: One thing off the start is that he had a notepad and did NOT write our order down  not cool ! But over all the food was great . Most items in the menu average under 10$ . I got the mushroom empanadas (I should of order 2 extra they are good ! ) but s little over price for what it is . My girl orders a veggie bagel for $9! Lol she enjoyed her lavender latte for $6 . I had the chai tea with almond milk :) everything was good the service was good and the location was fun. They have an outside patio and free wifi. Will come back when I have to meet with friends or having a meeting. Not as a personal place that've look forward going to .

WuJyL6iqSlCaxEFlfOUKSQ.text: When you are tired of Vegas and over priced crap food go to Makers & Finders for breakfast and coffee.  The coffee selections are fun and I had a Lavender coffee that was not too sweet and better than anything I had in a while;  moreover, just the regular coffee is great.  Service was fast and the staff was caring.  The food selections were great for everyone and everything tasted good (as far as all the dishes I sampled from everyone around me).  Enjoy the coffee stay for the food and more!  A quaint spot that makes you feel like a human amongst the chaos of Vegas.

gVycaQymkiavgI90eClGCg.text: This place is legit. They definitely know their coffee. Got a black Columbia pour over. So smooth. Wife got lavender fog iced. Not on menu but the guy just invented on the spot and it was awesome. I even hate lavender and I thought it was good. Not too sweet and perfect level of flavor.

gohEMhf4zzP-5QqheOsJQg.text: What a wonderful breakfast/ coffee place we found 5 minutes from Circus Circus! ! !  The omelette pericos was heavenly (eggs done to perfection) ! ! !  Coffee was so so so good ! !

yoonSWdU4cYoV5mAQ4Irgw.text: Honey Spice latte was good. I was definitely a fan of their latin hash. It was definitely tasty. Service was great too.

84PjxDksYOMP50YQdngNFQ.text: Lovely food and coffee. Hash and tinga chicken both have amazing flavors. Definitely coming back!

eLTbToZ4wi6dkXBgrM373A.text: I just found this place and loved it.  Met with a work friend for early morning breakfast.  Definitely a relaxed vibe but it was just 7:30a.  Server was cool, nice and super helpful.  Explained the menu and very friendly without being overly attentive, if you know what I mean.  We both had the Latin Hash with pulled beef and fried egg.  So good!  Oh and good coffee, lots of refills.  Will be back for sure.  perfect place to eat solo or meet up.

M8yPuEWgnhdIbpfuLxvI5A.text: So nice to have a Non Corporate coffee house ..Located off Main Street ..It has inside and outside seating ..I enjoy the vibe they have created ..Nice addition to the Area ...Enjoy

R5BgD9hDP0caTOrJxiTt1A.text: This coffee shop is our favorite:)! Everyone is super nice that works here. The lavender latte is the best latte I've ever had.

zwVjwt2HBWMNsekSnTjcFw.text: I wish they were open later when I get off work but on the days I can make it, I absolutely love it here. I always get my vanilla iced coffee with the sliders. AND BANANA CHIPS!!! super yummy!

LOosBp4ktM-cWsPBQbRJ7Q.text: Ok this is third time here and I have not been  disappointed. First of all great atmosphere and very clean. Second of all the fella that makes the coffee has a gift. I'm a cream and sugar kind of person but not here. Food is delightful and super flavorful. Today I had the something hash. Basically potatoes and pulled pork with veggies and extra delish.   I definitely recommend!!

KzlASPqp_sONVN9NRopuBw.text: Very nice and unique place that lives up to the revitalization of the downtown area. Coffees are fantastic!!

xwxruyQtZP9uOpyVn-qt9w.text: Bro, what a great spot!  A chick I was with here called it delightful. I overheard someone saying something about it being orgasmic. My brain and taste buds registered top points with the Cuban Espresso. Coconut Turmeric Latte... Holy-S it is the best Latin latte I've had in the past 30 years - I'll throw in a period dot there.

2iD9YQpDiiU1kpg4TxcpYQ.text: I got the La Paisa arepa, lavender infused latte, and espresso flan for brunch today. I love strong, complex, and unusual flavor combinations and this place is very special and original for being able to pull that off. Everything tasted amazing and was reasonably priced. I've been craving hipster brunch cafes for a while now. Being new to Vegas, this was a very pleasant discovery which reminded of the hipster yuppie businesses in Boston that I love so dearly. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Another reason to explore and fall in love with Downtown Las Vegas.  Verdict: muy muy excelente y delicioso!

l5-9Spc6Eq3vT3cqd7s1bw.text: This place is perfect. The atmosphere is pleasant and relaxing. The service was efficient and courteous. The food is outstanding. Each individual component is fresh and delicious and the seasoning is really well done. I had the breakfast bagel and espresso and it was an absolute dream. I highly recommend this establishment

KdTX8N5K8X5Foy-GvNa-xA.text: I love that we found this place. They have amazing coffee and food for a great price. I'm moving to Vegas soon and can't wait to come here more often.

kUG1_EIlHi_3ie_L8Og6gw.text: One if the best coffee spots we have ever visited!! The lavender latte is to die for. And the best breakfast I've had in a very long time. Best coffee house in Vegas by a mile!!!

vytRYNffvMonB-COxcyyWw.text: This is best breakfast place downtown. Great coffee and tea selection. Not too busy. The food is wonderful been here a couple times and want to come try everything on the menu. Prices were. Server Cynthia is awesome and was very helpful! Yay.

2HIRiLHmBqmIz02CdRxrwQ.text: We were visiting Las Vegas and wanted to go to NOT a buffet on the strip, and this place caught my eye! Totally worth it, I will be going here every time I am out in Vegas for work or play! Had the best waffles, and the lavender infused latte was heaven! I highly recommend it! Our servers were all incredibly kind and helpful too, especially considering we were in a large group with a LOT of kids! We never felt judged (that honestly never happens) and the kids had a great time and loved their food too! Will be back for sure!

1TAYBm7Cu492Hb46FL4Wvw.text: Great coffee and expresso drinks.  Terrific small plates with a South American flair.  Loved the mashed yucca, cerviche and the stuffed avocado.  Good brunch.  My wife was disappointed in the kale salad but I am not a kale connoisseur so I do not know a good one.  On Main Street where parking is a challenge at times but worth walking a block or two to hang out here for a while and enjoy life.

cJHVtOVUjZ1DB3Bc5s4y3Q.text: Left a mediocre review awhile back & finally got around to going again. To be honest I was nervous because I was contacted by Omar, the manager because of my review (he was very polite & wanted to prevent the situation from happening again) so it shows that they care about their customer's experience. Very genuine people! When I went in I sat at the bar again & was automatically greeted by Ruben. I was super awkward since it turned out he recognized me from my review  But he was very chill & attentive. You can tell he was genuine the entire time. When Omar contacted me he offered me a free drink next time I came in but I personally didn't wanna bring that up  I didn't want anyone to know I wrote that review xD But nonetheless, Ruben comped my drink. I never even brought it up so I was taken by surprise. SO FUCKING SWEET! He apologized for my last experience which I didn't expect at all! Definitely give these people a try! They're worth it! P.S. I had the veggie bagel this time, AMAZING.

LVgvYwj-SVLgGujoTLPbSA.text: It's a great way to hangout with their amazing wifi connection, cool ambiance and your go-to neighborhood coffee shop. Definitely does not feel like you're in Vegas, which is a good thing for me. I moved from the midwest, and this area feels like Broad Ripple in Indianapolis or Bucktown from Chicago area where you and your local friends can hang out or just have a date with yourself. Servers are very accommodating and friendly, knowledgeable of their selections too. The food is good and well described, the menu is simple. I recommend everyone trying the lavender infused latte, this is their signature drink.

72GRXnX2gRdXSxGqHioJnA.text: This place is bomb.com! The chai tea latte is my favorite. This place is a small cafe and they offer unique food options that are absolutely delicious. You cannot go wrong with the tomato bisque soup for a light lunch.

Food is awsome urban style normal size plates, very fresh and unique cuisine.  the vibe is awesome too young people come to this place its a great experience for locals to have.

hFKki2tpo_7cojBQJAa6Ng.text: This little gem is a great spot to chill and have some excellent coffee.  The empanadas where a spicy delight and the latte was a fusion of flavor well balanced and tasteful.  I will be coming back again to this spot. If you want to go to a cool, chill, and flavorful spot with mellow music.. This is the jackpot!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was some of the best coffee i have had in a long time... Fresh and full of flavor.  I will defitnetly be coming back again.

yXWuxUWsXTJP7MhMx1Yzyg.text: Amazing food and the service is fast and courteous. Definitely will be coming here again.

j6eHk9QpCx0EK9MVXUhK-A.text: THANK YOU YELPERS!!! This was a great pick from Yelpers reviews. Was looking for something different away from the strip and a place with good food and coffee.  Well this is the place. Great food and great service.... Can't ask for anything more.   I had the Arepa Benny dish which was recommended by the waitress and it was perfect.  Thank you Yelpers!

The staff are very nice, the Ambiance is as Vegas should be with its industrial look interior. This is how Vegas should strive to be especially for the locals. We will be making this a definite stop as frequently as possible.

9zM5CLdWUqUSyufHSdr9iw.text: This is probably my favorite coffee shop since moving to Las Vegas. They have the best coffee. My favorite during summer time would have to be a Vanilla Chai and during the winter a Mexican spice latte. They also have amazing food. I've gone 3 different times and there food is to die for. Their staff is all amazing and very friendly. A place that is a must while visiting Las Vegas.

31tnqF9wFTRA3xaP3Vcn8g.text: When I first met the founders of Makers & Finders, Josh Molina and Valeria Varela I knew that both of our companies have something in common. Passion and Knowledge for our industry. I was impressed by the understanding they had on the wonderful coffee world . Since that day I knew I wanted to be part of the Makers & Finders family.  As one of the owners of Sin City Coffee & Beverage I am always proud to say that they are one of our best partners. They perfectly portrait the same philosophy our company was founded on.  The environment, efforts and dedication M&F team members put every day is what makes this place to be considered one of the best Coffee/ Restaurant in town. Thank you for letting us be part of this amazing family!!

09LDzYVmqkBx2y3UBVMTWQ.text: I LOVE IT HERE. Hands down my favorite coffee shop in Vegas. Super cute aesthetically, first of all, and the servers are so darn friendly. I've had a great experience each time. I love bringing my laptop and books here. My favorite drink is the salted caramel latte, iced, with an extra shot. Without the extra shot, it's too milky tasting for me. As for food, my favorites are the croissant sandwich, the grilled chicken arepa, and the lomo saltado. I love all these things so much I'd get them delivered to my work (through postmates) which thankfully isn't too far off. My only other wish for this place is that it was open later :( They close at 4 on the weekdays and at 3 on Sundays.

C6fyWi4U60WRF6bvDWQoiQ.text: Finally made it to this place. Super cool vibe, very knowledgeable about heir coffee and of course really good pour overs. If you're going downtown and need a pick me up, stop by this place

sJqfH5ABSdBxPuyQqbCcWg.text: AREPAAAAASSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS!!!!  Wooooohooooooooo!  I really loved their lavender coffee and hibiscus tea. So refreshing and sweet just enough. I tried the arepa with mozzarella, peppers, and avocado lime cream and It was super delicious!!! (Raja)

OfLhXqwRC9hFY_U7_Nqj4Q.text: My family and I decided to have brunch here on Xmad Eve. The place was packed when we arrived and we were told it would be a 20min wait for table of 4. There were some seats by the front door so we decided to grab coffee and wait. It took 15 mins for us to receive our coffee (2 brews and 2 lattes), even though people walking in after us received their coffee upon ordering. The barista apologized when I finally asked, but it was clear they simply forgot our order. Then when we were finally seated, it took another 10-15 mins before a waiter finally approached us with water. Mind you, there were only a couple of tables at this point and most of the diners around us were finishing up their meals. I expressed my frustration to the waiter, and he was nice and apologetic while explaining they were shortstaffed due to the holiday. Fine, that I can understand but even still....We quickly placed our orders and the food arrived within about 10mins. As someone who grew up eating Latino/Hispanic inspired food, I must say I was not impressed. Food was mediocre, meat and rice not well seasoned at all, and beans tasted like they came straight out of can. What I enjoyed most was my side of maduros and yucca frites, but how can you mess those up right?. I'm giving this place 3 stars for ambiance and the coffee was good (when we finally recieved it), but food was just okay. I'm not even counting off for the poor service we received. Modern, cool looking space, but subpar food.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s good to be here

7MQZsQTXwB46i151LmmMHQ.text: Wonderful atmosphere and customer service! Thank you for the Flan  with expresso it was delicious and thank you for making it special on my Birthday

0O_zziZbZOiWXCW_HQ0AlQ.text: This is my absolute favorite brunch spot in Vegas. I live in LA but my fiance works out here a lot so when I get the chance to come with him, we always go here for breakfast/lunch. It is the BEST!! The food is insanely delicious and the coffee, especially the iced lavender latte, is to die for. As far as the food, La Paisa Arepa is my go-to but the Arepa Benny and the Latin Hash are also amazing. Because this place is my favorite, when I decided to have my bachelorette party in Vegas, it was a no-brainer that we would come here. All my girlfriends raved about their food and coffee. We even had some lavender mimosas. Gah. Seriously, I almost hate them for making everything so perfect. Um if you guys decide to expand, please set up shop in East LA!   I also just want to give them a shout-out for being so kind to me and my friends. I get that bachelorette parties can be annoying to have in your restaurant, and some businesses treated us that way, which was upsetting for me as they were also places I put a lot of thought into picking when showing my girlfriends a good time. Makers & Finders though, you guys were awesome! You were attentive, funny, and friendly. Thank you for being a highlight of my bachelorette. And I mean it about it opening in Los Angeles! Think about it :).

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NUMd74RzeSLfTJmdSQhmTw.text: After a couple days eating expensive, unmemorable food on the Vegas strip, we stopped here along the way to downtown LV for some good lunch/brunch food. I was drawn to their breakfast, brunch and Latin food when I looked them up. The ambiance is casual but a bit hipster. Hipster or not, the customer service was good, they make you feel welcome and at home. We ordered the Latin Hash breakfast and the Bandeja Paisa Lunch. The Latin Hash had such an amazing flavor; the meat was tender and juicy. Potatoes and peppers were tasty with a little heat but it was manageable. The Bandeja Paisa was satisfying as well; it's a good dish to order if you're really hungry. Finally, I wanted to mention the cold brew coffee. The fact that I didn't veer off and order one of their many other coffee drinks is amazing, because I was VERY tempted. But their cold brew was smooth and flavorful, not bitter, nor an acidic taste. Because of this, I didn't use as much half & half as I usually would do elsewhere. The prices here are reasonable. A really good experience overall.

FtPlzbkW8b9Qu_6W-84T8g.text: Came here for a yelp meeting. & this place is amazing! I tried their iced lavender infused latte which was soo good, not strong in flavor at all! As well as their empanadas, it was so flakey and bigger in size than i expected. I don't usually come downtown so meeting here i got kind of nervous especially because parking can be a pain. But there is 2 hr parking on the side on the street & in front (thank goodness) fairly small place but a great one at that.. definitely plan on coming back to try other items i didn't get the chance to my first time.

ld3vgV7VbJbOJHuG38-K9w.text: I came to have brunch here, the service awful!! I asked to be seated outside, where there were several other tables, waited 20 min nothing, no water, nothing. I went back inside, girl asked again if I'm dining in or out I said I just wanted to get an order to go now, after waiting for 20 min. I place my order 15 min later I get my food.

zSr8jw939SHqBgUWHje1GA.text: Every time I come here the service, food and drinks are always excellent. I can't help but bring friends and family here because it's such a hidden gym and yesterday was no different. Everyone enjoyed everything! We had arepas, cerviche, a Cajun chicken sandwich and empanadas. We also had two mimosas and a tai tea. Everything was delish. The only issue I had was that I had to physically get up and go to pay because despite waiting and waiting, then asking the hostess to get our server for the check and leaving my card on the table no check was ever brought over. It was at near closing time and the place was clearing out so I'm giving a pass but it was definitely an error for a place that usually does everything perfect. Until next time M&F but please, take my money when it's time to go! PLEASE! :)

6iA763AVMbyaXQe1AEKj-Q.text: My friend and I stumbled upon this coffee shop since we were in the Antique Alley Main street to do some vintage hunting.  As soon as we walked in, the coffee smelled amazing and we both had our eye on the salted caramel latte!  We shared a breakfast empanada which from the flakiness we could tell it was made fresh!  The staff was super attentive, and it really felt like we belonged as part of the neighborhood.  We liked it so much, we came back bringing more girlfriends and had lunch there too!  Everything was good and didn't disappoint!  Definitely on my list of places to eat whenever I come back to Vegas and do shopping on Main Street!

byrlj8Zd72KnAbLGNNxQ6Q.text: I'm in love with this restaurant!!! I couldn't be happier to visit them at their new location as well! I can't wait to go try their lunch menu I can not change my breakfast plate since I love it so much.  The coffees are amazingggg!!!!! I love how they have unique flavors that combine perfectly. I love the authentic Mexican cuisine they created and every time it comes out right. The service is great too the staff keeps Up with you and makes sure you are comfortable and enjoying your food.   Go visit them and try them yourself you won't regret it!   I had the lavender latte and the chilaquiles.

cYBCRIAUz0mmue0GPZaLPA.text: I'll take a Nutella white mocha latte please. On ice in the summer heat...  Love the coffee here! The honey vanilla and coconut turmeric lattes are also fabulous and this vibrant coffee house brews up all sorts of fun drinks and they also offer Latin bites. Favorites for breakfast are the Latin hash and arepa benny and for lunch I enjoy the empanada sampler which comes with 5 different empanadas!   It's a cool downtown spot with fun art and details and lots of comfy seating inside or outside.
