WS5se8ctfh8lu-7S6oB9eA.text: Food was amazing but we got our drinks at the end of our meal, bartender gave our waiter attitude when she told him we didn't want them anymore.

O76HDV5op5g6UsuvQenwig.text: We came to Buffalo exchange and got there an hour early. We were looking for a cuppa coffee and ended up at makers and finders. We ordered the breakfast empanadas which were outstanding. The outer crust kind of reminded me of the McDonald's apple pie back in the day. One of those dishes you'll end up craving. The coffee was Rich the service was good all be it took a long time. Place was packed. We will definitely be back. My wife Ethel also loved the place.

PLpzUIFIiuFj1UeXIcNtjg.text: Came to shop Buffalo Exchange got there an hour early so we decided to go across the street for a quick bite and a cup at this lovely establishment. Breakfast empanadas were out of this world flaky light crispy and in an odd way the outside crust reminded me of the McDonald's apple pie that came in that little box. Coffee was dark and yummy. Service was kind and on point all be it a tad slow. We will be back . Been gone 10 minutes and I'm already craving those breakfast empanadas.

8yt3OHy0UVOgN5nd6iOvvw.text: I'm from Seattle, so I have a pretty large amount of experience visiting coffee shops and cafes. This place was so much fun. It's located in the art district of Vegas, so it has a fun hipster vibe to it. The interior design was really cute and very photogenic. Our server was super nice and did a really good job on checking in with us and getting our food and drinks quick. I had the vanilla honey latte, and I'm so glad I did. It was absolutely delicious, might have been my favorite latte thus far.   We also tried the lavender latte and that was a great contender for coffee drinks. Definitely get off the beaten path of Vegas brunch and come check out this place, it's a quick Uber ride off the strip.

adxVQw5PyJGxxo_doFq-8w.text: The coffee and food were delicious. I ended up getting the tumeric, cinnamon latte with the Latin hash.   The latte naturally comes with two espresso shots, I asked for 1 and received a cup of java with cinnamon on top. After I mixed it in and drank it, it was so creamy you couldn't even taste the tumeric.   The Latin hash came out on a skillet. Good portion and tasted like someone put care into their cooking.  Would definitely recommend as a must try brunch place in Vegas.

6H3fY9QyNUvnw9dOZ0-AlQ.text: My favorite coffee shop  I tried salted caramel latte, it was so good I love it !  For parking, I can park my car next restaurant for 2 hours for free  Price was regular  Menu was easy to read  I love my coffee and my omelette!

bGLnaltQjNfcpKNZkQ3OSw.text: Outstanding coffee and food with an eclectic atmosphere!  If you're in the area stop in you won't be disappointed!!  Try the veggie eggs benedict and honey vanilla latte!

ndzwmsUln6-6DyIPsTBLBQ.text: Decided to go here for brunch on Saturday around 1pm. Got here with a party of 4 and the wait time was 20-30 minutes.. cool we decided to wait. 30 minutes later we ask the hostess how much longer the wait will be? She said another 15. We waited soooo long just to be seated in a table that was "reserved" and had been empty all along since we first got here. Seriously??? When I brought this to the hostess attention she didn't seem to care one bit.  Anyways we tried to look past the wait time and ordered some drinks which were good. We then ordered our food & maybe 20 minutes later received most of our food except one. We waited another 10 minutes and someone said it'd be right out. 3 out of the party we're done eating by the time the last plate came out so we decided to get it to go.  Honestly, everyone here was either running around or standing around. No one seemed to have a certain job to do and when we asked for a to go box and our check, one waitress passed the job on to another waitress. At the end someone else got us our check and our to go box. Definitely won't be back.

xAvq9MaGDwbPXHTu1hcemQ.text: This place is very hip and trendy. Located in the ARTS DISTRICT/ DTLV AREA. We came on a busy morning/lunch day considering that it was a holiday today. The hostess had a warm welcome, awesome ambiance and vibe. The Latin dishes were great, I got their popular Arepa benny which has a lot of great flavors, and a simple Belgium waffle for the baby. Spanish rice and black beans had good flavor. The Drinks are great also. Try their "lavender latte" nice aroma. The only downside was the wait time for our drinks and food, but again they were busy and the server was nice.

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AREPA BENNY

vIlkvI_HP47uOZHYFY1iLg.text: Great brunch/ lunch spot. The service is always great and They have a small but cute patio so you can bring your fur children. They have a really good coffee selection. The lavender latte is my go-to drink. The elote cupcakes are definitely something you can't get anywhere else.

0Q4ZPAAb8wwTr0Uf5wD4Mg.text: Just don't try to order a coffee.  I so wanted to like this place.  I just moved into the area and was looking for a cool place.  I went with a friend on a Wednesday morning and there were only 2 other people eating inside but I counted at least 3 employees. We ordered a black coffee and a cappuccino and then asked for a moment to review the menu.  After a few minutes we then ordered some breakfast.  After about 10 minutes I asked the waitress if we could get the coffee as the barista was just sitting there talking with 2 girls who came in.  (Keep in mind I ordered a black coffee).  The waitress said "our coffee comes from the bar" and then just walked away without trying to get our coffees.    Then a guy comes out with our food.  I pointed out that we were hoping (and had asked) to have our coffees before our meal or at least while we waited to order.  He seemed shocked and kind of ran around to find out where our coffee was.  Then the waitress came over and said that the barista was out of coffee and had to make a new batch for us.  We ended up cancelling the coffee.  Listen - the food is solid but this is NOT a coffee shop.  They had no coffee at 8:19am on a Wednesday and it took over 15 minutes and asking 2 people for an update for them to make a black coffee... complete fail.

KCFrRnqi3YT5n9UAqC50pw.text: First time in the Arts District and I had this place bookmarked for a while so me and the boyfriend went for brunch. We arrived around 12 and this particular location is a lot smaller than the Summerlin location I'm guessing. There was a 15min wait unless we wanted to eat outside so we decided to wait. We waited on the patio which is bigger than the restaurant but still cozy and inviting. Our server was Israel he was great and very attentive checking on us throughout our meal. We started with the shrimp ceviche with plantain chips OMG it was delicious. For drinks we had the black tea and beermosa very refreshing and equal parts of beer and juice. For our entree it was a tough decision trying to decide what to get since everything on the menu sound sooo good but we decided to go with the skillet chilaquiquiles and added short-rib and he had the veggie Benny (yes he is the healthy one). When the skillet arrived I immediately thought it was not enough food but I was wrong. The short rib was cooked perfectly with so much flavor and I loved how the egg was the base of the skillet. We had a great meal and I would like to come back to try other dishes. PS on Sunday's they close at 3pm so come early it gets packed!!!

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles skillet with short-rib

Deqvei5yJTxBlifmiyR9Xg.text: Went to brunch with my good friend, nice atmosphere. The outdoor seating is perfectwhrn the weather is nice.  Food was amazing. I felt that home cooking sensation times three!! I was going to get something simple but I went all out and got meat for breakfast! Haha Would definitely come back some time!

kQ3CXxxUIeTn6ROpKVgddQ.text: A cute cafe in the Arts district. The coffee is great. I had the coconut turmeric latte--delicious!  The food was good, but not great. The dough for the empanadas is more like a puff pastry, and the filling-to-wrap ratio was a little too low. The bandeja paisa was A LOT of food and proteins. The steak was a bit overcooked and dry. It comes with a 1 inch-wide strip of pork belly, not to mention a fried egg and avocado, beans, plantains, and rice! Aside from the steak, everything tasted good, but it was way too much food.  The service is very friendly. I'd definitely return for the coffee!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut turmeric latte and Bandeja paisa--TONS of food!

ajb6ArAz352cp9cAVUpCPg.text: Food was delicious! Was in Las Vegas for a short trip, and was told about this place by one of the Uber drivers. Definitely worth it.

_arx3f30euFUsjE2-mVN5w.text: I am so glad for Makers & Finders. From the beginning a few years ago - I was excited for a quality coffee spot downtown - along side places like Public Us and Vesta Coffee - Makers & Finders is the OG and another gem.   The staff is always friendly and helpful - and I find their product to be really quality, and the food delicious and filling. There isn't much else to say other than - thanks! See you soon.

cgUe0HTogDrXr3Tdwrv0jw.text: We all decided to come here for fathers day and had such a great time I have no choice but to leave a 5 star review. Tiffany was our waitress and she did an incredible job with such a large group. I just want to say thank you for the amazing fathers day experience.

Pqn_VNhYqzy4Z98i8PjHgQ.text: Ceviche- Very good flavor, I really liked it because the amount of acidity In the dish  Coffee- Tasty  Bullet proof coffee- This is the real deal, it gave me energy the entire day! A+ worth the money   Chilaquiles w/ chicken tings- Not bad, needs work. I don't like how the egg is on the bottom, I wish it would have been on top. All the chips were soggy, I wish there would have been some crunchy chips in the dish as well. Maybe some sour cream and pico would have been nice as well.   It's a little over priced for what this restaurant has to offer. Especially for Vegas the prices are too much.   Cute atmosphere, located on a street with antique stores super cool!  Waitress was whatever a little too blah, she didn't try to rearrange the table even though I got multiple dishes. The hostess on the other hand was very nice.   The outside patio was cute.

Gc51_6mu3Ap3PwB3qsphkQ.text: I really enjoyed this place. The vibe was great. Both the hostess and the guy who took our order were really nice, super chill. And weren't overly pushy. I love little hipster places. And I seek out the best possible food I can find while travelling. I will be back!

I4XpqY7j7NdE9p93czxRYg.text: My go to breakfast joint on the way out of Vegas! Their lavender lattes are a lot of fun! The lavender is very subtle but adds a little complexity and fun to an already great cup of coffee!   Their food is great for brunch. Arepa bennys? Yas please!!

CoRnWvCKf-xtzjIdwWGmVA.text: Chill, vegan/vegetarian friendly place! The waiters were so kind and very welcoming. They had bottomless mimosas on the menu! Definitely would come back!

BTry65Kywoy2CLAI3U9RLA.text: Main St location. Another Yelp find searching for coffee pour-over, this place is amazing for 3rd wave single origin plus Latin American inspired food. We ordered a round of Colombian pour-overs and one siphon. Great coffee but the siphon was $9 and was no better than a pour-over. We all ordered chilaquiles which tasted amazing and price/portion appropriate. Tip: if you're a coffee geek order some toast to be served with your drink as the flavors of food will overwhelm your ability to taste the coffee. The food is not super spicey but has a lot of flav

Xn6FXX5Vvi_tvB2y9h1ccw.text: This is a 4.5 I'm rounding up to a 5. Really big a fan of this place. So much so that I came here for breakfast twice out of 3 days while in town and will definitely stop in on future trips. I was in town for work and found Makers & Finders to be a great start to my day. The atmosphere is clean, open and welcoming. Their food and coffee were on point too.  I had their Chicken Tinga Benny and Arepa Benny, both of which were great. Their salsa verde hollandaise was delicate and flavorful. The rest of their menu sounds great too. I'll have to try their Coconut Tres Leche Waffle next time and since they offer it with the option of adding bacon, that should be a great sweet and savory combo. Their espresso was nice and bold and service across the board was excellent.  Definitely a go to spot to good food, great coffee, and fantastic service.  P.S. Super easy street parking right in front doesn't hurt either.

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ITuTjVGOLVZ6vRHJGqCu9Q.text: A great down town spot for breakfast and lunch. The lavender latte is an absolute winner!! And cocktails on the patio is a lovely way to spend an afternoon.   Cody, Jessie, Misha and the whole staff have a friendly rapport with each other and their customers. Would absolutely recommend to locals and visitors alike!!

IijXi0QXUPk4BECTM6d5Hw.text: The longest wait ever for a coffee! No exaggeration, didn't just feel like it, it really was  15-20 minutes.  A couple waiting in front of me was so annoyed with their long wait they grabbed my coffee and left. I let the staff know and instead of making my coffee right away, they continued with the orders piled up and put my replacement coffee behind those. I got an apology. But I should not have had to wait through orders placed after mine. A comp really would have been the appropriate to do. I will not return.

7JPXDpsJO8X-Ye99wgmEDA.text: Well, I know discovered bottomless mimosas last time I was here but finally made it back to try it out and was extremely underwhelming. Waited 40 mins for a non-toasted bagel (????) and lots of service delays overall. Unimpressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KmNyEsnDFajVV4tZpTiSaA.text: Tucked away in the Arts District of Downtown Las Vegas is this wonderful gem.  Parking is scarce due to endless construction but if you get here early, you'll be able to park directly across the street.    I brunched here with my wife, brother and sister in law during the weekend and was impressed with the restaurant. They serve Latin Style Hash, Empenadas and of course coffee/lattes.   We were seated immediately and placed our order within 10 minutes.  Drinks came out quickly and food came out maybe 10 minutes after.  The ambiance is perfect for one on one conversations or large groups.  The decor is simple and eclectic. With patio seating, lounge seating and formal dining seating, this place has enough room for everyone.   Our coffee/lattes were perfect in size and flavor.   The service is prompt and friendly.  Drinks are refreshed, plates cleared and follow ups were frequent.  I'm glad my wife chose this place, as we were able to enjoy a delicious meal, lengthy conversation and a great place to relax away from the hustle and bustle of the Las Vegas Strip.  I'll be back for sure when we visit paradise again.  Kudos to Makers and Finders Coffee for providing a chill place to enjoy a chilled drink or two or three... Did I mention they also serve liquor!?

Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good!

r-OzaG3LSConeFPohzNyTg.text: I been to this place many times (brunch and bottomless mimosas) with decent service until this past weekend (2/9/19) where I took my partner and 9 of our closes friends to brunch with prior reservations for our birthday but it still took them 20 mins for us to be seated.   Placing food and drink (bottomless mimosas) was quick however our food came in 60 mins after ordering and drinks 45 mins after. Everything was going decent until we were abruptly stopped by our waiter about an hr into our meal that "the manager was cutting us off" with only 2 drinks in our mimosas because a party of three whom was carrying non-concealed guns (yes I know it's okay in NV) made a smart comment to another waiter on how we were "loud" with that particular waiter making a smirk and saying "I'll take care of them."  So without prior WARNING they stopped us (a minority group consisting professionals and paraprofessional Asians, Pacific Islanders, and African American), served us our $500 bill, packed the food immediately, and asked us to leave.    We were laughing and having a good time until racism hit.

jxgjbz_V4RbnS_fOEQn9hA.text: The food here was so good it makes me wish I lived near Vegas!! I went with two other people who also loved their dishes! It's a Latin American menu and I had the ribeye and eggs, it was cooked perfectly and had so much flavor. The place is spacious and has bright/clean decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye and Eggs Breakfast

UKA8aR2-F-ZfyEQZzptd0g.text: My wife and I were visiting from out of town for a couple of friends' birthdays. We came to Makers & Finders for brunch last Saturday to celebrate. Our group of 11 had a reservation, however, when we arrived we waited for a table to be prepared. It wasn't a long wait so we were ok with it.  When we were seated, everyone at our table ordered bottomless mimosas. Though we were directly beside the bar, we waited over half an hour for our first round of drinks. When the drinks came, a few of them were incorrect. Knowing that our group was large, we didn't make a big deal of it. Our server, Marquee, brought the correct drinks rather quickly and he was very pleasant. Our food came about an hour after putting in the order with the first round of drinks. We were out as a group of close friends for a celebration so naturally, laughter and conversation a bit louder than average may be expected. If we were an annoyance to anyone, we were not informed or given any type of warning. Our server came to us about an hour and a half into our visit and told us that the manager is cutting us off from anymore alcohol. No warning or request to settle down.  It's safe to say no one in my group of 11 will be visiting here again. 4 out of the 11 are Vegas residents. We spent over $500 and I hope they appreciated our money, because they definitely did not appreciate us as customers.

Mj2bQm3VMVFAHAKeuleQyg.text: Sorry the rating is False  Today i needed to get up and ask for menu  After had get up ask to place my order  After ask for paper napkins   After i had ro show a hair in my soup  He went into the kitchen and came back said it it was an onion   Cook or raw Onion  doesn't spring back in a Curl    Lazy staff soup couldn't eat either   Save your money

m8WJFpAf_2Ha7lzggz711A.text: The first time I came here it made me feel weird when she sat my cup of coffee in front of me...why? because we have the same glassware at home :)   She even brought my ice water in a Ball just like I drink it at home :)  Since the lame draft above^ I have been here a million times. Why? That lavender latte with almond milk!!!! Iced in the summer, warm in the winter!  They also have very yummy vegan empanadas. Wowza the mushroom one I could eat everyday!!!

hfoXZHqrY8sYSK7n47olSA.text: First visit. Love the atmosphere. The service left a little to be desired. It seemed the hostess area and servers weren't on the same page. Or maybe there was no hostess as my server both sat people and took orders, maybe that's why it was slow.  As for my meal, it was great. Had the steak skillet, egg white skillet and berry waffle. Everything tasted great.  I'll for sure back for sure.   Went back 2 weeks later, same time. The service was better. Ordered the Latin hash... great dish. I'm going through the coffee bar menu also, there are a lot of really good choices. Still 4 stars. I still think they need to add a server in the morning.

vTZWTIXLjy_BNyYBUCMQkQ.text: Ever since I decided to become vegan full time I've been making it a point of mine to find really cool vegan friendly restaurants. A friend of mine actually suggested we go there. We met for a lunch date and it was a cute little spot with indoor and outdoor seating. We were greeted and sat within about 2-3min which was surprising because it looked pretty busy at the time we went. The service was great and the vegan empanadas were amazing! I tried the soyrizo and spicy mushroom the seasoning on the crust was perfect! The rice and beans that accompanied the empanadas were flavorful too! The food was so good I went back with my girlfriends after work on a Saturday for the mimosas

yJcG8nD1PZs2A01Dr7vkgw.text: Food was excellent however the service really let them down, this was all down to the waitress I'm afraid.  Baristas finished our drinks and then they sat for a LONG time before I asked the bus boy about them.  Waitress also didn't get the food order correct. The place is over staffed but this does not equate to good service. I hope for their sakes that it's just the one waitress with the problem or that she was just having s bad day.  Otherwise a nice little hipster place with service that is a bit too casual for my taste.  Hipsters take your ironic beard or moustache here but have a Starbucks to feed your addiction first or you'll pull your beard out.

Ct9Yvm9hB5i2AIH4P7wAdQ.text: Downtown is getting cool. The new blood going there shows. You find any of this cool stuff outside of downtown in this city. Live music in the am. Great food. Nice people and hot babes. I'd like them to put ice in their water when they greet you however. But other than that small hiccup. It was great.

j-tmbapDYslKFJnxdJadjg.text: We went here for breakfast and it was SO GOOD! I got the brussels and bacon skillet after our waitress recommended it. It was unlike anything I have ever had for breakfast but I am so glad I tried it! The coffees were also very very good! 10/10 would recommend the honey vanilla latte! We will definitely remember to come here again when we come back to Vegas!

CXLBwiOhLGbgR4kP4erRUw.text: This is one of my favorites brunch spots in Las Vegas the atmosphere of this location is very relaxing. Their lavender latte are by far their flagship product. The perfect balance of espresso and floral sweetness. The baristas here are some of the sweetest people you'll meet. I strongly recommend coming to makers for brunch . If you don't have anything to do on a Friday night I also recommend coming here around 6 or 7pm for dinner and take a seat at the bar and chat with the baristas. Overall this place is worth trying out if you love brunch, coffee , cocktails, and Latin food.

3l9IlZA59kl-7PXJSflGmg.text: We walked in and wanted to sit at a table near the bar. The bartender told us to sit against the wall. We said we wanted this table. He wasn't happy about it, but let us sit there. Our server was really nice.   We ordered Yuca Croquettes, Strawberry & Mango Salad, Spicy Mushroom Empanada, Shrimp Ajillo Empanada for food. We drank Thou Shall Matcha and Mexican Spice Latte. The food was flavorless. I thought it would be tasty since it's Latin food. The Matcha drink was so mild. The Mexican Spice Latte tasted like a Chai.  The decor inside is really cool and artsy.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Ajillo &amp; Spicy Mushroom Empanada

1StmqPGMilsaM00HqmOprQ.text: So I am pretty harsh consumer.  I believe if I am paying you, you should go the extra mile to fake that you appreciate it.  Makers and Finders is out of my way.  I have to drive a while to get there.  I never have had a bad experience here.   Today, I didn't know what to get.  I ordered the double  espresso and took a chance on some avocado toast.  Sounds like it won't be that great.  The waiter there was very attentive and the food came out on time but get this, the food was delicious.  I don't know what they do to make it so much better than I can make it, but it was very yummy.  I asked for scrambled egg instead of the way it normally comes out.  Then, when the waiter sensed that I was upset about the amount of the espresso (it just seemed like such a small amount of coffee) he replaced it.  That is going the extra mile to make me feel at home and that they appreciate my business.  This is a business that will grow.  They are getting it right so far.

rLGNrjRvWmriercTglzOqw.text: Delicious, flavorful and beautiful food. Truly the best coffee in Vegas. Husband had his coffee hot and I ordered chilled. Both tasty and I considered ordering another for the road. The environment is tasteful and well put together. Touches of life brought to the table with live plant centerpieces. The staff is friendly and knows about the food and offerings. The menu isn't always in the same order, so look at all the pages! All and all, delicious and highly recommended. We went two days in a row!

cB029QWrZgXYIeFP3LYQKQ.text: I have been wanting to try out this place since I had first heard about it. I Finally got the chance because it is not close to where I live, since it is located in the downtown Vegas by the art district area.   Phenomenal place! Artisan style Latin food with full bar and coffee drinks! I love that you can get French pressed coffee too!! The ambience makes you feel like you are in a hipster San Francisco neighborhood coffee house.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K99aa8cBbsa24DO611h5YQ.text: Had one of the best coffees in my life here. Super nice service and yummy breakfast. Spend 3 days in Vegas and had breakfast twice there.

IiEfYDgDffCJnHOiV4zfZg.text: This is quickly becoming one of my favorite coffee spots in Las Vegas. The coffee is incredible, thoughtful, and unique with the addition of a bomb breakfast and lunch menu. Where else can you find a Coconut Turmeric Latte? Lavender infused? The list goes on as their beverage menu is bananas.  You can order in and sit at a table or grab a stool at the bar. Whether you're there when the doors open at 7am or for lunch in the afternoon the menu is surprisingly large and full of flavor. The Latin Hash is packed with potatoes, roasted vegis, and pulled beef. Feeling like you need something lighter? The Egg White Omelet is fluffy and full of flavor. I highly recommend adding a side of bacon because, it's delicious.  Two hour street parking is available right in front or along the side streets, but you might end up wanting to post up here a bit longer.

BZ6ZBjXRjK6T5rkeNP4DPA.text: Came across this gem walking through Downtown Summerlin and I loved the atmosphere, the setup and the friendly customer service. I will be a returning customer!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey vanilla latte

JbqhKuGnnEY53C3nKzy5UQ.text: I had higher hopes for this place. The look of the cafe (restaurant? coffee shop? what is it?) is cool. They have a covered front patio with plenty of seating, which is a nice bonus. It's advertised as Latin American, but the only Latin feel I get is from the music. There were some Latin food options but most of it was too American-friendly when I'm looking for a Latin experience.   We were feeling more peckish than hungry, so we ordered the avocado toast, smoked salmon toast, and tomato soup with grilled cheese. Both toasts were perfect. The tomato soup had the consistency of pureed tomatoes and was served lukewarm. The grilled cheese was made with a croissant. Now, I'm a huge fan of croissants, but as a grilled cheese, it's not the best. Instead of a crispy bread with a soft center, the whole thing felt soggy and greasy. Then, when dipped in tomato soup (as is the tradition), it fell apart. Especially because the soup was thick. And finally, I ordered the Nutella crepe but never got it.  They also recommended the Beermosa to me. In theory, it sounded interesting. But to me it tasted like a sweet cough syrup. But that just might be me.  Now as for the service, it was fine. Our hostess/server was nice. But we were the only two people in the place on a Saturday night at 7 pm. It felt like they were getting ready to close (mop was out, cleaning the windows) and they weren't due to close for another two hours.   The espresso and coffee are good! And they have a walk-up window for coffee orders--so that's probably cool when you're walking around the area.  After this experience, it's hard to justify traveling all the way here for a second visit unless I happen to be in the Arts District.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato soup with croissant grilled cheese.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado toast.
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked salmon toast. Yum!

JB9Uy780Js6P1Xu5B_cU9A.text: Since my first visit, I've popped in a few more times to grab a quick drink while in the downtown area but it wasn't until Restaurant Week that I gave their food another try. M&F had a $20 three course breakfast, including a latte, which was a great deal.  ICED LAVENDER LATTE: The way to my heart, served in a Ball jar. My server said this drink was best cold, and I have to agree with her. It was light and refreshing to prepare for the day's crazy heat. AVOCADO TOAST: Lightly toasted golden bread with avocado, tomato, and queso fresco. Avocado toast is a favorite quick breakfast of mine and I enjoyed this version. AREPA BENNY: Enjoyed this combination of flavors again, egg was perfectly poached, the arepa makes a great, solid base for this dish. Surprised I haven't seen more versions crop up around town. BIONICO SHOOTER: Essentially a mini-parfait, with Greek yogurt, fresh fruit, and granola, this was a nice bit of sweetness to end the morning meal.   I really like the trendy-cool but still cozy-local vibe this place rocks. Covered patio seating is available if you get there early enough that it's not too hot. There's bar seating with outlets if you need to multitask and get some work done. Bathrooms are in the back, shared with Hopnuts next door.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Logo
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yucca mash
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp ceviche

43QRYEG6cPImBAznr_ydSQ.text: Although the drinks here are still amazing, service has definitely gone downhill at this place. Sometimes the attitude from the servers is a little much. I decided to write a review because this is the second time one of the staff has had an attitude towards customers. The first time it happened I figured it was a one time thing, maybe I'll have a different experience next time but nope! Perhaps better training should be required and a better screening process before hiring. BY THE WAY- thanks for putting bacon on the to-go order of someone who doesn't even eat bacon!!!! Wtf! Bacon on an item that doesn't show bacon in the menu description. GET IT TOGETHER.

z6vuQodDrc4bYdBaNeBsFQ.text: What a great place! Away from the strip drama, eat with the locals and still hip. Amazing coffee, menu, and friendly service. Must try when in town.

Rd4hq_voOntYDrqzkO5lgA.text: So happy I discovered this gem with my friends. Awesome atmosphere, music, delicious lattes and dope staff. Still haven't tried their food, will do on the next visit.  Imma sucker for a good lavender latte, they make theirs with a homemade lavender syrup, just the perfect amount of sweet.  My friend had a coconut turmeric latte and oh my god was that goooood!  I also heard they opened another location in downtown summerlin so I know where I'll be spending time after my yoga classes

mOL1jUqXrouzA6hp81ttTw.text: Went to check it out for breakfast and was told they only sit people on table tops of 4 with three or more people and my cousin and I were very disappointed. There wasn't anyone else waiting to be seated. So just upset they would say that instead of just seating us there. Thanks for nothing.

d2vk-V4_ga1i7wM4tGcpBw.text: What an awesome place to chill and have some drinks Jessie was so freakin cool I would defiantly would be back thanks guys

QskEKYrCpK0uD1E9og-lFw.text: waited there forever no one ever greeted me or offered me a table ... weak ...was there 20 min if not more and there were open tables ... customer service is horrible... wont ever come back ...if i was there with someone id be furious ...they never served me i was like a ghost ...how you not goin pay attention to guest and have them wait for 20 to 30 min when 30 min with no service what so ever ...??comming to Resturant and being ignored like this makes you feel like garbage ... word of advice be attentive to Future costumers...

bbb6mRfOqE0NC7biLssdDw.text: I don't need to explain myself. Rude to paying customers. They kicked us out because we were laughing and having a good time for my birthday.

UD_iIM80zk44rngnkpPpEA.text: Exceptional service in such a comfortable space that is aesthetically pleasing. The food is yummy and inexpensive it mostly ranges between $5-$15. The place is extremely clean. I  cannot wait to come back here again. I had the tomato bisque it was great and they give a large portion for only $5. I definitely recommend this place.

Rxzu9aB_MkL7qeqRRJP-PQ.text: Makers & Finders makes a lavender latte and it is fabulous. I've had it iced and hot. I've taken it to go, I've had it in the restaurant, either way it is delicious, refreshing, and made perfectly every time.  This cute little restaurant/coffee shop is located on Main Street, south of Charleston, so it is a little ways off from the many restaurant openings of Fremont. This makes the restaurant a nice retreat in the Downtown area.   As for food I have had the Chicken Tinga Empanads which are awesome. Perfectly fried with succulent, spiced chicken inside, served with a small bed of lettuce. I have also had their tomato bisque soup, which is creamy and bursting with flavor.  I will miss Makers & Finders for sure. I hope I can find an equivalent when I move to Texas.

CCV01dNyNfEjj1gGLslQdw.text: Cute spot with a delicious lavender latte that they're known for. Stumbled upon this place when I was looking for a cafe that had outdoor seating that was pet friendly. I ended up coming back the next day

pP91Zdf6_MBNxdyIyQSv0g.text: People you really need to get downtown and start enjoying our city. We need to support our community and local businesses. The people were great. The coffee was delicious. We hng out outside with rhe kids and watched local kids dance and then went to the antique stores rhe best day. So many wonderful places to go see. Please people get out and see this amazing downtown the people are amazing and are local and trying so hard to keep up our amazing city

G2cLdhYRGHlkFxquYmjDPQ.text: I live in Arizona and visit Vegas quite frequently,  The highlight of my trip is stopping in with my family at Makers and Finders.  The atmosphere is so different than your every day coffee shop!  The food is fresh and homemade the coffee is amazing!!! I have never tasted a Empanada as good anywhere else! The staff is very attentive and friendly! There is always daily specials and a great Happy Hour! I would love to see this restaurant expand in the future!

UKptYWtTHOjpq63Fk6LRfQ.text: Las Vegas perfection! This place has some amazingly passionate baristas and really great food. The breakfast menu is kind of out there but trust it. They deliver in spades!! I will be back on my next trip for sure!!

TbLG5DghCQy4v8eutuZdKw.text: Kale chorizo omelet (I added a side of avocado) was phenomenal. Hip and Cute place. Would definitely go back.

M1YtlOcr0bKGqUwfYx0A5Q.text: A good walk from Fremont, this place has it all. Coffee, bar, breakfast and.. T-Shirts?? Best coffee I've ever had, had to go with the most renowned coffee they offer so got the Lavender infused latte and the honey vanilla iced latte.. Both surpass the competition.. For a hot drink the Lavender infused is a cozy and decedent choice where as the honey vanilla is a bright uplifting cold drink. Also had to buy a shirt for my girl when we stopped here. They have a strong selection of well designed and manufactured t-shirts and tanks. Def worth stopping here if you're in Vegas.

Y1hBTNtzhk22ZeYOf99grQ.text: Try the lavender latte! It's what brought me in.The tastiness will bring me back to try more. I was sat at the bar, which is neat if you want to watch them make your coffee drink. That was fun. I also ordered a benny, which was half the price of a similar quality one I could get at other breakfast/brunch places. I was impressed with the food, the latte, and the service. After a great first experience, I'm planning to come back soon.

6XhyvGjorq_Qa_BTqO8dyg.text: The cortado, lavender infused latte, coconut and turmeric latte and honey vanilla latte were so good. Priced fairly and the ambiance is so relaxing and non pretentious. Looking forward to visit again

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavender infused latte and coconut and turmeric latte

TqQbGy1d6Rrm-sMAvaxH3g.text: Amazing breakfast food every time I come. I love the honey latte and the red arepa. Such delicious food. The Latin hash is also excellent. This is a great little place for lunch or breakfast!

y0XF2buCMiZXpooodJIzcA.text: For a Las Vegas coffee shop this is as good as it gets. I do hate sharing my local secrets but its for the best right??? Makers and finders is right up there with Sambalatte battling for my coffee addiction. The location is in the arts district so unless you are staying downtown or near/on main street you will probably need a car to easily get here. Once you are here though, the staff is friendly, the coffee is amazing and the ambiance is well, hipster-esque. Me personally I am not a hipster but I don't feel really turned off coming here at all.  My favorite things here are of course the lattes, specifically the lavender latte or Mexican spice latte, and a few of the random food items they serve. My favorite will have to be the chicken tingas, which are basically homemade chicken enchiladas that come in an order of 2 and cut in half with sauce ON them. If you want them plain you better say something when you order. As for my second favorite thing here I would have to suggest the tomato bisque soup. Tastes delicious and looks homemade. As for the 'grill cheese' croissant that comes with it, I could pass, but that still doesn't stop me from ordering it!  I have been here many times, have tried about half of the menu and I must say I have never really been disappointed. My coffee is always amazing- keep in mind on weekends or when they are super busy, expect waits of up to 10 minutes for your lattes but it will be well worth it. I drive out of my way to come here. And will continue to do so unless they disappoint me!

FU9qDmNI5vhznNIimFD1qg.text: Loved the almond milk flat white, ordered at the bar on a quiet morning in downtown Las Vegas!

i_ZxxdbxeKEw5pkkcGWuhw.text: I typically don't give 5 out of 5 but this place is amazingly good and a hidden treasure! We have decided to ALWAYS stop by when we visit Vegas going forward. Ask for Jen she is awesome host and very courteous and helpful for newbies who want to get recommendations! MUST VISIT and try any of the coffees (our favs were Flat white, Mexican Spice Latin or Caramel Salted Late)

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside view of this trendy coffee / meal spot for all Vegas visitors :)
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flat white for morning wake up! GREATNESS
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flat white with Latin Hash as a meal AWESOME!

zay61IMZ0dHYuLqpgFNRNg.text: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! Some of the best serving staff I've ever had! Exceptional service, coffee, dishes, the server was even helpful recommending vegan substitutions.  Love this place and can't wait to go back

SIaO42G6sgN_p2bB6xxC1Q.text: Came here for the second  time last week with my lady and out of town friends . It's located off of Main Street (Arts District) by the antique stores and Buffalo Exchange...the cafe itself is a hidden gem, all the furniture and accents looks like stuff you see on Pinterest... It's definitely a Hipster cafe, minus the know-it-all attitude ..   Upon arrival we were greeted immediately and asked if we wanted to dine inside or on the patio, we chose the patio, within 5 minutes we were served fresh ice water in cute mason jars and offered the menu, the cuisine is modern Colombian and very tasty .  We're coffee aficionados and I was so happy to see cafe' con leche on the menu, if there's Cubans in Vegas you know how hard it is to come by an authentic con leche. I chose the Lavender Latte and I'm so happy I did...Wow ! It's the perfect balance floral and not to sweet .. It's not too subtle but all your senses explode !  Once you're done at the cafe, make your way around the Arts District and check out the Arts Factory and all the antique stores off Main St.

B9i59gF-BZIolD9toR7Y6Q.text: Love this place! Such a great little coffee shop in the heart of the Arts District. They put a great twist on latin comfort food. The coffee here is excellent. The lavender infused latte is so good and not sweet at all which is a plus if you want coffee to go with savory food. The couple times I've been here the food did not disappoint! Everything I've had to eat here was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken TInga Empanadas! Delish!
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La Paisa Arepa, perfect mixture of savory with a dash of sweet from the plantains!

WmNEvOR0D3DES38GEPcIDw.text: Ambience was great, my waiter was great, and the lavender latte was delicious. Comfy little couches to relax with a book on the patio.

nFmLfqVJKeX9GJI-n7u05g.text: We stopped by this spot for some grub after a downtown event, and we were not disappointed.  The place was very busy (downtown on a Saturday usually is), but they sat us quickly, and the service was good. I had the La Paisa (arepa), and it was delicious. It had a lovely mix of ingredients that satisfied the salty, sweet and savory that's oh so very important. Everyone else at the table seemed very satisfied with their choices as well, which included one of the eggs Benedict choices and the chilaquiles (sp?).  The prices are reasonable for the food you get. Parking is a little tough on a busy day, but it's worth it for the food.

wGLkrUMoDi32jPC5QNTEFQ.text: This review is dinner only - no coffee.  We got the lomo saltado and la paisa arepas.  Both were good, but not amazing, and overpriced for what we got.  Lomo: the beef was flavorful but tough, stingy on the onions and peppers, fries delicious (highlight of the meal), no jalapenos though the menu called for them, egg was done right, and rice was just meh.  For $14.00, the quality wasn't up to par and the serving size was disappointing.  Arepa: like the lomo, the beef was flavorful but tough, plantains weren't very good, pretty tough and flavorless, black beans were meh, avocado - stingy!  Avocado looked almost like garnish than part of the meal.  Overall, good, but not great, and for the prices, we expected more.  Without the automatic markup for being in Summerlin, this might be four stars, but for the quality and mediocre portions, three stars.  We hope their coffee will be better!

-JeKc_B-CPksVY-6NXm7HA.text: The guys were super busy but seemed nice enough. They invited me to sit on the patio, which seemed great.  I waited for about twenty minutes until an other customer sat out there as well, and he got served right away.  I gave the waiter a look and he realized he'd forgotten me, and was super apologetic. He promised to "step on it" and grab me a $3.79 cup of coffee to go, and was nice enough to bring the bill and take my cash off the table about five minutes before the actual paper cup of coffee ever materialized. A spoon or something to stir the honey would have been cool but the coffee itself was good enough I didn't end up needing honey, so at least there's that.  Whatever. Shit happens. I think what's going on here is that the brunch vibe is killing the coffee shop vibe, the model isn't really clear, and the service for people who think this is a coffee bar like it says on the sign is suffering.  I wouldn't come here again as if the place is a coffee bar, but know where to go if I need hipster brunch and a $4 cup of joe off the strip. Nice design. Chill location.

vTvTa8Y2Badv80NycDm8kA.text: This is the BEST  breakfast/brunch place in LV. The Coconut Turmeric Latte is to die for. I ordered two. Food is delicious too and they have many gluten free options as well as vegan. I liked this place so much I came back the next day.

5XlgxoWQ_V95HwnZa-pZ9A.text: Hmmmm.. Great service, nice decor, felt very tranquil while enjoying my coffee.  The coffee, flavorful, though to watery for my taste. I like to hear my heart beat when savoring a cuban cortaditos! Best empanada I've tasted in vegas. Mixing chilled cook shrimp with mojo isn't ceviche! Mango basil tomato balsamic is brilliant #Chef_whooo??? #jbo

NLYcx76Pr6dlVr5TLISgYQ.text: Too many beyond excellent reviews! I don't get it. Maybe these people haven't been to fancy cafes in other places around the world. Coffee was all right, croissants old, dry and terrible and empanadas ok (wasn't exactly what it said). Plus is ambience and polite welcoming server! So not bad, not great but nothing that I'll drive out of my way to be at.

opdNMzuh2WwVBQntM3olGg.text: Great food, great service!  Cool place, don't hesitate to eat here. Simply awesome and interesting food.

QpyAp4ULv0SsJwrw3PkcSw.text: Awesome food and awesome coffee. The Arepa Benny was delicious. I also tried the empanadas and the sliders which were also great.  Great customer service.

q-dl6Gg94x-TJKm0ighL7g.text: Absolutely love my skinny capuchino.  All coffee is done from scratch which is amazing, delicious .  Owners are knowledgeable on the whole process (went to South America) a definite plus .  Food is great, service is wonderful.   Finally something different in the area.  Highly recommended this place.!!!!

WXNN7oGkWeLsPcDNERx5Cg.text: Excellent coffee the best I have had in a long while. This is not a run in for a cup but more a come to savor delicious coffee in a shop with a great vibe. I chatted with the owners who went to Columbia to research coffee and it shows. I will definitely go back.

SMl7dsN61xikDJw0l-Ha6g.text: Awesome place! I would definitely recommend, it's super cute and trendy , very clean,  and friendly staff.  The menu is also great! A great addition to DTLV!

ZUIM_47gUuTOpd94qfbCNA.text: its like these prople get mad if you dont leave them a tip?? cofee is $6 a cup and its to go, why would i leave you a tip???  these peopke also suck at making lattes its more milk than anything :(( shitty baristas

HfdZMdhKRLMITL1KYxR92A.text: I came here the other day with some friends. I'm not one to go to these little coffee shops, but I'm so glad I did! I ordered an iced chai tea latte, delicious! I loved everything about it. The food wasn't the best in my opinion, but I can't complain about anything else!

Es1nB98uMm5FmySvpb_idQ.text: Best coffee anywhere I've ever been. We ended up here for breakfast twice during a trip to Las Vegas and it's amazing. The lavender latte will surprise, the straight up latte is great, the Mexican spice latte is fantastic. The breakfast (also twice) is great - the chilaquiles and arepa benny stand out (a few shots of hot sauce on the benny if perfect). Fantastic staff. If you're in Vegas head off the strip and relax...

hVkPmLuV7H53Wc3Jv9VYdQ.text: Finally, opened on a Sunday. We happened to pass by and saw they were opened for Breakfast/ Brunch this past Sunday (first time).  We had heard great things about their food and their reputation is correct.  The food is quite excellent. And the coffee, spectacular.  The only reason I am not giving it a 5-star review is that the wait staff is not informed of the menu.  I am not saying they should know how to cook but when I asked how many eggs to an omelet and was told six, I knew not to trust that answer.  I also asked what "sofrito" meant and one of the wait staff gave me a completely different answer than, I believe, the manager/ owner response (after I ate it).  So, management, please teach your staff how to answer questions and if they don't know, to go ask and not make up stuff.  I ordered the Omelet Pericos and it was excellent. The house sauce was sooo good, I wish I could have dipped the crunchy plaintain chips into more sauce...! Next time, additional sauce on the side, please.   My boyfriend had the Chicken Omelet Tinga. He is a picky eater and he said it was very good.  Lastly, the coffee, the best cortado I have had in this country, so far.  So, if you can overlook the misinformed wait staff, try M&F. Very good.

uSLixXHF9mB6cB5QxsNR_w.text: Love going to this place. The breakfast bagel and iced vanilla latte is everything. A must go to cafe when you're in Las Vegas. 5/5 stars

68wiIgbwcE0Tp5DpcDqaGA.text: So happy to finally have a place like this in Vegas! I don't think it's possible to be disappointed here. Even if you had to wait, good things are worth waiting for ; ) Great coffee, great design, great service and...they have a big patio (with little direct sunlight which is a plus for Vegas) so it's a winner all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Cortadito. Perfect balance of sweetness.

uQnUL8E11AB2IvYeFDZJ1A.text: My experience at Makers and Finders was great! The food is phenomenal and their coffee is one of a kind. If you're looking for a place that brews coffee in 30 seconds, this isn't the place for you. You come for the experience and the many varieties that have to offer. I had their horchata mixed with expresso and was blown away by the flavor. I can't wait to return again for the breakfast!

yaEfztVv1O1hzXQpbic1aw.text: Brilliant place for breakfast and great coffee from an Aussie coffee snob. Friendly and attentive service, great vibe and really delicious food. A must try!

PGTY2wO4eSbg51Tfz_dYzw.text: I like it! The lavender cappuccino was great and the pb, nutella, banana, bacon croissant was very satisying! Fresh coffee, fresh food, fresh atmosphere!

OmnkNpkPYtapeH7uYxyq6w.text: Whenever I travel whether for work or leisure I always look for a great breakfast place that has great coffee and satisfying food selections. Makers & Finders fits the bill for sure. Reasonably priced and the atmosphere and decor are relaxing, and welcoming. Place just has a nice vibe to it. I'll be back for sure.

4z_jZbwaeizJrltGOaeKHw.text: I really love this place for a nice breakfast/brunch/lunch to catch up with a friend. The atmosphere is really cozy and the staff has always been really nice. I highly recommend the Arepa Benny, and you really can't go wrong with ordering any of their drinks.

PZvhaMpt5oEAOrbY1mc1DA.text: Came here for brunch with few friends on a Sunday. Wait was a little too long for me but this place isn't really a big place and when people come for coffee they usually like to sit and talk for a while.   The caffeine was awesome. Nice selection. I decided on a Nutella latte which was pretty delicious. I really wanted to try the lavender latte but I thought that might be a little too daring for me.   As for food, I decided on the Arepa Benny. It's like Benedict. It was good but it really wasn't mind blowing. My friend did order one of their specials for the day.. I think it was called Mashed Yucca but don't quote me on it. That was probably one of the best things ever. My other friend got the empanada sampler which was alright nothing too special.   Both my friends got a Cordadito which was VERY strong. That may be a little too much caffeine for me and I took just 1 sip.   Overall, the vibe is very hipster. The location is in the art district which to me is very hipster as well. The staff are nice. I probably won't be returning just because there wasn't really anything special on the menu that I would want to come back for. None the less, I didn't have a bad meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella latte

Yu53gVPZ1YI0NxbflhCDiw.text: So this place is within a couple of blocks of where I live so I tend to frequent it very often.  I read the reviews and I have to say that as far as the coffee goes this is a spot on place! I am a huge fan of the lavender latte. I have also grown addicted to their Mexican chocolate latte! The idea and the concept of the place is perfect for the location. I'm from Los Angeles so I'm used to places like Silverlake and Melrose. This place would stand among the best in those two areas.  The coffee, anything from the lattes to their special drips, are always flavorful and fresh and robust. The staff has always been extremely helpful and friendly. If there's ever been the slightest issue or mistake with my order, they have always been very quick to fix any kind of issue.  I've only eaten here once but the locks Benedict that I had was extremely tasty. I can understand some of the other reviews when it comes to price versus value. Everything seems to be made fresh and to order so I can understand the price point. You also have to look at the hip and trendy arts District that this coffee place I s in and understand some of the price is based on location.  I highly recommend any of their lattes and it makes for a great to go cup to walk around and do a little window or antique shopping in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh drips are the best!

iR4yNsiskqR34a8Fy065LQ.text: The service was very slow, and it was the worst cup of coffee I've had in my life. But the food was phenomenal. I had the Veggie Benny and would recommend it to anyone

M-AsGn2VdpxixRQqh_vkYw.text: UPDATE I've been 3 more times.  It's still absolutely amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing craftsmanship.

Ag5kSi8fQhw_hrT95I-dAQ.text: more of a restaurant than a sit down, chill, and do some hw coffee shop. super delicious artisan food and quality coffee. i've had a honey can latte and a mexican spice of the same and both have been perfectly foamy w nice rich shots. for food, i've had the breakfast croissant sandwich which was perfectly butttery and delicious, then i've had the turkey sandwich for dinner with tomato bisque that was also top notch. for sure the place to go, alone or w friends and family. staff has been wholesomely friendly.   also-- CRUSHED ICE. so much love for this little shop

photos.caption: Photo of Makers & Finders - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b0XBFtsZ0J8rU7GVHjqSEQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE the folks at Makers & Finders, the downtown location (their first location) is our usual hangout spot when we need to step away from the office and refresh our eyes.   Everything on their menu from Empanadas, Latin Hash, Coconut Chia and of course coffee is simply amazing which complements the always amazing service they provide as well.  Thanks guys, we'll keep coming back for those Latin Hash ;P

SWsqpODsQYkbseFph7Xd7w.text: Delicious spot for brunch or lunch with friends. Very insta worthy.

s8nh2_rI3hy4uS51PeygLg.text: Makers & Finders is a very fine brunch/lunch place. Not my usual go to type of food in the Latin/Vegetarian variety for the most part, but still a nice change of pace for a brunch wth options besides eggs and hash. I had the lemon chicken plate and thought it was tasty but not quite a lunch you'd want on a weekend to detox from festivities the night before. It's a very good weekday lunch though, but a little much at $13.   I do believe this is some of the best coffee in town, however. Makers really knows their beans. I would come back for an afternoon coffee and to chill on the patio area any day. But Unless you have a hankering for Arepas, I might try another spot in the area for an amazing brunch meal.

iAqGRxWdP0LO45oUswJ9EQ.text: Overall good. I would recommend this place for the coffee and come again when I am in the area to give it another shot. It has a variety of good options for those with dietary restrictions. There was no option for turkey bacon though for our kosher/halal friends.   I ordered the coconut turmeric latte with coconut milk. Absolutely delicious. Not too sweet where you want to gag, and not too coffee-forward if you are feeling a little fancy.   I had the salmon lox, it was very good. The cream cheese was very buttery tasting. It was beautifully drizzled with olive oil upon presentation. I would have liked to see a little more salmon on the bagel. Usually these bagels are loaded with salmon if ordered elsewhere.  Hubby also ordered the Omelet Pericos. This was an underwhelming dish for me, maybe because I hate green bell peppers. Hubby thought it was ok. He thought the the egg was over cooked and was expecting an actual sharp cheddar flavor. He says it tasted like American cheese. To him, it was an overpriced "meh" omelet.  The decor is great, but the service is slow. I think the hostess was in training. Waiter was great.

hEZQkDp5eJt_FCKxaViY8g.text: Caramel Salted Latte was soooo delicious I drank it slow as if it were hard liquor lol. I didn't really care for the vegetable skillet hash. It tasted like a stir fry with way too much oil. This place has a urban decor reminding me of a coffee house back home in Baltimore. My date said it felt like Seattle in there. Music was dope and the staff, very friendly. Love the ambiance and will be back with a new date lol. It's definitely a spot to vibe out or meet and greet.  Main Street has construction going on. They tearing up these Vegas streets, but still and all outside is so adorable you can easily ignore the grind of loud machines and a dusty dug out street scenery.

yKHIBANmeR2mW2wdeSuMxA.text: I love this coffee spot!! Super trendy, the food and coffee is really good. I crave this coffee on the regular and it's a nice spot to go relax, read, study or just to clear your head. I love the waitress Josie!

CE5vr9EmEJR4Tx4j97ly0g.text: Our large group came here after a particularly long NYE, luckily it was one of the few places open on New Year's Day to feed the incredibly hungover crowds (including myself). I was so impressed with the large array of unique craft drinks!! From lavender lattes to "matcha-chinos", there was definitely a beverage that catered to every individual. These drinks were also beautifully presented and tasted wonderful which was the most important part. The food which was $7-15, was absolutely delicious and provided a lovely Latin flare that sets it apart from other breakfast joints. The interior was spacious, cute and had retro (70s-80s) music playing in the background along with a nice patio in the front. The only reason why I took off a star is because service was quite slow. We were the first group there, yet it took an unusually long time for them to take our orders and give us our food/drinks, so much so that we had to wave them down a couple of times. Other than that, I would love to go here again!

U5SEot7d16HruJbxBrmjpg.text: My wife and I enjoyed a late breakfast here on a weekday. As some mentioned, it has that hipster vibe. We both had the coconut waffle, which was pretty good. The house blend coffee was also pretty good. Seating was comfortable. Restaurant was clean. Server was pleasant and attentive. A 5 is generous. It's more like a 4.5, but there really isn't anything wrong with it. Would I rush to go back? No. But would I go back? Sure. A good find, and we're happy we went.

iwp4aB0H9KYYIJOFW9rFpw.text: THE. LATTES. OMG.  I found this place from Yelp. Yay Yelp recommendations! From our hotel, it was a good half mile walk. With the Las Vegas heat being dry vs. humidity in Texas, the walk wasn't bad at all.  The lavender latte is my all-time favorite. I convinced my lovey to go back a second day and also loved the Coconut Tumeric latte while we were there for breakfast.   Latin comfort food is definitely a plus in our book. Although, it is on the lighter side, not saying that in a bad way. We were starving by lunch time at the airport, so it makes for a good meal if you don't want to be weighed down.

-0Wwydq_1UhgHONEz7C0lw.text: I'm a local, born and raised, and I had been wanting to check out Downtown Las Vegas to try more small businesses. I was absolutely stunned by this cafe!  First off, the idea of a coffee shop mixed with Latin comfort foods is original and brilliant. And the menu is full of innovative combos and classic drinks. I ordered the cold brew, chicken tingas empanadas, and crispy fries to share with a friend. I was served pretty quickly, and the food was not only presented nicely, but it tasted just as good as it looked!  The exterior and interior of the shop is immaculate. Due to poor Vegas weather, I was unable to enjoy the couches and lounge chairs outside, but the thought is so inviting. The inside is beautifully decorated and a very comforting atmosphere. There's copies of literature and free Vegas magazines to read. There's an open area for laptop use. And there's your standard bench and table seating, which was perfect for my party of two.   The staff was very friendly and inviting! I never felt over serviced or badgered, which made me relaxed.   Absolutely a place worth checking out if you're a tourist or a local! I'll definitely be back. Often.

UyLZGAjOe2Se70C7UgiIow.text: Just ordered from here through Postmates because I heard rave reviews re: their coffee. I think those customers ordered the siphon coffee, but I ordered a French press at an eyebrow raising $5.50 (although, still $2 cheaper than the siphon). I would compare the coffee to the gas station coffee I've had up the street at Arco. I also ordered their lox and bagel (in photos), which was just kind of sad, especially at $10 a pop. Lox and trimming only included on one half of the bagel with a few tiny shavings of onion (which I don't personally have an issue with). If the food and beverage were half the price they ask, I wouldn't complain about the underwhelming quality.

oH_6JfnfwmeAgMR27ySyRg.text: I can't wait to return for the grand opening. For a soft opening month things seem to be going very well, i found everyone to be personable and attentive.  It's great to see Sean running the coffee program there, he is a great barista with tons of enthusiasm and an equal amount of innovativeness (check out the coffee menu!). I also love how open for feed back they were on my visit, which if this is being reviewed by the owners can i beg for ORGANIC MILK?! No one else in Vegas is doing this, i would even be in for an up charge of 50 cents or so, optional or not.  I ordered the tomato bisque which was delightful, perfectly tomato-y and spot on with the black pepper. I really appreciated how understated it was, just simple clean flavors with no gimmicks. The croissant panini was a nice touch but could have been a bit warmer and i personally could have gone for a saltier cheese like a long aged cheddar or gruyere.  I thoroughly enjoyed my experience, especially the neighborhood vibe with the clean and lively interior. I know i will be returning several times before the grand opening. I can't wait to see this place evolve.

xQti6jI4rAzT9bcQmXxwtQ.text: I'd like to take a moment to thank Josh and his hardworking staff for hosting my organization's recent business workshop. Josh went above and beyond to meet our needs prior to and during the event. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful toward all attendees. The delicious cocktails, lattes, and food left everyone satisfied and wanting more. The venue provided an open, clean, and inviting environment for all, and I look forward to working together again. Between the excellent customer service, mouthwatering menu, and perfect location nestled in the heart of the DTLV's Arts District, there's no other coffee shop that compares. Thank you, Makers & Finders for an amazing experience!

3afQBDoCfuN1o3CK262i2g.text: Found this place via Yelp, was excited given the positive reviews I read. Went there with the hubby and while our server was polite, the food and speed of service was sorely lacking. It was expensive for what it was.   Ordered breakfast items and they do not come with potatoes or toast or anything else--that cost extra. Portions were terribly small. The chicken tinga omelette was bland and really was only egg and chicken with the other ingredients seemingly just lightly glazed over the top - offering no flavor whatsoever. The Latin hash, described on the menu as 'pulled beef, fried potatoes and yucca, peppers, fried egg,' had zero yucca (red potatoes instead--so sad since I was really looking forward to this), over cooked egg, and loads of oil. The one redeeming factor for the hash was that it was somewhat flavorful. The latte tasted like burnt drip coffee not at all like espresso, and it was $6!!!! We left feeling extremely unsatisfied, still hungry, and grossly overcharged for the skimpy meal we had!

IZiQUGszgEwITl4fUp9vLA.text: Such a great experience at Makers and Finders! Great service, such a cute atmosphere, and great vibes throughout the entire restaurant. Their salted Carmel latte is honestly the best thing in life.

NH-g1DEZSVvrPlm6vVFa6A.text: WOW! What a pleasant surprise!  We ordered the  1. Breakfast Bagel $9.50 ** 2. Kale Chorizo Omelet $10.00 ** 3. Smoked Lox Bagel $10.00  4. Honey Vanilla Latte $5.50 5. Salted Caramel Latte $5.50 **  I can't even find the words to describe how amazingggggg the BREAKFAST BAGEL was!!! The best bagel I have EVER had- hands down. The KALE CHORIZO OMELET was exceptional as well! I usually don't like omelets but this one made me a believer. I also had the Salted Caramel Latte which we all know was amazing- can't go wrong with salted caramel :)  My man friend however really enjoyed the smoked lox bagel and the kale chorizo omelet. He also really liked the honey vanilla latte! 5/5 for us!!!!

ofCZ7lSaKcERMYYZhTpxHg.text: Great place for coffee and a nosh.   My fave (so far) is the Mexican Spice Latte -iced, because it hit 112 today.  (Oh, Vegas in the Summer. You're like a bad relationship with great sex. We know that you're gonna bitch-slap us come July, but we just can't quit you)  ...but I digress  Service here tends to move at a fairly contemplative pace. But it's a fair trade. They don't rush you as you gently nurse your cappuccino, so give them a few extra minutes to make your lovingly and beautifully prepared meal.   The location is in the up-and-coming (i.e. Gentrifying) Antique Row. Very near great shops like Retro Vegas and Desert Buddha -and of course that perennial favorite, Buffalo Exchange (It's not a store, it's a lifestyle)   My only request: please add a few more vegetarian options to the food menu. Right now, I'm driving up from Henderson just for the coffee and the hang. I'd show up more frequently, (and spend more money) if there were a few more veggie choices.   Great Place!

j1RwxrzzY5P9zulNkd4tXw.text: This is the only place I have ever had an Armando Palmer! It is this lemonade and hibiscus drink that is to die for. The food is always great. One of my favorite places to relax and get centered.

xN_UI9g96sPMByKJsZDxog.text: Really like this cute, hipster cafe.  Concept is kinda odd, though - an espresso joint with Latin American cuisine and service at the table. That means it's not the kind of cafe often seen in urban cities that you sit down with a laptop and get some work done while sipping a nice cup of coffee and munching some pastries.  On the bright side, Makers and Finders serves better food options than a typical coffee shops. The Chicken Tinga was really good - crispy, thin crust with just the right amount of fillings - second to none in itself.  However, Ceviche de Camarones was a bit of let down - it's uninspiring and just too sour. I like sour Ceviche, but I failed to taste anything other than a bunch of lemon juice - my expectation was a delicate balance between sour, salty, and fatty.  La Paisa was good, but not as spectacular as Chicken Tinga.  The cappuccino was well crafted, not too milky and the powerful shot of espresso was present - comparable to Sunrise Coffee or Sambalatte. That alone makes M&F a great addition to the local coffee scene.  I'll come back and try more.
